tg3.c
00001 /*
00002  * tg3.c: Broadcom Tigon3 ethernet driver.
00003  *

00005  * Copyright (C) 2001, 2002, 2003 Jeff Garzik (jgarzik@pobox.com)
00006  * Copyright (C) 2004 Sun Microsystems Inc.

00008  *
00009  * Firmware is:
00010  *  Derived from proprietary unpublished source code,
00011  *  Copyright (C) 2000-2003 Broadcom Corporation.
00012  *
00013  *  Permission is hereby granted for the distribution of this firmware
00014  *  data in hexadecimal or equivalent format, provided this copyright
00015  *  notice is accompanying it.
00016  */

00019 #include <linux/module.h>

00058 #define BAR_0   0
00059 #define BAR_2   2

00078 #define DRV_MODULE_NAME     "tg3"
00079 #define PFX DRV_MODULE_NAME ": "
00080 #define DRV_MODULE_VERSION  "3.102"
00081 #define DRV_MODULE_RELDATE  "September 1, 2009"
00082 
00083 #define TG3_DEF_MAC_MODE    0
00084 #define TG3_DEF_RX_MODE     0
00085 #define TG3_DEF_TX_MODE     0
00086 #define TG3_DEF_MSG_ENABLE    \
00087     (NETIF_MSG_DRV      | \
00088      NETIF_MSG_PROBE    | \
00089      NETIF_MSG_LINK     | \
00090      NETIF_MSG_TIMER    | \
00091      NETIF_MSG_IFDOWN   | \
00092      NETIF_MSG_IFUP     | \
00093      NETIF_MSG_RX_ERR   | \
00094      NETIF_MSG_TX_ERR)
00095 
00096 /* length of time before we decide the hardware is borked,
00097  * and dev->tx_timeout() should be called to fix the problem
00098  */
00099 #define TG3_TX_TIMEOUT          (5 * HZ)
00100 
00101 /* hardware minimum and maximum for a single frame's data payload */
00102 #define TG3_MIN_MTU         60
00103 #define TG3_MAX_MTU(tp) \
00104     ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) ? 9000 : 1500)
00105 
00106 /* These numbers seem to be hard coded in the NIC firmware somehow.
00107  * You can't change the ring sizes, but you can change where you place
00108  * them in the NIC onboard memory.
00109  */
00110 #define TG3_RX_RING_SIZE        512
00111 #define TG3_DEF_RX_RING_PENDING     200
00112 #define TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE      256
00113 #define TG3_DEF_RX_JUMBO_RING_PENDING   100
00114 #define TG3_RSS_INDIR_TBL_SIZE 128
00115 
00116 /* Do not place this n-ring entries value into the tp struct itself,
00117  * we really want to expose these constants to GCC so that modulo et
00118  * al.  operations are done with shifts and masks instead of with
00119  * hw multiply/modulo instructions.  Another solution would be to
00120  * replace things like '% foo' with '& (foo - 1)'.
00121  */
00122 #define TG3_RX_RCB_RING_SIZE(tp)    \
00123     (((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) && \
00124       !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)) ? 1024 : 512)
00125 
00126 #define TG3_TX_RING_SIZE        512
00127 #define TG3_DEF_TX_RING_PENDING     (TG3_TX_RING_SIZE - 1)
00128 
00129 #define TG3_RX_RING_BYTES   (sizeof(struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc) * \
00130                  TG3_RX_RING_SIZE)
00131 #define TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_BYTES (sizeof(struct tg3_ext_rx_buffer_desc) * \
00132                  TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE)
00133 #define TG3_RX_RCB_RING_BYTES(tp) (sizeof(struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc) * \
00134                  TG3_RX_RCB_RING_SIZE(tp))
00135 #define TG3_TX_RING_BYTES   (sizeof(struct tg3_tx_buffer_desc) * \
00136                  TG3_TX_RING_SIZE)
00137 #define NEXT_TX(N)      (((N) + 1) & (TG3_TX_RING_SIZE - 1))
00138 
00139 #define TG3_DMA_BYTE_ENAB       64
00140 
00141 #define TG3_RX_STD_DMA_SZ       1536
00142 #define TG3_RX_JMB_DMA_SZ       9046
00143 
00144 #define TG3_RX_DMA_TO_MAP_SZ(x)     ((x) + TG3_DMA_BYTE_ENAB)
00145 
00146 #define TG3_RX_STD_MAP_SZ       TG3_RX_DMA_TO_MAP_SZ(TG3_RX_STD_DMA_SZ)
00147 #define TG3_RX_JMB_MAP_SZ       TG3_RX_DMA_TO_MAP_SZ(TG3_RX_JMB_DMA_SZ)
00148 
00149 /* minimum number of free TX descriptors required to wake up TX process */
00150 #define TG3_TX_WAKEUP_THRESH(tnapi)     ((tnapi)->tx_pending / 4)
00151 
00152 #define TG3_RAW_IP_ALIGN 2
00153 
00154 /* number of ETHTOOL_GSTATS u64's */
00155 #define TG3_NUM_STATS       (sizeof(struct tg3_ethtool_stats)/sizeof(u64))
00156 
00157 #define TG3_NUM_TEST        6
00158 
00159 #define FIRMWARE_TG3        "tigon/tg3.bin"
00160 #define FIRMWARE_TG3TSO     "tigon/tg3_tso.bin"
00161 #define FIRMWARE_TG3TSO5    "tigon/tg3_tso5.bin"

00164     DRV_MODULE_NAME ".c:v" DRV_MODULE_VERSION " (" DRV_MODULE_RELDATE ")\n";

00177 module_param(tg3_debug, int, 0);
00178 MODULE_PARM_DESC(tg3_debug, "Tigon3 bitmapped debugging message enable value");

00350 
00351 static void tg3_write32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00352 {
00353     writel(val, tp->regs + off);
00354 }
00355 
00356 static u32 tg3_read32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off)
00357 {
00358     return (readl(tp->regs + off));
00359 }
00360 
00361 static void tg3_ape_write32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00362 {
00363     writel(val, tp->aperegs + off);
00364 }
00365 
00366 static u32 tg3_ape_read32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off)
00367 {
00368     return (readl(tp->aperegs + off));
00369 }
00370 
00371 static void tg3_write_indirect_reg32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00372 {
00373     unsigned long flags;
00374 
00375     spin_lock_irqsave(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00376     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_BASE_ADDR, off);
00377     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_DATA, val);
00378     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00379 }
00380 
00381 static void tg3_write_flush_reg32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00382 {
00383     writel(val, tp->regs + off);
00384     readl(tp->regs + off);
00385 }
00386 
00387 static u32 tg3_read_indirect_reg32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off)
00388 {
00389     unsigned long flags;
00390     u32 val;
00391 
00392     spin_lock_irqsave(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00393     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_BASE_ADDR, off);
00394     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_DATA, &val);
00395     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00396     return val;
00397 }
00398 
00399 static void tg3_write_indirect_mbox(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00400 {
00401     unsigned long flags;
00402 
00403     if (off == (MAILBOX_RCVRET_CON_IDX_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW)) {
00404         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_RCV_RET_RING_CON_IDX +
00405                        TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, val);
00406         return;
00407     }
00408     if (off == (MAILBOX_RCV_STD_PROD_IDX + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW)) {
00409         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_STD_RING_PROD_IDX +
00410                        TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, val);
00411         return;
00412     }
00413 
00414     spin_lock_irqsave(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00415     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_BASE_ADDR, off + 0x5600);
00416     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_DATA, val);
00417     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00418 
00419     /* In indirect mode when disabling interrupts, we also need
00420      * to clear the interrupt bit in the GRC local ctrl register.
00421      */
00422     if ((off == (MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW)) &&
00423         (val == 0x1)) {
00424         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MISC_LOCAL_CTRL,
00425                        tp->grc_local_ctrl|GRC_LCLCTRL_CLEARINT);
00426     }
00427 }
00428 
00429 static u32 tg3_read_indirect_mbox(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off)
00430 {
00431     unsigned long flags;
00432     u32 val;
00433 
00434     spin_lock_irqsave(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00435     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_BASE_ADDR, off + 0x5600);
00436     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_REG_DATA, &val);
00437     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00438     return val;
00439 }
00440 
00441 /* usec_wait specifies the wait time in usec when writing to certain registers
00442  * where it is unsafe to read back the register without some delay.
00443  * GRC_LOCAL_CTRL is one example if the GPIOs are toggled to switch power.
00444  * TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL is another example if the clock frequencies are changed.
00445  */
00446 static void _tw32_flush(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val, u32 usec_wait)
00447 {
00448     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_TARGET_HWBUG) ||
00449         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ICH_WORKAROUND))
00450         /* Non-posted methods */
00451         tp->write32(tp, off, val);
00452     else {
00453         /* Posted method */
00454         tg3_write32(tp, off, val);
00455         if (usec_wait)
00456             udelay(usec_wait);
00457         tp->read32(tp, off);
00458     }
00459     /* Wait again after the read for the posted method to guarantee that
00460      * the wait time is met.
00461      */
00462     if (usec_wait)
00463         udelay(usec_wait);
00464 }
00465 
00466 static inline void tw32_mailbox_flush(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00467 {
00468     tp->write32_mbox(tp, off, val);
00469     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_MBOX_WRITE_REORDER) &&
00470         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ICH_WORKAROUND))
00471         tp->read32_mbox(tp, off);
00472 }
00473 
00474 static void tg3_write32_tx_mbox(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00475 {
00476     void __iomem *mbox = tp->regs + off;
00477     writel(val, mbox);
00478     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TXD_MBOX_HWBUG)
00479         writel(val, mbox);
00480     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_MBOX_WRITE_REORDER)
00481         readl(mbox);
00482 }
00483 
00484 static u32 tg3_read32_mbox_5906(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off)
00485 {
00486     return (readl(tp->regs + off + GRCMBOX_BASE));
00487 }
00488 
00489 static void tg3_write32_mbox_5906(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00490 {
00491     writel(val, tp->regs + off + GRCMBOX_BASE);
00492 }
00493 
00494 #define tw32_mailbox(reg, val)  tp->write32_mbox(tp, reg, val)
00495 #define tw32_mailbox_f(reg, val)    tw32_mailbox_flush(tp, (reg), (val))
00496 #define tw32_rx_mbox(reg, val)  tp->write32_rx_mbox(tp, reg, val)
00497 #define tw32_tx_mbox(reg, val)  tp->write32_tx_mbox(tp, reg, val)
00498 #define tr32_mailbox(reg)   tp->read32_mbox(tp, reg)
00499 
00500 #define tw32(reg,val)       tp->write32(tp, reg, val)
00501 #define tw32_f(reg,val)     _tw32_flush(tp,(reg),(val), 0)
00502 #define tw32_wait_f(reg,val,us) _tw32_flush(tp,(reg),(val), (us))
00503 #define tr32(reg)       tp->read32(tp, reg)
00504 
00505 static void tg3_write_mem(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 val)
00506 {
00507     unsigned long flags;
00508 
00509     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) &&
00510         (off >= NIC_SRAM_STATS_BLK) && (off < NIC_SRAM_TX_BUFFER_DESC))
00511         return;
00512 
00513     spin_lock_irqsave(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00514     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SRAM_USE_CONFIG) {
00515         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, off);
00516         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_DATA, val);
00517 
00518         /* Always leave this as zero. */
00519         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
00520     } else {
00521         tw32_f(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, off);
00522         tw32_f(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_DATA, val);
00523 
00524         /* Always leave this as zero. */
00525         tw32_f(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
00526     }
00527     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00528 }
00529 
00530 static void tg3_read_mem(struct tg3 *tp, u32 off, u32 *val)
00531 {
00532     unsigned long flags;
00533 
00534     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) &&
00535         (off >= NIC_SRAM_STATS_BLK) && (off < NIC_SRAM_TX_BUFFER_DESC)) {
00536         *val = 0;
00537         return;
00538     }
00539 
00540     spin_lock_irqsave(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00541     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SRAM_USE_CONFIG) {
00542         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, off);
00543         pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_DATA, val);
00544 
00545         /* Always leave this as zero. */
00546         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
00547     } else {
00548         tw32_f(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, off);
00549         *val = tr32(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_DATA);
00550 
00551         /* Always leave this as zero. */
00552         tw32_f(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
00553     }
00554     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tp->indirect_lock, flags);
00555 }
00556 
00557 static void tg3_ape_lock_init(struct tg3 *tp)
00558 {
00559     int i;
00560 
00561     /* Make sure the driver hasn't any stale locks. */
00562     for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
00563         tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_GRANT + 4 * i,
00564                 APE_LOCK_GRANT_DRIVER);
00565 }
00566 
00567 static int tg3_ape_lock(struct tg3 *tp, int locknum)
00568 {
00569     int i, off;
00570     int ret = 0;
00571     u32 status;
00572 
00573     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE))
00574         return 0;
00575 
00576     switch (locknum) {
00577         case TG3_APE_LOCK_GRC:
00578         case TG3_APE_LOCK_MEM:
00579             break;
00580         default:
00581             return -EINVAL;
00582     }
00583 
00584     off = 4 * locknum;
00585 
00586     tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_REQ + off, APE_LOCK_REQ_DRIVER);
00587 
00588     /* Wait for up to 1 millisecond to acquire lock. */
00589     for (i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
00590         status = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_GRANT + off);
00591         if (status == APE_LOCK_GRANT_DRIVER)
00592             break;
00593         udelay(10);
00594     }
00595 
00596     if (status != APE_LOCK_GRANT_DRIVER) {
00597         /* Revoke the lock request. */
00598         tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_GRANT + off,
00599                 APE_LOCK_GRANT_DRIVER);
00600 
00601         ret = -EBUSY;
00602     }
00603 
00604     return ret;
00605 }
00606 
00607 static void tg3_ape_unlock(struct tg3 *tp, int locknum)
00608 {
00609     int off;
00610 
00611     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE))
00612         return;
00613 
00614     switch (locknum) {
00615         case TG3_APE_LOCK_GRC:
00616         case TG3_APE_LOCK_MEM:
00617             break;
00618         default:
00619             return;
00620     }
00621 
00622     off = 4 * locknum;
00623     tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_GRANT + off, APE_LOCK_GRANT_DRIVER);
00624 }
00625 
00626 static void tg3_disable_ints(struct tg3 *tp)
00627 {
00628     int i;
00629 
00630     tw32(TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
00631          (tp->misc_host_ctrl | MISC_HOST_CTRL_MASK_PCI_INT));
00632     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_max; i++)
00633         tw32_mailbox_f(tp->napi[i].int_mbox, 0x00000001);
00634 }
00635 
00636 static void tg3_enable_ints(struct tg3 *tp)
00637 {
00638     int i;
00639     u32 coal_now = 0;
00640 
00641     tp->irq_sync = 0;
00642     wmb();
00643 
00644     tw32(TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
00645          (tp->misc_host_ctrl & ~MISC_HOST_CTRL_MASK_PCI_INT));
00646 
00647     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
00648         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
00649         tw32_mailbox_f(tnapi->int_mbox, tnapi->last_tag << 24);
00650         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_1SHOT_MSI)
00651             tw32_mailbox_f(tnapi->int_mbox, tnapi->last_tag << 24);
00652 
00653         coal_now |= tnapi->coal_now;
00654     }
00655 
00656     /* Force an initial interrupt */
00657     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS) &&
00658         (tp->napi[0].hw_status->status & SD_STATUS_UPDATED))
00659         tw32(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl | GRC_LCLCTRL_SETINT);
00660     else
00661         tw32(HOSTCC_MODE, tp->coalesce_mode |
00662              HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE | coal_now);
00663 }
00664 
00665 static inline unsigned int tg3_has_work(struct tg3_napi *tnapi)
00666 {
00667     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
00668     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
00669     unsigned int work_exists = 0;
00670 
00671     /* check for phy events */
00672     if (!(tp->tg3_flags &
00673           (TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG |
00674            TG3_FLAG_POLL_SERDES))) {
00675         if (sblk->status & SD_STATUS_LINK_CHG)
00676             work_exists = 1;
00677     }
00678     /* check for RX/TX work to do */
00679     if (sblk->idx[0].tx_consumer != tnapi->tx_cons ||
00680         *(tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx) != tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr)
00681         work_exists = 1;
00682 
00683     return work_exists;
00684 }
00685 
00686 /* tg3_int_reenable
00687  *  similar to tg3_enable_ints, but it accurately determines whether there
00688  *  is new work pending and can return without flushing the PIO write
00689  *  which reenables interrupts
00690  */
00691 static void tg3_int_reenable(struct tg3_napi *tnapi)
00692 {
00693     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
00694 
00695     tw32_mailbox(tnapi->int_mbox, tnapi->last_tag << 24);
00696     mmiowb();
00697 
00698     /* When doing tagged status, this work check is unnecessary.
00699      * The last_tag we write above tells the chip which piece of
00700      * work we've completed.
00701      */
00702     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS) &&
00703         tg3_has_work(tnapi))
00704         tw32(HOSTCC_MODE, tp->coalesce_mode |
00705              HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE | tnapi->coal_now);
00706 }
00707 
00708 static void tg3_napi_disable(struct tg3 *tp)
00709 {
00710     int i;
00711 
00712     for (i = tp->irq_cnt - 1; i >= 0; i--)
00713         napi_disable(&tp->napi[i].napi);
00714 }
00715 
00716 static void tg3_napi_enable(struct tg3 *tp)
00717 {
00718     int i;
00719 
00720     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++)
00721         napi_enable(&tp->napi[i].napi);
00722 }
00723 
00724 static inline void tg3_netif_stop(struct tg3 *tp)
00725 {
00726     tp->dev->trans_start = jiffies; /* prevent tx timeout */
00727     tg3_napi_disable(tp);
00728     netif_tx_disable(tp->dev);
00729 }
00730 
00731 static inline void tg3_netif_start(struct tg3 *tp)
00732 {
00733     /* NOTE: unconditional netif_tx_wake_all_queues is only
00734      * appropriate so long as all callers are assured to
00735      * have free tx slots (such as after tg3_init_hw)
00736      */
00737     netif_tx_wake_all_queues(tp->dev);
00738 
00739     tg3_napi_enable(tp);
00740     tp->napi[0].hw_status->status |= SD_STATUS_UPDATED;
00741     tg3_enable_ints(tp);
00742 }
00743 
00744 static void tg3_switch_clocks(struct tg3 *tp)
00745 {
00746     u32 clock_ctrl;
00747     u32 orig_clock_ctrl;
00748 
00749     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT) ||
00750         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS))
00751         return;
00752 
00753     clock_ctrl = tr32(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL);
00754 
00755     orig_clock_ctrl = clock_ctrl;
00756     clock_ctrl &= (CLOCK_CTRL_FORCE_CLKRUN |
00757                CLOCK_CTRL_CLKRUN_OENABLE |
00758                0x1f);
00759     tp->pci_clock_ctrl = clock_ctrl;
00760 
00761     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) {
00762         if (orig_clock_ctrl & CLOCK_CTRL_625_CORE) {
00763             tw32_wait_f(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL,
00764                     clock_ctrl | CLOCK_CTRL_625_CORE, 40);
00765         }
00766     } else if ((orig_clock_ctrl & CLOCK_CTRL_44MHZ_CORE) != 0) {
00767         tw32_wait_f(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL,
00768                 clock_ctrl |
00769                 (CLOCK_CTRL_44MHZ_CORE | CLOCK_CTRL_ALTCLK),
00770                 40);
00771         tw32_wait_f(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL,
00772                 clock_ctrl | (CLOCK_CTRL_ALTCLK),
00773                 40);
00774     }
00775     tw32_wait_f(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL, clock_ctrl, 40);
00776 }
00777 
00778 #define PHY_BUSY_LOOPS  5000
00779 
00780 static int tg3_readphy(struct tg3 *tp, int reg, u32 *val)
00781 {
00782     u32 frame_val;
00783     unsigned int loops;
00784     int ret;
00785 
00786     if ((tp->mi_mode & MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL) != 0) {
00787         tw32_f(MAC_MI_MODE,
00788              (tp->mi_mode & ~MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL));
00789         udelay(80);
00790     }
00791 
00792     *val = 0x0;
00793 
00794     frame_val  = ((tp->phy_addr << MI_COM_PHY_ADDR_SHIFT) &
00795               MI_COM_PHY_ADDR_MASK);
00796     frame_val |= ((reg << MI_COM_REG_ADDR_SHIFT) &
00797               MI_COM_REG_ADDR_MASK);
00798     frame_val |= (MI_COM_CMD_READ | MI_COM_START);
00799 
00800     tw32_f(MAC_MI_COM, frame_val);
00801 
00802     loops = PHY_BUSY_LOOPS;
00803     while (loops != 0) {
00804         udelay(10);
00805         frame_val = tr32(MAC_MI_COM);
00806 
00807         if ((frame_val & MI_COM_BUSY) == 0) {
00808             udelay(5);
00809             frame_val = tr32(MAC_MI_COM);
00810             break;
00811         }
00812         loops -= 1;
00813     }
00814 
00815     ret = -EBUSY;
00816     if (loops != 0) {
00817         *val = frame_val & MI_COM_DATA_MASK;
00818         ret = 0;
00819     }
00820 
00821     if ((tp->mi_mode & MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL) != 0) {
00822         tw32_f(MAC_MI_MODE, tp->mi_mode);
00823         udelay(80);
00824     }
00825 
00826     return ret;
00827 }
00828 
00829 static int tg3_writephy(struct tg3 *tp, int reg, u32 val)
00830 {
00831     u32 frame_val;
00832     unsigned int loops;
00833     int ret;
00834 
00835     if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) &&
00836         (reg == MII_TG3_CTRL || reg == MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL))
00837         return 0;
00838 
00839     if ((tp->mi_mode & MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL) != 0) {
00840         tw32_f(MAC_MI_MODE,
00841              (tp->mi_mode & ~MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL));
00842         udelay(80);
00843     }
00844 
00845     frame_val  = ((tp->phy_addr << MI_COM_PHY_ADDR_SHIFT) &
00846               MI_COM_PHY_ADDR_MASK);
00847     frame_val |= ((reg << MI_COM_REG_ADDR_SHIFT) &
00848               MI_COM_REG_ADDR_MASK);
00849     frame_val |= (val & MI_COM_DATA_MASK);
00850     frame_val |= (MI_COM_CMD_WRITE | MI_COM_START);
00851 
00852     tw32_f(MAC_MI_COM, frame_val);
00853 
00854     loops = PHY_BUSY_LOOPS;
00855     while (loops != 0) {
00856         udelay(10);
00857         frame_val = tr32(MAC_MI_COM);
00858         if ((frame_val & MI_COM_BUSY) == 0) {
00859             udelay(5);
00860             frame_val = tr32(MAC_MI_COM);
00861             break;
00862         }
00863         loops -= 1;
00864     }
00865 
00866     ret = -EBUSY;
00867     if (loops != 0)
00868         ret = 0;
00869 
00870     if ((tp->mi_mode & MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL) != 0) {
00871         tw32_f(MAC_MI_MODE, tp->mi_mode);
00872         udelay(80);
00873     }
00874 
00875     return ret;
00876 }
00877 
00878 static int tg3_bmcr_reset(struct tg3 *tp)
00879 {
00880     u32 phy_control;
00881     int limit, err;
00882 
00883     /* OK, reset it, and poll the BMCR_RESET bit until it
00884      * clears or we time out.
00885      */
00886     phy_control = BMCR_RESET;
00887     err = tg3_writephy(tp, MII_BMCR, phy_control);
00888     if (err != 0)
00889         return -EBUSY;
00890 
00891     limit = 5000;
00892     while (limit--) {
00893         err = tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMCR, &phy_control);
00894         if (err != 0)
00895             return -EBUSY;
00896 
00897         if ((phy_control & BMCR_RESET) == 0) {
00898             udelay(40);
00899             break;
00900         }
00901         udelay(10);
00902     }
00903     if (limit < 0)
00904         return -EBUSY;
00905 
00906     return 0;
00907 }
00908 
00909 static int tg3_mdio_read(struct mii_bus *bp, int mii_id, int reg)
00910 {
00911     struct tg3 *tp = bp->priv;
00912     u32 val;
00913 
00914     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
00915 
00916     if (tg3_readphy(tp, reg, &val))
00917         val = -EIO;
00918 
00919     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
00920 
00921     return val;
00922 }
00923 
00924 static int tg3_mdio_write(struct mii_bus *bp, int mii_id, int reg, u16 val)
00925 {
00926     struct tg3 *tp = bp->priv;
00927     u32 ret = 0;
00928 
00929     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
00930 
00931     if (tg3_writephy(tp, reg, val))
00932         ret = -EIO;
00933 
00934     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
00935 
00936     return ret;
00937 }
00938 
00939 static int tg3_mdio_reset(struct mii_bus *bp)
00940 {
00941     return 0;
00942 }
00943 
00944 static void tg3_mdio_config_5785(struct tg3 *tp)
00945 {
00946     u32 val;
00947     struct phy_device *phydev;
00948 
00949     phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
00950     switch (phydev->drv->phy_id & phydev->drv->phy_id_mask) {
00951     case TG3_PHY_ID_BCM50610:
00952         val = MAC_PHYCFG2_50610_LED_MODES;
00953         break;
00954     case TG3_PHY_ID_BCMAC131:
00955         val = MAC_PHYCFG2_AC131_LED_MODES;
00956         break;
00957     case TG3_PHY_ID_RTL8211C:
00958         val = MAC_PHYCFG2_RTL8211C_LED_MODES;
00959         break;
00960     case TG3_PHY_ID_RTL8201E:
00961         val = MAC_PHYCFG2_RTL8201E_LED_MODES;
00962         break;
00963     default:
00964         return;
00965     }
00966 
00967     if (phydev->interface != PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_RGMII) {
00968         tw32(MAC_PHYCFG2, val);
00969 
00970         val = tr32(MAC_PHYCFG1);
00971         val &= ~(MAC_PHYCFG1_RGMII_INT |
00972              MAC_PHYCFG1_RXCLK_TO_MASK | MAC_PHYCFG1_TXCLK_TO_MASK);
00973         val |= MAC_PHYCFG1_RXCLK_TIMEOUT | MAC_PHYCFG1_TXCLK_TIMEOUT;
00974         tw32(MAC_PHYCFG1, val);
00975 
00976         return;
00977     }
00978 
00979     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_STD_IBND_DISABLE))
00980         val |= MAC_PHYCFG2_EMODE_MASK_MASK |
00981                MAC_PHYCFG2_FMODE_MASK_MASK |
00982                MAC_PHYCFG2_GMODE_MASK_MASK |
00983                MAC_PHYCFG2_ACT_MASK_MASK   |
00984                MAC_PHYCFG2_QUAL_MASK_MASK |
00985                MAC_PHYCFG2_INBAND_ENABLE;
00986 
00987     tw32(MAC_PHYCFG2, val);
00988 
00989     val = tr32(MAC_PHYCFG1);
00990     val &= ~(MAC_PHYCFG1_RXCLK_TO_MASK | MAC_PHYCFG1_TXCLK_TO_MASK |
00991          MAC_PHYCFG1_RGMII_EXT_RX_DEC | MAC_PHYCFG1_RGMII_SND_STAT_EN);
00992     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_STD_IBND_DISABLE)) {
00993         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_RX_EN)
00994             val |= MAC_PHYCFG1_RGMII_EXT_RX_DEC;
00995         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_TX_EN)
00996             val |= MAC_PHYCFG1_RGMII_SND_STAT_EN;
00997     }
00998     val |= MAC_PHYCFG1_RXCLK_TIMEOUT | MAC_PHYCFG1_TXCLK_TIMEOUT |
00999            MAC_PHYCFG1_RGMII_INT | MAC_PHYCFG1_TXC_DRV;
01000     tw32(MAC_PHYCFG1, val);
01001 
01002     val = tr32(MAC_EXT_RGMII_MODE);
01003     val &= ~(MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_INT_B |
01004          MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_QUALITY |
01005          MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_ACTIVITY |
01006          MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_ENG_DET |
01007          MAC_RGMII_MODE_TX_ENABLE |
01008          MAC_RGMII_MODE_TX_LOWPWR |
01009          MAC_RGMII_MODE_TX_RESET);
01010     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_STD_IBND_DISABLE)) {
01011         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_RX_EN)
01012             val |= MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_INT_B |
01013                    MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_QUALITY |
01014                    MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_ACTIVITY |
01015                    MAC_RGMII_MODE_RX_ENG_DET;
01016         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_TX_EN)
01017             val |= MAC_RGMII_MODE_TX_ENABLE |
01018                    MAC_RGMII_MODE_TX_LOWPWR |
01019                    MAC_RGMII_MODE_TX_RESET;
01020     }
01021     tw32(MAC_EXT_RGMII_MODE, val);
01022 }
01023 
01024 static void tg3_mdio_start(struct tg3 *tp)
01025 {
01026     tp->mi_mode &= ~MAC_MI_MODE_AUTO_POLL;
01027     tw32_f(MAC_MI_MODE, tp->mi_mode);
01028     udelay(80);
01029 
01030     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717) {
01031         u32 funcnum, is_serdes;
01032 
01033         funcnum = tr32(TG3_CPMU_STATUS) & TG3_CPMU_STATUS_PCIE_FUNC;
01034         if (funcnum)
01035             tp->phy_addr = 2;
01036         else
01037             tp->phy_addr = 1;
01038 
01039         is_serdes = tr32(SG_DIG_STATUS) & SG_DIG_IS_SERDES;
01040         if (is_serdes)
01041             tp->phy_addr += 7;
01042     } else
01043         tp->phy_addr = PHY_ADDR;
01044 
01045     if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_MDIOBUS_INITED) &&
01046         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785)
01047         tg3_mdio_config_5785(tp);
01048 }
01049 
01050 static int tg3_mdio_init(struct tg3 *tp)
01051 {
01052     int i;
01053     u32 reg;
01054     struct phy_device *phydev;
01055 
01056     tg3_mdio_start(tp);
01057 
01058     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) ||
01059         (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_MDIOBUS_INITED))
01060         return 0;
01061 
01062     tp->mdio_bus = mdiobus_alloc();
01063     if (tp->mdio_bus == NULL)
01064         return -ENOMEM;
01065 
01066     tp->mdio_bus->name     = "tg3 mdio bus";
01067     snprintf(tp->mdio_bus->id, MII_BUS_ID_SIZE, "%x",
01068          (tp->pdev->bus->number << 8) | tp->pdev->devfn);
01069     tp->mdio_bus->priv     = tp;
01070     tp->mdio_bus->parent   = &tp->pdev->dev;
01071     tp->mdio_bus->read     = &tg3_mdio_read;
01072     tp->mdio_bus->write    = &tg3_mdio_write;
01073     tp->mdio_bus->reset    = &tg3_mdio_reset;
01074     tp->mdio_bus->phy_mask = ~(1 << PHY_ADDR);
01075     tp->mdio_bus->irq      = &tp->mdio_irq[0];
01076 
01077     for (i = 0; i < PHY_MAX_ADDR; i++)
01078         tp->mdio_bus->irq[i] = PHY_POLL;
01079 
01080     /* The bus registration will look for all the PHYs on the mdio bus.
01081      * Unfortunately, it does not ensure the PHY is powered up before
01082      * accessing the PHY ID registers.  A chip reset is the
01083      * quickest way to bring the device back to an operational state..
01084      */
01085     if (tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMCR, &reg) || (reg & BMCR_PDOWN))
01086         tg3_bmcr_reset(tp);
01087 
01088     i = mdiobus_register(tp->mdio_bus);
01089     if (i) {
01090         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: mdiobus_reg failed (0x%x)\n",
01091             tp->dev->name, i);
01092         mdiobus_free(tp->mdio_bus);
01093         return i;
01094     }
01095 
01096     phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
01097 
01098     if (!phydev || !phydev->drv) {
01099         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: No PHY devices\n", tp->dev->name);
01100         mdiobus_unregister(tp->mdio_bus);
01101         mdiobus_free(tp->mdio_bus);
01102         return -ENODEV;
01103     }
01104 
01105     switch (phydev->drv->phy_id & phydev->drv->phy_id_mask) {
01106     case TG3_PHY_ID_BCM57780:
01107         phydev->interface = PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_GMII;
01108         break;
01109     case TG3_PHY_ID_BCM50610:
01110         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_STD_IBND_DISABLE)
01111             phydev->dev_flags |= PHY_BRCM_STD_IBND_DISABLE;
01112         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_RX_EN)
01113             phydev->dev_flags |= PHY_BRCM_EXT_IBND_RX_ENABLE;
01114         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_TX_EN)
01115             phydev->dev_flags |= PHY_BRCM_EXT_IBND_TX_ENABLE;
01116         /* fallthru */
01117     case TG3_PHY_ID_RTL8211C:
01118         phydev->interface = PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_RGMII;
01119         break;
01120     case TG3_PHY_ID_RTL8201E:
01121     case TG3_PHY_ID_BCMAC131:
01122         phydev->interface = PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_MII;
01123         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET;
01124         break;
01125     }
01126 
01127     tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_MDIOBUS_INITED;
01128 
01129     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785)
01130         tg3_mdio_config_5785(tp);
01131 
01132     return 0;
01133 }
01134 
01135 static void tg3_mdio_fini(struct tg3 *tp)
01136 {
01137     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_MDIOBUS_INITED) {
01138         tp->tg3_flags3 &= ~TG3_FLG3_MDIOBUS_INITED;
01139         mdiobus_unregister(tp->mdio_bus);
01140         mdiobus_free(tp->mdio_bus);
01141     }
01142 }
01143 
01144 /* tp->lock is held. */
01145 static inline void tg3_generate_fw_event(struct tg3 *tp)
01146 {
01147     u32 val;
01148 
01149     val = tr32(GRC_RX_CPU_EVENT);
01150     val |= GRC_RX_CPU_DRIVER_EVENT;
01151     tw32_f(GRC_RX_CPU_EVENT, val);
01152 
01153     tp->last_event_jiffies = jiffies;
01154 }
01155 
01156 #define TG3_FW_EVENT_TIMEOUT_USEC 2500
01157 
01158 /* tp->lock is held. */
01159 static void tg3_wait_for_event_ack(struct tg3 *tp)
01160 {
01161     int i;
01162     unsigned int delay_cnt;
01163     long time_remain;
01164 
01165     /* If enough time has passed, no wait is necessary. */
01166     time_remain = (long)(tp->last_event_jiffies + 1 +
01167               usecs_to_jiffies(TG3_FW_EVENT_TIMEOUT_USEC)) -
01168               (long)jiffies;
01169     if (time_remain < 0)
01170         return;
01171 
01172     /* Check if we can shorten the wait time. */
01173     delay_cnt = jiffies_to_usecs(time_remain);
01174     if (delay_cnt > TG3_FW_EVENT_TIMEOUT_USEC)
01175         delay_cnt = TG3_FW_EVENT_TIMEOUT_USEC;
01176     delay_cnt = (delay_cnt >> 3) + 1;
01177 
01178     for (i = 0; i < delay_cnt; i++) {
01179         if (!(tr32(GRC_RX_CPU_EVENT) & GRC_RX_CPU_DRIVER_EVENT))
01180             break;
01181         udelay(8);
01182     }
01183 }
01184 
01185 /* tp->lock is held. */
01186 static void tg3_ump_link_report(struct tg3 *tp)
01187 {
01188     u32 reg;
01189     u32 val;
01190 
01191     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS) ||
01192         !(tp->tg3_flags  & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF))
01193         return;
01194 
01195     tg3_wait_for_event_ack(tp);
01196 
01197     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_MBOX, FWCMD_NICDRV_LINK_UPDATE);
01198 
01199     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_LEN_MBOX, 14);
01200 
01201     val = 0;
01202     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMCR, &reg))
01203         val = reg << 16;
01204     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMSR, &reg))
01205         val |= (reg & 0xffff);
01206     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_DATA_MBOX, val);
01207 
01208     val = 0;
01209     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_ADVERTISE, &reg))
01210         val = reg << 16;
01211     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_LPA, &reg))
01212         val |= (reg & 0xffff);
01213     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_DATA_MBOX + 4, val);
01214 
01215     val = 0;
01216     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES)) {
01217         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_CTRL1000, &reg))
01218             val = reg << 16;
01219         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_STAT1000, &reg))
01220             val |= (reg & 0xffff);
01221     }
01222     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_DATA_MBOX + 8, val);
01223 
01224     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_PHYADDR, &reg))
01225         val = reg << 16;
01226     else
01227         val = 0;
01228     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_DATA_MBOX + 12, val);
01229 
01230     tg3_generate_fw_event(tp);
01231 }
01232 
01233 static void tg3_link_report(struct tg3 *tp)
01234 {
01235     if (!netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev)) {
01236         if (netif_msg_link(tp))
01237             printk(KERN_INFO PFX "%s: Link is down.\n",
01238                    tp->dev->name);
01239         tg3_ump_link_report(tp);
01240     } else if (netif_msg_link(tp)) {
01241         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "%s: Link is up at %d Mbps, %s duplex.\n",
01242                tp->dev->name,
01243                (tp->link_config.active_speed == SPEED_1000 ?
01244             1000 :
01245             (tp->link_config.active_speed == SPEED_100 ?
01246              100 : 10)),
01247                (tp->link_config.active_duplex == DUPLEX_FULL ?
01248             "full" : "half"));
01249 
01250         printk(KERN_INFO PFX
01251                "%s: Flow control is %s for TX and %s for RX.\n",
01252                tp->dev->name,
01253                (tp->link_config.active_flowctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX) ?
01254                "on" : "off",
01255                (tp->link_config.active_flowctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX) ?
01256                "on" : "off");
01257         tg3_ump_link_report(tp);
01258     }
01259 }
01260 
01261 static u16 tg3_advert_flowctrl_1000T(u8 flow_ctrl)
01262 {
01263     u16 miireg;
01264 
01265     if ((flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX) && (flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX))
01266         miireg = ADVERTISE_PAUSE_CAP;
01267     else if (flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX)
01268         miireg = ADVERTISE_PAUSE_ASYM;
01269     else if (flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX)
01270         miireg = ADVERTISE_PAUSE_CAP | ADVERTISE_PAUSE_ASYM;
01271     else
01272         miireg = 0;
01273 
01274     return miireg;
01275 }
01276 
01277 static u16 tg3_advert_flowctrl_1000X(u8 flow_ctrl)
01278 {
01279     u16 miireg;
01280 
01281     if ((flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX) && (flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX))
01282         miireg = ADVERTISE_1000XPAUSE;
01283     else if (flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX)
01284         miireg = ADVERTISE_1000XPSE_ASYM;
01285     else if (flow_ctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX)
01286         miireg = ADVERTISE_1000XPAUSE | ADVERTISE_1000XPSE_ASYM;
01287     else
01288         miireg = 0;
01289 
01290     return miireg;
01291 }
01292 
01293 static u8 tg3_resolve_flowctrl_1000X(u16 lcladv, u16 rmtadv)
01294 {
01295     u8 cap = 0;
01296 
01297     if (lcladv & ADVERTISE_1000XPAUSE) {
01298         if (lcladv & ADVERTISE_1000XPSE_ASYM) {
01299             if (rmtadv & LPA_1000XPAUSE)
01300                 cap = FLOW_CTRL_TX | FLOW_CTRL_RX;
01301             else if (rmtadv & LPA_1000XPAUSE_ASYM)
01302                 cap = FLOW_CTRL_RX;
01303         } else {
01304             if (rmtadv & LPA_1000XPAUSE)
01305                 cap = FLOW_CTRL_TX | FLOW_CTRL_RX;
01306         }
01307     } else if (lcladv & ADVERTISE_1000XPSE_ASYM) {
01308         if ((rmtadv & LPA_1000XPAUSE) && (rmtadv & LPA_1000XPAUSE_ASYM))
01309             cap = FLOW_CTRL_TX;
01310     }
01311 
01312     return cap;
01313 }
01314 
01315 static void tg3_setup_flow_control(struct tg3 *tp, u32 lcladv, u32 rmtadv)
01316 {
01317     u8 autoneg;
01318     u8 flowctrl = 0;
01319     u32 old_rx_mode = tp->rx_mode;
01320     u32 old_tx_mode = tp->tx_mode;
01321 
01322     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB)
01323         autoneg = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]->autoneg;
01324     else
01325         autoneg = tp->link_config.autoneg;
01326 
01327     if (autoneg == AUTONEG_ENABLE &&
01328         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PAUSE_AUTONEG)) {
01329         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES)
01330             flowctrl = tg3_resolve_flowctrl_1000X(lcladv, rmtadv);
01331         else
01332             flowctrl = mii_resolve_flowctrl_fdx(lcladv, rmtadv);
01333     } else
01334         flowctrl = tp->link_config.flowctrl;
01335 
01336     tp->link_config.active_flowctrl = flowctrl;
01337 
01338     if (flowctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX)
01339         tp->rx_mode |= RX_MODE_FLOW_CTRL_ENABLE;
01340     else
01341         tp->rx_mode &= ~RX_MODE_FLOW_CTRL_ENABLE;
01342 
01343     if (old_rx_mode != tp->rx_mode)
01344         tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, tp->rx_mode);
01345 
01346     if (flowctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX)
01347         tp->tx_mode |= TX_MODE_FLOW_CTRL_ENABLE;
01348     else
01349         tp->tx_mode &= ~TX_MODE_FLOW_CTRL_ENABLE;
01350 
01351     if (old_tx_mode != tp->tx_mode)
01352         tw32_f(MAC_TX_MODE, tp->tx_mode);
01353 }
01354 
01355 static void tg3_adjust_link(struct net_device *dev)
01356 {
01357     u8 oldflowctrl, linkmesg = 0;
01358     u32 mac_mode, lcl_adv, rmt_adv;
01359     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
01360     struct phy_device *phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
01361 
01362     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
01363 
01364     mac_mode = tp->mac_mode & ~(MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MASK |
01365                     MAC_MODE_HALF_DUPLEX);
01366 
01367     oldflowctrl = tp->link_config.active_flowctrl;
01368 
01369     if (phydev->link) {
01370         lcl_adv = 0;
01371         rmt_adv = 0;
01372 
01373         if (phydev->speed == SPEED_100 || phydev->speed == SPEED_10)
01374             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MII;
01375         else
01376             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_GMII;
01377 
01378         if (phydev->duplex == DUPLEX_HALF)
01379             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_HALF_DUPLEX;
01380         else {
01381             lcl_adv = tg3_advert_flowctrl_1000T(
01382                   tp->link_config.flowctrl);
01383 
01384             if (phydev->pause)
01385                 rmt_adv = LPA_PAUSE_CAP;
01386             if (phydev->asym_pause)
01387                 rmt_adv |= LPA_PAUSE_ASYM;
01388         }
01389 
01390         tg3_setup_flow_control(tp, lcl_adv, rmt_adv);
01391     } else
01392         mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_GMII;
01393 
01394     if (mac_mode != tp->mac_mode) {
01395         tp->mac_mode = mac_mode;
01396         tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode);
01397         udelay(40);
01398     }
01399 
01400     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785) {
01401         if (phydev->speed == SPEED_10)
01402             tw32(MAC_MI_STAT,
01403                  MAC_MI_STAT_10MBPS_MODE |
01404                  MAC_MI_STAT_LNKSTAT_ATTN_ENAB);
01405         else
01406             tw32(MAC_MI_STAT, MAC_MI_STAT_LNKSTAT_ATTN_ENAB);
01407     }
01408 
01409     if (phydev->speed == SPEED_1000 && phydev->duplex == DUPLEX_HALF)
01410         tw32(MAC_TX_LENGTHS,
01411              ((2 << TX_LENGTHS_IPG_CRS_SHIFT) |
01412               (6 << TX_LENGTHS_IPG_SHIFT) |
01413               (0xff << TX_LENGTHS_SLOT_TIME_SHIFT)));
01414     else
01415         tw32(MAC_TX_LENGTHS,
01416              ((2 << TX_LENGTHS_IPG_CRS_SHIFT) |
01417               (6 << TX_LENGTHS_IPG_SHIFT) |
01418               (32 << TX_LENGTHS_SLOT_TIME_SHIFT)));
01419 
01420     if ((phydev->link && tp->link_config.active_speed == SPEED_INVALID) ||
01421         (!phydev->link && tp->link_config.active_speed != SPEED_INVALID) ||
01422         phydev->speed != tp->link_config.active_speed ||
01423         phydev->duplex != tp->link_config.active_duplex ||
01424         oldflowctrl != tp->link_config.active_flowctrl)
01425         linkmesg = 1;
01426 
01427     tp->link_config.active_speed = phydev->speed;
01428     tp->link_config.active_duplex = phydev->duplex;
01429 
01430     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
01431 
01432     if (linkmesg)
01433         tg3_link_report(tp);
01434 }
01435 
01436 static int tg3_phy_init(struct tg3 *tp)
01437 {
01438     struct phy_device *phydev;
01439 
01440     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED)
01441         return 0;
01442 
01443     /* Bring the PHY back to a known state. */
01444     tg3_bmcr_reset(tp);
01445 
01446     phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
01447 
01448     /* Attach the MAC to the PHY. */
01449     phydev = phy_connect(tp->dev, dev_name(&phydev->dev), tg3_adjust_link,
01450                  phydev->dev_flags, phydev->interface);
01451     if (IS_ERR(phydev)) {
01452         printk(KERN_ERR "%s: Could not attach to PHY\n", tp->dev->name);
01453         return PTR_ERR(phydev);
01454     }
01455 
01456     /* Mask with MAC supported features. */
01457     switch (phydev->interface) {
01458     case PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_GMII:
01459     case PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_RGMII:
01460         if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY)) {
01461             phydev->supported &= (PHY_GBIT_FEATURES |
01462                           SUPPORTED_Pause |
01463                           SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
01464             break;
01465         }
01466         /* fallthru */
01467     case PHY_INTERFACE_MODE_MII:
01468         phydev->supported &= (PHY_BASIC_FEATURES |
01469                       SUPPORTED_Pause |
01470                       SUPPORTED_Asym_Pause);
01471         break;
01472     default:
01473         phy_disconnect(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]);
01474         return -EINVAL;
01475     }
01476 
01477     tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED;
01478 
01479     phydev->advertising = phydev->supported;
01480 
01481     return 0;
01482 }
01483 
01484 static void tg3_phy_start(struct tg3 *tp)
01485 {
01486     struct phy_device *phydev;
01487 
01488     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
01489         return;
01490 
01491     phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
01492 
01493     if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power) {
01494         tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power = 0;
01495         phydev->speed = tp->link_config.orig_speed;
01496         phydev->duplex = tp->link_config.orig_duplex;
01497         phydev->autoneg = tp->link_config.orig_autoneg;
01498         phydev->advertising = tp->link_config.orig_advertising;
01499     }
01500 
01501     phy_start(phydev);
01502 
01503     phy_start_aneg(phydev);
01504 }
01505 
01506 static void tg3_phy_stop(struct tg3 *tp)
01507 {
01508     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
01509         return;
01510 
01511     phy_stop(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]);
01512 }
01513 
01514 static void tg3_phy_fini(struct tg3 *tp)
01515 {
01516     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED) {
01517         phy_disconnect(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]);
01518         tp->tg3_flags3 &= ~TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED;
01519     }
01520 }
01521 
01522 static void tg3_phydsp_write(struct tg3 *tp, u32 reg, u32 val)
01523 {
01524     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, reg);
01525     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, val);
01526 }
01527 
01528 static void tg3_phy_fet_toggle_apd(struct tg3 *tp, bool enable)
01529 {
01530     u32 phytest;
01531 
01532     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_TEST, &phytest)) {
01533         u32 phy;
01534 
01535         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_TEST,
01536                  phytest | MII_TG3_FET_SHADOW_EN);
01537         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_AUXSTAT2, &phy)) {
01538             if (enable)
01539                 phy |= MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_AUXSTAT2_APD;
01540             else
01541                 phy &= ~MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_AUXSTAT2_APD;
01542             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_AUXSTAT2, phy);
01543         }
01544         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_TEST, phytest);
01545     }
01546 }
01547 
01548 static void tg3_phy_toggle_apd(struct tg3 *tp, bool enable)
01549 {
01550     u32 reg;
01551 
01552     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
01553         return;
01554 
01555     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) {
01556         tg3_phy_fet_toggle_apd(tp, enable);
01557         return;
01558     }
01559 
01560     reg = MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_WREN |
01561           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_SCR5_SEL |
01562           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_SCR5_LPED |
01563           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_SCR5_DLPTLM |
01564           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_SCR5_SDTL |
01565           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_SCR5_C125OE;
01566     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5784 || !enable)
01567         reg |= MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_SCR5_DLLAPD;
01568 
01569     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW, reg);
01570 
01571 
01572     reg = MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_WREN |
01573           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_APD_SEL |
01574           MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_APD_WKTM_84MS;
01575     if (enable)
01576         reg |= MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW_APD_ENABLE;
01577 
01578     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_MISC_SHDW, reg);
01579 }
01580 
01581 static void tg3_phy_toggle_automdix(struct tg3 *tp, int enable)
01582 {
01583     u32 phy;
01584 
01585     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) ||
01586         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES))
01587         return;
01588 
01589     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) {
01590         u32 ephy;
01591 
01592         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_TEST, &ephy)) {
01593             u32 reg = MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_MISCCTRL;
01594 
01595             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_TEST,
01596                      ephy | MII_TG3_FET_SHADOW_EN);
01597             if (!tg3_readphy(tp, reg, &phy)) {
01598                 if (enable)
01599                     phy |= MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_MISCCTRL_MDIX;
01600                 else
01601                     phy &= ~MII_TG3_FET_SHDW_MISCCTRL_MDIX;
01602                 tg3_writephy(tp, reg, phy);
01603             }
01604             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_TEST, ephy);
01605         }
01606     } else {
01607         phy = MII_TG3_AUXCTL_MISC_RDSEL_MISC |
01608               MII_TG3_AUXCTL_SHDWSEL_MISC;
01609         if (!tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, phy) &&
01610             !tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, &phy)) {
01611             if (enable)
01612                 phy |= MII_TG3_AUXCTL_MISC_FORCE_AMDIX;
01613             else
01614                 phy &= ~MII_TG3_AUXCTL_MISC_FORCE_AMDIX;
01615             phy |= MII_TG3_AUXCTL_MISC_WREN;
01616             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, phy);
01617         }
01618     }
01619 }
01620 
01621 static void tg3_phy_set_wirespeed(struct tg3 *tp)
01622 {
01623     u32 val;
01624 
01625     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_NO_ETH_WIRE_SPEED)
01626         return;
01627 
01628     if (!tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x7007) &&
01629         !tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, &val))
01630         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL,
01631                  (val | (1 << 15) | (1 << 4)));
01632 }
01633 
01634 static void tg3_phy_apply_otp(struct tg3 *tp)
01635 {
01636     u32 otp, phy;
01637 
01638     if (!tp->phy_otp)
01639         return;
01640 
01641     otp = tp->phy_otp;
01642 
01643     /* Enable SM_DSP clock and tx 6dB coding. */
01644     phy = MII_TG3_AUXCTL_SHDWSEL_AUXCTL |
01645           MII_TG3_AUXCTL_ACTL_SMDSP_ENA |
01646           MII_TG3_AUXCTL_ACTL_TX_6DB;
01647     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, phy);
01648 
01649     phy = ((otp & TG3_OTP_AGCTGT_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_AGCTGT_SHIFT);
01650     phy |= MII_TG3_DSP_TAP1_AGCTGT_DFLT;
01651     tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_TAP1, phy);
01652 
01653     phy = ((otp & TG3_OTP_HPFFLTR_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_HPFFLTR_SHIFT) |
01654           ((otp & TG3_OTP_HPFOVER_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_HPFOVER_SHIFT);
01655     tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_AADJ1CH0, phy);
01656 
01657     phy = ((otp & TG3_OTP_LPFDIS_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_LPFDIS_SHIFT);
01658     phy |= MII_TG3_DSP_AADJ1CH3_ADCCKADJ;
01659     tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_AADJ1CH3, phy);
01660 
01661     phy = ((otp & TG3_OTP_VDAC_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_VDAC_SHIFT);
01662     tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_EXP75, phy);
01663 
01664     phy = ((otp & TG3_OTP_10BTAMP_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_10BTAMP_SHIFT);
01665     tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_EXP96, phy);
01666 
01667     phy = ((otp & TG3_OTP_ROFF_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_ROFF_SHIFT) |
01668           ((otp & TG3_OTP_RCOFF_MASK) >> TG3_OTP_RCOFF_SHIFT);
01669     tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_EXP97, phy);
01670 
01671     /* Turn off SM_DSP clock. */
01672     phy = MII_TG3_AUXCTL_SHDWSEL_AUXCTL |
01673           MII_TG3_AUXCTL_ACTL_TX_6DB;
01674     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, phy);
01675 }
01676 
01677 static int tg3_wait_macro_done(struct tg3 *tp)
01678 {
01679     int limit = 100;
01680 
01681     while (limit--) {
01682         u32 tmp32;
01683 
01684         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, 0x16, &tmp32)) {
01685             if ((tmp32 & 0x1000) == 0)
01686                 break;
01687         }
01688     }
01689     if (limit < 0)
01690         return -EBUSY;
01691 
01692     return 0;
01693 }
01694 
01695 static int tg3_phy_write_and_check_testpat(struct tg3 *tp, int *resetp)
01696 {
01697     static const u32 test_pat[4][6] = {
01698     { 0x00005555, 0x00000005, 0x00002aaa, 0x0000000a, 0x00003456, 0x00000003 },
01699     { 0x00002aaa, 0x0000000a, 0x00003333, 0x00000003, 0x0000789a, 0x00000005 },
01700     { 0x00005a5a, 0x00000005, 0x00002a6a, 0x0000000a, 0x00001bcd, 0x00000003 },
01701     { 0x00002a5a, 0x0000000a, 0x000033c3, 0x00000003, 0x00002ef1, 0x00000005 }
01702     };
01703     int chan;
01704 
01705     for (chan = 0; chan < 4; chan++) {
01706         int i;
01707 
01708         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS,
01709                  (chan * 0x2000) | 0x0200);
01710         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0002);
01711 
01712         for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
01713             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT,
01714                      test_pat[chan][i]);
01715 
01716         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0202);
01717         if (tg3_wait_macro_done(tp)) {
01718             *resetp = 1;
01719             return -EBUSY;
01720         }
01721 
01722         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS,
01723                  (chan * 0x2000) | 0x0200);
01724         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0082);
01725         if (tg3_wait_macro_done(tp)) {
01726             *resetp = 1;
01727             return -EBUSY;
01728         }
01729 
01730         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0802);
01731         if (tg3_wait_macro_done(tp)) {
01732             *resetp = 1;
01733             return -EBUSY;
01734         }
01735 
01736         for (i = 0; i < 6; i += 2) {
01737             u32 low, high;
01738 
01739             if (tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, &low) ||
01740                 tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, &high) ||
01741                 tg3_wait_macro_done(tp)) {
01742                 *resetp = 1;
01743                 return -EBUSY;
01744             }
01745             low &= 0x7fff;
01746             high &= 0x000f;
01747             if (low != test_pat[chan][i] ||
01748                 high != test_pat[chan][i+1]) {
01749                 tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x000b);
01750                 tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x4001);
01751                 tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x4005);
01752 
01753                 return -EBUSY;
01754             }
01755         }
01756     }
01757 
01758     return 0;
01759 }
01760 
01761 static int tg3_phy_reset_chanpat(struct tg3 *tp)
01762 {
01763     int chan;
01764 
01765     for (chan = 0; chan < 4; chan++) {
01766         int i;
01767 
01768         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS,
01769                  (chan * 0x2000) | 0x0200);
01770         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0002);
01771         for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
01772             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x000);
01773         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0202);
01774         if (tg3_wait_macro_done(tp))
01775             return -EBUSY;
01776     }
01777 
01778     return 0;
01779 }
01780 
01781 static int tg3_phy_reset_5703_4_5(struct tg3 *tp)
01782 {
01783     u32 reg32, phy9_orig;
01784     int retries, do_phy_reset, err;
01785 
01786     retries = 10;
01787     do_phy_reset = 1;
01788     do {
01789         if (do_phy_reset) {
01790             err = tg3_bmcr_reset(tp);
01791             if (err)
01792                 return err;
01793             do_phy_reset = 0;
01794         }
01795 
01796         /* Disable transmitter and interrupt.  */
01797         if (tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL, &reg32))
01798             continue;
01799 
01800         reg32 |= 0x3000;
01801         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL, reg32);
01802 
01803         /* Set full-duplex, 1000 mbps.  */
01804         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_BMCR,
01805                  BMCR_FULLDPLX | TG3_BMCR_SPEED1000);
01806 
01807         /* Set to master mode.  */
01808         if (tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_CTRL, &phy9_orig))
01809             continue;
01810 
01811         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_CTRL,
01812                  (MII_TG3_CTRL_AS_MASTER |
01813                   MII_TG3_CTRL_ENABLE_AS_MASTER));
01814 
01815         /* Enable SM_DSP_CLOCK and 6dB.  */
01816         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0c00);
01817 
01818         /* Block the PHY control access.  */
01819         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x8005);
01820         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x0800);
01821 
01822         err = tg3_phy_write_and_check_testpat(tp, &do_phy_reset);
01823         if (!err)
01824             break;
01825     } while (--retries);
01826 
01827     err = tg3_phy_reset_chanpat(tp);
01828     if (err)
01829         return err;
01830 
01831     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x8005);
01832     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x0000);
01833 
01834     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x8200);
01835     tg3_writephy(tp, 0x16, 0x0000);
01836 
01837     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 ||
01838         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) {
01839         /* Set Extended packet length bit for jumbo frames */
01840         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x4400);
01841     }
01842     else {
01843         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0400);
01844     }
01845 
01846     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_CTRL, phy9_orig);
01847 
01848     if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL, &reg32)) {
01849         reg32 &= ~0x3000;
01850         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL, reg32);
01851     } else if (!err)
01852         err = -EBUSY;
01853 
01854     return err;
01855 }
01856 
01857 /* This will reset the tigon3 PHY if there is no valid
01858  * link unless the FORCE argument is non-zero.
01859  */
01860 static int tg3_phy_reset(struct tg3 *tp)
01861 {
01862     u32 cpmuctrl;
01863     u32 phy_status;
01864     int err;
01865 
01866     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
01867         u32 val;
01868 
01869         val = tr32(GRC_MISC_CFG);
01870         tw32_f(GRC_MISC_CFG, val & ~GRC_MISC_CFG_EPHY_IDDQ);
01871         udelay(40);
01872     }
01873     err  = tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMSR, &phy_status);
01874     err |= tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMSR, &phy_status);
01875     if (err != 0)
01876         return -EBUSY;
01877 
01878     if (netif_running(tp->dev) && netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev)) {
01879         netif_carrier_off(tp->dev);
01880         tg3_link_report(tp);
01881     }
01882 
01883     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 ||
01884         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704 ||
01885         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705) {
01886         err = tg3_phy_reset_5703_4_5(tp);
01887         if (err)
01888             return err;
01889         goto out;
01890     }
01891 
01892     cpmuctrl = 0;
01893     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 &&
01894         GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5784_AX) {
01895         cpmuctrl = tr32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL);
01896         if (cpmuctrl & CPMU_CTRL_GPHY_10MB_RXONLY)
01897             tw32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL,
01898                  cpmuctrl & ~CPMU_CTRL_GPHY_10MB_RXONLY);
01899     }
01900 
01901     err = tg3_bmcr_reset(tp);
01902     if (err)
01903         return err;
01904 
01905     if (cpmuctrl & CPMU_CTRL_GPHY_10MB_RXONLY) {
01906         u32 phy;
01907 
01908         phy = MII_TG3_DSP_EXP8_AEDW | MII_TG3_DSP_EXP8_REJ2MHz;
01909         tg3_phydsp_write(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_EXP8, phy);
01910 
01911         tw32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL, cpmuctrl);
01912     }
01913 
01914     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5784_AX ||
01915         GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5761_AX) {
01916         u32 val;
01917 
01918         val = tr32(TG3_CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_CLK);
01919         if ((val & CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_MACCLK_MASK) ==
01920             CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_MACCLK_12_5) {
01921             val &= ~CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_MACCLK_MASK;
01922             udelay(40);
01923             tw32_f(TG3_CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_CLK, val);
01924         }
01925     }
01926 
01927     tg3_phy_apply_otp(tp);
01928 
01929     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_ENABLE_APD)
01930         tg3_phy_toggle_apd(tp, true);
01931     else
01932         tg3_phy_toggle_apd(tp, false);
01933 
01934 out:
01935     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_ADC_BUG) {
01936         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0c00);
01937         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x201f);
01938         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x2aaa);
01939         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x000a);
01940         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x0323);
01941         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0400);
01942     }
01943     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_5704_A0_BUG) {
01944         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x1c, 0x8d68);
01945         tg3_writephy(tp, 0x1c, 0x8d68);
01946     }
01947     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_BER_BUG) {
01948         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0c00);
01949         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x000a);
01950         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x310b);
01951         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x201f);
01952         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x9506);
01953         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x401f);
01954         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x14e2);
01955         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0400);
01956     }
01957     else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_JITTER_BUG) {
01958         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0c00);
01959         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_ADDRESS, 0x000a);
01960         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_ADJUST_TRIM) {
01961             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x110b);
01962             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_TEST1,
01963                      MII_TG3_TEST1_TRIM_EN | 0x4);
01964         } else
01965             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_DSP_RW_PORT, 0x010b);
01966         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0400);
01967     }
01968     /* Set Extended packet length bit (bit 14) on all chips that */
01969     /* support jumbo frames */
01970     if ((tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) == PHY_ID_BCM5401) {
01971         /* Cannot do read-modify-write on 5401 */
01972         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x4c20);
01973     } else if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) {
01974         u32 phy_reg;
01975 
01976         /* Set bit 14 with read-modify-write to preserve other bits */
01977         if (!tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, 0x0007) &&
01978             !tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, &phy_reg))
01979             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL, phy_reg | 0x4000);
01980     }
01981 
01982     /* Set phy register 0x10 bit 0 to high fifo elasticity to support
01983      * jumbo frames transmission.
01984      */
01985     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) {
01986         u32 phy_reg;
01987 
01988         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL, &phy_reg))
01989             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL,
01990                  phy_reg | MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL_FIFO_ELASTIC);
01991     }
01992 
01993     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
01994         /* adjust output voltage */
01995         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_PTEST, 0x12);
01996     }
01997 
01998     tg3_phy_toggle_automdix(tp, 1);
01999     tg3_phy_set_wirespeed(tp);
02000     return 0;
02001 }
02002 
02003 static void tg3_frob_aux_power(struct tg3 *tp)
02004 {
02005     struct tg3 *tp_peer = tp;
02006 
02007     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC) == 0)
02008         return;
02009 
02010     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704 ||
02011         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5714 ||
02012         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717) {
02013         struct net_device *dev_peer;
02014 
02015         dev_peer = pci_get_drvdata(tp->pdev_peer);
02016         /* remove_one() may have been run on the peer. */
02017         if (!dev_peer)
02018             tp_peer = tp;
02019         else
02020             tp_peer = netdev_priv(dev_peer);
02021     }
02022 
02023     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE) != 0 ||
02024         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) != 0 ||
02025         (tp_peer->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE) != 0 ||
02026         (tp_peer->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) != 0) {
02027         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
02028             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701) {
02029             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02030                     (GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE0 |
02031                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
02032                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE2 |
02033                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT0 |
02034                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1),
02035                     100);
02036         } else if (tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5761 ||
02037                tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_5761S) {
02038             /* The 5761 non-e device swaps GPIO 0 and GPIO 2. */
02039             u32 grc_local_ctrl = GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE0 |
02040                          GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
02041                          GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE2 |
02042                          GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT0 |
02043                          GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1 |
02044                          tp->grc_local_ctrl;
02045             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02046 
02047             grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT2;
02048             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02049 
02050             grc_local_ctrl &= ~GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT0;
02051             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02052         } else {
02053             u32 no_gpio2;
02054             u32 grc_local_ctrl = 0;
02055 
02056             if (tp_peer != tp &&
02057                 (tp_peer->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE) != 0)
02058                 return;
02059 
02060             /* Workaround to prevent overdrawing Amps. */
02061             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) ==
02062                 ASIC_REV_5714) {
02063                 grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE3;
02064                 tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02065                         grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02066             }
02067 
02068             /* On 5753 and variants, GPIO2 cannot be used. */
02069             no_gpio2 = tp->nic_sram_data_cfg &
02070                     NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_NO_GPIO2;
02071 
02072             grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE0 |
02073                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
02074                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE2 |
02075                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1 |
02076                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT2;
02077             if (no_gpio2) {
02078                 grc_local_ctrl &= ~(GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE2 |
02079                             GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT2);
02080             }
02081             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02082                             grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02083 
02084             grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT0;
02085 
02086             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02087                             grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02088 
02089             if (!no_gpio2) {
02090                 grc_local_ctrl &= ~GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT2;
02091                 tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02092                         grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02093             }
02094         }
02095     } else {
02096         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700 &&
02097             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5701) {
02098             if (tp_peer != tp &&
02099                 (tp_peer->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE) != 0)
02100                 return;
02101 
02102             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02103                     (GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
02104                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1), 100);
02105 
02106             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02107                     GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1, 100);
02108 
02109             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl |
02110                     (GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
02111                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1), 100);
02112         }
02113     }
02114 }
02115 
02116 static int tg3_5700_link_polarity(struct tg3 *tp, u32 speed)
02117 {
02118     if (tp->led_ctrl == LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_2)
02119         return 1;
02120     else if ((tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) == PHY_ID_BCM5411) {
02121         if (speed != SPEED_10)
02122             return 1;
02123     } else if (speed == SPEED_10)
02124         return 1;
02125 
02126     return 0;
02127 }
02128 
02129 static int tg3_setup_phy(struct tg3 *, int);
02130 
02131 #define RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN 0
02132 #define RESET_KIND_INIT     1
02133 #define RESET_KIND_SUSPEND  2
02134 
02135 static void tg3_write_sig_post_reset(struct tg3 *, int);
02136 static int tg3_halt_cpu(struct tg3 *, u32);
02137 
02138 static void tg3_power_down_phy(struct tg3 *tp, bool do_low_power)
02139 {
02140     u32 val;
02141 
02142     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) {
02143         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) {
02144             u32 sg_dig_ctrl = tr32(SG_DIG_CTRL);
02145             u32 serdes_cfg = tr32(MAC_SERDES_CFG);
02146 
02147             sg_dig_ctrl |=
02148                 SG_DIG_USING_HW_AUTONEG | SG_DIG_SOFT_RESET;
02149             tw32(SG_DIG_CTRL, sg_dig_ctrl);
02150             tw32(MAC_SERDES_CFG, serdes_cfg | (1 << 15));
02151         }
02152         return;
02153     }
02154 
02155     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
02156         tg3_bmcr_reset(tp);
02157         val = tr32(GRC_MISC_CFG);
02158         tw32_f(GRC_MISC_CFG, val | GRC_MISC_CFG_EPHY_IDDQ);
02159         udelay(40);
02160         return;
02161     } else if (do_low_power) {
02162         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL,
02163                  MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL_FORCE_LED_OFF);
02164 
02165         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_AUX_CTRL,
02166                  MII_TG3_AUXCTL_SHDWSEL_PWRCTL |
02167                  MII_TG3_AUXCTL_PCTL_100TX_LPWR |
02168                  MII_TG3_AUXCTL_PCTL_SPR_ISOLATE |
02169                  MII_TG3_AUXCTL_PCTL_VREG_11V);
02170     }
02171 
02172     /* The PHY should not be powered down on some chips because
02173      * of bugs.
02174      */
02175     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
02176         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704 ||
02177         (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5780 &&
02178          (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES)))
02179         return;
02180 
02181     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5784_AX ||
02182         GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5761_AX) {
02183         val = tr32(TG3_CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_CLK);
02184         val &= ~CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_MACCLK_MASK;
02185         val |= CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_MACCLK_12_5;
02186         tw32_f(TG3_CPMU_LSPD_1000MB_CLK, val);
02187     }
02188 
02189     tg3_writephy(tp, MII_BMCR, BMCR_PDOWN);
02190 }
02191 
02192 /* tp->lock is held. */
02193 static int tg3_nvram_lock(struct tg3 *tp)
02194 {
02195     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM) {
02196         int i;
02197 
02198         if (tp->nvram_lock_cnt == 0) {
02199             tw32(NVRAM_SWARB, SWARB_REQ_SET1);
02200             for (i = 0; i < 8000; i++) {
02201                 if (tr32(NVRAM_SWARB) & SWARB_GNT1)
02202                     break;
02203                 udelay(20);
02204             }
02205             if (i == 8000) {
02206                 tw32(NVRAM_SWARB, SWARB_REQ_CLR1);
02207                 return -ENODEV;
02208             }
02209         }
02210         tp->nvram_lock_cnt++;
02211     }
02212     return 0;
02213 }
02214 
02215 /* tp->lock is held. */
02216 static void tg3_nvram_unlock(struct tg3 *tp)
02217 {
02218     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM) {
02219         if (tp->nvram_lock_cnt > 0)
02220             tp->nvram_lock_cnt--;
02221         if (tp->nvram_lock_cnt == 0)
02222             tw32_f(NVRAM_SWARB, SWARB_REQ_CLR1);
02223     }
02224 }
02225 
02226 /* tp->lock is held. */
02227 static void tg3_enable_nvram_access(struct tg3 *tp)
02228 {
02229     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS) &&
02230         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PROTECTED_NVRAM)) {
02231         u32 nvaccess = tr32(NVRAM_ACCESS);
02232 
02233         tw32(NVRAM_ACCESS, nvaccess | ACCESS_ENABLE);
02234     }
02235 }
02236 
02237 /* tp->lock is held. */
02238 static void tg3_disable_nvram_access(struct tg3 *tp)
02239 {
02240     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS) &&
02241         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PROTECTED_NVRAM)) {
02242         u32 nvaccess = tr32(NVRAM_ACCESS);
02243 
02244         tw32(NVRAM_ACCESS, nvaccess & ~ACCESS_ENABLE);
02245     }
02246 }
02247 
02248 static int tg3_nvram_read_using_eeprom(struct tg3 *tp,
02249                     u32 offset, u32 *val)
02250 {
02251     u32 tmp;
02252     int i;
02253 
02254     if (offset > EEPROM_ADDR_ADDR_MASK || (offset % 4) != 0)
02255         return -EINVAL;
02256 
02257     tmp = tr32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR) & ~(EEPROM_ADDR_ADDR_MASK |
02258                     EEPROM_ADDR_DEVID_MASK |
02259                     EEPROM_ADDR_READ);
02260     tw32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR,
02261          tmp |
02262          (0 << EEPROM_ADDR_DEVID_SHIFT) |
02263          ((offset << EEPROM_ADDR_ADDR_SHIFT) &
02264           EEPROM_ADDR_ADDR_MASK) |
02265          EEPROM_ADDR_READ | EEPROM_ADDR_START);
02266 
02267     for (i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
02268         tmp = tr32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR);
02269 
02270         if (tmp & EEPROM_ADDR_COMPLETE)
02271             break;
02272         msleep(1);
02273     }
02274     if (!(tmp & EEPROM_ADDR_COMPLETE))
02275         return -EBUSY;
02276 
02277     tmp = tr32(GRC_EEPROM_DATA);
02278 
02279     /*
02280      * The data will always be opposite the native endian
02281      * format.  Perform a blind byteswap to compensate.
02282      */
02283     *val = swab32(tmp);
02284 
02285     return 0;
02286 }
02287 
02288 #define NVRAM_CMD_TIMEOUT 10000
02289 
02290 static int tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(struct tg3 *tp, u32 nvram_cmd)
02291 {
02292     int i;
02293 
02294     tw32(NVRAM_CMD, nvram_cmd);
02295     for (i = 0; i < NVRAM_CMD_TIMEOUT; i++) {
02296         udelay(10);
02297         if (tr32(NVRAM_CMD) & NVRAM_CMD_DONE) {
02298             udelay(10);
02299             break;
02300         }
02301     }
02302 
02303     if (i == NVRAM_CMD_TIMEOUT)
02304         return -EBUSY;
02305 
02306     return 0;
02307 }
02308 
02309 static u32 tg3_nvram_phys_addr(struct tg3 *tp, u32 addr)
02310 {
02311     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM) &&
02312         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED) &&
02313         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_FLASH) &&
02314        !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM_ADDR_TRANS) &&
02315         (tp->nvram_jedecnum == JEDEC_ATMEL))
02316 
02317         addr = ((addr / tp->nvram_pagesize) <<
02318             ATMEL_AT45DB0X1B_PAGE_POS) +
02319                (addr % tp->nvram_pagesize);
02320 
02321     return addr;
02322 }
02323 
02324 static u32 tg3_nvram_logical_addr(struct tg3 *tp, u32 addr)
02325 {
02326     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM) &&
02327         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED) &&
02328         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_FLASH) &&
02329        !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM_ADDR_TRANS) &&
02330         (tp->nvram_jedecnum == JEDEC_ATMEL))
02331 
02332         addr = ((addr >> ATMEL_AT45DB0X1B_PAGE_POS) *
02333             tp->nvram_pagesize) +
02334                (addr & ((1 << ATMEL_AT45DB0X1B_PAGE_POS) - 1));
02335 
02336     return addr;
02337 }
02338 
02339 /* NOTE: Data read in from NVRAM is byteswapped according to
02340  * the byteswapping settings for all other register accesses.
02341  * tg3 devices are BE devices, so on a BE machine, the data
02342  * returned will be exactly as it is seen in NVRAM.  On a LE
02343  * machine, the 32-bit value will be byteswapped.
02344  */
02345 static int tg3_nvram_read(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, u32 *val)
02346 {
02347     int ret;
02348 
02349     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM))
02350         return tg3_nvram_read_using_eeprom(tp, offset, val);
02351 
02352     offset = tg3_nvram_phys_addr(tp, offset);
02353 
02354     if (offset > NVRAM_ADDR_MSK)
02355         return -EINVAL;
02356 
02357     ret = tg3_nvram_lock(tp);
02358     if (ret)
02359         return ret;
02360 
02361     tg3_enable_nvram_access(tp);
02362 
02363     tw32(NVRAM_ADDR, offset);
02364     ret = tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, NVRAM_CMD_RD | NVRAM_CMD_GO |
02365         NVRAM_CMD_FIRST | NVRAM_CMD_LAST | NVRAM_CMD_DONE);
02366 
02367     if (ret == 0)
02368         *val = tr32(NVRAM_RDDATA);
02369 
02370     tg3_disable_nvram_access(tp);
02371 
02372     tg3_nvram_unlock(tp);
02373 
02374     return ret;
02375 }
02376 
02377 /* Ensures NVRAM data is in bytestream format. */
02378 static int tg3_nvram_read_be32(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, __be32 *val)
02379 {
02380     u32 v;
02381     int res = tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset, &v);
02382     if (!res)
02383         *val = cpu_to_be32(v);
02384     return res;
02385 }
02386 
02387 /* tp->lock is held. */
02388 static void __tg3_set_mac_addr(struct tg3 *tp, int skip_mac_1)
02389 {
02390     u32 addr_high, addr_low;
02391     int i;
02392 
02393     addr_high = ((tp->dev->dev_addr[0] << 8) |
02394              tp->dev->dev_addr[1]);
02395     addr_low = ((tp->dev->dev_addr[2] << 24) |
02396             (tp->dev->dev_addr[3] << 16) |
02397             (tp->dev->dev_addr[4] <<  8) |
02398             (tp->dev->dev_addr[5] <<  0));
02399     for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
02400         if (i == 1 && skip_mac_1)
02401             continue;
02402         tw32(MAC_ADDR_0_HIGH + (i * 8), addr_high);
02403         tw32(MAC_ADDR_0_LOW + (i * 8), addr_low);
02404     }
02405 
02406     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 ||
02407         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) {
02408         for (i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
02409             tw32(MAC_EXTADDR_0_HIGH + (i * 8), addr_high);
02410             tw32(MAC_EXTADDR_0_LOW + (i * 8), addr_low);
02411         }
02412     }
02413 
02414     addr_high = (tp->dev->dev_addr[0] +
02415              tp->dev->dev_addr[1] +
02416              tp->dev->dev_addr[2] +
02417              tp->dev->dev_addr[3] +
02418              tp->dev->dev_addr[4] +
02419              tp->dev->dev_addr[5]) &
02420         TX_BACKOFF_SEED_MASK;
02421     tw32(MAC_TX_BACKOFF_SEED, addr_high);
02422 }
02423 
02424 static int tg3_set_power_state(struct tg3 *tp, pci_power_t state)
02425 {
02426     u32 misc_host_ctrl;
02427     bool device_should_wake, do_low_power;
02428 
02429     /* Make sure register accesses (indirect or otherwise)
02430      * will function correctly.
02431      */
02432     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev,
02433                    TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
02434                    tp->misc_host_ctrl);
02435 
02436     switch (state) {
02437     case PCI_D0:
02438         pci_enable_wake(tp->pdev, state, false);
02439         pci_set_power_state(tp->pdev, PCI_D0);
02440 
02441         /* Switch out of Vaux if it is a NIC */
02442         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC)
02443             tw32_wait_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl, 100);
02444 
02445         return 0;
02446 
02447     case PCI_D1:
02448     case PCI_D2:
02449     case PCI_D3hot:
02450         break;
02451 
02452     default:
02453         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "%s: Invalid power state (D%d) requested\n",
02454             tp->dev->name, state);
02455         return -EINVAL;
02456     }
02457 
02458     /* Restore the CLKREQ setting. */
02459     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_CLKREQ_BUG) {
02460         u16 lnkctl;
02461 
02462         pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev,
02463                      tp->pcie_cap + PCI_EXP_LNKCTL,
02464                      &lnkctl);
02465         lnkctl |= PCI_EXP_LNKCTL_CLKREQ_EN;
02466         pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev,
02467                       tp->pcie_cap + PCI_EXP_LNKCTL,
02468                       lnkctl);
02469     }
02470 
02471     misc_host_ctrl = tr32(TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL);
02472     tw32(TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
02473          misc_host_ctrl | MISC_HOST_CTRL_MASK_PCI_INT);
02474 
02475     device_should_wake = pci_pme_capable(tp->pdev, state) &&
02476                  device_may_wakeup(&tp->pdev->dev) &&
02477                  (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE);
02478 
02479     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
02480         do_low_power = false;
02481         if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED) &&
02482             !tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power) {
02483             struct phy_device *phydev;
02484             u32 phyid, advertising;
02485 
02486             phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
02487 
02488             tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power = 1;
02489 
02490             tp->link_config.orig_speed = phydev->speed;
02491             tp->link_config.orig_duplex = phydev->duplex;
02492             tp->link_config.orig_autoneg = phydev->autoneg;
