04612             skb_reserve(copy_skb, TG3_RAW_IP_ALIGN);
04613             skb_put(copy_skb, len);
04614             pci_dma_sync_single_for_cpu(tp->pdev, dma_addr, len, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
04615             skb_copy_from_linear_data(skb, copy_skb->data, len);
04616             pci_dma_sync_single_for_device(tp->pdev, dma_addr, len, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
04617 
04618             /* We'll reuse the original ring buffer. */
04619             skb = copy_skb;
04620         }
04621 
04622         if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_RX_CHECKSUMS) &&
04623             (desc->type_flags & RXD_FLAG_TCPUDP_CSUM) &&
04624             (((desc->ip_tcp_csum & RXD_TCPCSUM_MASK)
04625               >> RXD_TCPCSUM_SHIFT) == 0xffff))
04626             skb->ip_summed = CHECKSUM_UNNECESSARY;
04627         else
04628             skb->ip_summed = CHECKSUM_NONE;
04629 
04630         skb->protocol = eth_type_trans(skb, tp->dev);
04631 
04632 
04633         #ifdef HAVE_PF_RING
04634             {
04635               int debug = 0;
04636               struct pfring_hooks *hook = (struct pfring_hooks*)tp->dev->pfring_ptr;
04637               
04638               if(hook && (hook->magic == PF_RING)) {
04639                 /* Wow: PF_RING is alive & kickin' ! */
04640                 int rc;
04641         
04642                 if(debug) 
04643                   printk(KERN_INFO "[PF_RING] alive [%s][len=%d]\n", tp->dev->name, skb->len);
04644         
04645                 if(*hook->transparent_mode != standard_linux_path) {
04646                   rc = hook->ring_handler(skb, 1, 1, -1, 1);
04647                   
04648                   if(rc >= 1 /* Packet handled by PF_RING */) {
04649                 if(*hook->transparent_mode == driver2pf_ring_non_transparent) {
04650                   /* PF_RING has already freed the memory */
04651                   goto next_pkt;
04652                 }
04653                   }
04654                 } else {
04655                   if(debug) printk(KERN_INFO "[PF_RING] not present on %s\n", 
04656                                                                  tp->dev->name);
04657                 }
04658               }
04659             }
04660         #endif
04661         
04662 
04663 
04664 
04665         if (len > (tp->dev->mtu + ETH_HLEN) &&
04666             skb->protocol != htons(ETH_P_8021Q)) {
04667             dev_kfree_skb(skb);
04668             goto next_pkt;
04669         }
04670 
04671 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
04672         if (tp->vlgrp != NULL &&
04673             desc->type_flags & RXD_FLAG_VLAN) {
04674             vlan_gro_receive(&tnapi->napi, tp->vlgrp,
04675                      desc->err_vlan & RXD_VLAN_MASK, skb);
04676         } else
04677 #endif
04678             napi_gro_receive(&tnapi->napi, skb);
04679 
04680         received++;
04681         budget--;
04682 
04683 next_pkt:
04684         (*post_ptr)++;
04685 
04686         if (unlikely(rx_std_posted >= tp->rx_std_max_post)) {
04687             u32 idx = *post_ptr % TG3_RX_RING_SIZE;
04688 
04689             tw32_rx_mbox(MAILBOX_RCV_STD_PROD_IDX +
04690                      TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, idx);
04691             work_mask &= ~RXD_OPAQUE_RING_STD;
04692             rx_std_posted = 0;
04693         }
04694 next_pkt_nopost:
04695         sw_idx++;
04696         sw_idx &= (TG3_RX_RCB_RING_SIZE(tp) - 1);
04697 
04698         /* Refresh hw_idx to see if there is new work */
04699         if (sw_idx == hw_idx) {
04700             hw_idx = *(tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx);
04701             rmb();
04702         }
04703     }
04704 
04705     /* ACK the status ring. */
04706     tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr = sw_idx;
04707     tw32_rx_mbox(tnapi->consmbox, sw_idx);
04708 
04709     /* Refill RX ring(s). */
04710     if (work_mask & RXD_OPAQUE_RING_STD) {
04711         sw_idx = tpr->rx_std_ptr % TG3_RX_RING_SIZE;
04712         tw32_rx_mbox(MAILBOX_RCV_STD_PROD_IDX + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
04713                  sw_idx);
04714     }
04715     if (work_mask & RXD_OPAQUE_RING_JUMBO) {
04716         sw_idx = tpr->rx_jmb_ptr % TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE;
04717         tw32_rx_mbox(MAILBOX_RCV_JUMBO_PROD_IDX + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
04718                  sw_idx);
04719     }
04720     mmiowb();
04721 
04722     return received;
04723 }
04724 
04725 static int tg3_poll_work(struct tg3_napi *tnapi, int work_done, int budget)
04726 {
04727     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04728     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
04729 
04730     /* handle link change and other phy events */
04731     if (!(tp->tg3_flags &
04732           (TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG |
04733            TG3_FLAG_POLL_SERDES))) {
04734         if (sblk->status & SD_STATUS_LINK_CHG) {
04735             sblk->status = SD_STATUS_UPDATED |
04736                 (sblk->status & ~SD_STATUS_LINK_CHG);
04737             spin_lock(&tp->lock);
04738             if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
04739                 tw32_f(MAC_STATUS,
04740                      (MAC_STATUS_SYNC_CHANGED |
04741                       MAC_STATUS_CFG_CHANGED |
04742                       MAC_STATUS_MI_COMPLETION |
04743                       MAC_STATUS_LNKSTATE_CHANGED));
04744                 udelay(40);
04745             } else
04746                 tg3_setup_phy(tp, 0);
04747             spin_unlock(&tp->lock);
04748         }
04749     }
04750 
04751     /* run TX completion thread */
04752     if (tnapi->hw_status->idx[0].tx_consumer != tnapi->tx_cons) {
04753         tg3_tx(tnapi);
04754         if (unlikely(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TX_RECOVERY_PENDING))
04755             return work_done;
04756     }
04757 
04758     /* run RX thread, within the bounds set by NAPI.
04759      * All RX "locking" is done by ensuring outside
04760      * code synchronizes with tg3->napi.poll()
04761      */
04762     if (*(tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx) != tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr)
04763         work_done += tg3_rx(tnapi, budget - work_done);
04764 
04765     return work_done;
04766 }
04767 
04768 static int tg3_poll(struct napi_struct *napi, int budget)
04769 {
04770     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = container_of(napi, struct tg3_napi, napi);
04771     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04772     int work_done = 0;
04773     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
04774 
04775     while (1) {
04776         work_done = tg3_poll_work(tnapi, work_done, budget);
04777 
04778         if (unlikely(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TX_RECOVERY_PENDING))
04779             goto tx_recovery;
04780 
04781         if (unlikely(work_done >= budget))
04782             break;
04783 
04784         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS) {
04785             /* tp->last_tag is used in tg3_int_reenable() below
04786              * to tell the hw how much work has been processed,
04787              * so we must read it before checking for more work.
04788              */
04789             tnapi->last_tag = sblk->status_tag;
04790             tnapi->last_irq_tag = tnapi->last_tag;
04791             rmb();
04792         } else
04793             sblk->status &= ~SD_STATUS_UPDATED;
04794 
04795         if (likely(!tg3_has_work(tnapi))) {
04796             napi_complete(napi);
04797             tg3_int_reenable(tnapi);
04798             break;
04799         }
04800     }
04801 
04802     return work_done;
04803 
04804 tx_recovery:
04805     /* work_done is guaranteed to be less than budget. */
04806     napi_complete(napi);
04807     schedule_work(&tp->reset_task);
04808     return work_done;
04809 }
04810 
04811 static void tg3_irq_quiesce(struct tg3 *tp)
04812 {
04813     int i;
04814 
04815     BUG_ON(tp->irq_sync);
04816 
04817     tp->irq_sync = 1;
04818     smp_mb();
04819 
04820     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++)
04821         synchronize_irq(tp->napi[i].irq_vec);
04822 }
04823 
04824 static inline int tg3_irq_sync(struct tg3 *tp)
04825 {
04826     return tp->irq_sync;
04827 }
04828 
04829 /* Fully shutdown all tg3 driver activity elsewhere in the system.
04830  * If irq_sync is non-zero, then the IRQ handler must be synchronized
04831  * with as well.  Most of the time, this is not necessary except when
04832  * shutting down the device.
04833  */
04834 static inline void tg3_full_lock(struct tg3 *tp, int irq_sync)
04835 {
04836     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
04837     if (irq_sync)
04838         tg3_irq_quiesce(tp);
04839 }
04840 
04841 static inline void tg3_full_unlock(struct tg3 *tp)
04842 {
04843     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
04844 }
04845 
04846 /* One-shot MSI handler - Chip automatically disables interrupt
04847  * after sending MSI so driver doesn't have to do it.
04848  */
04849 static irqreturn_t tg3_msi_1shot(int irq, void *dev_id)
04850 {
04851     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = dev_id;
04852     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04853 
04854     prefetch(tnapi->hw_status);
04855     if (tnapi->rx_rcb)
04856         prefetch(&tnapi->rx_rcb[tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr]);
04857 
04858     if (likely(!tg3_irq_sync(tp)))
04859         napi_schedule(&tnapi->napi);
04860 
04861     return IRQ_HANDLED;
04862 }
04863 
04864 /* MSI ISR - No need to check for interrupt sharing and no need to
04865  * flush status block and interrupt mailbox. PCI ordering rules
04866  * guarantee that MSI will arrive after the status block.
04867  */
04868 static irqreturn_t tg3_msi(int irq, void *dev_id)
04869 {
04870     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = dev_id;
04871     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04872 
04873     prefetch(tnapi->hw_status);
04874     if (tnapi->rx_rcb)
04875         prefetch(&tnapi->rx_rcb[tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr]);
04876     /*
04877      * Writing any value to intr-mbox-0 clears PCI INTA# and
04878      * chip-internal interrupt pending events.
04879      * Writing non-zero to intr-mbox-0 additional tells the
04880      * NIC to stop sending us irqs, engaging "in-intr-handler"
04881      * event coalescing.
04882      */
04883     tw32_mailbox(MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, 0x00000001);
04884     if (likely(!tg3_irq_sync(tp)))
04885         napi_schedule(&tnapi->napi);
04886 
04887     return IRQ_RETVAL(1);
04888 }
04889 
04890 static irqreturn_t tg3_interrupt(int irq, void *dev_id)
04891 {
04892     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = dev_id;
04893     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04894     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
04895     unsigned int handled = 1;
04896 
04897     /* In INTx mode, it is possible for the interrupt to arrive at
04898      * the CPU before the status block posted prior to the interrupt.
04899      * Reading the PCI State register will confirm whether the
04900      * interrupt is ours and will flush the status block.
04901      */
04902     if (unlikely(!(sblk->status & SD_STATUS_UPDATED))) {
04903         if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CHIP_RESETTING) ||
04904             (tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE) & PCISTATE_INT_NOT_ACTIVE)) {
04905             handled = 0;
04906             goto out;
04907         }
04908     }
04909 
04910     /*
04911      * Writing any value to intr-mbox-0 clears PCI INTA# and
04912      * chip-internal interrupt pending events.
04913      * Writing non-zero to intr-mbox-0 additional tells the
04914      * NIC to stop sending us irqs, engaging "in-intr-handler"
04915      * event coalescing.
04916      *
04917      * Flush the mailbox to de-assert the IRQ immediately to prevent
04918      * spurious interrupts.  The flush impacts performance but
04919      * excessive spurious interrupts can be worse in some cases.
04920      */
04921     tw32_mailbox_f(MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, 0x00000001);
04922     if (tg3_irq_sync(tp))
04923         goto out;
04924     sblk->status &= ~SD_STATUS_UPDATED;
04925     if (likely(tg3_has_work(tnapi))) {
04926         prefetch(&tnapi->rx_rcb[tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr]);
04927         napi_schedule(&tnapi->napi);
04928     } else {
04929         /* No work, shared interrupt perhaps?  re-enable
04930          * interrupts, and flush that PCI write
04931          */
04932         tw32_mailbox_f(MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
04933                    0x00000000);
04934     }
04935 out:
04936     return IRQ_RETVAL(handled);
04937 }
04938 
04939 static irqreturn_t tg3_interrupt_tagged(int irq, void *dev_id)
04940 {
04941     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = dev_id;
04942     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04943     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
04944     unsigned int handled = 1;
04945 
04946     /* In INTx mode, it is possible for the interrupt to arrive at
04947      * the CPU before the status block posted prior to the interrupt.
04948      * Reading the PCI State register will confirm whether the
04949      * interrupt is ours and will flush the status block.
04950      */
04951     if (unlikely(sblk->status_tag == tnapi->last_irq_tag)) {
04952         if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CHIP_RESETTING) ||
04953             (tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE) & PCISTATE_INT_NOT_ACTIVE)) {
04954             handled = 0;
04955             goto out;
04956         }
04957     }
04958 
04959     /*
04960      * writing any value to intr-mbox-0 clears PCI INTA# and
04961      * chip-internal interrupt pending events.
04962      * writing non-zero to intr-mbox-0 additional tells the
04963      * NIC to stop sending us irqs, engaging "in-intr-handler"
04964      * event coalescing.
04965      *
04966      * Flush the mailbox to de-assert the IRQ immediately to prevent
04967      * spurious interrupts.  The flush impacts performance but
04968      * excessive spurious interrupts can be worse in some cases.
04969      */
04970     tw32_mailbox_f(MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, 0x00000001);
04971 
04972     /*
04973      * In a shared interrupt configuration, sometimes other devices'
04974      * interrupts will scream.  We record the current status tag here
04975      * so that the above check can report that the screaming interrupts
04976      * are unhandled.  Eventually they will be silenced.
04977      */
04978     tnapi->last_irq_tag = sblk->status_tag;
04979 
04980     if (tg3_irq_sync(tp))
04981         goto out;
04982 
04983     prefetch(&tnapi->rx_rcb[tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr]);
04984 
04985     napi_schedule(&tnapi->napi);
04986 
04987 out:
04988     return IRQ_RETVAL(handled);
04989 }
04990 
04991 /* ISR for interrupt test */
04992 static irqreturn_t tg3_test_isr(int irq, void *dev_id)
04993 {
04994     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = dev_id;
04995     struct tg3 *tp = tnapi->tp;
04996     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
04997 
04998     if ((sblk->status & SD_STATUS_UPDATED) ||
04999         !(tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE) & PCISTATE_INT_NOT_ACTIVE)) {
05000         tg3_disable_ints(tp);
05001         return IRQ_RETVAL(1);
05002     }
05003     return IRQ_RETVAL(0);
05004 }
05005 
05006 static int tg3_init_hw(struct tg3 *, int);
05007 static int tg3_halt(struct tg3 *, int, int);
05008 
05009 /* Restart hardware after configuration changes, self-test, etc.
05010  * Invoked with tp->lock held.
05011  */
05012 static int tg3_restart_hw(struct tg3 *tp, int reset_phy)
05013     __releases(tp->lock)
05014     __acquires(tp->lock)
05015 {
05016     int err;
05017 
05018     err = tg3_init_hw(tp, reset_phy);
05019     if (err) {
05020         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "%s: Failed to re-initialize device, "
05021                "aborting.\n", tp->dev->name);
05022         tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
05023         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
05024         del_timer_sync(&tp->timer);
05025         tp->irq_sync = 0;
05026         tg3_napi_enable(tp);
05027         dev_close(tp->dev);
05028         tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
05029     }
05030     return err;
05031 }
05032 
05033 #ifdef CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER
05034 static void tg3_poll_controller(struct net_device *dev)
05035 {
05036     int i;
05037     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
05038 
05039     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++)
05040         tg3_interrupt(tp->napi[i].irq_vec, dev);
05041 }
05042 #endif
05043 
05044 static void tg3_reset_task(struct work_struct *work)
05045 {
05046     struct tg3 *tp = container_of(work, struct tg3, reset_task);
05047     int err;
05048     unsigned int restart_timer;
05049 
05050     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
05051 
05052     if (!netif_running(tp->dev)) {
05053         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
05054         return;
05055     }
05056 
05057     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
05058 
05059     tg3_phy_stop(tp);
05060 
05061     tg3_netif_stop(tp);
05062 
05063     tg3_full_lock(tp, 1);
05064 
05065     restart_timer = tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_RESTART_TIMER;
05066     tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_RESTART_TIMER;
05067 
05068     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TX_RECOVERY_PENDING) {
05069         tp->write32_tx_mbox = tg3_write32_tx_mbox;
05070         tp->write32_rx_mbox = tg3_write_flush_reg32;
05071         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_MBOX_WRITE_REORDER;
05072         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_TX_RECOVERY_PENDING;
05073     }
05074 
05075     tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 0);
05076     err = tg3_init_hw(tp, 1);
05077     if (err)
05078         goto out;
05079 
05080     tg3_netif_start(tp);
05081 
05082     if (restart_timer)
05083         mod_timer(&tp->timer, jiffies + 1);
05084 
05085 out:
05086     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
05087 
05088     if (!err)
05089         tg3_phy_start(tp);
05090 }
05091 
05092 static void tg3_dump_short_state(struct tg3 *tp)
05093 {
05094     printk(KERN_ERR PFX "DEBUG: MAC_TX_STATUS[%08x] MAC_RX_STATUS[%08x]\n",
05095            tr32(MAC_TX_STATUS), tr32(MAC_RX_STATUS));
05096     printk(KERN_ERR PFX "DEBUG: RDMAC_STATUS[%08x] WDMAC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
05097            tr32(RDMAC_STATUS), tr32(WDMAC_STATUS));
05098 }
05099 
05100 static void tg3_tx_timeout(struct net_device *dev)
05101 {
05102     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
05103 
05104     if (netif_msg_tx_err(tp)) {
05105         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "%s: transmit timed out, resetting\n",
05106                dev->name);
05107         tg3_dump_short_state(tp);
05108     }
05109 
05110     schedule_work(&tp->reset_task);
05111 }
05112 
05113 /* Test for DMA buffers crossing any 4GB boundaries: 4G, 8G, etc */
05114 static inline int tg3_4g_overflow_test(dma_addr_t mapping, int len)
05115 {
05116     u32 base = (u32) mapping & 0xffffffff;
05117 
05118     return ((base > 0xffffdcc0) &&
05119         (base + len + 8 < base));
05120 }
05121 
05122 /* Test for DMA addresses > 40-bit */
05123 static inline int tg3_40bit_overflow_test(struct tg3 *tp, dma_addr_t mapping,
05124                       int len)
05125 {
05126 #if defined(CONFIG_HIGHMEM) && (BITS_PER_LONG == 64)
05127     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_40BIT_DMA_BUG)
05128         return (((u64) mapping + len) > DMA_BIT_MASK(40));
05129     return 0;
05130 #else
05131     return 0;
05132 #endif
05133 }
05134 
05135 static void tg3_set_txd(struct tg3_napi *, int, dma_addr_t, int, u32, u32);
05136 
05137 /* Workaround 4GB and 40-bit hardware DMA bugs. */
05138 static int tigon3_dma_hwbug_workaround(struct tg3 *tp, struct sk_buff *skb,
05139                        u32 last_plus_one, u32 *start,
05140                        u32 base_flags, u32 mss)
05141 {
05142     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[0];
05143     struct sk_buff *new_skb;
05144     dma_addr_t new_addr = 0;
05145     u32 entry = *start;
05146     int i, ret = 0;
05147 
05148     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5701)
05149         new_skb = skb_copy(skb, GFP_ATOMIC);
05150     else {
05151         int more_headroom = 4 - ((unsigned long)skb->data & 3);
05152 
05153         new_skb = skb_copy_expand(skb,
05154                       skb_headroom(skb) + more_headroom,
05155                       skb_tailroom(skb), GFP_ATOMIC);
05156     }
05157 
05158     if (!new_skb) {
05159         ret = -1;
05160     } else {
05161         /* New SKB is guaranteed to be linear. */
05162         entry = *start;
05163         ret = skb_dma_map(&tp->pdev->dev, new_skb, DMA_TO_DEVICE);
05164         new_addr = skb_shinfo(new_skb)->dma_head;
05165 
05166         /* Make sure new skb does not cross any 4G boundaries.
05167          * Drop the packet if it does.
05168          */
05169         if (ret || tg3_4g_overflow_test(new_addr, new_skb->len)) {
05170             if (!ret)
05171                 skb_dma_unmap(&tp->pdev->dev, new_skb,
05172                           DMA_TO_DEVICE);
05173             ret = -1;
05174             dev_kfree_skb(new_skb);
05175             new_skb = NULL;
05176         } else {
05177             tg3_set_txd(tnapi, entry, new_addr, new_skb->len,
05178                     base_flags, 1 | (mss << 1));
05179             *start = NEXT_TX(entry);
05180         }
05181     }
05182 
05183     /* Now clean up the sw ring entries. */
05184     i = 0;
05185     while (entry != last_plus_one) {
05186         if (i == 0)
05187             tnapi->tx_buffers[entry].skb = new_skb;
05188         else
05189             tnapi->tx_buffers[entry].skb = NULL;
05190         entry = NEXT_TX(entry);
05191         i++;
05192     }
05193 
05194     skb_dma_unmap(&tp->pdev->dev, skb, DMA_TO_DEVICE);
05195     dev_kfree_skb(skb);
05196 
05197     return ret;
05198 }
05199 
05200 static void tg3_set_txd(struct tg3_napi *tnapi, int entry,
05201             dma_addr_t mapping, int len, u32 flags,
05202             u32 mss_and_is_end)
05203 {
05204     struct tg3_tx_buffer_desc *txd = &tnapi->tx_ring[entry];
05205     int is_end = (mss_and_is_end & 0x1);
05206     u32 mss = (mss_and_is_end >> 1);
05207     u32 vlan_tag = 0;
05208 
05209     if (is_end)
05210         flags |= TXD_FLAG_END;
05211     if (flags & TXD_FLAG_VLAN) {
05212         vlan_tag = flags >> 16;
05213         flags &= 0xffff;
05214     }
05215     vlan_tag |= (mss << TXD_MSS_SHIFT);
05216 
05217     txd->addr_hi = ((u64) mapping >> 32);
05218     txd->addr_lo = ((u64) mapping & 0xffffffff);
05219     txd->len_flags = (len << TXD_LEN_SHIFT) | flags;
05220     txd->vlan_tag = vlan_tag << TXD_VLAN_TAG_SHIFT;
05221 }
05222 
05223 /* hard_start_xmit for devices that don't have any bugs and
05224  * support TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_2 only.
05225  */
05226 static netdev_tx_t tg3_start_xmit(struct sk_buff *skb,
05227                   struct net_device *dev)
05228 {
05229     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
05230     u32 len, entry, base_flags, mss;
05231     struct skb_shared_info *sp;
05232     dma_addr_t mapping;
05233     struct tg3_napi *tnapi;
05234     struct netdev_queue *txq;
05235 
05236     txq = netdev_get_tx_queue(dev, skb_get_queue_mapping(skb));
05237     tnapi = &tp->napi[skb_get_queue_mapping(skb)];
05238     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX)
05239         tnapi++;
05240 
05241     /* We are running in BH disabled context with netif_tx_lock
05242      * and TX reclaim runs via tp->napi.poll inside of a software
05243      * interrupt.  Furthermore, IRQ processing runs lockless so we have
05244      * no IRQ context deadlocks to worry about either.  Rejoice!
05245      */
05246     if (unlikely(tg3_tx_avail(tnapi) <= (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags + 1))) {
05247         if (!netif_tx_queue_stopped(txq)) {
05248             netif_tx_stop_queue(txq);
05249 
05250             /* This is a hard error, log it. */
05251             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "%s: BUG! Tx Ring full when "
05252                    "queue awake!\n", dev->name);
05253         }
05254         return NETDEV_TX_BUSY;
05255     }
05256 
05257     entry = tnapi->tx_prod;
05258     base_flags = 0;
05259     mss = 0;
05260     if ((mss = skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size) != 0) {
05261         int tcp_opt_len, ip_tcp_len;
05262         u32 hdrlen;
05263 
05264         if (skb_header_cloned(skb) &&
05265             pskb_expand_head(skb, 0, 0, GFP_ATOMIC)) {
05266             dev_kfree_skb(skb);
05267             goto out_unlock;
05268         }
05269 
05270         if (skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_type & SKB_GSO_TCPV6)
05271             hdrlen = skb_headlen(skb) - ETH_HLEN;
05272         else {
05273             struct iphdr *iph = ip_hdr(skb);
05274 
05275             tcp_opt_len = tcp_optlen(skb);
05276             ip_tcp_len = ip_hdrlen(skb) + sizeof(struct tcphdr);
05277 
05278             iph->check = 0;
05279             iph->tot_len = htons(mss + ip_tcp_len + tcp_opt_len);
05280             hdrlen = ip_tcp_len + tcp_opt_len;
05281         }
05282 
05283         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717) {
05284             mss |= (hdrlen & 0xc) << 12;
05285             if (hdrlen & 0x10)
05286                 base_flags |= 0x00000010;
05287             base_flags |= (hdrlen & 0x3e0) << 5;
05288         } else
05289             mss |= hdrlen << 9;
05290 
05291         base_flags |= (TXD_FLAG_CPU_PRE_DMA |
05292                    TXD_FLAG_CPU_POST_DMA);
05293 
05294         tcp_hdr(skb)->check = 0;
05295 
05296     }
05297     else if (skb->ip_summed == CHECKSUM_PARTIAL)
05298         base_flags |= TXD_FLAG_TCPUDP_CSUM;
05299 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
05300     if (tp->vlgrp != NULL && vlan_tx_tag_present(skb))
05301         base_flags |= (TXD_FLAG_VLAN |
05302                    (vlan_tx_tag_get(skb) << 16));
05303 #endif
05304 
05305     if (skb_dma_map(&tp->pdev->dev, skb, DMA_TO_DEVICE)) {
05306         dev_kfree_skb(skb);
05307         goto out_unlock;
05308     }
05309 
05310     sp = skb_shinfo(skb);
05311 
05312     mapping = sp->dma_head;
05313 
05314     tnapi->tx_buffers[entry].skb = skb;
05315 
05316     len = skb_headlen(skb);
05317 
05318     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717 &&
05319         !mss && skb->len > ETH_DATA_LEN)
05320         base_flags |= TXD_FLAG_JMB_PKT;
05321 
05322     tg3_set_txd(tnapi, entry, mapping, len, base_flags,
05323             (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags == 0) | (mss << 1));
05324 
05325     entry = NEXT_TX(entry);
05326 
05327     /* Now loop through additional data fragments, and queue them. */
05328     if (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags > 0) {
05329         unsigned int i, last;
05330 
05331         last = skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags - 1;
05332         for (i = 0; i <= last; i++) {
05333             skb_frag_t *frag = &skb_shinfo(skb)->frags[i];
05334 
05335             len = frag->size;
05336             mapping = sp->dma_maps[i];
05337             tnapi->tx_buffers[entry].skb = NULL;
05338 
05339             tg3_set_txd(tnapi, entry, mapping, len,
05340                     base_flags, (i == last) | (mss << 1));
05341 
05342             entry = NEXT_TX(entry);
05343         }
05344     }
05345 
05346     /* Packets are ready, update Tx producer idx local and on card. */
05347     tw32_tx_mbox(tnapi->prodmbox, entry);
05348 
05349     tnapi->tx_prod = entry;
05350     if (unlikely(tg3_tx_avail(tnapi) <= (MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 1))) {
05351         netif_tx_stop_queue(txq);
05352         if (tg3_tx_avail(tnapi) > TG3_TX_WAKEUP_THRESH(tnapi))
05353             netif_tx_wake_queue(txq);
05354     }
05355 
05356 out_unlock:
05357     mmiowb();
05358 
05359     return NETDEV_TX_OK;
05360 }
05361 
05362 static netdev_tx_t tg3_start_xmit_dma_bug(struct sk_buff *,
05363                       struct net_device *);
05364 
05365 /* Use GSO to workaround a rare TSO bug that may be triggered when the
05366  * TSO header is greater than 80 bytes.
05367  */
05368 static int tg3_tso_bug(struct tg3 *tp, struct sk_buff *skb)
05369 {
05370     struct sk_buff *segs, *nskb;
05371     u32 frag_cnt_est = skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_segs * 3;
05372 
05373     /* Estimate the number of fragments in the worst case */
05374     if (unlikely(tg3_tx_avail(&tp->napi[0]) <= frag_cnt_est)) {
05375         netif_stop_queue(tp->dev);
05376         if (tg3_tx_avail(&tp->napi[0]) <= frag_cnt_est)
05377             return NETDEV_TX_BUSY;
05378 
05379         netif_wake_queue(tp->dev);
05380     }
05381 
05382     segs = skb_gso_segment(skb, tp->dev->features & ~NETIF_F_TSO);
05383     if (IS_ERR(segs))
05384         goto tg3_tso_bug_end;
05385 
05386     do {
05387         nskb = segs;
05388         segs = segs->next;
05389         nskb->next = NULL;
05390         tg3_start_xmit_dma_bug(nskb, tp->dev);
05391     } while (segs);
05392 
05393 tg3_tso_bug_end:
05394     dev_kfree_skb(skb);
05395 
05396     return NETDEV_TX_OK;
05397 }
05398 
05399 /* hard_start_xmit for devices that have the 4G bug and/or 40-bit bug and
05400  * support TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_1 or firmware TSO only.
05401  */
05402 static netdev_tx_t tg3_start_xmit_dma_bug(struct sk_buff *skb,
05403                       struct net_device *dev)
05404 {
05405     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
05406     u32 len, entry, base_flags, mss;
05407     struct skb_shared_info *sp;
05408     int would_hit_hwbug;
05409     dma_addr_t mapping;
05410     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[0];
05411 
05412     len = skb_headlen(skb);
05413 
05414     /* We are running in BH disabled context with netif_tx_lock
05415      * and TX reclaim runs via tp->napi.poll inside of a software
05416      * interrupt.  Furthermore, IRQ processing runs lockless so we have
05417      * no IRQ context deadlocks to worry about either.  Rejoice!
05418      */
05419     if (unlikely(tg3_tx_avail(tnapi) <= (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags + 1))) {
05420         if (!netif_queue_stopped(dev)) {
05421             netif_stop_queue(dev);
05422 
05423             /* This is a hard error, log it. */
05424             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "%s: BUG! Tx Ring full when "
05425                    "queue awake!\n", dev->name);
05426         }
05427         return NETDEV_TX_BUSY;
05428     }
05429 
05430     entry = tnapi->tx_prod;
05431     base_flags = 0;
05432     if (skb->ip_summed == CHECKSUM_PARTIAL)
05433         base_flags |= TXD_FLAG_TCPUDP_CSUM;
05434     mss = 0;
05435     if ((mss = skb_shinfo(skb)->gso_size) != 0) {
05436         struct iphdr *iph;
05437         int tcp_opt_len, ip_tcp_len, hdr_len;
05438 
05439         if (skb_header_cloned(skb) &&
05440             pskb_expand_head(skb, 0, 0, GFP_ATOMIC)) {
05441             dev_kfree_skb(skb);
05442             goto out_unlock;
05443         }
05444 
05445         tcp_opt_len = tcp_optlen(skb);
05446         ip_tcp_len = ip_hdrlen(skb) + sizeof(struct tcphdr);
05447 
05448         hdr_len = ip_tcp_len + tcp_opt_len;
05449         if (unlikely((ETH_HLEN + hdr_len) > 80) &&
05450                  (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_BUG))
05451             return (tg3_tso_bug(tp, skb));
05452 
05453         base_flags |= (TXD_FLAG_CPU_PRE_DMA |
05454                    TXD_FLAG_CPU_POST_DMA);
05455 
05456         iph = ip_hdr(skb);
05457         iph->check = 0;
05458         iph->tot_len = htons(mss + hdr_len);
05459         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO) {
05460             tcp_hdr(skb)->check = 0;
05461             base_flags &= ~TXD_FLAG_TCPUDP_CSUM;
05462         } else
05463             tcp_hdr(skb)->check = ~csum_tcpudp_magic(iph->saddr,
05464                                  iph->daddr, 0,
05465                                  IPPROTO_TCP,
05466                                  0);
05467 
05468         if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO) ||
05469             (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705)) {
05470             if (tcp_opt_len || iph->ihl > 5) {
05471                 int tsflags;
05472 
05473                 tsflags = (iph->ihl - 5) + (tcp_opt_len >> 2);
05474                 mss |= (tsflags << 11);
05475             }
05476         } else {
05477             if (tcp_opt_len || iph->ihl > 5) {
05478                 int tsflags;
05479 
05480                 tsflags = (iph->ihl - 5) + (tcp_opt_len >> 2);
05481                 base_flags |= tsflags << 12;
05482             }
05483         }
05484     }
05485 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
05486     if (tp->vlgrp != NULL && vlan_tx_tag_present(skb))
05487         base_flags |= (TXD_FLAG_VLAN |
05488                    (vlan_tx_tag_get(skb) << 16));
05489 #endif
05490 
05491     if (skb_dma_map(&tp->pdev->dev, skb, DMA_TO_DEVICE)) {
05492         dev_kfree_skb(skb);
05493         goto out_unlock;
05494     }
05495 
05496     sp = skb_shinfo(skb);
05497 
05498     mapping = sp->dma_head;
05499 
05500     tnapi->tx_buffers[entry].skb = skb;
05501 
05502     would_hit_hwbug = 0;
05503 
05504     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5701_DMA_BUG)
05505         would_hit_hwbug = 1;
05506     else if (tg3_4g_overflow_test(mapping, len))
05507         would_hit_hwbug = 1;
05508 
05509     tg3_set_txd(tnapi, entry, mapping, len, base_flags,
05510             (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags == 0) | (mss << 1));
05511 
05512     entry = NEXT_TX(entry);
05513 
05514     /* Now loop through additional data fragments, and queue them. */
05515     if (skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags > 0) {
05516         unsigned int i, last;
05517 
05518         last = skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags - 1;
05519         for (i = 0; i <= last; i++) {
05520             skb_frag_t *frag = &skb_shinfo(skb)->frags[i];
05521 
05522             len = frag->size;
05523             mapping = sp->dma_maps[i];
05524 
05525             tnapi->tx_buffers[entry].skb = NULL;
05526 
05527             if (tg3_4g_overflow_test(mapping, len))
05528                 would_hit_hwbug = 1;
05529 
05530             if (tg3_40bit_overflow_test(tp, mapping, len))
05531                 would_hit_hwbug = 1;
05532 
05533             if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO)
05534                 tg3_set_txd(tnapi, entry, mapping, len,
05535                         base_flags, (i == last)|(mss << 1));
05536             else
05537                 tg3_set_txd(tnapi, entry, mapping, len,
05538                         base_flags, (i == last));
05539 
05540             entry = NEXT_TX(entry);
05541         }
05542     }
05543 
05544     if (would_hit_hwbug) {
05545         u32 last_plus_one = entry;
05546         u32 start;
05547 
05548         start = entry - 1 - skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags;
05549         start &= (TG3_TX_RING_SIZE - 1);
05550 
05551         /* If the workaround fails due to memory/mapping
05552          * failure, silently drop this packet.
05553          */
05554         if (tigon3_dma_hwbug_workaround(tp, skb, last_plus_one,
05555                         &start, base_flags, mss))
05556             goto out_unlock;
05557 
05558         entry = start;
05559     }
05560 
05561     /* Packets are ready, update Tx producer idx local and on card. */
05562     tw32_tx_mbox(MAILBOX_SNDHOST_PROD_IDX_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, entry);
05563 
05564     tnapi->tx_prod = entry;
05565     if (unlikely(tg3_tx_avail(tnapi) <= (MAX_SKB_FRAGS + 1))) {
05566         netif_stop_queue(dev);
05567         if (tg3_tx_avail(tnapi) > TG3_TX_WAKEUP_THRESH(tnapi))
05568             netif_wake_queue(tp->dev);
05569     }
05570 
05571 out_unlock:
05572     mmiowb();
05573 
05574     return NETDEV_TX_OK;
05575 }
05576 
05577 static inline void tg3_set_mtu(struct net_device *dev, struct tg3 *tp,
05578                    int new_mtu)
05579 {
05580     dev->mtu = new_mtu;
05581 
05582     if (new_mtu > ETH_DATA_LEN) {
05583         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS) {
05584             tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE;
05585             ethtool_op_set_tso(dev, 0);
05586         }
05587         else
05588             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE;
05589     } else {
05590         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)
05591             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE;
05592         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE;
05593     }
05594 }
05595 
05596 static int tg3_change_mtu(struct net_device *dev, int new_mtu)
05597 {
05598     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
05599     int err;
05600 
05601     if (new_mtu < TG3_MIN_MTU || new_mtu > TG3_MAX_MTU(tp))
05602         return -EINVAL;
05603 
05604     if (!netif_running(dev)) {
05605         /* We'll just catch it later when the
05606          * device is up'd.
05607          */
05608         tg3_set_mtu(dev, tp, new_mtu);
05609         return 0;
05610     }
05611 
05612     tg3_phy_stop(tp);
05613 
05614     tg3_netif_stop(tp);
05615 
05616     tg3_full_lock(tp, 1);
05617 
05618     tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
05619 
05620     tg3_set_mtu(dev, tp, new_mtu);
05621 
05622     err = tg3_restart_hw(tp, 0);
05623 
05624     if (!err)
05625         tg3_netif_start(tp);
05626 
05627     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
05628 
05629     if (!err)
05630         tg3_phy_start(tp);
05631 
05632     return err;
05633 }
05634 
05635 static void tg3_rx_prodring_free(struct tg3 *tp,
05636                  struct tg3_rx_prodring_set *tpr)
05637 {
05638     int i;
05639     struct ring_info *rxp;
05640 
05641     for (i = 0; i < TG3_RX_RING_SIZE; i++) {
05642         rxp = &tpr->rx_std_buffers[i];
05643 
05644         if (rxp->skb == NULL)
05645             continue;
05646 
05647         pci_unmap_single(tp->pdev,
05648                  pci_unmap_addr(rxp, mapping),
05649                  tp->rx_pkt_map_sz,
05650                  PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
05651         dev_kfree_skb_any(rxp->skb);
05652         rxp->skb = NULL;
05653     }
05654 
05655     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) {
05656         for (i = 0; i < TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE; i++) {
05657             rxp = &tpr->rx_jmb_buffers[i];
05658 
05659             if (rxp->skb == NULL)
05660                 continue;
05661 
05662             pci_unmap_single(tp->pdev,
05663                      pci_unmap_addr(rxp, mapping),
05664                      TG3_RX_JMB_MAP_SZ,
05665                      PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
05666             dev_kfree_skb_any(rxp->skb);
05667             rxp->skb = NULL;
05668         }
05669     }
05670 }
05671 
05672 /* Initialize tx/rx rings for packet processing.
05673  *
05674  * The chip has been shut down and the driver detached from
05675  * the networking, so no interrupts or new tx packets will
05676  * end up in the driver.  tp->{tx,}lock are held and thus
05677  * we may not sleep.
05678  */
05679 static int tg3_rx_prodring_alloc(struct tg3 *tp,
05680                  struct tg3_rx_prodring_set *tpr)
05681 {
05682     u32 i, rx_pkt_dma_sz;
05683     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[0];
05684 
05685     /* Zero out all descriptors. */
05686     memset(tpr->rx_std, 0, TG3_RX_RING_BYTES);
05687 
05688     rx_pkt_dma_sz = TG3_RX_STD_DMA_SZ;
05689     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS) &&
05690         tp->dev->mtu > ETH_DATA_LEN)
05691         rx_pkt_dma_sz = TG3_RX_JMB_DMA_SZ;
05692     tp->rx_pkt_map_sz = TG3_RX_DMA_TO_MAP_SZ(rx_pkt_dma_sz);
05693 
05694     /* Initialize invariants of the rings, we only set this
05695      * stuff once.  This works because the card does not
05696      * write into the rx buffer posting rings.
05697      */
05698     for (i = 0; i < TG3_RX_RING_SIZE; i++) {
05699         struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc *rxd;
05700 
05701         rxd = &tpr->rx_std[i];
05702         rxd->idx_len = rx_pkt_dma_sz << RXD_LEN_SHIFT;
05703         rxd->type_flags = (RXD_FLAG_END << RXD_FLAGS_SHIFT);
05704         rxd->opaque = (RXD_OPAQUE_RING_STD |
05705                    (i << RXD_OPAQUE_INDEX_SHIFT));
05706     }
05707 
05708     /* Now allocate fresh SKBs for each rx ring. */
05709     for (i = 0; i < tp->rx_pending; i++) {
05710         if (tg3_alloc_rx_skb(tnapi, RXD_OPAQUE_RING_STD, -1, i) < 0) {
05711             printk(KERN_WARNING PFX
05712                    "%s: Using a smaller RX standard ring, "
05713                    "only %d out of %d buffers were allocated "
05714                    "successfully.\n",
05715                    tp->dev->name, i, tp->rx_pending);
05716             if (i == 0)
05717                 goto initfail;
05718             tp->rx_pending = i;
05719             break;
05720         }
05721     }
05722 
05723     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE))
05724         goto done;
05725 
05726     memset(tpr->rx_jmb, 0, TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_BYTES);
05727 
05728     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE) {
05729         for (i = 0; i < TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE; i++) {
05730             struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc *rxd;
05731 
05732             rxd = &tpr->rx_jmb[i].std;
05733             rxd->idx_len = TG3_RX_JMB_DMA_SZ << RXD_LEN_SHIFT;
05734             rxd->type_flags = (RXD_FLAG_END << RXD_FLAGS_SHIFT) |
05735                 RXD_FLAG_JUMBO;
05736             rxd->opaque = (RXD_OPAQUE_RING_JUMBO |
05737                    (i << RXD_OPAQUE_INDEX_SHIFT));
05738         }
05739 
05740         for (i = 0; i < tp->rx_jumbo_pending; i++) {
05741             if (tg3_alloc_rx_skb(tnapi, RXD_OPAQUE_RING_JUMBO,
05742                          -1, i) < 0) {
05743                 printk(KERN_WARNING PFX
05744                        "%s: Using a smaller RX jumbo ring, "
05745                        "only %d out of %d buffers were "
05746                        "allocated successfully.\n",
05747                        tp->dev->name, i, tp->rx_jumbo_pending);
05748                 if (i == 0)
05749                     goto initfail;
05750                 tp->rx_jumbo_pending = i;
05751                 break;
05752             }
05753         }
05754     }
05755 
05756 done:
05757     return 0;
05758 
05759 initfail:
05760     tg3_rx_prodring_free(tp, tpr);
05761     return -ENOMEM;
05762 }
05763 
05764 static void tg3_rx_prodring_fini(struct tg3 *tp,
05765                  struct tg3_rx_prodring_set *tpr)
05766 {
05767     kfree(tpr->rx_std_buffers);
05768     tpr->rx_std_buffers = NULL;
05769     kfree(tpr->rx_jmb_buffers);
05770     tpr->rx_jmb_buffers = NULL;
05771     if (tpr->rx_std) {
05772         pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, TG3_RX_RING_BYTES,
05773                     tpr->rx_std, tpr->rx_std_mapping);
05774         tpr->rx_std = NULL;
05775     }
05776     if (tpr->rx_jmb) {
05777         pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_BYTES,
05778                     tpr->rx_jmb, tpr->rx_jmb_mapping);
05779         tpr->rx_jmb = NULL;
05780     }
05781 }
05782 
05783 static int tg3_rx_prodring_init(struct tg3 *tp,
05784                 struct tg3_rx_prodring_set *tpr)
05785 {
05786     tpr->rx_std_buffers = kzalloc(sizeof(struct ring_info) *
05787                       TG3_RX_RING_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
05788     if (!tpr->rx_std_buffers)
05789         return -ENOMEM;
05790 
05791     tpr->rx_std = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev, TG3_RX_RING_BYTES,
05792                        &tpr->rx_std_mapping);
05793     if (!tpr->rx_std)
05794         goto err_out;
05795 
05796     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) {
05797         tpr->rx_jmb_buffers = kzalloc(sizeof(struct ring_info) *
05798                           TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE,
05799                           GFP_KERNEL);
05800         if (!tpr->rx_jmb_buffers)
05801             goto err_out;
05802 
05803         tpr->rx_jmb = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev,
05804                            TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_BYTES,
05805                            &tpr->rx_jmb_mapping);
05806         if (!tpr->rx_jmb)
05807             goto err_out;
05808     }
05809 
05810     return 0;
05811 
05812 err_out:
05813     tg3_rx_prodring_fini(tp, tpr);
05814     return -ENOMEM;
05815 }
05816 
05817 /* Free up pending packets in all rx/tx rings.
05818  *
05819  * The chip has been shut down and the driver detached from
05820  * the networking, so no interrupts or new tx packets will
05821  * end up in the driver.  tp->{tx,}lock is not held and we are not
05822  * in an interrupt context and thus may sleep.
05823  */
05824 static void tg3_free_rings(struct tg3 *tp)
05825 {
05826     int i, j;
05827 
05828     for (j = 0; j < tp->irq_cnt; j++) {
05829         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[j];
05830 
05831         if (!tnapi->tx_buffers)
05832             continue;
05833 
05834         for (i = 0; i < TG3_TX_RING_SIZE; ) {
05835             struct tx_ring_info *txp;
05836             struct sk_buff *skb;
05837 
05838             txp = &tnapi->tx_buffers[i];
05839             skb = txp->skb;
05840 
05841             if (skb == NULL) {
05842                 i++;
05843                 continue;
05844             }
05845 
05846             skb_dma_unmap(&tp->pdev->dev, skb, DMA_TO_DEVICE);
05847 
05848             txp->skb = NULL;
05849 
05850             i += skb_shinfo(skb)->nr_frags + 1;
05851 
05852             dev_kfree_skb_any(skb);
05853         }
05854     }
05855 
05856     tg3_rx_prodring_free(tp, &tp->prodring[0]);
05857 }
05858 
05859 /* Initialize tx/rx rings for packet processing.
05860  *
05861  * The chip has been shut down and the driver detached from
05862  * the networking, so no interrupts or new tx packets will
05863  * end up in the driver.  tp->{tx,}lock are held and thus
05864  * we may not sleep.
05865  */
05866 static int tg3_init_rings(struct tg3 *tp)
05867 {
05868     int i;
05869 
05870     /* Free up all the SKBs. */
05871     tg3_free_rings(tp);
05872 
05873     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
05874         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
05875 
05876         tnapi->last_tag = 0;
05877         tnapi->last_irq_tag = 0;
05878         tnapi->hw_status->status = 0;
05879         tnapi->hw_status->status_tag = 0;
05880         memset(tnapi->hw_status, 0, TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE);
05881 
05882         tnapi->tx_prod = 0;
05883         tnapi->tx_cons = 0;
05884         if (tnapi->tx_ring)
05885             memset(tnapi->tx_ring, 0, TG3_TX_RING_BYTES);
05886 
05887         tnapi->rx_rcb_ptr = 0;
05888         if (tnapi->rx_rcb)
05889             memset(tnapi->rx_rcb, 0, TG3_RX_RCB_RING_BYTES(tp));
05890     }
05891 
05892     return tg3_rx_prodring_alloc(tp, &tp->prodring[0]);
05893 }
05894 
05895 /*
05896  * Must not be invoked with interrupt sources disabled and
05897  * the hardware shutdown down.
05898  */
05899 static void tg3_free_consistent(struct tg3 *tp)
05900 {
05901     int i;
05902 
05903     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
05904         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
05905 
05906         if (tnapi->tx_ring) {
05907             pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, TG3_TX_RING_BYTES,
05908                 tnapi->tx_ring, tnapi->tx_desc_mapping);
05909             tnapi->tx_ring = NULL;
05910         }
05911 
05912         kfree(tnapi->tx_buffers);
05913         tnapi->tx_buffers = NULL;
05914 
05915         if (tnapi->rx_rcb) {
05916             pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, TG3_RX_RCB_RING_BYTES(tp),
05917                         tnapi->rx_rcb,
05918                         tnapi->rx_rcb_mapping);
05919             tnapi->rx_rcb = NULL;
05920         }
05921 
05922         if (tnapi->hw_status) {
05923             pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE,
05924                         tnapi->hw_status,
05925                         tnapi->status_mapping);
05926             tnapi->hw_status = NULL;
05927         }
05928     }
05929 
05930     if (tp->hw_stats) {
05931         pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, sizeof(struct tg3_hw_stats),
05932                     tp->hw_stats, tp->stats_mapping);
05933         tp->hw_stats = NULL;
05934     }
05935 
05936     tg3_rx_prodring_fini(tp, &tp->prodring[0]);
05937 }
05938 
05939 /*
05940  * Must not be invoked with interrupt sources disabled and
05941  * the hardware shutdown down.  Can sleep.
05942  */
05943 static int tg3_alloc_consistent(struct tg3 *tp)
05944 {
05945     int i;
05946 
05947     if (tg3_rx_prodring_init(tp, &tp->prodring[0]))
05948         return -ENOMEM;
05949 
05950     tp->hw_stats = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev,
05951                         sizeof(struct tg3_hw_stats),
05952                         &tp->stats_mapping);
05953     if (!tp->hw_stats)
05954         goto err_out;
05955 
05956     memset(tp->hw_stats, 0, sizeof(struct tg3_hw_stats));
05957 
05958     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
05959         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
05960         struct tg3_hw_status *sblk;
05961 
05962         tnapi->hw_status = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev,
05963                             TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE,
05964                             &tnapi->status_mapping);
05965         if (!tnapi->hw_status)
05966             goto err_out;
05967 
05968         memset(tnapi->hw_status, 0, TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE);
05969         sblk = tnapi->hw_status;
05970 
05971         /*
05972          * When RSS is enabled, the status block format changes
05973          * slightly.  The "rx_jumbo_consumer", "reserved",
05974          * and "rx_mini_consumer" members get mapped to the
05975          * other three rx return ring producer indexes.
05976          */
05977         switch (i) {
05978         default:
05979             tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx = &sblk->idx[0].rx_producer;
05980             break;
05981         case 2:
05982             tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx = &sblk->rx_jumbo_consumer;
05983             break;
05984         case 3:
05985             tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx = &sblk->reserved;
05986             break;
05987         case 4:
05988             tnapi->rx_rcb_prod_idx = &sblk->rx_mini_consumer;
05989             break;
05990         }
05991 
05992         /*
05993          * If multivector RSS is enabled, vector 0 does not handle
05994          * rx or tx interrupts.  Don't allocate any resources for it.
05995          */
05996         if (!i && (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_RSS))
05997             continue;
05998 
05999         tnapi->rx_rcb = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev,
06000                              TG3_RX_RCB_RING_BYTES(tp),
06001                              &tnapi->rx_rcb_mapping);
06002         if (!tnapi->rx_rcb)
06003             goto err_out;
06004 
06005         memset(tnapi->rx_rcb, 0, TG3_RX_RCB_RING_BYTES(tp));
06006 
06007         tnapi->tx_buffers = kzalloc(sizeof(struct tx_ring_info) *
06008                         TG3_TX_RING_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
06009         if (!tnapi->tx_buffers)
06010             goto err_out;
06011 
06012         tnapi->tx_ring = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev,
06013                               TG3_TX_RING_BYTES,
06014                               &tnapi->tx_desc_mapping);
06015         if (!tnapi->tx_ring)
06016             goto err_out;
06017     }
06018 
06019     return 0;
06020 
06021 err_out:
06022     tg3_free_consistent(tp);
06023     return -ENOMEM;
06024 }
06025 
06026 #define MAX_WAIT_CNT 1000
06027 
06028 /* To stop a block, clear the enable bit and poll till it
06029  * clears.  tp->lock is held.
06030  */
06031 static int tg3_stop_block(struct tg3 *tp, unsigned long ofs, u32 enable_bit, int silent)
06032 {
06033     unsigned int i;
06034     u32 val;
06035 
06036     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) {
06037         switch (ofs) {
06038         case RCVLSC_MODE:
06039         case DMAC_MODE:
06040         case MBFREE_MODE:
06041         case BUFMGR_MODE:
06042         case MEMARB_MODE:
06043             /* We can't enable/disable these bits of the
06044              * 5705/5750, just say success.
06045              */
06046             return 0;
06047 
06048         default:
06049             break;
06050         }
06051     }
06052 
06053     val = tr32(ofs);
06054     val &= ~enable_bit;
06055     tw32_f(ofs, val);
06056 
06057     for (i = 0; i < MAX_WAIT_CNT; i++) {
06058         udelay(100);
06059         val = tr32(ofs);
06060         if ((val & enable_bit) == 0)
06061             break;
06062     }
06063 
06064     if (i == MAX_WAIT_CNT && !silent) {
06065         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_stop_block timed out, "
06066                "ofs=%lx enable_bit=%x\n",
06067                ofs, enable_bit);
06068         return -ENODEV;
06069     }
06070 
06071     return 0;
06072 }
06073 
06074 /* tp->lock is held. */
06075 static int tg3_abort_hw(struct tg3 *tp, int silent)
06076 {
06077     int i, err;
06078 
06079     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
06080 
06081     tp->rx_mode &= ~RX_MODE_ENABLE;
06082     tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, tp->rx_mode);
06083     udelay(10);
06084 
06085     err  = tg3_stop_block(tp, RCVBDI_MODE, RCVBDI_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06086     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, RCVLPC_MODE, RCVLPC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06087     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, RCVLSC_MODE, RCVLSC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06088     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, RCVDBDI_MODE, RCVDBDI_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06089     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, RCVDCC_MODE, RCVDCC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06090     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, RCVCC_MODE, RCVCC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06091 
06092     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, SNDBDS_MODE, SNDBDS_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06093     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, SNDBDI_MODE, SNDBDI_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06094     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, SNDDATAI_MODE, SNDDATAI_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06095     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, RDMAC_MODE, RDMAC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06096     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, SNDDATAC_MODE, SNDDATAC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06097     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, DMAC_MODE, DMAC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06098     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, SNDBDC_MODE, SNDBDC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06099 
06100     tp->mac_mode &= ~MAC_MODE_TDE_ENABLE;
06101     tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode);
06102     udelay(40);
06103 
06104     tp->tx_mode &= ~TX_MODE_ENABLE;
06105     tw32_f(MAC_TX_MODE, tp->tx_mode);
06106 
06107     for (i = 0; i < MAX_WAIT_CNT; i++) {
06108         udelay(100);
06109         if (!(tr32(MAC_TX_MODE) & TX_MODE_ENABLE))
06110             break;
06111     }
06112     if (i >= MAX_WAIT_CNT) {
06113         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_abort_hw timed out for %s, "
06114                "TX_MODE_ENABLE will not clear MAC_TX_MODE=%08x\n",
06115                tp->dev->name, tr32(MAC_TX_MODE));
06116         err |= -ENODEV;
06117     }
06118 
06119     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, HOSTCC_MODE, HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06120     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, WDMAC_MODE, WDMAC_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06121     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, MBFREE_MODE, MBFREE_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06122 
06123     tw32(FTQ_RESET, 0xffffffff);
06124     tw32(FTQ_RESET, 0x00000000);
06125 
06126     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, BUFMGR_MODE, BUFMGR_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06127     err |= tg3_stop_block(tp, MEMARB_MODE, MEMARB_MODE_ENABLE, silent);
06128 
06129     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
06130         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
06131         if (tnapi->hw_status)
06132             memset(tnapi->hw_status, 0, TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE);
06133     }
06134     if (tp->hw_stats)
06135         memset(tp->hw_stats, 0, sizeof(struct tg3_hw_stats));
06136 
06137     return err;
06138 }
06139 
06140 static void tg3_ape_send_event(struct tg3 *tp, u32 event)
06141 {
06142     int i;
06143     u32 apedata;
06144 
06145     apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_SEG_SIG);
06146     if (apedata != APE_SEG_SIG_MAGIC)
06147         return;
06148 
06149     apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_FW_STATUS);
06150     if (!(apedata & APE_FW_STATUS_READY))
06151         return;
06152 
06153     /* Wait for up to 1 millisecond for APE to service previous event. */
06154     for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
06155         if (tg3_ape_lock(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_MEM))
06156             return;
06157 
06158         apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_EVENT_STATUS);
06159 
06160         if (!(apedata & APE_EVENT_STATUS_EVENT_PENDING))
06161             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_EVENT_STATUS,
06162                     event | APE_EVENT_STATUS_EVENT_PENDING);
06163 
06164         tg3_ape_unlock(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_MEM);
06165 
06166         if (!(apedata & APE_EVENT_STATUS_EVENT_PENDING))
06167             break;
06168 
06169         udelay(100);
06170     }
06171 
06172     if (!(apedata & APE_EVENT_STATUS_EVENT_PENDING))
06173         tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_EVENT, APE_EVENT_1);
06174 }
06175 
06176 static void tg3_ape_driver_state_change(struct tg3 *tp, int kind)
06177 {
06178     u32 event;
06179     u32 apedata;
06180 
06181     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE))
06182         return;
06183 
06184     switch (kind) {
06185         case RESET_KIND_INIT:
06186             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_SEG_SIG,
06187                     APE_HOST_SEG_SIG_MAGIC);
06188             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_SEG_LEN,
06189                     APE_HOST_SEG_LEN_MAGIC);
06190             apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_INIT_COUNT);
06191             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_INIT_COUNT, ++apedata);
06192             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_DRIVER_ID,
06193                     APE_HOST_DRIVER_ID_MAGIC);
06194             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_BEHAVIOR,
06195                     APE_HOST_BEHAV_NO_PHYLOCK);
06196 
06197             event = APE_EVENT_STATUS_STATE_START;
06198             break;
06199         case RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN:
06200             /* With the interface we are currently using,
06201              * APE does not track driver state.  Wiping
06202              * out the HOST SEGMENT SIGNATURE forces
06203              * the APE to assume OS absent status.
06204              */
06205             tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_SEG_SIG, 0x0);
06206 
06207             event = APE_EVENT_STATUS_STATE_UNLOAD;
06208             break;
06209         case RESET_KIND_SUSPEND:
06210             event = APE_EVENT_STATUS_STATE_SUSPEND;
06211             break;
06212         default:
06213             return;
06214     }
06215 
06216     event |= APE_EVENT_STATUS_DRIVER_EVNT | APE_EVENT_STATUS_STATE_CHNGE;
06217 
06218     tg3_ape_send_event(tp, event);
06219 }
06220 
06221 /* tp->lock is held. */
06222 static void tg3_write_sig_pre_reset(struct tg3 *tp, int kind)
06223 {
06224     tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FIRMWARE_MBOX,
06225               NIC_SRAM_FIRMWARE_MBOX_MAGIC1);
06226 
06227     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ASF_NEW_HANDSHAKE) {
06228         switch (kind) {
06229         case RESET_KIND_INIT:
06230             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06231                       DRV_STATE_START);
06232             break;
06233 
06234         case RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN:
06235             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06236                       DRV_STATE_UNLOAD);
06237             break;
06238 
06239         case RESET_KIND_SUSPEND:
06240             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06241                       DRV_STATE_SUSPEND);
06242             break;
06243 
06244         default:
06245             break;
06246         }
06247     }
06248 
06249     if (kind == RESET_KIND_INIT ||
06250         kind == RESET_KIND_SUSPEND)
06251         tg3_ape_driver_state_change(tp, kind);
06252 }
06253 
06254 /* tp->lock is held. */
06255 static void tg3_write_sig_post_reset(struct tg3 *tp, int kind)
06256 {
06257     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ASF_NEW_HANDSHAKE) {
06258         switch (kind) {
06259         case RESET_KIND_INIT:
06260             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06261                       DRV_STATE_START_DONE);
06262             break;
06263 
06264         case RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN:
06265             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06266                       DRV_STATE_UNLOAD_DONE);
06267             break;
06268 
06269         default:
06270             break;
06271         }
06272     }
06273 
06274     if (kind == RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN)
06275         tg3_ape_driver_state_change(tp, kind);
06276 }
06277 
06278 /* tp->lock is held. */
06279 static void tg3_write_sig_legacy(struct tg3 *tp, int kind)
06280 {
06281     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) {
06282         switch (kind) {
06283         case RESET_KIND_INIT:
06284             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06285                       DRV_STATE_START);
06286             break;
06287 
06288         case RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN:
06289             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06290                       DRV_STATE_UNLOAD);
06291             break;
06292 
06293         case RESET_KIND_SUSPEND:
06294             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_DRV_STATE_MBOX,
06295                       DRV_STATE_SUSPEND);
06296             break;
06297 
06298         default:
06299             break;
06300         }
06301     }
06302 }
06303 
06304 static int tg3_poll_fw(struct tg3 *tp)
06305 {
06306     int i;
06307     u32 val;
06308 
06309     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
06310         /* Wait up to 20ms for init done. */
06311         for (i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
06312             if (tr32(VCPU_STATUS) & VCPU_STATUS_INIT_DONE)
06313                 return 0;
06314             udelay(100);
06315         }
06316         return -ENODEV;
06317     }
06318 
06319     /* Wait for firmware initialization to complete. */
06320     for (i = 0; i < 100000; i++) {
06321         tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FIRMWARE_MBOX, &val);
06322         if (val == ~NIC_SRAM_FIRMWARE_MBOX_MAGIC1)
06323             break;
06324         udelay(10);
06325     }
06326 
06327     /* Chip might not be fitted with firmware.  Some Sun onboard
06328      * parts are configured like that.  So don't signal the timeout
06329      * of the above loop as an error, but do report the lack of
06330      * running firmware once.
06331      */
06332     if (i >= 100000 &&
06333         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_NO_FWARE_REPORTED)) {
06334         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_NO_FWARE_REPORTED;
06335 
06336         printk(KERN_INFO PFX "%s: No firmware running.\n",
06337                tp->dev->name);
06338     }
06339 
06340     return 0;
06341 }
06342 
06343 /* Save PCI command register before chip reset */
06344 static void tg3_save_pci_state(struct tg3 *tp)
06345 {
06346     pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &tp->pci_cmd);
06347 }
06348 
06349 /* Restore PCI state after chip reset */
06350 static void tg3_restore_pci_state(struct tg3 *tp)
06351 {
06352     u32 val;
06353 
06354     /* Re-enable indirect register accesses. */
06355     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
06356                    tp->misc_host_ctrl);
06357 
06358     /* Set MAX PCI retry to zero. */
06359     val = (PCISTATE_ROM_ENABLE | PCISTATE_ROM_RETRY_ENABLE);
06360     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5704_A0 &&
06361         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE))
06362         val |= PCISTATE_RETRY_SAME_DMA;
06363     /* Allow reads and writes to the APE register and memory space. */
06364     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)
06365         val |= PCISTATE_ALLOW_APE_CTLSPC_WR |
06366                PCISTATE_ALLOW_APE_SHMEM_WR;
06367     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PCISTATE, val);
06368 
06369     pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, tp->pci_cmd);
06370 
06371     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5785) {
06372         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS)
06373             pcie_set_readrq(tp->pdev, 4096);
06374         else {
06375             pci_write_config_byte(tp->pdev, PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE,
06376                           tp->pci_cacheline_sz);
06377             pci_write_config_byte(tp->pdev, PCI_LATENCY_TIMER,
06378                           tp->pci_lat_timer);
06379         }
06380     }
06381 
06382     /* Make sure PCI-X relaxed ordering bit is clear. */
06383     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) {
06384         u16 pcix_cmd;
06385 
06386         pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, tp->pcix_cap + PCI_X_CMD,
06387                      &pcix_cmd);
06388         pcix_cmd &= ~PCI_X_CMD_ERO;
06389         pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, tp->pcix_cap + PCI_X_CMD,
06390                       pcix_cmd);
06391     }
06392 
06393     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS) {
06394 
06395         /* Chip reset on 5780 will reset MSI enable bit,
06396          * so need to restore it.
06397          */
06398         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI) {
06399             u16 ctrl;
06400 
06401             pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev,
06402                          tp->msi_cap + PCI_MSI_FLAGS,
06403                          &ctrl);
06404             pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev,
06405                           tp->msi_cap + PCI_MSI_FLAGS,
06406                           ctrl | PCI_MSI_FLAGS_ENABLE);
06407             val = tr32(MSGINT_MODE);
06408             tw32(MSGINT_MODE, val | MSGINT_MODE_ENABLE);
06409         }
06410     }
06411 }
06412 
06413 static void tg3_stop_fw(struct tg3 *);
06414 
06415 /* tp->lock is held. */
06416 static int tg3_chip_reset(struct tg3 *tp)
06417 {
06418     u32 val;
06419     void (*write_op)(struct tg3 *, u32, u32);
06420     int i, err;
06421 
06422     tg3_nvram_lock(tp);
06423 
06424     tg3_ape_lock(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_GRC);
06425 
06426     /* No matching tg3_nvram_unlock() after this because
06427      * chip reset below will undo the nvram lock.
06428      */
06429     tp->nvram_lock_cnt = 0;
06430 
06431     /* GRC_MISC_CFG core clock reset will clear the memory
06432      * enable bit in PCI register 4 and the MSI enable bit
06433      * on some chips, so we save relevant registers here.
06434      */
06435     tg3_save_pci_state(tp);
06436 
06437     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5752 ||
06438         (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS))
06439         tw32(GRC_FASTBOOT_PC, 0);
06440 
06441     /*
06442      * We must avoid the readl() that normally takes place.
06443      * It locks machines, causes machine checks, and other
06444      * fun things.  So, temporarily disable the 5701
06445      * hardware workaround, while we do the reset.
06446      */
06447     write_op = tp->write32;
06448     if (write_op == tg3_write_flush_reg32)
06449         tp->write32 = tg3_write32;
06450 
06451     /* Prevent the irq handler from reading or writing PCI registers
06452      * during chip reset when the memory enable bit in the PCI command
06453      * register may be cleared.  The chip does not generate interrupt
06454      * at this time, but the irq handler may still be called due to irq
06455      * sharing or irqpoll.
06456      */
06457     tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_CHIP_RESETTING;
06458     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
06459         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
06460         if (tnapi->hw_status) {
06461             tnapi->hw_status->status = 0;
06462             tnapi->hw_status->status_tag = 0;
06463         }
06464         tnapi->last_tag = 0;
06465         tnapi->last_irq_tag = 0;
06466     }
06467     smp_mb();
06468 
06469     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++)
06470         synchronize_irq(tp->napi[i].irq_vec);
06471 
06472     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780) {
06473         val = tr32(TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL) & ~TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL_L1_PLL_PD_EN;
06474         tw32(TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL, val | TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL_L1_PLL_PD_DIS);
06475     }
06476 
06477     /* do the reset */
06478     val = GRC_MISC_CFG_CORECLK_RESET;
06479 
06480     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) {
06481         if (tr32(0x7e2c) == 0x60) {
06482             tw32(0x7e2c, 0x20);
06483         }
06484         if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5750_A0) {
06485             tw32(GRC_MISC_CFG, (1 << 29));
06486             val |= (1 << 29);
06487         }
06488     }
06489 
06490     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
06491         tw32(VCPU_STATUS, tr32(VCPU_STATUS) | VCPU_STATUS_DRV_RESET);
06492         tw32(GRC_VCPU_EXT_CTRL,
06493              tr32(GRC_VCPU_EXT_CTRL) & ~GRC_VCPU_EXT_CTRL_HALT_CPU);
06494     }
06495 
06496     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)
06497         val |= GRC_MISC_CFG_KEEP_GPHY_POWER;
06498     tw32(GRC_MISC_CFG, val);
06499 
06500     /* restore 5701 hardware bug workaround write method */
06501     tp->write32 = write_op;
06502 
06503     /* Unfortunately, we have to delay before the PCI read back.
06504      * Some 575X chips even will not respond to a PCI cfg access
06505      * when the reset command is given to the chip.
06506      *
06507      * How do these hardware designers expect things to work
06508      * properly if the PCI write is posted for a long period
06509      * of time?  It is always necessary to have some method by
06510      * which a register read back can occur to push the write
06511      * out which does the reset.
06512      *
06513      * For most tg3 variants the trick below was working.
06514      * Ho hum...
06515      */
06516     udelay(120);
06517 
06518     /* Flush PCI posted writes.  The normal MMIO registers
06519      * are inaccessible at this time so this is the only
06520      * way to make this reliably (actually, this is no longer
06521      * the case, see above).  I tried to use indirect
06522      * register read/write but this upset some 5701 variants.
06523      */
06524     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &val);
06525 
06526     udelay(120);
06527 
06528     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) && tp->pcie_cap) {
06529         u16 val16;
06530 
06531         if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5750_A0) {
06532             int i;
06533             u32 cfg_val;
06534 
06535             /* Wait for link training to complete.  */
06536             for (i = 0; i < 5000; i++)
06537                 udelay(100);
06538 
06539             pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, 0xc4, &cfg_val);
06540             pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, 0xc4,
06541                            cfg_val | (1 << 15));
06542         }
06543 
06544         /* Clear the "no snoop" and "relaxed ordering" bits. */
06545         pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev,
06546                      tp->pcie_cap + PCI_EXP_DEVCTL,
06547                      &val16);
06548         val16 &= ~(PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_RELAX_EN |
06549                PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_NOSNOOP_EN);
06550         /*
06551          * Older PCIe devices only support the 128 byte
06552          * MPS setting.  Enforce the restriction.
06553          */
06554         if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT) ||
06555             (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784))
06556             val16 &= ~PCI_EXP_DEVCTL_PAYLOAD;
06557         pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev,
06558                       tp->pcie_cap + PCI_EXP_DEVCTL,
06559                       val16);
06560 
06561         pcie_set_readrq(tp->pdev, 4096);
06562 
06563         /* Clear error status */
06564         pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev,
06565                       tp->pcie_cap + PCI_EXP_DEVSTA,
06566                       PCI_EXP_DEVSTA_CED |
06567                       PCI_EXP_DEVSTA_NFED |
06568                       PCI_EXP_DEVSTA_FED |
06569                       PCI_EXP_DEVSTA_URD);
06570     }
06571 
06572     tg3_restore_pci_state(tp);
06573 
06574     tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_CHIP_RESETTING;
06575 
06576     val = 0;
06577     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)
06578         val = tr32(MEMARB_MODE);
06579     tw32(MEMARB_MODE, val | MEMARB_MODE_ENABLE);
06580 
06581     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5750_A3) {
06582         tg3_stop_fw(tp);
06583         tw32(0x5000, 0x400);
06584     }
06585 
06586     tw32(GRC_MODE, tp->grc_mode);
06587 
06588     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5705_A0) {
06589         val = tr32(0xc4);
06590 
06591         tw32(0xc4, val | (1 << 15));
06592     }
06593 
06594     if ((tp->nic_sram_data_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_MINI_PCI) != 0 &&
06595         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705) {
06596         tp->pci_clock_ctrl |= CLOCK_CTRL_CLKRUN_OENABLE;
06597         if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5705_A0)
06598             tp->pci_clock_ctrl |= CLOCK_CTRL_FORCE_CLKRUN;
06599         tw32(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL, tp->pci_clock_ctrl);
06600     }
06601 
06602     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) {
06603         tp->mac_mode = MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_TBI;
06604         tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode);
06605     } else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES) {
06606         tp->mac_mode = MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_GMII;
06607         tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode);
06608     } else if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE) {
06609         tp->mac_mode &= (MAC_MODE_APE_TX_EN | MAC_MODE_APE_RX_EN);
06610         if (tp->mac_mode & MAC_MODE_APE_TX_EN)
06611             tp->mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_TDE_ENABLE;
06612         tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode);
06613     } else
06614         tw32_f(MAC_MODE, 0);
06615     udelay(40);
06616 
06617     tg3_ape_unlock(tp, TG3_APE_LOCK_GRC);
06618 
06619     err = tg3_poll_fw(tp);
06620     if (err)
06621         return err;
06622 
06623     tg3_mdio_start(tp);
06624 
06625     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) &&
06626         tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5750_A0 &&
06627         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5785 &&
06628         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5717) {
06629         val = tr32(0x7c00);
06630 
06631         tw32(0x7c00, val | (1 << 25));
06632     }
06633 
06634     /* Reprobe ASF enable state.  */
06635     tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF;
06636     tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_ASF_NEW_HANDSHAKE;
06637     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_SIG, &val);
06638     if (val == NIC_SRAM_DATA_SIG_MAGIC) {
06639         u32 nic_cfg;
06640 
06641         tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG, &nic_cfg);
06642         if (nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_ASF_ENABLE) {
06643             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF;
06644             tp->last_event_jiffies = jiffies;
06645             if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS)
06646                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_ASF_NEW_HANDSHAKE;
06647         }
06648     }
06649 
06650     return 0;
06651 }
06652 
06653 /* tp->lock is held. */
06654 static void tg3_stop_fw(struct tg3 *tp)
06655 {
06656     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) &&
06657        !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)) {
06658         /* Wait for RX cpu to ACK the previous event. */
06659         tg3_wait_for_event_ack(tp);
06660 
06661         tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_MBOX, FWCMD_NICDRV_PAUSE_FW);
06662 
06663         tg3_generate_fw_event(tp);
06664 
06665         /* Wait for RX cpu to ACK this event. */
06666         tg3_wait_for_event_ack(tp);
06667     }
06668 }
06669 
06670 /* tp->lock is held. */
06671 static int tg3_halt(struct tg3 *tp, int kind, int silent)
06672 {
06673     int err;
06674 
06675     tg3_stop_fw(tp);
06676 
06677     tg3_write_sig_pre_reset(tp, kind);
06678 
06679     tg3_abort_hw(tp, silent);
06680     err = tg3_chip_reset(tp);
06681 
06682     __tg3_set_mac_addr(tp, 0);
06683 
06684     tg3_write_sig_legacy(tp, kind);
06685     tg3_write_sig_post_reset(tp, kind);
06686 
06687     if (err)
06688         return err;
06689 
06690     return 0;
06691 }
06692 
06693 #define RX_CPU_SCRATCH_BASE 0x30000
06694 #define RX_CPU_SCRATCH_SIZE 0x04000
06695 #define TX_CPU_SCRATCH_BASE 0x34000
06696 #define TX_CPU_SCRATCH_SIZE 0x04000
06697 
06698 /* tp->lock is held. */
06699 static int tg3_halt_cpu(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset)
06700 {
06701     int i;
06702 
06703     BUG_ON(offset == TX_CPU_BASE &&
06704         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS));
06705 
06706     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
06707         u32 val = tr32(GRC_VCPU_EXT_CTRL);
06708 
06709         tw32(GRC_VCPU_EXT_CTRL, val | GRC_VCPU_EXT_CTRL_HALT_CPU);
06710         return 0;
06711     }
06712     if (offset == RX_CPU_BASE) {
06713         for (i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {
06714             tw32(offset + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06715             tw32(offset + CPU_MODE,  CPU_MODE_HALT);
06716             if (tr32(offset + CPU_MODE) & CPU_MODE_HALT)
06717                 break;
06718         }
06719 
06720         tw32(offset + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06721         tw32_f(offset + CPU_MODE,  CPU_MODE_HALT);
06722         udelay(10);
06723     } else {
06724         for (i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {
06725             tw32(offset + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06726             tw32(offset + CPU_MODE,  CPU_MODE_HALT);
06727             if (tr32(offset + CPU_MODE) & CPU_MODE_HALT)
06728                 break;
06729         }
06730     }
06731 
06732     if (i >= 10000) {
06733         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_reset_cpu timed out for %s, "
06734                "and %s CPU\n",
06735                tp->dev->name,
06736                (offset == RX_CPU_BASE ? "RX" : "TX"));
06737         return -ENODEV;
06738     }
06739 
06740     /* Clear firmware's nvram arbitration. */
06741     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM)
06742         tw32(NVRAM_SWARB, SWARB_REQ_CLR0);
06743     return 0;
06744 }
06745 
06746 struct fw_info {
06747     unsigned int fw_base;
06748     unsigned int fw_len;
06749     const __be32 *fw_data;
06750 };
06751 
06752 /* tp->lock is held. */
06753 static int tg3_load_firmware_cpu(struct tg3 *tp, u32 cpu_base, u32 cpu_scratch_base,
06754                  int cpu_scratch_size, struct fw_info *info)
06755 {
06756     int err, lock_err, i;
06757     void (*write_op)(struct tg3 *, u32, u32);
06758 
06759     if (cpu_base == TX_CPU_BASE &&
06760         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)) {
06761         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_load_firmware_cpu: Trying to load "
06762                "TX cpu firmware on %s which is 5705.\n",
06763                tp->dev->name);
06764         return -EINVAL;
06765     }
06766 
06767     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)
06768         write_op = tg3_write_mem;
06769     else
06770         write_op = tg3_write_indirect_reg32;
06771 
06772     /* It is possible that bootcode is still loading at this point.
06773      * Get the nvram lock first before halting the cpu.
06774      */
06775     lock_err = tg3_nvram_lock(tp);
06776     err = tg3_halt_cpu(tp, cpu_base);
06777     if (!lock_err)
06778         tg3_nvram_unlock(tp);
06779     if (err)
06780         goto out;
06781 
06782     for (i = 0; i < cpu_scratch_size; i += sizeof(u32))
06783         write_op(tp, cpu_scratch_base + i, 0);
06784     tw32(cpu_base + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06785     tw32(cpu_base + CPU_MODE, tr32(cpu_base+CPU_MODE)|CPU_MODE_HALT);
06786     for (i = 0; i < (info->fw_len / sizeof(u32)); i++)
06787         write_op(tp, (cpu_scratch_base +
06788                   (info->fw_base & 0xffff) +
06789                   (i * sizeof(u32))),
06790                   be32_to_cpu(info->fw_data[i]));
06791 
06792     err = 0;
06793 
06794 out:
06795     return err;
06796 }
06797 
06798 /* tp->lock is held. */
06799 static int tg3_load_5701_a0_firmware_fix(struct tg3 *tp)
06800 {
06801     struct fw_info info;
06802     const __be32 *fw_data;
06803     int err, i;
06804 
06805     fw_data = (void *)tp->fw->data;
06806 
06807     /* Firmware blob starts with version numbers, followed by
06808        start address and length. We are setting complete length.
06809        length = end_address_of_bss - start_address_of_text.
06810        Remainder is the blob to be loaded contiguously
06811        from start address. */
06812 
06813     info.fw_base = be32_to_cpu(fw_data[1]);
06814     info.fw_len = tp->fw->size - 12;
06815     info.fw_data = &fw_data[3];
06816 
06817     err = tg3_load_firmware_cpu(tp, RX_CPU_BASE,
06818                     RX_CPU_SCRATCH_BASE, RX_CPU_SCRATCH_SIZE,
06819                     &info);
06820     if (err)
06821         return err;
06822 
06823     err = tg3_load_firmware_cpu(tp, TX_CPU_BASE,
06824                     TX_CPU_SCRATCH_BASE, TX_CPU_SCRATCH_SIZE,
06825                     &info);
06826     if (err)
06827         return err;
06828 
06829     /* Now startup only the RX cpu. */
06830     tw32(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06831     tw32_f(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_PC, info.fw_base);
06832 
06833     for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
06834         if (tr32(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_PC) == info.fw_base)
06835             break;
06836         tw32(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06837         tw32(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_MODE,  CPU_MODE_HALT);
06838         tw32_f(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_PC, info.fw_base);
06839         udelay(1000);
06840     }
06841     if (i >= 5) {
06842         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_load_firmware fails for %s "
06843                "to set RX CPU PC, is %08x should be %08x\n",
06844                tp->dev->name, tr32(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_PC),
06845                info.fw_base);
06846         return -ENODEV;
06847     }
06848     tw32(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06849     tw32_f(RX_CPU_BASE + CPU_MODE,  0x00000000);
06850 
06851     return 0;
06852 }
06853
