06854 /* 5705 needs a special version of the TSO firmware.  */
06855 
06856 /* tp->lock is held. */
06857 static int tg3_load_tso_firmware(struct tg3 *tp)
06858 {
06859     struct fw_info info;
06860     const __be32 *fw_data;
06861     unsigned long cpu_base, cpu_scratch_base, cpu_scratch_size;
06862     int err, i;
06863 
06864     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO)
06865         return 0;
06866 
06867     fw_data = (void *)tp->fw->data;
06868 
06869     /* Firmware blob starts with version numbers, followed by
06870        start address and length. We are setting complete length.
06871        length = end_address_of_bss - start_address_of_text.
06872        Remainder is the blob to be loaded contiguously
06873        from start address. */
06874 
06875     info.fw_base = be32_to_cpu(fw_data[1]);
06876     cpu_scratch_size = tp->fw_len;
06877     info.fw_len = tp->fw->size - 12;
06878     info.fw_data = &fw_data[3];
06879 
06880     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705) {
06881         cpu_base = RX_CPU_BASE;
06882         cpu_scratch_base = NIC_SRAM_MBUF_POOL_BASE5705;
06883     } else {
06884         cpu_base = TX_CPU_BASE;
06885         cpu_scratch_base = TX_CPU_SCRATCH_BASE;
06886         cpu_scratch_size = TX_CPU_SCRATCH_SIZE;
06887     }
06888 
06889     err = tg3_load_firmware_cpu(tp, cpu_base,
06890                     cpu_scratch_base, cpu_scratch_size,
06891                     &info);
06892     if (err)
06893         return err;
06894 
06895     /* Now startup the cpu. */
06896     tw32(cpu_base + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06897     tw32_f(cpu_base + CPU_PC, info.fw_base);
06898 
06899     for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
06900         if (tr32(cpu_base + CPU_PC) == info.fw_base)
06901             break;
06902         tw32(cpu_base + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06903         tw32(cpu_base + CPU_MODE,  CPU_MODE_HALT);
06904         tw32_f(cpu_base + CPU_PC, info.fw_base);
06905         udelay(1000);
06906     }
06907     if (i >= 5) {
06908         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_load_tso_firmware fails for %s "
06909                "to set CPU PC, is %08x should be %08x\n",
06910                tp->dev->name, tr32(cpu_base + CPU_PC),
06911                info.fw_base);
06912         return -ENODEV;
06913     }
06914     tw32(cpu_base + CPU_STATE, 0xffffffff);
06915     tw32_f(cpu_base + CPU_MODE,  0x00000000);
06916     return 0;
06917 }
06918 
06919 
06920 static int tg3_set_mac_addr(struct net_device *dev, void *p)
06921 {
06922     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
06923     struct sockaddr *addr = p;
06924     int err = 0, skip_mac_1 = 0;
06925 
06926     if (!is_valid_ether_addr(addr->sa_data))
06927         return -EINVAL;
06928 
06929     memcpy(dev->dev_addr, addr->sa_data, dev->addr_len);
06930 
06931     if (!netif_running(dev))
06932         return 0;
06933 
06934     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) {
06935         u32 addr0_high, addr0_low, addr1_high, addr1_low;
06936 
06937         addr0_high = tr32(MAC_ADDR_0_HIGH);
06938         addr0_low = tr32(MAC_ADDR_0_LOW);
06939         addr1_high = tr32(MAC_ADDR_1_HIGH);
06940         addr1_low = tr32(MAC_ADDR_1_LOW);
06941 
06942         /* Skip MAC addr 1 if ASF is using it. */
06943         if ((addr0_high != addr1_high || addr0_low != addr1_low) &&
06944             !(addr1_high == 0 && addr1_low == 0))
06945             skip_mac_1 = 1;
06946     }
06947     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
06948     __tg3_set_mac_addr(tp, skip_mac_1);
06949     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
06950 
06951     return err;
06952 }
06953 
06954 /* tp->lock is held. */
06955 static void tg3_set_bdinfo(struct tg3 *tp, u32 bdinfo_addr,
06956                dma_addr_t mapping, u32 maxlen_flags,
06957                u32 nic_addr)
06958 {
06959     tg3_write_mem(tp,
06960               (bdinfo_addr + TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH),
06961               ((u64) mapping >> 32));
06962     tg3_write_mem(tp,
06963               (bdinfo_addr + TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW),
06964               ((u64) mapping & 0xffffffff));
06965     tg3_write_mem(tp,
06966               (bdinfo_addr + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS),
06967                maxlen_flags);
06968 
06969     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
06970         tg3_write_mem(tp,
06971                   (bdinfo_addr + TG3_BDINFO_NIC_ADDR),
06972                   nic_addr);
06973 }
06974 
06975 static void __tg3_set_rx_mode(struct net_device *);
06976 static void __tg3_set_coalesce(struct tg3 *tp, struct ethtool_coalesce *ec)
06977 {
06978     int i;
06979 
06980     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX)) {
06981         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOL_TICKS, ec->tx_coalesce_usecs);
06982         tw32(HOSTCC_TXMAX_FRAMES, ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames);
06983         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT, ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames_irq);
06984 
06985         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOL_TICKS, ec->rx_coalesce_usecs);
06986         tw32(HOSTCC_RXMAX_FRAMES, ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames);
06987         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT, ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames_irq);
06988     } else {
06989         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOL_TICKS, 0);
06990         tw32(HOSTCC_TXMAX_FRAMES, 0);
06991         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT, 0);
06992 
06993         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOL_TICKS, 0);
06994         tw32(HOSTCC_RXMAX_FRAMES, 0);
06995         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT, 0);
06996     }
06997 
06998     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)) {
06999         u32 val = ec->stats_block_coalesce_usecs;
07000 
07001         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOAL_TICK_INT, ec->rx_coalesce_usecs_irq);
07002         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOAL_TICK_INT, ec->tx_coalesce_usecs_irq);
07003 
07004         if (!netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev))
07005             val = 0;
07006 
07007         tw32(HOSTCC_STAT_COAL_TICKS, val);
07008     }
07009 
07010     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt - 1; i++) {
07011         u32 reg;
07012 
07013         reg = HOSTCC_RXCOL_TICKS_VEC1 + i * 0x18;
07014         tw32(reg, ec->rx_coalesce_usecs);
07015         reg = HOSTCC_TXCOL_TICKS_VEC1 + i * 0x18;
07016         tw32(reg, ec->tx_coalesce_usecs);
07017         reg = HOSTCC_RXMAX_FRAMES_VEC1 + i * 0x18;
07018         tw32(reg, ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames);
07019         reg = HOSTCC_TXMAX_FRAMES_VEC1 + i * 0x18;
07020         tw32(reg, ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames);
07021         reg = HOSTCC_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT_VEC1 + i * 0x18;
07022         tw32(reg, ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames_irq);
07023         reg = HOSTCC_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT_VEC1 + i * 0x18;
07024         tw32(reg, ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames_irq);
07025     }
07026 
07027     for (; i < tp->irq_max - 1; i++) {
07028         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOL_TICKS_VEC1 + i * 0x18, 0);
07029         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOL_TICKS_VEC1 + i * 0x18, 0);
07030         tw32(HOSTCC_RXMAX_FRAMES_VEC1 + i * 0x18, 0);
07031         tw32(HOSTCC_TXMAX_FRAMES_VEC1 + i * 0x18, 0);
07032         tw32(HOSTCC_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT_VEC1 + i * 0x18, 0);
07033         tw32(HOSTCC_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT_VEC1 + i * 0x18, 0);
07034     }
07035 }
07036 
07037 /* tp->lock is held. */
07038 static void tg3_rings_reset(struct tg3 *tp)
07039 {
07040     int i;
07041     u32 stblk, txrcb, rxrcb, limit;
07042     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[0];
07043 
07044     /* Disable all transmit rings but the first. */
07045     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
07046         limit = NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE * 16;
07047     else
07048         limit = NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07049 
07050     for (txrcb = NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07051          txrcb < limit; txrcb += TG3_BDINFO_SIZE)
07052         tg3_write_mem(tp, txrcb + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS,
07053                   BDINFO_FLAGS_DISABLED);
07054 
07055 
07056     /* Disable all receive return rings but the first. */
07057     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
07058         limit = NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE * 17;
07059     else if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
07060         limit = NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE * 16;
07061     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755)
07062         limit = NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE * 4;
07063     else
07064         limit = NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07065 
07066     for (rxrcb = NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07067          rxrcb < limit; rxrcb += TG3_BDINFO_SIZE)
07068         tg3_write_mem(tp, rxrcb + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS,
07069                   BDINFO_FLAGS_DISABLED);
07070 
07071     /* Disable interrupts */
07072     tw32_mailbox_f(tp->napi[0].int_mbox, 1);
07073 
07074     /* Zero mailbox registers. */
07075     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSIX) {
07076         for (i = 1; i < TG3_IRQ_MAX_VECS; i++) {
07077             tp->napi[i].tx_prod = 0;
07078             tp->napi[i].tx_cons = 0;
07079             tw32_mailbox(tp->napi[i].prodmbox, 0);
07080             tw32_rx_mbox(tp->napi[i].consmbox, 0);
07081             tw32_mailbox_f(tp->napi[i].int_mbox, 1);
07082         }
07083     } else {
07084         tp->napi[0].tx_prod = 0;
07085         tp->napi[0].tx_cons = 0;
07086         tw32_mailbox(tp->napi[0].prodmbox, 0);
07087         tw32_rx_mbox(tp->napi[0].consmbox, 0);
07088     }
07089 
07090     /* Make sure the NIC-based send BD rings are disabled. */
07091     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)) {
07092         u32 mbox = MAILBOX_SNDNIC_PROD_IDX_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW;
07093         for (i = 0; i < 16; i++)
07094             tw32_tx_mbox(mbox + i * 8, 0);
07095     }
07096 
07097     txrcb = NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB;
07098     rxrcb = NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB;
07099 
07100     /* Clear status block in ram. */
07101     memset(tnapi->hw_status, 0, TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE);
07102 
07103     /* Set status block DMA address */
07104     tw32(HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH,
07105          ((u64) tnapi->status_mapping >> 32));
07106     tw32(HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
07107          ((u64) tnapi->status_mapping & 0xffffffff));
07108 
07109     if (tnapi->tx_ring) {
07110         tg3_set_bdinfo(tp, txrcb, tnapi->tx_desc_mapping,
07111                    (TG3_TX_RING_SIZE <<
07112                 BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT),
07113                    NIC_SRAM_TX_BUFFER_DESC);
07114         txrcb += TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07115     }
07116 
07117     if (tnapi->rx_rcb) {
07118         tg3_set_bdinfo(tp, rxrcb, tnapi->rx_rcb_mapping,
07119                    (TG3_RX_RCB_RING_SIZE(tp) <<
07120                 BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT), 0);
07121         rxrcb += TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07122     }
07123 
07124     stblk = HOSTCC_STATBLCK_RING1;
07125 
07126     for (i = 1, tnapi++; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++, tnapi++) {
07127         u64 mapping = (u64)tnapi->status_mapping;
07128         tw32(stblk + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH, mapping >> 32);
07129         tw32(stblk + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW, mapping & 0xffffffff);
07130 
07131         /* Clear status block in ram. */
07132         memset(tnapi->hw_status, 0, TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE);
07133 
07134         tg3_set_bdinfo(tp, txrcb, tnapi->tx_desc_mapping,
07135                    (TG3_TX_RING_SIZE <<
07136                 BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT),
07137                    NIC_SRAM_TX_BUFFER_DESC);
07138 
07139         tg3_set_bdinfo(tp, rxrcb, tnapi->rx_rcb_mapping,
07140                    (TG3_RX_RCB_RING_SIZE(tp) <<
07141                 BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT), 0);
07142 
07143         stblk += 8;
07144         txrcb += TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07145         rxrcb += TG3_BDINFO_SIZE;
07146     }
07147 }
07148 
07149 /* tp->lock is held. */
07150 static int tg3_reset_hw(struct tg3 *tp, int reset_phy)
07151 {
07152     u32 val, rdmac_mode;
07153     int i, err, limit;
07154     struct tg3_rx_prodring_set *tpr = &tp->prodring[0];
07155 
07156     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
07157 
07158     tg3_stop_fw(tp);
07159 
07160     tg3_write_sig_pre_reset(tp, RESET_KIND_INIT);
07161 
07162     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE) {
07163         tg3_abort_hw(tp, 1);
07164     }
07165 
07166     if (reset_phy &&
07167         !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB))
07168         tg3_phy_reset(tp);
07169 
07170     err = tg3_chip_reset(tp);
07171     if (err)
07172         return err;
07173 
07174     tg3_write_sig_legacy(tp, RESET_KIND_INIT);
07175 
07176     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5784_AX) {
07177         val = tr32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL);
07178         val &= ~(CPMU_CTRL_LINK_AWARE_MODE | CPMU_CTRL_LINK_IDLE_MODE);
07179         tw32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL, val);
07180 
07181         val = tr32(TG3_CPMU_LSPD_10MB_CLK);
07182         val &= ~CPMU_LSPD_10MB_MACCLK_MASK;
07183         val |= CPMU_LSPD_10MB_MACCLK_6_25;
07184         tw32(TG3_CPMU_LSPD_10MB_CLK, val);
07185 
07186         val = tr32(TG3_CPMU_LNK_AWARE_PWRMD);
07187         val &= ~CPMU_LNK_AWARE_MACCLK_MASK;
07188         val |= CPMU_LNK_AWARE_MACCLK_6_25;
07189         tw32(TG3_CPMU_LNK_AWARE_PWRMD, val);
07190 
07191         val = tr32(TG3_CPMU_HST_ACC);
07192         val &= ~CPMU_HST_ACC_MACCLK_MASK;
07193         val |= CPMU_HST_ACC_MACCLK_6_25;
07194         tw32(TG3_CPMU_HST_ACC, val);
07195     }
07196 
07197     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780) {
07198         val = tr32(PCIE_PWR_MGMT_THRESH) & ~PCIE_PWR_MGMT_L1_THRESH_MSK;
07199         val |= PCIE_PWR_MGMT_EXT_ASPM_TMR_EN |
07200                PCIE_PWR_MGMT_L1_THRESH_4MS;
07201         tw32(PCIE_PWR_MGMT_THRESH, val);
07202 
07203         val = tr32(TG3_PCIE_EIDLE_DELAY) & ~TG3_PCIE_EIDLE_DELAY_MASK;
07204         tw32(TG3_PCIE_EIDLE_DELAY, val | TG3_PCIE_EIDLE_DELAY_13_CLKS);
07205 
07206         tw32(TG3_CORR_ERR_STAT, TG3_CORR_ERR_STAT_CLEAR);
07207     }
07208 
07209     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_TOGGLE_10_100_L1PLLPD) {
07210         val = tr32(TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL);
07211         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_CLKREQ_BUG)
07212             val |= TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL_L1_PLL_PD_DIS;
07213         else
07214             val &= ~TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL_L1_PLL_PD_DIS;
07215         tw32(TG3_PCIE_LNKCTL, val);
07216     }
07217 
07218     /* This works around an issue with Athlon chipsets on
07219      * B3 tigon3 silicon.  This bit has no effect on any
07220      * other revision.  But do not set this on PCI Express
07221      * chips and don't even touch the clocks if the CPMU is present.
07222      */
07223     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT)) {
07224         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS))
07225             tp->pci_clock_ctrl |= CLOCK_CTRL_DELAY_PCI_GRANT;
07226         tw32_f(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL, tp->pci_clock_ctrl);
07227     }
07228 
07229     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5704_A0 &&
07230         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE)) {
07231         val = tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE);
07232         val |= PCISTATE_RETRY_SAME_DMA;
07233         tw32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE, val);
07234     }
07235 
07236     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE) {
07237         /* Allow reads and writes to the
07238          * APE register and memory space.
07239          */
07240         val = tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE);
07241         val |= PCISTATE_ALLOW_APE_CTLSPC_WR |
07242                PCISTATE_ALLOW_APE_SHMEM_WR;
07243         tw32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE, val);
07244     }
07245 
07246     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5704_BX) {
07247         /* Enable some hw fixes.  */
07248         val = tr32(TG3PCI_MSI_DATA);
07249         val |= (1 << 26) | (1 << 28) | (1 << 29);
07250         tw32(TG3PCI_MSI_DATA, val);
07251     }
07252 
07253     /* Descriptor ring init may make accesses to the
07254      * NIC SRAM area to setup the TX descriptors, so we
07255      * can only do this after the hardware has been
07256      * successfully reset.
07257      */
07258     err = tg3_init_rings(tp);
07259     if (err)
07260         return err;
07261 
07262     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5784 &&
07263         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5761 &&
07264         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5717) {
07265         /* This value is determined during the probe time DMA
07266          * engine test, tg3_test_dma.
07267          */
07268         tw32(TG3PCI_DMA_RW_CTRL, tp->dma_rwctrl);
07269     }
07270 
07271     tp->grc_mode &= ~(GRC_MODE_HOST_SENDBDS |
07272               GRC_MODE_4X_NIC_SEND_RINGS |
07273               GRC_MODE_NO_TX_PHDR_CSUM |
07274               GRC_MODE_NO_RX_PHDR_CSUM);
07275     tp->grc_mode |= GRC_MODE_HOST_SENDBDS;
07276 
07277     /* Pseudo-header checksum is done by hardware logic and not
07278      * the offload processers, so make the chip do the pseudo-
07279      * header checksums on receive.  For transmit it is more
07280      * convenient to do the pseudo-header checksum in software
07281      * as Linux does that on transmit for us in all cases.
07282      */
07283     tp->grc_mode |= GRC_MODE_NO_TX_PHDR_CSUM;
07284 
07285     tw32(GRC_MODE,
07286          tp->grc_mode |
07287          (GRC_MODE_IRQ_ON_MAC_ATTN | GRC_MODE_HOST_STACKUP));
07288 
07289     /* Setup the timer prescalar register.  Clock is always 66Mhz. */
07290     val = tr32(GRC_MISC_CFG);
07291     val &= ~0xff;
07292     val |= (65 << GRC_MISC_CFG_PRESCALAR_SHIFT);
07293     tw32(GRC_MISC_CFG, val);
07294 
07295     /* Initialize MBUF/DESC pool. */
07296     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS) {
07297         /* Do nothing.  */
07298     } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5705) {
07299         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_ADDR, NIC_SRAM_MBUF_POOL_BASE);
07300         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704)
07301             tw32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_SIZE, NIC_SRAM_MBUF_POOL_SIZE64);
07302         else
07303             tw32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_SIZE, NIC_SRAM_MBUF_POOL_SIZE96);
07304         tw32(BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_ADDR, NIC_SRAM_DMA_DESC_POOL_BASE);
07305         tw32(BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_SIZE, NIC_SRAM_DMA_DESC_POOL_SIZE);
07306     }
07307     else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE) {
07308         int fw_len;
07309 
07310         fw_len = tp->fw_len;
07311         fw_len = (fw_len + (0x80 - 1)) & ~(0x80 - 1);
07312         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_ADDR,
07313              NIC_SRAM_MBUF_POOL_BASE5705 + fw_len);
07314         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_SIZE,
07315              NIC_SRAM_MBUF_POOL_SIZE5705 - fw_len - 0xa00);
07316     }
07317 
07318     if (tp->dev->mtu <= ETH_DATA_LEN) {
07319         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER,
07320              tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_read_dma_low_water);
07321         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER,
07322              tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water);
07323         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_HIGH_WATER,
07324              tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water);
07325     } else {
07326         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER,
07327              tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_read_dma_low_water_jumbo);
07328         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER,
07329              tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water_jumbo);
07330         tw32(BUFMGR_MB_HIGH_WATER,
07331              tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water_jumbo);
07332     }
07333     tw32(BUFMGR_DMA_LOW_WATER,
07334          tp->bufmgr_config.dma_low_water);
07335     tw32(BUFMGR_DMA_HIGH_WATER,
07336          tp->bufmgr_config.dma_high_water);
07337 
07338     tw32(BUFMGR_MODE, BUFMGR_MODE_ENABLE | BUFMGR_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE);
07339     for (i = 0; i < 2000; i++) {
07340         if (tr32(BUFMGR_MODE) & BUFMGR_MODE_ENABLE)
07341             break;
07342         udelay(10);
07343     }
07344     if (i >= 2000) {
07345         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "tg3_reset_hw cannot enable BUFMGR for %s.\n",
07346                tp->dev->name);
07347         return -ENODEV;
07348     }
07349 
07350     /* Setup replenish threshold. */
07351     val = tp->rx_pending / 8;
07352     if (val == 0)
07353         val = 1;
07354     else if (val > tp->rx_std_max_post)
07355         val = tp->rx_std_max_post;
07356     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
07357         if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5906_A1)
07358             tw32(ISO_PKT_TX, (tr32(ISO_PKT_TX) & ~0x3) | 0x2);
07359 
07360         if (val > (TG3_RX_INTERNAL_RING_SZ_5906 / 2))
07361             val = TG3_RX_INTERNAL_RING_SZ_5906 / 2;
07362     }
07363 
07364     tw32(RCVBDI_STD_THRESH, val);
07365 
07366     /* Initialize TG3_BDINFO's at:
07367      *  RCVDBDI_STD_BD: standard eth size rx ring
07368      *  RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD:   jumbo frame rx ring
07369      *  RCVDBDI_MINI_BD:    small frame rx ring (??? does not work)
07370      *
07371      * like so:
07372      *  TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR:   high/low parts of DMA address of ring
07373      *  TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS:    (rx max buffer size << 16) |
07374      *                              ring attribute flags
07375      *  TG3_BDINFO_NIC_ADDR:    location of descriptors in nic SRAM
07376      *
07377      * Standard receive ring @ NIC_SRAM_RX_BUFFER_DESC, 512 entries.
07378      * Jumbo receive ring @ NIC_SRAM_RX_JUMBO_BUFFER_DESC, 256 entries.
07379      *
07380      * The size of each ring is fixed in the firmware, but the location is
07381      * configurable.
07382      */
07383     tw32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH,
07384          ((u64) tpr->rx_std_mapping >> 32));
07385     tw32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
07386          ((u64) tpr->rx_std_mapping & 0xffffffff));
07387     tw32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + TG3_BDINFO_NIC_ADDR,
07388          NIC_SRAM_RX_BUFFER_DESC);
07389 
07390     /* Disable the mini ring */
07391     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
07392         tw32(RCVDBDI_MINI_BD + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS,
07393              BDINFO_FLAGS_DISABLED);
07394 
07395     /* Program the jumbo buffer descriptor ring control
07396      * blocks on those devices that have them.
07397      */
07398     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE) &&
07399         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)) {
07400         /* Setup replenish threshold. */
07401         tw32(RCVBDI_JUMBO_THRESH, tp->rx_jumbo_pending / 8);
07402 
07403         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE) {
07404             tw32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH,
07405                  ((u64) tpr->rx_jmb_mapping >> 32));
07406             tw32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + TG3_BDINFO_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
07407                  ((u64) tpr->rx_jmb_mapping & 0xffffffff));
07408             tw32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS,
07409                  (RX_JUMBO_MAX_SIZE << BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT) |
07410                  BDINFO_FLAGS_USE_EXT_RECV);
07411             tw32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + TG3_BDINFO_NIC_ADDR,
07412                  NIC_SRAM_RX_JUMBO_BUFFER_DESC);
07413         } else {
07414             tw32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS,
07415                  BDINFO_FLAGS_DISABLED);
07416         }
07417 
07418         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
07419             val = (RX_STD_MAX_SIZE_5705 << BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT) |
07420                   (RX_STD_MAX_SIZE << 2);
07421         else
07422             val = RX_STD_MAX_SIZE << BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT;
07423     } else
07424         val = RX_STD_MAX_SIZE_5705 << BDINFO_FLAGS_MAXLEN_SHIFT;
07425 
07426     tw32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + TG3_BDINFO_MAXLEN_FLAGS, val);
07427 
07428     tpr->rx_std_ptr = tp->rx_pending;
07429     tw32_rx_mbox(MAILBOX_RCV_STD_PROD_IDX + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
07430              tpr->rx_std_ptr);
07431 
07432     tpr->rx_jmb_ptr = (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE) ?
07433               tp->rx_jumbo_pending : 0;
07434     tw32_rx_mbox(MAILBOX_RCV_JUMBO_PROD_IDX + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
07435              tpr->rx_jmb_ptr);
07436 
07437     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717) {
07438         tw32(STD_REPLENISH_LWM, 32);
07439         tw32(JMB_REPLENISH_LWM, 16);
07440     }
07441 
07442     tg3_rings_reset(tp);
07443 
07444     /* Initialize MAC address and backoff seed. */
07445     __tg3_set_mac_addr(tp, 0);
07446 
07447     /* MTU + ethernet header + FCS + optional VLAN tag */
07448     tw32(MAC_RX_MTU_SIZE,
07449          tp->dev->mtu + ETH_HLEN + ETH_FCS_LEN + VLAN_HLEN);
07450 
07451     /* The slot time is changed by tg3_setup_phy if we
07452      * run at gigabit with half duplex.
07453      */
07454     tw32(MAC_TX_LENGTHS,
07455          (2 << TX_LENGTHS_IPG_CRS_SHIFT) |
07456          (6 << TX_LENGTHS_IPG_SHIFT) |
07457          (32 << TX_LENGTHS_SLOT_TIME_SHIFT));
07458 
07459     /* Receive rules. */
07460     tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_CFG, RCV_RULE_CFG_DEFAULT_CLASS);
07461     tw32(RCVLPC_CONFIG, 0x0181);
07462 
07463     /* Calculate RDMAC_MODE setting early, we need it to determine
07464      * the RCVLPC_STATE_ENABLE mask.
07465      */
07466     rdmac_mode = (RDMAC_MODE_ENABLE | RDMAC_MODE_TGTABORT_ENAB |
07467               RDMAC_MODE_MSTABORT_ENAB | RDMAC_MODE_PARITYERR_ENAB |
07468               RDMAC_MODE_ADDROFLOW_ENAB | RDMAC_MODE_FIFOOFLOW_ENAB |
07469               RDMAC_MODE_FIFOURUN_ENAB | RDMAC_MODE_FIFOOREAD_ENAB |
07470               RDMAC_MODE_LNGREAD_ENAB);
07471 
07472     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 ||
07473         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
07474         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780)
07475         rdmac_mode |= RDMAC_MODE_BD_SBD_CRPT_ENAB |
07476                   RDMAC_MODE_MBUF_RBD_CRPT_ENAB |
07477                   RDMAC_MODE_MBUF_SBD_CRPT_ENAB;
07478 
07479     /* If statement applies to 5705 and 5750 PCI devices only */
07480     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705 &&
07481          tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5705_A0) ||
07482         (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5750)) {
07483         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE &&
07484             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705) {
07485             rdmac_mode |= RDMAC_MODE_FIFO_SIZE_128;
07486         } else if (!(tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE) & PCISTATE_BUS_SPEED_HIGH) &&
07487                !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_5788)) {
07488             rdmac_mode |= RDMAC_MODE_FIFO_LONG_BURST;
07489         }
07490     }
07491 
07492     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS)
07493         rdmac_mode |= RDMAC_MODE_FIFO_LONG_BURST;
07494 
07495     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO)
07496         rdmac_mode |= RDMAC_MODE_IPV4_LSO_EN;
07497 
07498     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
07499         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780)
07500         rdmac_mode |= RDMAC_MODE_IPV6_LSO_EN;
07501 
07502     /* Receive/send statistics. */
07503     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS) {
07504         val = tr32(RCVLPC_STATS_ENABLE);
07505         val &= ~RCVLPC_STATSENAB_DACK_FIX;
07506         tw32(RCVLPC_STATS_ENABLE, val);
07507     } else if ((rdmac_mode & RDMAC_MODE_FIFO_SIZE_128) &&
07508            (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE)) {
07509         val = tr32(RCVLPC_STATS_ENABLE);
07510         val &= ~RCVLPC_STATSENAB_LNGBRST_RFIX;
07511         tw32(RCVLPC_STATS_ENABLE, val);
07512     } else {
07513         tw32(RCVLPC_STATS_ENABLE, 0xffffff);
07514     }
07515     tw32(RCVLPC_STATSCTRL, RCVLPC_STATSCTRL_ENABLE);
07516     tw32(SNDDATAI_STATSENAB, 0xffffff);
07517     tw32(SNDDATAI_STATSCTRL,
07518          (SNDDATAI_SCTRL_ENABLE |
07519           SNDDATAI_SCTRL_FASTUPD));
07520 
07521     /* Setup host coalescing engine. */
07522     tw32(HOSTCC_MODE, 0);
07523     for (i = 0; i < 2000; i++) {
07524         if (!(tr32(HOSTCC_MODE) & HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE))
07525             break;
07526         udelay(10);
07527     }
07528 
07529     __tg3_set_coalesce(tp, &tp->coal);
07530 
07531     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)) {
07532         /* Status/statistics block address.  See tg3_timer,
07533          * the tg3_periodic_fetch_stats call there, and
07534          * tg3_get_stats to see how this works for 5705/5750 chips.
07535          */
07536         tw32(HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH,
07537              ((u64) tp->stats_mapping >> 32));
07538         tw32(HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW,
07539              ((u64) tp->stats_mapping & 0xffffffff));
07540         tw32(HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_NIC_ADDR, NIC_SRAM_STATS_BLK);
07541 
07542         tw32(HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_NIC_ADDR, NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK);
07543 
07544         /* Clear statistics and status block memory areas */
07545         for (i = NIC_SRAM_STATS_BLK;
07546              i < NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK + TG3_HW_STATUS_SIZE;
07547              i += sizeof(u32)) {
07548             tg3_write_mem(tp, i, 0);
07549             udelay(40);
07550         }
07551     }
07552 
07553     tw32(HOSTCC_MODE, HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE | tp->coalesce_mode);
07554 
07555     tw32(RCVCC_MODE, RCVCC_MODE_ENABLE | RCVCC_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE);
07556     tw32(RCVLPC_MODE, RCVLPC_MODE_ENABLE);
07557     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
07558         tw32(RCVLSC_MODE, RCVLSC_MODE_ENABLE | RCVLSC_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE);
07559 
07560     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES) {
07561         tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_PARALLEL_DETECT;
07562         /* reset to prevent losing 1st rx packet intermittently */
07563         tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, RX_MODE_RESET);
07564         udelay(10);
07565     }
07566 
07567     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)
07568         tp->mac_mode &= MAC_MODE_APE_TX_EN | MAC_MODE_APE_RX_EN;
07569     else
07570         tp->mac_mode = 0;
07571     tp->mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_TXSTAT_ENABLE | MAC_MODE_RXSTAT_ENABLE |
07572         MAC_MODE_TDE_ENABLE | MAC_MODE_RDE_ENABLE | MAC_MODE_FHDE_ENABLE;
07573     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) &&
07574         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) &&
07575         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700)
07576         tp->mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_LINK_POLARITY;
07577     tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode | MAC_MODE_RXSTAT_CLEAR | MAC_MODE_TXSTAT_CLEAR);
07578     udelay(40);
07579 
07580     /* tp->grc_local_ctrl is partially set up during tg3_get_invariants().
07581      * If TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC is zero, we should read the
07582      * register to preserve the GPIO settings for LOMs. The GPIOs,
07583      * whether used as inputs or outputs, are set by boot code after
07584      * reset.
07585      */
07586     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC)) {
07587         u32 gpio_mask;
07588 
07589         gpio_mask = GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE0 | GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
07590                 GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE2 | GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT0 |
07591                 GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1 | GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT2;
07592 
07593         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5752)
07594             gpio_mask |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE3 |
07595                      GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT3;
07596 
07597         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755)
07598             gpio_mask |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_UART_SEL;
07599 
07600         tp->grc_local_ctrl &= ~gpio_mask;
07601         tp->grc_local_ctrl |= tr32(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL) & gpio_mask;
07602 
07603         /* GPIO1 must be driven high for eeprom write protect */
07604         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT)
07605             tp->grc_local_ctrl |= (GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
07606                            GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1);
07607     }
07608     tw32_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl);
07609     udelay(100);
07610 
07611     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX) {
07612         val = tr32(MSGINT_MODE);
07613         val |= MSGINT_MODE_MULTIVEC_EN | MSGINT_MODE_ENABLE;
07614         tw32(MSGINT_MODE, val);
07615     }
07616 
07617     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)) {
07618         tw32_f(DMAC_MODE, DMAC_MODE_ENABLE);
07619         udelay(40);
07620     }
07621 
07622     val = (WDMAC_MODE_ENABLE | WDMAC_MODE_TGTABORT_ENAB |
07623            WDMAC_MODE_MSTABORT_ENAB | WDMAC_MODE_PARITYERR_ENAB |
07624            WDMAC_MODE_ADDROFLOW_ENAB | WDMAC_MODE_FIFOOFLOW_ENAB |
07625            WDMAC_MODE_FIFOURUN_ENAB | WDMAC_MODE_FIFOOREAD_ENAB |
07626            WDMAC_MODE_LNGREAD_ENAB);
07627 
07628     /* If statement applies to 5705 and 5750 PCI devices only */
07629     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705 &&
07630          tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5705_A0) ||
07631         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5750) {
07632         if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE) &&
07633             (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5705_A1 ||
07634              tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5705_A2)) {
07635             /* nothing */
07636         } else if (!(tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE) & PCISTATE_BUS_SPEED_HIGH) &&
07637                !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_5788) &&
07638                !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS)) {
07639             val |= WDMAC_MODE_RX_ACCEL;
07640         }
07641     }
07642 
07643     /* Enable host coalescing bug fix */
07644     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS)
07645         val |= WDMAC_MODE_STATUS_TAG_FIX;
07646 
07647     tw32_f(WDMAC_MODE, val);
07648     udelay(40);
07649 
07650     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) {
07651         u16 pcix_cmd;
07652 
07653         pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, tp->pcix_cap + PCI_X_CMD,
07654                      &pcix_cmd);
07655         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703) {
07656             pcix_cmd &= ~PCI_X_CMD_MAX_READ;
07657             pcix_cmd |= PCI_X_CMD_READ_2K;
07658         } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) {
07659             pcix_cmd &= ~(PCI_X_CMD_MAX_SPLIT | PCI_X_CMD_MAX_READ);
07660             pcix_cmd |= PCI_X_CMD_READ_2K;
07661         }
07662         pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, tp->pcix_cap + PCI_X_CMD,
07663                       pcix_cmd);
07664     }
07665 
07666     tw32_f(RDMAC_MODE, rdmac_mode);
07667     udelay(40);
07668 
07669     tw32(RCVDCC_MODE, RCVDCC_MODE_ENABLE | RCVDCC_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE);
07670     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
07671         tw32(MBFREE_MODE, MBFREE_MODE_ENABLE);
07672 
07673     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761)
07674         tw32(SNDDATAC_MODE,
07675              SNDDATAC_MODE_ENABLE | SNDDATAC_MODE_CDELAY);
07676     else
07677         tw32(SNDDATAC_MODE, SNDDATAC_MODE_ENABLE);
07678 
07679     tw32(SNDBDC_MODE, SNDBDC_MODE_ENABLE | SNDBDC_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE);
07680     tw32(RCVBDI_MODE, RCVBDI_MODE_ENABLE | RCVBDI_MODE_RCB_ATTN_ENAB);
07681     tw32(RCVDBDI_MODE, RCVDBDI_MODE_ENABLE | RCVDBDI_MODE_INV_RING_SZ);
07682     tw32(SNDDATAI_MODE, SNDDATAI_MODE_ENABLE);
07683     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO)
07684         tw32(SNDDATAI_MODE, SNDDATAI_MODE_ENABLE | 0x8);
07685     val = SNDBDI_MODE_ENABLE | SNDBDI_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE;
07686     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX)
07687         val |= SNDBDI_MODE_MULTI_TXQ_EN;
07688     tw32(SNDBDI_MODE, val);
07689     tw32(SNDBDS_MODE, SNDBDS_MODE_ENABLE | SNDBDS_MODE_ATTN_ENABLE);
07690 
07691     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_A0) {
07692         err = tg3_load_5701_a0_firmware_fix(tp);
07693         if (err)
07694             return err;
07695     }
07696 
07697     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE) {
07698         err = tg3_load_tso_firmware(tp);
07699         if (err)
07700             return err;
07701     }
07702 
07703     tp->tx_mode = TX_MODE_ENABLE;
07704     tw32_f(MAC_TX_MODE, tp->tx_mode);
07705     udelay(100);
07706 
07707     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_RSS) {
07708         u32 reg = MAC_RSS_INDIR_TBL_0;
07709         u8 *ent = (u8 *)&val;
07710 
07711         /* Setup the indirection table */
07712         for (i = 0; i < TG3_RSS_INDIR_TBL_SIZE; i++) {
07713             int idx = i % sizeof(val);
07714 
07715             ent[idx] = i % (tp->irq_cnt - 1);
07716             if (idx == sizeof(val) - 1) {
07717                 tw32(reg, val);
07718                 reg += 4;
07719             }
07720         }
07721 
07722         /* Setup the "secret" hash key. */
07723         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_0, 0x5f865437);
07724         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_1, 0xe4ac62cc);
07725         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_2, 0x50103a45);
07726         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_3, 0x36621985);
07727         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_4, 0xbf14c0e8);
07728         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_5, 0x1bc27a1e);
07729         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_6, 0x84f4b556);
07730         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_7, 0x094ea6fe);
07731         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_8, 0x7dda01e7);
07732         tw32(MAC_RSS_HASH_KEY_9, 0xc04d7481);
07733     }
07734 
07735     tp->rx_mode = RX_MODE_ENABLE;
07736     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS)
07737         tp->rx_mode |= RX_MODE_IPV6_CSUM_ENABLE;
07738 
07739     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_RSS)
07740         tp->rx_mode |= RX_MODE_RSS_ENABLE |
07741                    RX_MODE_RSS_ITBL_HASH_BITS_7 |
07742                    RX_MODE_RSS_IPV6_HASH_EN |
07743                    RX_MODE_RSS_TCP_IPV6_HASH_EN |
07744                    RX_MODE_RSS_IPV4_HASH_EN |
07745                    RX_MODE_RSS_TCP_IPV4_HASH_EN;
07746 
07747     tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, tp->rx_mode);
07748     udelay(10);
07749 
07750     tw32(MAC_LED_CTRL, tp->led_ctrl);
07751 
07752     tw32(MAC_MI_STAT, MAC_MI_STAT_LNKSTAT_ATTN_ENAB);
07753     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) {
07754         tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, RX_MODE_RESET);
07755         udelay(10);
07756     }
07757     tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, tp->rx_mode);
07758     udelay(10);
07759 
07760     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) {
07761         if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) &&
07762             !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_SERDES_PREEMPHASIS)) {
07763             /* Set drive transmission level to 1.2V  */
07764             /* only if the signal pre-emphasis bit is not set  */
07765             val = tr32(MAC_SERDES_CFG);
07766             val &= 0xfffff000;
07767             val |= 0x880;
07768             tw32(MAC_SERDES_CFG, val);
07769         }
07770         if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5703_A1)
07771             tw32(MAC_SERDES_CFG, 0x616000);
07772     }
07773 
07774     /* Prevent chip from dropping frames when flow control
07775      * is enabled.
07776      */
07777     tw32_f(MAC_LOW_WMARK_MAX_RX_FRAME, 2);
07778 
07779     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704 &&
07780         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES)) {
07781         /* Use hardware link auto-negotiation */
07782         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_HW_AUTONEG;
07783     }
07784 
07785     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES) &&
07786         (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5714)) {
07787         u32 tmp;
07788 
07789         tmp = tr32(SERDES_RX_CTRL);
07790         tw32(SERDES_RX_CTRL, tmp | SERDES_RX_SIG_DETECT);
07791         tp->grc_local_ctrl &= ~GRC_LCLCTRL_USE_EXT_SIG_DETECT;
07792         tp->grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_USE_SIG_DETECT;
07793         tw32(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl);
07794     }
07795 
07796     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB)) {
07797         if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power) {
07798             tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power = 0;
07799             tp->link_config.speed = tp->link_config.orig_speed;
07800             tp->link_config.duplex = tp->link_config.orig_duplex;
07801             tp->link_config.autoneg = tp->link_config.orig_autoneg;
07802         }
07803 
07804         err = tg3_setup_phy(tp, 0);
07805         if (err)
07806             return err;
07807 
07808         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) &&
07809             !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET)) {
07810             u32 tmp;
07811 
07812             /* Clear CRC stats. */
07813             if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_TEST1, &tmp)) {
07814                 tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_TEST1,
07815                          tmp | MII_TG3_TEST1_CRC_EN);
07816                 tg3_readphy(tp, 0x14, &tmp);
07817             }
07818         }
07819     }
07820 
07821     __tg3_set_rx_mode(tp->dev);
07822 
07823     /* Initialize receive rules. */
07824     tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_0,  0xc2000000 & RCV_RULE_DISABLE_MASK);
07825     tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_0, 0xffffffff & RCV_RULE_DISABLE_MASK);
07826     tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_1,  0x86000004 & RCV_RULE_DISABLE_MASK);
07827     tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_1, 0xffffffff & RCV_RULE_DISABLE_MASK);
07828 
07829     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) &&
07830         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS))
07831         limit = 8;
07832     else
07833         limit = 16;
07834     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF)
07835         limit -= 4;
07836     switch (limit) {
07837     case 16:
07838         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_15,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_15,  0);
07839     case 15:
07840         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_14,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_14,  0);
07841     case 14:
07842         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_13,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_13,  0);
07843     case 13:
07844         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_12,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_12,  0);
07845     case 12:
07846         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_11,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_11,  0);
07847     case 11:
07848         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_10,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_10,  0);
07849     case 10:
07850         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_9,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_9,  0);
07851     case 9:
07852         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_8,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_8,  0);
07853     case 8:
07854         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_7,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_7,  0);
07855     case 7:
07856         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_6,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_6,  0);
07857     case 6:
07858         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_5,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_5,  0);
07859     case 5:
07860         tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_4,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_4,  0);
07861     case 4:
07862         /* tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_3,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_3,  0); */
07863     case 3:
07864         /* tw32(MAC_RCV_RULE_2,  0); tw32(MAC_RCV_VALUE_2,  0); */
07865     case 2:
07866     case 1:
07867 
07868     default:
07869         break;
07870     }
07871 
07872     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)
07873         /* Write our heartbeat update interval to APE. */
07874         tg3_ape_write32(tp, TG3_APE_HOST_HEARTBEAT_INT_MS,
07875                 APE_HOST_HEARTBEAT_INT_DISABLE);
07876 
07877     tg3_write_sig_post_reset(tp, RESET_KIND_INIT);
07878 
07879     return 0;
07880 }
07881 
07882 /* Called at device open time to get the chip ready for
07883  * packet processing.  Invoked with tp->lock held.
07884  */
07885 static int tg3_init_hw(struct tg3 *tp, int reset_phy)
07886 {
07887     tg3_switch_clocks(tp);
07888 
07889     tw32(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
07890 
07891     return tg3_reset_hw(tp, reset_phy);
07892 }
07893 
07894 #define TG3_STAT_ADD32(PSTAT, REG) \
07895 do {    u32 __val = tr32(REG); \
07896     (PSTAT)->low += __val; \
07897     if ((PSTAT)->low < __val) \
07898         (PSTAT)->high += 1; \
07899 } while (0)
07900 
07901 static void tg3_periodic_fetch_stats(struct tg3 *tp)
07902 {
07903     struct tg3_hw_stats *sp = tp->hw_stats;
07904 
07905     if (!netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev))
07906         return;
07907 
07908     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_octets, MAC_TX_STATS_OCTETS);
07909     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_collisions, MAC_TX_STATS_COLLISIONS);
07910     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_xon_sent, MAC_TX_STATS_XON_SENT);
07911     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_xoff_sent, MAC_TX_STATS_XOFF_SENT);
07912     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_mac_errors, MAC_TX_STATS_MAC_ERRORS);
07913     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_single_collisions, MAC_TX_STATS_SINGLE_COLLISIONS);
07914     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_mult_collisions, MAC_TX_STATS_MULT_COLLISIONS);
07915     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_deferred, MAC_TX_STATS_DEFERRED);
07916     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_excessive_collisions, MAC_TX_STATS_EXCESSIVE_COL);
07917     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_late_collisions, MAC_TX_STATS_LATE_COL);
07918     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_ucast_packets, MAC_TX_STATS_UCAST);
07919     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_mcast_packets, MAC_TX_STATS_MCAST);
07920     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->tx_bcast_packets, MAC_TX_STATS_BCAST);
07921 
07922     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_octets, MAC_RX_STATS_OCTETS);
07923     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_fragments, MAC_RX_STATS_FRAGMENTS);
07924     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_ucast_packets, MAC_RX_STATS_UCAST);
07925     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_mcast_packets, MAC_RX_STATS_MCAST);
07926     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_bcast_packets, MAC_RX_STATS_BCAST);
07927     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_fcs_errors, MAC_RX_STATS_FCS_ERRORS);
07928     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_align_errors, MAC_RX_STATS_ALIGN_ERRORS);
07929     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_xon_pause_rcvd, MAC_RX_STATS_XON_PAUSE_RECVD);
07930     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_xoff_pause_rcvd, MAC_RX_STATS_XOFF_PAUSE_RECVD);
07931     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_mac_ctrl_rcvd, MAC_RX_STATS_MAC_CTRL_RECVD);
07932     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_xoff_entered, MAC_RX_STATS_XOFF_ENTERED);
07933     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_frame_too_long_errors, MAC_RX_STATS_FRAME_TOO_LONG);
07934     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_jabbers, MAC_RX_STATS_JABBERS);
07935     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_undersize_packets, MAC_RX_STATS_UNDERSIZE);
07936 
07937     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rxbds_empty, RCVLPC_NO_RCV_BD_CNT);
07938     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_discards, RCVLPC_IN_DISCARDS_CNT);
07939     TG3_STAT_ADD32(&sp->rx_errors, RCVLPC_IN_ERRORS_CNT);
07940 }
07941 
07942 static void tg3_timer(unsigned long __opaque)
07943 {
07944     struct tg3 *tp = (struct tg3 *) __opaque;
07945 
07946     if (tp->irq_sync)
07947         goto restart_timer;
07948 
07949     spin_lock(&tp->lock);
07950 
07951     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS)) {
07952         /* All of this garbage is because when using non-tagged
07953          * IRQ status the mailbox/status_block protocol the chip
07954          * uses with the cpu is race prone.
07955          */
07956         if (tp->napi[0].hw_status->status & SD_STATUS_UPDATED) {
07957             tw32(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL,
07958                  tp->grc_local_ctrl | GRC_LCLCTRL_SETINT);
07959         } else {
07960             tw32(HOSTCC_MODE, tp->coalesce_mode |
07961                  HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE | HOSTCC_MODE_NOW);
07962         }
07963 
07964         if (!(tr32(WDMAC_MODE) & WDMAC_MODE_ENABLE)) {
07965             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_RESTART_TIMER;
07966             spin_unlock(&tp->lock);
07967             schedule_work(&tp->reset_task);
07968             return;
07969         }
07970     }
07971 
07972     /* This part only runs once per second. */
07973     if (!--tp->timer_counter) {
07974         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)
07975             tg3_periodic_fetch_stats(tp);
07976 
07977         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG) {
07978             u32 mac_stat;
07979             int phy_event;
07980 
07981             mac_stat = tr32(MAC_STATUS);
07982 
07983             phy_event = 0;
07984             if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_USE_MI_INTERRUPT) {
07985                 if (mac_stat & MAC_STATUS_MI_INTERRUPT)
07986                     phy_event = 1;
07987             } else if (mac_stat & MAC_STATUS_LNKSTATE_CHANGED)
07988                 phy_event = 1;
07989 
07990             if (phy_event)
07991                 tg3_setup_phy(tp, 0);
07992         } else if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_POLL_SERDES) {
07993             u32 mac_stat = tr32(MAC_STATUS);
07994             int need_setup = 0;
07995 
07996             if (netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev) &&
07997                 (mac_stat & MAC_STATUS_LNKSTATE_CHANGED)) {
07998                 need_setup = 1;
07999             }
08000             if (! netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev) &&
08001                 (mac_stat & (MAC_STATUS_PCS_SYNCED |
08002                      MAC_STATUS_SIGNAL_DET))) {
08003                 need_setup = 1;
08004             }
08005             if (need_setup) {
08006                 if (!tp->serdes_counter) {
08007                     tw32_f(MAC_MODE,
08008                          (tp->mac_mode &
08009                           ~MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MASK));
08010                     udelay(40);
08011                     tw32_f(MAC_MODE, tp->mac_mode);
08012                     udelay(40);
08013                 }
08014                 tg3_setup_phy(tp, 0);
08015             }
08016         } else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES)
08017             tg3_serdes_parallel_detect(tp);
08018 
08019         tp->timer_counter = tp->timer_multiplier;
08020     }
08021 
08022     /* Heartbeat is only sent once every 2 seconds.
08023      *
08024      * The heartbeat is to tell the ASF firmware that the host
08025      * driver is still alive.  In the event that the OS crashes,
08026      * ASF needs to reset the hardware to free up the FIFO space
08027      * that may be filled with rx packets destined for the host.
08028      * If the FIFO is full, ASF will no longer function properly.
08029      *
08030      * Unintended resets have been reported on real time kernels
08031      * where the timer doesn't run on time.  Netpoll will also have
08032      * same problem.
08033      *
08034      * The new FWCMD_NICDRV_ALIVE3 command tells the ASF firmware
08035      * to check the ring condition when the heartbeat is expiring
08036      * before doing the reset.  This will prevent most unintended
08037      * resets.
08038      */
08039     if (!--tp->asf_counter) {
08040         if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) &&
08041             !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)) {
08042             tg3_wait_for_event_ack(tp);
08043 
08044             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_MBOX,
08045                       FWCMD_NICDRV_ALIVE3);
08046             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_LEN_MBOX, 4);
08047             /* 5 seconds timeout */
08048             tg3_write_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_FW_CMD_DATA_MBOX, 5);
08049 
08050             tg3_generate_fw_event(tp);
08051         }
08052         tp->asf_counter = tp->asf_multiplier;
08053     }
08054 
08055     spin_unlock(&tp->lock);
08056 
08057 restart_timer:
08058     tp->timer.expires = jiffies + tp->timer_offset;
08059     add_timer(&tp->timer);
08060 }
08061 
08062 static int tg3_request_irq(struct tg3 *tp, int irq_num)
08063 {
08064     irq_handler_t fn;
08065     unsigned long flags;
08066     char *name;
08067     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[irq_num];
08068 
08069     if (tp->irq_cnt == 1)
08070         name = tp->dev->name;
08071     else {
08072         name = &tnapi->irq_lbl[0];
08073         snprintf(name, IFNAMSIZ, "%s-%d", tp->dev->name, irq_num);
08074         name[IFNAMSIZ-1] = 0;
08075     }
08076 
08077     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI_OR_MSIX) {
08078         fn = tg3_msi;
08079         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_1SHOT_MSI)
08080             fn = tg3_msi_1shot;
08081         flags = IRQF_SAMPLE_RANDOM;
08082     } else {
08083         fn = tg3_interrupt;
08084         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS)
08085             fn = tg3_interrupt_tagged;
08086         flags = IRQF_SHARED | IRQF_SAMPLE_RANDOM;
08087     }
08088 
08089     return request_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, fn, flags, name, tnapi);
08090 }
08091 
08092 static int tg3_test_interrupt(struct tg3 *tp)
08093 {
08094     struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[0];
08095     struct net_device *dev = tp->dev;
08096     int err, i, intr_ok = 0;
08097     u32 val;
08098 
08099     if (!netif_running(dev))
08100         return -ENODEV;
08101 
08102     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
08103 
08104     free_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, tnapi);
08105 
08106     /*
08107      * Turn off MSI one shot mode.  Otherwise this test has no
08108      * observable way to know whether the interrupt was delivered.
08109      */
08110     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717 &&
08111         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI)) {
08112         val = tr32(MSGINT_MODE) | MSGINT_MODE_ONE_SHOT_DISABLE;
08113         tw32(MSGINT_MODE, val);
08114     }
08115 
08116     err = request_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, tg3_test_isr,
08117               IRQF_SHARED | IRQF_SAMPLE_RANDOM, dev->name, tnapi);
08118     if (err)
08119         return err;
08120 
08121     tnapi->hw_status->status &= ~SD_STATUS_UPDATED;
08122     tg3_enable_ints(tp);
08123 
08124     tw32_f(HOSTCC_MODE, tp->coalesce_mode | HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE |
08125            tnapi->coal_now);
08126 
08127     for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
08128         u32 int_mbox, misc_host_ctrl;
08129 
08130         int_mbox = tr32_mailbox(tnapi->int_mbox);
08131         misc_host_ctrl = tr32(TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL);
08132 
08133         if ((int_mbox != 0) ||
08134             (misc_host_ctrl & MISC_HOST_CTRL_MASK_PCI_INT)) {
08135             intr_ok = 1;
08136             break;
08137         }
08138 
08139         msleep(10);
08140     }
08141 
08142     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
08143 
08144     free_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, tnapi);
08145 
08146     err = tg3_request_irq(tp, 0);
08147 
08148     if (err)
08149         return err;
08150 
08151     if (intr_ok) {
08152         /* Reenable MSI one shot mode. */
08153         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717 &&
08154             (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI)) {
08155             val = tr32(MSGINT_MODE) & ~MSGINT_MODE_ONE_SHOT_DISABLE;
08156             tw32(MSGINT_MODE, val);
08157         }
08158         return 0;
08159     }
08160 
08161     return -EIO;
08162 }
08163 
08164 /* Returns 0 if MSI test succeeds or MSI test fails and INTx mode is
08165  * successfully restored
08166  */
08167 static int tg3_test_msi(struct tg3 *tp)
08168 {
08169     int err;
08170     u16 pci_cmd;
08171 
08172     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI))
08173         return 0;
08174 
08175     /* Turn off SERR reporting in case MSI terminates with Master
08176      * Abort.
08177      */
08178     pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &pci_cmd);
08179     pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND,
08180                   pci_cmd & ~PCI_COMMAND_SERR);
08181 
08182     err = tg3_test_interrupt(tp);
08183 
08184     pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, pci_cmd);
08185 
08186     if (!err)
08187         return 0;
08188 
08189     /* other failures */
08190     if (err != -EIO)
08191         return err;
08192 
08193     /* MSI test failed, go back to INTx mode */
08194     printk(KERN_WARNING PFX "%s: No interrupt was generated using MSI, "
08195            "switching to INTx mode. Please report this failure to "
08196            "the PCI maintainer and include system chipset information.\n",
08197                tp->dev->name);
08198 
08199     free_irq(tp->napi[0].irq_vec, &tp->napi[0]);
08200 
08201     pci_disable_msi(tp->pdev);
08202 
08203     tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI;
08204 
08205     err = tg3_request_irq(tp, 0);
08206     if (err)
08207         return err;
08208 
08209     /* Need to reset the chip because the MSI cycle may have terminated
08210      * with Master Abort.
08211      */
08212     tg3_full_lock(tp, 1);
08213 
08214     tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
08215     err = tg3_init_hw(tp, 1);
08216 
08217     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
08218 
08219     if (err)
08220         free_irq(tp->napi[0].irq_vec, &tp->napi[0]);
08221 
08222     return err;
08223 }
08224 
08225 static int tg3_request_firmware(struct tg3 *tp)
08226 {
08227     const __be32 *fw_data;
08228 
08229     if (request_firmware(&tp->fw, tp->fw_needed, &tp->pdev->dev)) {
08230         printk(KERN_ERR "%s: Failed to load firmware \"%s\"\n",
08231                tp->dev->name, tp->fw_needed);
08232         return -ENOENT;
08233     }
08234 
08235     fw_data = (void *)tp->fw->data;
08236 
08237     /* Firmware blob starts with version numbers, followed by
08238      * start address and _full_ length including BSS sections
08239      * (which must be longer than the actual data, of course
08240      */
08241 
08242     tp->fw_len = be32_to_cpu(fw_data[2]);   /* includes bss */
08243     if (tp->fw_len < (tp->fw->size - 12)) {
08244         printk(KERN_ERR "%s: bogus length %d in \"%s\"\n",
08245                tp->dev->name, tp->fw_len, tp->fw_needed);
08246         release_firmware(tp->fw);
08247         tp->fw = NULL;
08248         return -EINVAL;
08249     }
08250 
08251     /* We no longer need firmware; we have it. */
08252     tp->fw_needed = NULL;
08253     return 0;
08254 }
08255 
08256 static bool tg3_enable_msix(struct tg3 *tp)
08257 {
08258     int i, rc, cpus = num_online_cpus();
08259     struct msix_entry msix_ent[tp->irq_max];
08260 
08261     if (cpus == 1)
08262         /* Just fallback to the simpler MSI mode. */
08263         return false;
08264 
08265     /*
08266      * We want as many rx rings enabled as there are cpus.
08267      * The first MSIX vector only deals with link interrupts, etc,
08268      * so we add one to the number of vectors we are requesting.
08269      */
08270     tp->irq_cnt = min_t(unsigned, cpus + 1, tp->irq_max);
08271 
08272     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_max; i++) {
08273         msix_ent[i].entry  = i;
08274         msix_ent[i].vector = 0;
08275     }
08276 
08277     rc = pci_enable_msix(tp->pdev, msix_ent, tp->irq_cnt);
08278     if (rc != 0) {
08279         if (rc < TG3_RSS_MIN_NUM_MSIX_VECS)
08280             return false;
08281         if (pci_enable_msix(tp->pdev, msix_ent, rc))
08282             return false;
08283         printk(KERN_NOTICE
08284                "%s: Requested %d MSI-X vectors, received %d\n",
08285                tp->dev->name, tp->irq_cnt, rc);
08286         tp->irq_cnt = rc;
08287     }
08288 
08289     tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_RSS;
08290 
08291     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_max; i++)
08292         tp->napi[i].irq_vec = msix_ent[i].vector;
08293 
08294     tp->dev->real_num_tx_queues = tp->irq_cnt - 1;
08295 
08296     return true;
08297 }
08298 
08299 static void tg3_ints_init(struct tg3 *tp)
08300 {
08301     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSI_OR_MSIX) &&
08302         !(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS)) {
08303         /* All MSI supporting chips should support tagged
08304          * status.  Assert that this is the case.
08305          */
08306         printk(KERN_WARNING PFX "%s: MSI without TAGGED? "
08307                "Not using MSI.\n", tp->dev->name);
08308         goto defcfg;
08309     }
08310 
08311     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSIX) && tg3_enable_msix(tp))
08312         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX;
08313     else if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSI) &&
08314          pci_enable_msi(tp->pdev) == 0)
08315         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI;
08316 
08317     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI_OR_MSIX) {
08318         u32 msi_mode = tr32(MSGINT_MODE);
08319         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX)
08320             msi_mode |= MSGINT_MODE_MULTIVEC_EN;
08321         tw32(MSGINT_MODE, msi_mode | MSGINT_MODE_ENABLE);
08322     }
08323 defcfg:
08324     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX)) {
08325         tp->irq_cnt = 1;
08326         tp->napi[0].irq_vec = tp->pdev->irq;
08327         tp->dev->real_num_tx_queues = 1;
08328     }
08329 }
08330 
08331 static void tg3_ints_fini(struct tg3 *tp)
08332 {
08333     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSIX)
08334         pci_disable_msix(tp->pdev);
08335     else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI)
08336         pci_disable_msi(tp->pdev);
08337     tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI_OR_MSIX;
08338     tp->tg3_flags3 &= ~TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_RSS;
08339 }
08340 
08341 static int tg3_open(struct net_device *dev)
08342 {
08343     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
08344     int i, err;
08345 
08346     if (tp->fw_needed) {
08347         err = tg3_request_firmware(tp);
08348         if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_A0) {
08349             if (err)
08350                 return err;
08351         } else if (err) {
08352             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: TSO capability disabled.\n",
08353                    tp->dev->name);
08354             tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE;
08355         } else if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE)) {
08356             printk(KERN_NOTICE "%s: TSO capability restored.\n",
08357                    tp->dev->name);
08358             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE;
08359         }
08360     }
08361 
08362     netif_carrier_off(tp->dev);
08363 
08364     err = tg3_set_power_state(tp, PCI_D0);
08365     if (err)
08366         return err;
08367 
08368     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
08369 
08370     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
08371     tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
08372 
08373     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
08374 
08375     /*
08376      * Setup interrupts first so we know how
08377      * many NAPI resources to allocate
08378      */
08379     tg3_ints_init(tp);
08380 
08381     /* The placement of this call is tied
08382      * to the setup and use of Host TX descriptors.
08383      */
08384     err = tg3_alloc_consistent(tp);
08385     if (err)
08386         goto err_out1;
08387 
08388     tg3_napi_enable(tp);
08389 
08390     for (i = 0; i < tp->irq_cnt; i++) {
08391         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
08392         err = tg3_request_irq(tp, i);
08393         if (err) {
08394             for (i--; i >= 0; i--)
08395                 free_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, tnapi);
08396             break;
08397         }
08398     }
08399 
08400     if (err)
08401         goto err_out2;
08402 
08403     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
08404 
08405     err = tg3_init_hw(tp, 1);
08406     if (err) {
08407         tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
08408         tg3_free_rings(tp);
08409     } else {
08410         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS)
08411             tp->timer_offset = HZ;
08412         else
08413             tp->timer_offset = HZ / 10;
08414 
08415         BUG_ON(tp->timer_offset > HZ);
08416         tp->timer_counter = tp->timer_multiplier =
08417             (HZ / tp->timer_offset);
08418         tp->asf_counter = tp->asf_multiplier =
08419             ((HZ / tp->timer_offset) * 2);
08420 
08421         init_timer(&tp->timer);
08422         tp->timer.expires = jiffies + tp->timer_offset;
08423         tp->timer.data = (unsigned long) tp;
08424         tp->timer.function = tg3_timer;
08425     }
08426 
08427     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
08428 
08429     if (err)
08430         goto err_out3;
08431 
08432     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI) {
08433         err = tg3_test_msi(tp);
08434 
08435         if (err) {
08436             tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
08437             tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
08438             tg3_free_rings(tp);
08439             tg3_full_unlock(tp);
08440 
08441             goto err_out2;
08442         }
08443 
08444         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5717 &&
08445             (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_USING_MSI) &&
08446             (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_1SHOT_MSI)) {
08447             u32 val = tr32(PCIE_TRANSACTION_CFG);
08448 
08449             tw32(PCIE_TRANSACTION_CFG,
08450                  val | PCIE_TRANS_CFG_1SHOT_MSI);
08451         }
08452     }
08453 
08454     tg3_phy_start(tp);
08455 
08456     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
08457 
08458     add_timer(&tp->timer);
08459     tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
08460     tg3_enable_ints(tp);
08461 
08462     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
08463 
08464     netif_tx_start_all_queues(dev);
08465 
08466     return 0;
08467 
08468 err_out3:
08469     for (i = tp->irq_cnt - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
08470         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
08471         free_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, tnapi);
08472     }
08473 
08474 err_out2:
08475     tg3_napi_disable(tp);
08476     tg3_free_consistent(tp);
08477 
08478 err_out1:
08479     tg3_ints_fini(tp);
08480     return err;
08481 }
08482 
08483 #if 0
08484 /*static*/ void tg3_dump_state(struct tg3 *tp)
08485 {
08486     u32 val32, val32_2, val32_3, val32_4, val32_5;
08487     u16 val16;
08488     int i;
08489     struct tg3_hw_status *sblk = tp->napi[0]->hw_status;
08490 
08491     pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_STATUS, &val16);
08492     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PCISTATE, &val32);
08493     printk("DEBUG: PCI status [%04x] TG3PCI state[%08x]\n",
08494            val16, val32);
08495 
08496     /* MAC block */
08497     printk("DEBUG: MAC_MODE[%08x] MAC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08498            tr32(MAC_MODE), tr32(MAC_STATUS));
08499     printk("       MAC_EVENT[%08x] MAC_LED_CTRL[%08x]\n",
08500            tr32(MAC_EVENT), tr32(MAC_LED_CTRL));
08501     printk("DEBUG: MAC_TX_MODE[%08x] MAC_TX_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08502            tr32(MAC_TX_MODE), tr32(MAC_TX_STATUS));
08503     printk("       MAC_RX_MODE[%08x] MAC_RX_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08504            tr32(MAC_RX_MODE), tr32(MAC_RX_STATUS));
08505 
08506     /* Send data initiator control block */
08507     printk("DEBUG: SNDDATAI_MODE[%08x] SNDDATAI_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08508            tr32(SNDDATAI_MODE), tr32(SNDDATAI_STATUS));
08509     printk("       SNDDATAI_STATSCTRL[%08x]\n",
08510            tr32(SNDDATAI_STATSCTRL));
08511 
08512     /* Send data completion control block */
08513     printk("DEBUG: SNDDATAC_MODE[%08x]\n", tr32(SNDDATAC_MODE));
08514 
08515     /* Send BD ring selector block */
08516     printk("DEBUG: SNDBDS_MODE[%08x] SNDBDS_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08517            tr32(SNDBDS_MODE), tr32(SNDBDS_STATUS));
08518 
08519     /* Send BD initiator control block */
08520     printk("DEBUG: SNDBDI_MODE[%08x] SNDBDI_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08521            tr32(SNDBDI_MODE), tr32(SNDBDI_STATUS));
08522 
08523     /* Send BD completion control block */
08524     printk("DEBUG: SNDBDC_MODE[%08x]\n", tr32(SNDBDC_MODE));
08525 
08526     /* Receive list placement control block */
08527     printk("DEBUG: RCVLPC_MODE[%08x] RCVLPC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08528            tr32(RCVLPC_MODE), tr32(RCVLPC_STATUS));
08529     printk("       RCVLPC_STATSCTRL[%08x]\n",
08530            tr32(RCVLPC_STATSCTRL));
08531 
08532     /* Receive data and receive BD initiator control block */
08533     printk("DEBUG: RCVDBDI_MODE[%08x] RCVDBDI_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08534            tr32(RCVDBDI_MODE), tr32(RCVDBDI_STATUS));
08535 
08536     /* Receive data completion control block */
08537     printk("DEBUG: RCVDCC_MODE[%08x]\n",
08538            tr32(RCVDCC_MODE));
08539 
08540     /* Receive BD initiator control block */
08541     printk("DEBUG: RCVBDI_MODE[%08x] RCVBDI_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08542            tr32(RCVBDI_MODE), tr32(RCVBDI_STATUS));
08543 
08544     /* Receive BD completion control block */
08545     printk("DEBUG: RCVCC_MODE[%08x] RCVCC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08546            tr32(RCVCC_MODE), tr32(RCVCC_STATUS));
08547 
08548     /* Receive list selector control block */
08549     printk("DEBUG: RCVLSC_MODE[%08x] RCVLSC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08550            tr32(RCVLSC_MODE), tr32(RCVLSC_STATUS));
08551 
08552     /* Mbuf cluster free block */
08553     printk("DEBUG: MBFREE_MODE[%08x] MBFREE_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08554            tr32(MBFREE_MODE), tr32(MBFREE_STATUS));
08555 
08556     /* Host coalescing control block */
08557     printk("DEBUG: HOSTCC_MODE[%08x] HOSTCC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08558            tr32(HOSTCC_MODE), tr32(HOSTCC_STATUS));
08559     printk("DEBUG: HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR[%08x%08x]\n",
08560            tr32(HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH),
08561            tr32(HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW));
08562     printk("DEBUG: HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR[%08x%08x]\n",
08563            tr32(HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_HIGH),
08564            tr32(HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW));
08565     printk("DEBUG: HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_NIC_ADDR[%08x]\n",
08566            tr32(HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_NIC_ADDR));
08567     printk("DEBUG: HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_NIC_ADDR[%08x]\n",
08568            tr32(HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_NIC_ADDR));
08569 
08570     /* Memory arbiter control block */
08571     printk("DEBUG: MEMARB_MODE[%08x] MEMARB_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08572            tr32(MEMARB_MODE), tr32(MEMARB_STATUS));
08573 
08574     /* Buffer manager control block */
08575     printk("DEBUG: BUFMGR_MODE[%08x] BUFMGR_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08576            tr32(BUFMGR_MODE), tr32(BUFMGR_STATUS));
08577     printk("DEBUG: BUFMGR_MB_POOL_ADDR[%08x] BUFMGR_MB_POOL_SIZE[%08x]\n",
08578            tr32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_ADDR), tr32(BUFMGR_MB_POOL_SIZE));
08579     printk("DEBUG: BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_ADDR[%08x] "
08580            "BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_SIZE[%08x]\n",
08581            tr32(BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_ADDR),
08582            tr32(BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_SIZE));
08583 
08584     /* Read DMA control block */
08585     printk("DEBUG: RDMAC_MODE[%08x] RDMAC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08586            tr32(RDMAC_MODE), tr32(RDMAC_STATUS));
08587 
08588     /* Write DMA control block */
08589     printk("DEBUG: WDMAC_MODE[%08x] WDMAC_STATUS[%08x]\n",
08590            tr32(WDMAC_MODE), tr32(WDMAC_STATUS));
08591 
08592     /* DMA completion block */
08593     printk("DEBUG: DMAC_MODE[%08x]\n",
08594            tr32(DMAC_MODE));
08595 
08596     /* GRC block */
08597     printk("DEBUG: GRC_MODE[%08x] GRC_MISC_CFG[%08x]\n",
08598            tr32(GRC_MODE), tr32(GRC_MISC_CFG));
08599     printk("DEBUG: GRC_LOCAL_CTRL[%08x]\n",
08600            tr32(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL));
08601 
08602     /* TG3_BDINFOs */
08603     printk("DEBUG: RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD[%08x%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08604            tr32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + 0x0),
08605            tr32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + 0x4),
08606            tr32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + 0x8),
08607            tr32(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD + 0xc));
08608     printk("DEBUG: RCVDBDI_STD_BD[%08x%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08609            tr32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + 0x0),
08610            tr32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + 0x4),
08611            tr32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + 0x8),
08612            tr32(RCVDBDI_STD_BD + 0xc));
08613     printk("DEBUG: RCVDBDI_MINI_BD[%08x%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08614            tr32(RCVDBDI_MINI_BD + 0x0),
08615            tr32(RCVDBDI_MINI_BD + 0x4),
08616            tr32(RCVDBDI_MINI_BD + 0x8),
08617            tr32(RCVDBDI_MINI_BD + 0xc));
08618 
08619     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + 0x0, &val32);
08620     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + 0x4, &val32_2);
08621     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + 0x8, &val32_3);
08622     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_SEND_RCB + 0xc, &val32_4);
08623     printk("DEBUG: SRAM_SEND_RCB_0[%08x%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08624            val32, val32_2, val32_3, val32_4);
08625 
08626     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + 0x0, &val32);
08627     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + 0x4, &val32_2);
08628     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + 0x8, &val32_3);
08629     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB + 0xc, &val32_4);
08630     printk("DEBUG: SRAM_RCV_RET_RCB_0[%08x%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08631            val32, val32_2, val32_3, val32_4);
08632 
08633     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK + 0x0, &val32);
08634     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK + 0x4, &val32_2);
08635     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK + 0x8, &val32_3);
08636     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK + 0xc, &val32_4);
08637     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_STATUS_BLK + 0x10, &val32_5);
08638     printk("DEBUG: SRAM_STATUS_BLK[%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08639            val32, val32_2, val32_3, val32_4, val32_5);
08640 
08641     /* SW status block */
08642     printk(KERN_DEBUG
08643      "Host status block [%08x:%08x:(%04x:%04x:%04x):(%04x:%04x)]\n",
08644            sblk->status,
08645            sblk->status_tag,
08646            sblk->rx_jumbo_consumer,
08647            sblk->rx_consumer,
08648            sblk->rx_mini_consumer,
08649            sblk->idx[0].rx_producer,
08650            sblk->idx[0].tx_consumer);
08651 
08652     /* SW statistics block */
08653     printk("DEBUG: Host statistics block [%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08654            ((u32 *)tp->hw_stats)[0],
08655            ((u32 *)tp->hw_stats)[1],
08656            ((u32 *)tp->hw_stats)[2],
08657            ((u32 *)tp->hw_stats)[3]);
08658 
08659     /* Mailboxes */
08660     printk("DEBUG: SNDHOST_PROD[%08x%08x] SNDNIC_PROD[%08x%08x]\n",
08661            tr32_mailbox(MAILBOX_SNDHOST_PROD_IDX_0 + 0x0),
08662            tr32_mailbox(MAILBOX_SNDHOST_PROD_IDX_0 + 0x4),
08663            tr32_mailbox(MAILBOX_SNDNIC_PROD_IDX_0 + 0x0),
08664            tr32_mailbox(MAILBOX_SNDNIC_PROD_IDX_0 + 0x4));
08665 
08666     /* NIC side send descriptors. */
08667     for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
08668         unsigned long txd;
08669 
08670         txd = tp->regs + NIC_SRAM_WIN_BASE + NIC_SRAM_TX_BUFFER_DESC
08671             + (i * sizeof(struct tg3_tx_buffer_desc));
08672         printk("DEBUG: NIC TXD(%d)[%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08673                i,
08674                readl(txd + 0x0), readl(txd + 0x4),
08675                readl(txd + 0x8), readl(txd + 0xc));
08676     }
08677 
08678     /* NIC side RX descriptors. */
08679     for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
08680         unsigned long rxd;
08681 
08682         rxd = tp->regs + NIC_SRAM_WIN_BASE + NIC_SRAM_RX_BUFFER_DESC
08683             + (i * sizeof(struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc));
08684         printk("DEBUG: NIC RXD_STD(%d)[0][%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08685                i,
08686                readl(rxd + 0x0), readl(rxd + 0x4),
08687                readl(rxd + 0x8), readl(rxd + 0xc));
08688         rxd += (4 * sizeof(u32));
08689         printk("DEBUG: NIC RXD_STD(%d)[1][%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08690                i,
08691                readl(rxd + 0x0), readl(rxd + 0x4),
08692                readl(rxd + 0x8), readl(rxd + 0xc));
08693     }
08694 
08695     for (i = 0; i < 6; i++) {
08696         unsigned long rxd;
08697 
08698         rxd = tp->regs + NIC_SRAM_WIN_BASE + NIC_SRAM_RX_JUMBO_BUFFER_DESC
08699             + (i * sizeof(struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc));
08700         printk("DEBUG: NIC RXD_JUMBO(%d)[0][%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08701                i,
08702                readl(rxd + 0x0), readl(rxd + 0x4),
08703                readl(rxd + 0x8), readl(rxd + 0xc));
08704         rxd += (4 * sizeof(u32));
08705         printk("DEBUG: NIC RXD_JUMBO(%d)[1][%08x:%08x:%08x:%08x]\n",
08706                i,
08707                readl(rxd + 0x0), readl(rxd + 0x4),
08708                readl(rxd + 0x8), readl(rxd + 0xc));
08709     }
08710 }
08711 #endif
08712 
08713 static struct net_device_stats *tg3_get_stats(struct net_device *);
08714 static struct tg3_ethtool_stats *tg3_get_estats(struct tg3 *);
08715 
08716 static int tg3_close(struct net_device *dev)
08717 {
08718     int i;
08719     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
08720 
08721     tg3_napi_disable(tp);
08722     cancel_work_sync(&tp->reset_task);
08723 
08724     netif_tx_stop_all_queues(dev);
08725 
08726     del_timer_sync(&tp->timer);
08727 
08728     tg3_phy_stop(tp);
08729 
08730     tg3_full_lock(tp, 1);
08731 #if 0
08732     tg3_dump_state(tp);
08733 #endif
08734 
08735     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
08736 
08737     tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
08738     tg3_free_rings(tp);
08739     tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
08740 
08741     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
08742 
08743     for (i = tp->irq_cnt - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
08744         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
08745         free_irq(tnapi->irq_vec, tnapi);
08746     }
08747 
08748     tg3_ints_fini(tp);
08749 
08750     memcpy(&tp->net_stats_prev, tg3_get_stats(tp->dev),
08751            sizeof(tp->net_stats_prev));
08752     memcpy(&tp->estats_prev, tg3_get_estats(tp),
08753            sizeof(tp->estats_prev));
08754 
08755     tg3_free_consistent(tp);
08756 
08757     tg3_set_power_state(tp, PCI_D3hot);
08758 
08759     netif_carrier_off(tp->dev);
08760 
08761     return 0;
08762 }
08763 
08764 static inline unsigned long get_stat64(tg3_stat64_t *val)
08765 {
08766     unsigned long ret;
08767 
08768 #if (BITS_PER_LONG == 32)
08769     ret = val->low;
08770 #else
08771     ret = ((u64)val->high << 32) | ((u64)val->low);
08772 #endif
08773     return ret;
08774 }
08775 
08776 static inline u64 get_estat64(tg3_stat64_t *val)
08777 {
08778        return ((u64)val->high << 32) | ((u64)val->low);
08779 }
08780 
08781 static unsigned long calc_crc_errors(struct tg3 *tp)
08782 {
08783     struct tg3_hw_stats *hw_stats = tp->hw_stats;
08784 
08785     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) &&
08786         (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
08787          GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701)) {
08788         u32 val;
08789 
08790         spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
08791         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_TG3_TEST1, &val)) {
08792             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_TEST1,
08793                      val | MII_TG3_TEST1_CRC_EN);
08794             tg3_readphy(tp, 0x14, &val);
08795         } else
08796             val = 0;
08797         spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
08798 
08799         tp->phy_crc_errors += val;
08800 
08801         return tp->phy_crc_errors;
08802     }
08803 
08804     return get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_fcs_errors);
08805 }
08806 
08807 #define ESTAT_ADD(member) \
08808     estats->member =    old_estats->member + \
08809                 get_estat64(&hw_stats->member)
08810 
08811 static struct tg3_ethtool_stats *tg3_get_estats(struct tg3 *tp)
08812 {
08813     struct tg3_ethtool_stats *estats = &tp->estats;
08814     struct tg3_ethtool_stats *old_estats = &tp->estats_prev;
08815     struct tg3_hw_stats *hw_stats = tp->hw_stats;
08816 
08817     if (!hw_stats)
08818         return old_estats;
08819 
08820     ESTAT_ADD(rx_octets);
08821     ESTAT_ADD(rx_fragments);
08822     ESTAT_ADD(rx_ucast_packets);
08823     ESTAT_ADD(rx_mcast_packets);
08824     ESTAT_ADD(rx_bcast_packets);
08825     ESTAT_ADD(rx_fcs_errors);
08826     ESTAT_ADD(rx_align_errors);
08827     ESTAT_ADD(rx_xon_pause_rcvd);
08828     ESTAT_ADD(rx_xoff_pause_rcvd);
08829     ESTAT_ADD(rx_mac_ctrl_rcvd);
08830     ESTAT_ADD(rx_xoff_entered);
08831     ESTAT_ADD(rx_frame_too_long_errors);
08832     ESTAT_ADD(rx_jabbers);
08833     ESTAT_ADD(rx_undersize_packets);
08834     ESTAT_ADD(rx_in_length_errors);
08835     ESTAT_ADD(rx_out_length_errors);
08836     ESTAT_ADD(rx_64_or_less_octet_packets);
08837     ESTAT_ADD(rx_65_to_127_octet_packets);
08838     ESTAT_ADD(rx_128_to_255_octet_packets);
08839     ESTAT_ADD(rx_256_to_511_octet_packets);
08840     ESTAT_ADD(rx_512_to_1023_octet_packets);
08841     ESTAT_ADD(rx_1024_to_1522_octet_packets);
08842     ESTAT_ADD(rx_1523_to_2047_octet_packets);
08843     ESTAT_ADD(rx_2048_to_4095_octet_packets);
08844     ESTAT_ADD(rx_4096_to_8191_octet_packets);
08845     ESTAT_ADD(rx_8192_to_9022_octet_packets);
08846 
08847     ESTAT_ADD(tx_octets);
08848     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collisions);
08849     ESTAT_ADD(tx_xon_sent);
08850     ESTAT_ADD(tx_xoff_sent);
08851     ESTAT_ADD(tx_flow_control);
08852     ESTAT_ADD(tx_mac_errors);
08853     ESTAT_ADD(tx_single_collisions);
08854     ESTAT_ADD(tx_mult_collisions);
08855     ESTAT_ADD(tx_deferred);
08856     ESTAT_ADD(tx_excessive_collisions);
08857     ESTAT_ADD(tx_late_collisions);
08858     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_2times);
08859     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_3times);
08860     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_4times);
08861     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_5times);
08862     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_6times);
08863     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_7times);
08864     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_8times);
08865     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_9times);
08866     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_10times);
08867     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_11times);
08868     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_12times);
08869     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_13times);
08870     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_14times);
08871     ESTAT_ADD(tx_collide_15times);
08872     ESTAT_ADD(tx_ucast_packets);
08873     ESTAT_ADD(tx_mcast_packets);
08874     ESTAT_ADD(tx_bcast_packets);
08875     ESTAT_ADD(tx_carrier_sense_errors);
08876     ESTAT_ADD(tx_discards);
08877     ESTAT_ADD(tx_errors);
08878 
08879     ESTAT_ADD(dma_writeq_full);
08880     ESTAT_ADD(dma_write_prioq_full);
08881     ESTAT_ADD(rxbds_empty);
08882     ESTAT_ADD(rx_discards);
08883     ESTAT_ADD(rx_errors);
08884     ESTAT_ADD(rx_threshold_hit);
08885 
08886     ESTAT_ADD(dma_readq_full);
