08887     ESTAT_ADD(dma_read_prioq_full);
08888     ESTAT_ADD(tx_comp_queue_full);
08889 
08890     ESTAT_ADD(ring_set_send_prod_index);
08891     ESTAT_ADD(ring_status_update);
08892     ESTAT_ADD(nic_irqs);
08893     ESTAT_ADD(nic_avoided_irqs);
08894     ESTAT_ADD(nic_tx_threshold_hit);
08895 
08896     return estats;
08897 }
08898 
08899 static struct net_device_stats *tg3_get_stats(struct net_device *dev)
08900 {
08901     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
08902     struct net_device_stats *stats = &tp->net_stats;
08903     struct net_device_stats *old_stats = &tp->net_stats_prev;
08904     struct tg3_hw_stats *hw_stats = tp->hw_stats;
08905 
08906     if (!hw_stats)
08907         return old_stats;
08908 
08909     stats->rx_packets = old_stats->rx_packets +
08910         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_ucast_packets) +
08911         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_mcast_packets) +
08912         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_bcast_packets);
08913 
08914     stats->tx_packets = old_stats->tx_packets +
08915         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_ucast_packets) +
08916         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_mcast_packets) +
08917         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_bcast_packets);
08918 
08919     stats->rx_bytes = old_stats->rx_bytes +
08920         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_octets);
08921     stats->tx_bytes = old_stats->tx_bytes +
08922         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_octets);
08923 
08924     stats->rx_errors = old_stats->rx_errors +
08925         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_errors);
08926     stats->tx_errors = old_stats->tx_errors +
08927         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_errors) +
08928         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_mac_errors) +
08929         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_carrier_sense_errors) +
08930         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_discards);
08931 
08932     stats->multicast = old_stats->multicast +
08933         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_mcast_packets);
08934     stats->collisions = old_stats->collisions +
08935         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_collisions);
08936 
08937     stats->rx_length_errors = old_stats->rx_length_errors +
08938         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_frame_too_long_errors) +
08939         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_undersize_packets);
08940 
08941     stats->rx_over_errors = old_stats->rx_over_errors +
08942         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rxbds_empty);
08943     stats->rx_frame_errors = old_stats->rx_frame_errors +
08944         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_align_errors);
08945     stats->tx_aborted_errors = old_stats->tx_aborted_errors +
08946         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_discards);
08947     stats->tx_carrier_errors = old_stats->tx_carrier_errors +
08948         get_stat64(&hw_stats->tx_carrier_sense_errors);
08949 
08950     stats->rx_crc_errors = old_stats->rx_crc_errors +
08951         calc_crc_errors(tp);
08952 
08953     stats->rx_missed_errors = old_stats->rx_missed_errors +
08954         get_stat64(&hw_stats->rx_discards);
08955 
08956     return stats;
08957 }
08958 
08959 static inline u32 calc_crc(unsigned char *buf, int len)
08960 {
08961     u32 reg;
08962     u32 tmp;
08963     int j, k;
08964 
08965     reg = 0xffffffff;
08966 
08967     for (j = 0; j < len; j++) {
08968         reg ^= buf[j];
08969 
08970         for (k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
08971             tmp = reg & 0x01;
08972 
08973             reg >>= 1;
08974 
08975             if (tmp) {
08976                 reg ^= 0xedb88320;
08977             }
08978         }
08979     }
08980 
08981     return ~reg;
08982 }
08983 
08984 static void tg3_set_multi(struct tg3 *tp, unsigned int accept_all)
08985 {
08986     /* accept or reject all multicast frames */
08987     tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_0, accept_all ? 0xffffffff : 0);
08988     tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_1, accept_all ? 0xffffffff : 0);
08989     tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_2, accept_all ? 0xffffffff : 0);
08990     tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_3, accept_all ? 0xffffffff : 0);
08991 }
08992 
08993 static void __tg3_set_rx_mode(struct net_device *dev)
08994 {
08995     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
08996     u32 rx_mode;
08997 
08998     rx_mode = tp->rx_mode & ~(RX_MODE_PROMISC |
08999                   RX_MODE_KEEP_VLAN_TAG);
09000 
09001     /* When ASF is in use, we always keep the RX_MODE_KEEP_VLAN_TAG
09002      * flag clear.
09003      */
09004 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
09005     if (!tp->vlgrp &&
09006         !(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF))
09007         rx_mode |= RX_MODE_KEEP_VLAN_TAG;
09008 #else
09009     /* By definition, VLAN is disabled always in this
09010      * case.
09011      */
09012     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF))
09013         rx_mode |= RX_MODE_KEEP_VLAN_TAG;
09014 #endif
09015 
09016     if (dev->flags & IFF_PROMISC) {
09017         /* Promiscuous mode. */
09018         rx_mode |= RX_MODE_PROMISC;
09019     } else if (dev->flags & IFF_ALLMULTI) {
09020         /* Accept all multicast. */
09021         tg3_set_multi (tp, 1);
09022     } else if (dev->mc_count < 1) {
09023         /* Reject all multicast. */
09024         tg3_set_multi (tp, 0);
09025     } else {
09026         /* Accept one or more multicast(s). */
09027         struct dev_mc_list *mclist;
09028         unsigned int i;
09029         u32 mc_filter[4] = { 0, };
09030         u32 regidx;
09031         u32 bit;
09032         u32 crc;
09033 
09034         for (i = 0, mclist = dev->mc_list; mclist && i < dev->mc_count;
09035              i++, mclist = mclist->next) {
09036 
09037             crc = calc_crc (mclist->dmi_addr, ETH_ALEN);
09038             bit = ~crc & 0x7f;
09039             regidx = (bit & 0x60) >> 5;
09040             bit &= 0x1f;
09041             mc_filter[regidx] |= (1 << bit);
09042         }
09043 
09044         tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_0, mc_filter[0]);
09045         tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_1, mc_filter[1]);
09046         tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_2, mc_filter[2]);
09047         tw32(MAC_HASH_REG_3, mc_filter[3]);
09048     }
09049 
09050     if (rx_mode != tp->rx_mode) {
09051         tp->rx_mode = rx_mode;
09052         tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, rx_mode);
09053         udelay(10);
09054     }
09055 }
09056 
09057 static void tg3_set_rx_mode(struct net_device *dev)
09058 {
09059     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09060 
09061     if (!netif_running(dev))
09062         return;
09063 
09064     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
09065     __tg3_set_rx_mode(dev);
09066     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
09067 }
09068 
09069 #define TG3_REGDUMP_LEN     (32 * 1024)
09070 
09071 static int tg3_get_regs_len(struct net_device *dev)
09072 {
09073     return TG3_REGDUMP_LEN;
09074 }
09075 
09076 static void tg3_get_regs(struct net_device *dev,
09077         struct ethtool_regs *regs, void *_p)
09078 {
09079     u32 *p = _p;
09080     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09081     u8 *orig_p = _p;
09082     int i;
09083 
09084     regs->version = 0;
09085 
09086     memset(p, 0, TG3_REGDUMP_LEN);
09087 
09088     if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
09089         return;
09090 
09091     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
09092 
09093 #define __GET_REG32(reg)    (*(p)++ = tr32(reg))
09094 #define GET_REG32_LOOP(base,len)        \
09095 do {    p = (u32 *)(orig_p + (base));       \
09096     for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4)        \
09097         __GET_REG32((base) + i);    \
09098 } while (0)
09099 #define GET_REG32_1(reg)            \
09100 do {    p = (u32 *)(orig_p + (reg));        \
09101     __GET_REG32((reg));         \
09102 } while (0)
09103 
09104     GET_REG32_LOOP(TG3PCI_VENDOR, 0xb0);
09105     GET_REG32_LOOP(MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0, 0x200);
09106     GET_REG32_LOOP(MAC_MODE, 0x4f0);
09107     GET_REG32_LOOP(SNDDATAI_MODE, 0xe0);
09108     GET_REG32_1(SNDDATAC_MODE);
09109     GET_REG32_LOOP(SNDBDS_MODE, 0x80);
09110     GET_REG32_LOOP(SNDBDI_MODE, 0x48);
09111     GET_REG32_1(SNDBDC_MODE);
09112     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVLPC_MODE, 0x20);
09113     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVLPC_SELLST_BASE, 0x15c);
09114     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVDBDI_MODE, 0x0c);
09115     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD, 0x3c);
09116     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVDBDI_BD_PROD_IDX_0, 0x44);
09117     GET_REG32_1(RCVDCC_MODE);
09118     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVBDI_MODE, 0x20);
09119     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVCC_MODE, 0x14);
09120     GET_REG32_LOOP(RCVLSC_MODE, 0x08);
09121     GET_REG32_1(MBFREE_MODE);
09122     GET_REG32_LOOP(HOSTCC_MODE, 0x100);
09123     GET_REG32_LOOP(MEMARB_MODE, 0x10);
09124     GET_REG32_LOOP(BUFMGR_MODE, 0x58);
09125     GET_REG32_LOOP(RDMAC_MODE, 0x08);
09126     GET_REG32_LOOP(WDMAC_MODE, 0x08);
09127     GET_REG32_1(RX_CPU_MODE);
09128     GET_REG32_1(RX_CPU_STATE);
09129     GET_REG32_1(RX_CPU_PGMCTR);
09130     GET_REG32_1(RX_CPU_HWBKPT);
09131     GET_REG32_1(TX_CPU_MODE);
09132     GET_REG32_1(TX_CPU_STATE);
09133     GET_REG32_1(TX_CPU_PGMCTR);
09134     GET_REG32_LOOP(GRCMBOX_INTERRUPT_0, 0x110);
09135     GET_REG32_LOOP(FTQ_RESET, 0x120);
09136     GET_REG32_LOOP(MSGINT_MODE, 0x0c);
09137     GET_REG32_1(DMAC_MODE);
09138     GET_REG32_LOOP(GRC_MODE, 0x4c);
09139     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM)
09140         GET_REG32_LOOP(NVRAM_CMD, 0x24);
09141 
09142 #undef __GET_REG32
09143 #undef GET_REG32_LOOP
09144 #undef GET_REG32_1
09145 
09146     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
09147 }
09148 
09149 static int tg3_get_eeprom_len(struct net_device *dev)
09150 {
09151     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09152 
09153     return tp->nvram_size;
09154 }
09155 
09156 static int tg3_get_eeprom(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_eeprom *eeprom, u8 *data)
09157 {
09158     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09159     int ret;
09160     u8  *pd;
09161     u32 i, offset, len, b_offset, b_count;
09162     __be32 val;
09163 
09164     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM)
09165         return -EINVAL;
09166 
09167     if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
09168         return -EAGAIN;
09169 
09170     offset = eeprom->offset;
09171     len = eeprom->len;
09172     eeprom->len = 0;
09173 
09174     eeprom->magic = TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC;
09175 
09176     if (offset & 3) {
09177         /* adjustments to start on required 4 byte boundary */
09178         b_offset = offset & 3;
09179         b_count = 4 - b_offset;
09180         if (b_count > len) {
09181             /* i.e. offset=1 len=2 */
09182             b_count = len;
09183         }
09184         ret = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, offset-b_offset, &val);
09185         if (ret)
09186             return ret;
09187         memcpy(data, ((char*)&val) + b_offset, b_count);
09188         len -= b_count;
09189         offset += b_count;
09190             eeprom->len += b_count;
09191     }
09192 
09193     /* read bytes upto the last 4 byte boundary */
09194     pd = &data[eeprom->len];
09195     for (i = 0; i < (len - (len & 3)); i += 4) {
09196         ret = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, offset + i, &val);
09197         if (ret) {
09198             eeprom->len += i;
09199             return ret;
09200         }
09201         memcpy(pd + i, &val, 4);
09202     }
09203     eeprom->len += i;
09204 
09205     if (len & 3) {
09206         /* read last bytes not ending on 4 byte boundary */
09207         pd = &data[eeprom->len];
09208         b_count = len & 3;
09209         b_offset = offset + len - b_count;
09210         ret = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, b_offset, &val);
09211         if (ret)
09212             return ret;
09213         memcpy(pd, &val, b_count);
09214         eeprom->len += b_count;
09215     }
09216     return 0;
09217 }
09218 
09219 static int tg3_nvram_write_block(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, u32 len, u8 *buf);
09220 
09221 static int tg3_set_eeprom(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_eeprom *eeprom, u8 *data)
09222 {
09223     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09224     int ret;
09225     u32 offset, len, b_offset, odd_len;
09226     u8 *buf;
09227     __be32 start, end;
09228 
09229     if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
09230         return -EAGAIN;
09231 
09232     if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM) ||
09233         eeprom->magic != TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC)
09234         return -EINVAL;
09235 
09236     offset = eeprom->offset;
09237     len = eeprom->len;
09238 
09239     if ((b_offset = (offset & 3))) {
09240         /* adjustments to start on required 4 byte boundary */
09241         ret = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, offset-b_offset, &start);
09242         if (ret)
09243             return ret;
09244         len += b_offset;
09245         offset &= ~3;
09246         if (len < 4)
09247             len = 4;
09248     }
09249 
09250     odd_len = 0;
09251     if (len & 3) {
09252         /* adjustments to end on required 4 byte boundary */
09253         odd_len = 1;
09254         len = (len + 3) & ~3;
09255         ret = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, offset+len-4, &end);
09256         if (ret)
09257             return ret;
09258     }
09259 
09260     buf = data;
09261     if (b_offset || odd_len) {
09262         buf = kmalloc(len, GFP_KERNEL);
09263         if (!buf)
09264             return -ENOMEM;
09265         if (b_offset)
09266             memcpy(buf, &start, 4);
09267         if (odd_len)
09268             memcpy(buf+len-4, &end, 4);
09269         memcpy(buf + b_offset, data, eeprom->len);
09270     }
09271 
09272     ret = tg3_nvram_write_block(tp, offset, len, buf);
09273 
09274     if (buf != data)
09275         kfree(buf);
09276 
09277     return ret;
09278 }
09279 
09280 static int tg3_get_settings(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_cmd *cmd)
09281 {
09282     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09283 
09284     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
09285         if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
09286             return -EAGAIN;
09287         return phy_ethtool_gset(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR], cmd);
09288     }
09289 
09290     cmd->supported = (SUPPORTED_Autoneg);
09291 
09292     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY))
09293         cmd->supported |= (SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Half |
09294                    SUPPORTED_1000baseT_Full);
09295 
09296     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES)) {
09297         cmd->supported |= (SUPPORTED_100baseT_Half |
09298                   SUPPORTED_100baseT_Full |
09299                   SUPPORTED_10baseT_Half |
09300                   SUPPORTED_10baseT_Full |
09301                   SUPPORTED_TP);
09302         cmd->port = PORT_TP;
09303     } else {
09304         cmd->supported |= SUPPORTED_FIBRE;
09305         cmd->port = PORT_FIBRE;
09306     }
09307 
09308     cmd->advertising = tp->link_config.advertising;
09309     if (netif_running(dev)) {
09310         cmd->speed = tp->link_config.active_speed;
09311         cmd->duplex = tp->link_config.active_duplex;
09312     }
09313     cmd->phy_address = tp->phy_addr;
09314     cmd->transceiver = XCVR_INTERNAL;
09315     cmd->autoneg = tp->link_config.autoneg;
09316     cmd->maxtxpkt = 0;
09317     cmd->maxrxpkt = 0;
09318     return 0;
09319 }
09320 
09321 static int tg3_set_settings(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_cmd *cmd)
09322 {
09323     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09324 
09325     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
09326         if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
09327             return -EAGAIN;
09328         return phy_ethtool_sset(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR], cmd);
09329     }
09330 
09331     if (cmd->autoneg != AUTONEG_ENABLE &&
09332         cmd->autoneg != AUTONEG_DISABLE)
09333         return -EINVAL;
09334 
09335     if (cmd->autoneg == AUTONEG_DISABLE &&
09336         cmd->duplex != DUPLEX_FULL &&
09337         cmd->duplex != DUPLEX_HALF)
09338         return -EINVAL;
09339 
09340     if (cmd->autoneg == AUTONEG_ENABLE) {
09341         u32 mask = ADVERTISED_Autoneg |
09342                ADVERTISED_Pause |
09343                ADVERTISED_Asym_Pause;
09344 
09345         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY))
09346             mask |= ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Half |
09347                 ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full;
09348 
09349         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES))
09350             mask |= ADVERTISED_100baseT_Half |
09351                 ADVERTISED_100baseT_Full |
09352                 ADVERTISED_10baseT_Half |
09353                 ADVERTISED_10baseT_Full |
09354                 ADVERTISED_TP;
09355         else
09356             mask |= ADVERTISED_FIBRE;
09357 
09358         if (cmd->advertising & ~mask)
09359             return -EINVAL;
09360 
09361         mask &= (ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Half |
09362              ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full |
09363              ADVERTISED_100baseT_Half |
09364              ADVERTISED_100baseT_Full |
09365              ADVERTISED_10baseT_Half |
09366              ADVERTISED_10baseT_Full);
09367 
09368         cmd->advertising &= mask;
09369     } else {
09370         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES) {
09371             if (cmd->speed != SPEED_1000)
09372                 return -EINVAL;
09373 
09374             if (cmd->duplex != DUPLEX_FULL)
09375                 return -EINVAL;
09376         } else {
09377             if (cmd->speed != SPEED_100 &&
09378                 cmd->speed != SPEED_10)
09379                 return -EINVAL;
09380         }
09381     }
09382 
09383     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
09384 
09385     tp->link_config.autoneg = cmd->autoneg;
09386     if (cmd->autoneg == AUTONEG_ENABLE) {
09387         tp->link_config.advertising = (cmd->advertising |
09388                           ADVERTISED_Autoneg);
09389         tp->link_config.speed = SPEED_INVALID;
09390         tp->link_config.duplex = DUPLEX_INVALID;
09391     } else {
09392         tp->link_config.advertising = 0;
09393         tp->link_config.speed = cmd->speed;
09394         tp->link_config.duplex = cmd->duplex;
09395     }
09396 
09397     tp->link_config.orig_speed = tp->link_config.speed;
09398     tp->link_config.orig_duplex = tp->link_config.duplex;
09399     tp->link_config.orig_autoneg = tp->link_config.autoneg;
09400 
09401     if (netif_running(dev))
09402         tg3_setup_phy(tp, 1);
09403 
09404     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
09405 
09406     return 0;
09407 }
09408 
09409 static void tg3_get_drvinfo(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_drvinfo *info)
09410 {
09411     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09412 
09413     strcpy(info->driver, DRV_MODULE_NAME);
09414     strcpy(info->version, DRV_MODULE_VERSION);
09415     strcpy(info->fw_version, tp->fw_ver);
09416     strcpy(info->bus_info, pci_name(tp->pdev));
09417 }
09418 
09419 static void tg3_get_wol(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_wolinfo *wol)
09420 {
09421     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09422 
09423     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_CAP) &&
09424         device_can_wakeup(&tp->pdev->dev))
09425         wol->supported = WAKE_MAGIC;
09426     else
09427         wol->supported = 0;
09428     wol->wolopts = 0;
09429     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE) &&
09430         device_can_wakeup(&tp->pdev->dev))
09431         wol->wolopts = WAKE_MAGIC;
09432     memset(&wol->sopass, 0, sizeof(wol->sopass));
09433 }
09434 
09435 static int tg3_set_wol(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_wolinfo *wol)
09436 {
09437     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09438     struct device *dp = &tp->pdev->dev;
09439 
09440     if (wol->wolopts & ~WAKE_MAGIC)
09441         return -EINVAL;
09442     if ((wol->wolopts & WAKE_MAGIC) &&
09443         !((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_CAP) && device_can_wakeup(dp)))
09444         return -EINVAL;
09445 
09446     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
09447     if (wol->wolopts & WAKE_MAGIC) {
09448         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE;
09449         device_set_wakeup_enable(dp, true);
09450     } else {
09451         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE;
09452         device_set_wakeup_enable(dp, false);
09453     }
09454     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
09455 
09456     return 0;
09457 }
09458 
09459 static u32 tg3_get_msglevel(struct net_device *dev)
09460 {
09461     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09462     return tp->msg_enable;
09463 }
09464 
09465 static void tg3_set_msglevel(struct net_device *dev, u32 value)
09466 {
09467     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09468     tp->msg_enable = value;
09469 }
09470 
09471 static int tg3_set_tso(struct net_device *dev, u32 value)
09472 {
09473     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09474 
09475     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE)) {
09476         if (value)
09477             return -EINVAL;
09478         return 0;
09479     }
09480     if ((dev->features & NETIF_F_IPV6_CSUM) &&
09481         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_2)) {
09482         if (value) {
09483             dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO6;
09484             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761 ||
09485                 (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 &&
09486                  GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5784_AX) ||
09487                 GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
09488                 GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 ||
09489                 GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
09490                 dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO_ECN;
09491         } else
09492             dev->features &= ~(NETIF_F_TSO6 | NETIF_F_TSO_ECN);
09493     }
09494     return ethtool_op_set_tso(dev, value);
09495 }
09496 
09497 static int tg3_nway_reset(struct net_device *dev)
09498 {
09499     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09500     int r;
09501 
09502     if (!netif_running(dev))
09503         return -EAGAIN;
09504 
09505     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES)
09506         return -EINVAL;
09507 
09508     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
09509         if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
09510             return -EAGAIN;
09511         r = phy_start_aneg(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]);
09512     } else {
09513         u32 bmcr;
09514 
09515         spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
09516         r = -EINVAL;
09517         tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMCR, &bmcr);
09518         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMCR, &bmcr) &&
09519             ((bmcr & BMCR_ANENABLE) ||
09520              (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PARALLEL_DETECT))) {
09521             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_BMCR, bmcr | BMCR_ANRESTART |
09522                            BMCR_ANENABLE);
09523             r = 0;
09524         }
09525         spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
09526     }
09527 
09528     return r;
09529 }
09530 
09531 static void tg3_get_ringparam(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_ringparam *ering)
09532 {
09533     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09534 
09535     ering->rx_max_pending = TG3_RX_RING_SIZE - 1;
09536     ering->rx_mini_max_pending = 0;
09537     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE)
09538         ering->rx_jumbo_max_pending = TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE - 1;
09539     else
09540         ering->rx_jumbo_max_pending = 0;
09541 
09542     ering->tx_max_pending = TG3_TX_RING_SIZE - 1;
09543 
09544     ering->rx_pending = tp->rx_pending;
09545     ering->rx_mini_pending = 0;
09546     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE)
09547         ering->rx_jumbo_pending = tp->rx_jumbo_pending;
09548     else
09549         ering->rx_jumbo_pending = 0;
09550 
09551     ering->tx_pending = tp->napi[0].tx_pending;
09552 }
09553 
09554 static int tg3_set_ringparam(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_ringparam *ering)
09555 {
09556     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09557     int i, irq_sync = 0, err = 0;
09558 
09559     if ((ering->rx_pending > TG3_RX_RING_SIZE - 1) ||
09560         (ering->rx_jumbo_pending > TG3_RX_JUMBO_RING_SIZE - 1) ||
09561         (ering->tx_pending > TG3_TX_RING_SIZE - 1) ||
09562         (ering->tx_pending <= MAX_SKB_FRAGS) ||
09563         ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_BUG) &&
09564          (ering->tx_pending <= (MAX_SKB_FRAGS * 3))))
09565         return -EINVAL;
09566 
09567     if (netif_running(dev)) {
09568         tg3_phy_stop(tp);
09569         tg3_netif_stop(tp);
09570         irq_sync = 1;
09571     }
09572 
09573     tg3_full_lock(tp, irq_sync);
09574 
09575     tp->rx_pending = ering->rx_pending;
09576 
09577     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MAX_RXPEND_64) &&
09578         tp->rx_pending > 63)
09579         tp->rx_pending = 63;
09580     tp->rx_jumbo_pending = ering->rx_jumbo_pending;
09581 
09582     for (i = 0; i < TG3_IRQ_MAX_VECS; i++)
09583         tp->napi[i].tx_pending = ering->tx_pending;
09584 
09585     if (netif_running(dev)) {
09586         tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
09587         err = tg3_restart_hw(tp, 1);
09588         if (!err)
09589             tg3_netif_start(tp);
09590     }
09591 
09592     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
09593 
09594     if (irq_sync && !err)
09595         tg3_phy_start(tp);
09596 
09597     return err;
09598 }
09599 
09600 static void tg3_get_pauseparam(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_pauseparam *epause)
09601 {
09602     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09603 
09604     epause->autoneg = (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PAUSE_AUTONEG) != 0;
09605 
09606     if (tp->link_config.active_flowctrl & FLOW_CTRL_RX)
09607         epause->rx_pause = 1;
09608     else
09609         epause->rx_pause = 0;
09610 
09611     if (tp->link_config.active_flowctrl & FLOW_CTRL_TX)
09612         epause->tx_pause = 1;
09613     else
09614         epause->tx_pause = 0;
09615 }
09616 
09617 static int tg3_set_pauseparam(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_pauseparam *epause)
09618 {
09619     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09620     int err = 0;
09621 
09622     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
09623         if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
09624             return -EAGAIN;
09625 
09626         if (epause->autoneg) {
09627             u32 newadv;
09628             struct phy_device *phydev;
09629 
09630             phydev = tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR];
09631 
09632             if (epause->rx_pause) {
09633                 if (epause->tx_pause)
09634                     newadv = ADVERTISED_Pause;
09635                 else
09636                     newadv = ADVERTISED_Pause |
09637                          ADVERTISED_Asym_Pause;
09638             } else if (epause->tx_pause) {
09639                 newadv = ADVERTISED_Asym_Pause;
09640             } else
09641                 newadv = 0;
09642 
09643             if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED) {
09644                 u32 oldadv = phydev->advertising &
09645                          (ADVERTISED_Pause |
09646                           ADVERTISED_Asym_Pause);
09647                 if (oldadv != newadv) {
09648                     phydev->advertising &=
09649                         ~(ADVERTISED_Pause |
09650                           ADVERTISED_Asym_Pause);
09651                     phydev->advertising |= newadv;
09652                     err = phy_start_aneg(phydev);
09653                 }
09654             } else {
09655                 tp->link_config.advertising &=
09656                         ~(ADVERTISED_Pause |
09657                           ADVERTISED_Asym_Pause);
09658                 tp->link_config.advertising |= newadv;
09659             }
09660         } else {
09661             if (epause->rx_pause)
09662                 tp->link_config.flowctrl |= FLOW_CTRL_RX;
09663             else
09664                 tp->link_config.flowctrl &= ~FLOW_CTRL_RX;
09665 
09666             if (epause->tx_pause)
09667                 tp->link_config.flowctrl |= FLOW_CTRL_TX;
09668             else
09669                 tp->link_config.flowctrl &= ~FLOW_CTRL_TX;
09670 
09671             if (netif_running(dev))
09672                 tg3_setup_flow_control(tp, 0, 0);
09673         }
09674     } else {
09675         int irq_sync = 0;
09676 
09677         if (netif_running(dev)) {
09678             tg3_netif_stop(tp);
09679             irq_sync = 1;
09680         }
09681 
09682         tg3_full_lock(tp, irq_sync);
09683 
09684         if (epause->autoneg)
09685             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PAUSE_AUTONEG;
09686         else
09687             tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_PAUSE_AUTONEG;
09688         if (epause->rx_pause)
09689             tp->link_config.flowctrl |= FLOW_CTRL_RX;
09690         else
09691             tp->link_config.flowctrl &= ~FLOW_CTRL_RX;
09692         if (epause->tx_pause)
09693             tp->link_config.flowctrl |= FLOW_CTRL_TX;
09694         else
09695             tp->link_config.flowctrl &= ~FLOW_CTRL_TX;
09696 
09697         if (netif_running(dev)) {
09698             tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
09699             err = tg3_restart_hw(tp, 1);
09700             if (!err)
09701                 tg3_netif_start(tp);
09702         }
09703 
09704         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
09705     }
09706 
09707     return err;
09708 }
09709 
09710 static u32 tg3_get_rx_csum(struct net_device *dev)
09711 {
09712     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09713     return (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_RX_CHECKSUMS) != 0;
09714 }
09715 
09716 static int tg3_set_rx_csum(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
09717 {
09718     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09719 
09720     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_BROKEN_CHECKSUMS) {
09721         if (data != 0)
09722             return -EINVAL;
09723         return 0;
09724     }
09725 
09726     spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
09727     if (data)
09728         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_RX_CHECKSUMS;
09729     else
09730         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_RX_CHECKSUMS;
09731     spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
09732 
09733     return 0;
09734 }
09735 
09736 static int tg3_set_tx_csum(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
09737 {
09738     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09739 
09740     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_BROKEN_CHECKSUMS) {
09741         if (data != 0)
09742             return -EINVAL;
09743         return 0;
09744     }
09745 
09746     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS)
09747         ethtool_op_set_tx_ipv6_csum(dev, data);
09748     else
09749         ethtool_op_set_tx_csum(dev, data);
09750 
09751     return 0;
09752 }
09753 
09754 static int tg3_get_sset_count (struct net_device *dev, int sset)
09755 {
09756     switch (sset) {
09757     case ETH_SS_TEST:
09758         return TG3_NUM_TEST;
09759     case ETH_SS_STATS:
09760         return TG3_NUM_STATS;
09761     default:
09762         return -EOPNOTSUPP;
09763     }
09764 }
09765 
09766 static void tg3_get_strings (struct net_device *dev, u32 stringset, u8 *buf)
09767 {
09768     switch (stringset) {
09769     case ETH_SS_STATS:
09770         memcpy(buf, &ethtool_stats_keys, sizeof(ethtool_stats_keys));
09771         break;
09772     case ETH_SS_TEST:
09773         memcpy(buf, &ethtool_test_keys, sizeof(ethtool_test_keys));
09774         break;
09775     default:
09776         WARN_ON(1); /* we need a WARN() */
09777         break;
09778     }
09779 }
09780 
09781 static int tg3_phys_id(struct net_device *dev, u32 data)
09782 {
09783     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09784     int i;
09785 
09786     if (!netif_running(tp->dev))
09787         return -EAGAIN;
09788 
09789     if (data == 0)
09790         data = UINT_MAX / 2;
09791 
09792     for (i = 0; i < (data * 2); i++) {
09793         if ((i % 2) == 0)
09794             tw32(MAC_LED_CTRL, LED_CTRL_LNKLED_OVERRIDE |
09795                        LED_CTRL_1000MBPS_ON |
09796                        LED_CTRL_100MBPS_ON |
09797                        LED_CTRL_10MBPS_ON |
09798                        LED_CTRL_TRAFFIC_OVERRIDE |
09799                        LED_CTRL_TRAFFIC_BLINK |
09800                        LED_CTRL_TRAFFIC_LED);
09801 
09802         else
09803             tw32(MAC_LED_CTRL, LED_CTRL_LNKLED_OVERRIDE |
09804                        LED_CTRL_TRAFFIC_OVERRIDE);
09805 
09806         if (msleep_interruptible(500))
09807             break;
09808     }
09809     tw32(MAC_LED_CTRL, tp->led_ctrl);
09810     return 0;
09811 }
09812 
09813 static void tg3_get_ethtool_stats (struct net_device *dev,
09814                    struct ethtool_stats *estats, u64 *tmp_stats)
09815 {
09816     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
09817     memcpy(tmp_stats, tg3_get_estats(tp), sizeof(tp->estats));
09818 }
09819 
09820 #define NVRAM_TEST_SIZE 0x100
09821 #define NVRAM_SELFBOOT_FORMAT1_0_SIZE   0x14
09822 #define NVRAM_SELFBOOT_FORMAT1_2_SIZE   0x18
09823 #define NVRAM_SELFBOOT_FORMAT1_3_SIZE   0x1c
09824 #define NVRAM_SELFBOOT_HW_SIZE 0x20
09825 #define NVRAM_SELFBOOT_DATA_SIZE 0x1c
09826 
09827 static int tg3_test_nvram(struct tg3 *tp)
09828 {
09829     u32 csum, magic;
09830     __be32 *buf;
09831     int i, j, k, err = 0, size;
09832 
09833     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM)
09834         return 0;
09835 
09836     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0, &magic) != 0)
09837         return -EIO;
09838 
09839     if (magic == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC)
09840         size = NVRAM_TEST_SIZE;
09841     else if ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW_MSK) == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW) {
09842         if ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_SB_FORMAT_MASK) ==
09843             TG3_EEPROM_SB_FORMAT_1) {
09844             switch (magic & TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_MASK) {
09845             case TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_0:
09846                 size = NVRAM_SELFBOOT_FORMAT1_0_SIZE;
09847                 break;
09848             case TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_2:
09849                 size = NVRAM_SELFBOOT_FORMAT1_2_SIZE;
09850                 break;
09851             case TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_3:
09852                 size = NVRAM_SELFBOOT_FORMAT1_3_SIZE;
09853                 break;
09854             default:
09855                 return 0;
09856             }
09857         } else
09858             return 0;
09859     } else if ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW_MSK) == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW)
09860         size = NVRAM_SELFBOOT_HW_SIZE;
09861     else
09862         return -EIO;
09863 
09864     buf = kmalloc(size, GFP_KERNEL);
09865     if (buf == NULL)
09866         return -ENOMEM;
09867 
09868     err = -EIO;
09869     for (i = 0, j = 0; i < size; i += 4, j++) {
09870         err = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, i, &buf[j]);
09871         if (err)
09872             break;
09873     }
09874     if (i < size)
09875         goto out;
09876 
09877     /* Selfboot format */
09878     magic = be32_to_cpu(buf[0]);
09879     if ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW_MSK) ==
09880         TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW) {
09881         u8 *buf8 = (u8 *) buf, csum8 = 0;
09882 
09883         if ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_MASK) ==
09884             TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_2) {
09885             /* For rev 2, the csum doesn't include the MBA. */
09886             for (i = 0; i < TG3_EEPROM_SB_F1R2_MBA_OFF; i++)
09887                 csum8 += buf8[i];
09888             for (i = TG3_EEPROM_SB_F1R2_MBA_OFF + 4; i < size; i++)
09889                 csum8 += buf8[i];
09890         } else {
09891             for (i = 0; i < size; i++)
09892                 csum8 += buf8[i];
09893         }
09894 
09895         if (csum8 == 0) {
09896             err = 0;
09897             goto out;
09898         }
09899 
09900         err = -EIO;
09901         goto out;
09902     }
09903 
09904     if ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW_MSK) ==
09905         TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW) {
09906         u8 data[NVRAM_SELFBOOT_DATA_SIZE];
09907         u8 parity[NVRAM_SELFBOOT_DATA_SIZE];
09908         u8 *buf8 = (u8 *) buf;
09909 
09910         /* Separate the parity bits and the data bytes.  */
09911         for (i = 0, j = 0, k = 0; i < NVRAM_SELFBOOT_HW_SIZE; i++) {
09912             if ((i == 0) || (i == 8)) {
09913                 int l;
09914                 u8 msk;
09915 
09916                 for (l = 0, msk = 0x80; l < 7; l++, msk >>= 1)
09917                     parity[k++] = buf8[i] & msk;
09918                 i++;
09919             }
09920             else if (i == 16) {
09921                 int l;
09922                 u8 msk;
09923 
09924                 for (l = 0, msk = 0x20; l < 6; l++, msk >>= 1)
09925                     parity[k++] = buf8[i] & msk;
09926                 i++;
09927 
09928                 for (l = 0, msk = 0x80; l < 8; l++, msk >>= 1)
09929                     parity[k++] = buf8[i] & msk;
09930                 i++;
09931             }
09932             data[j++] = buf8[i];
09933         }
09934 
09935         err = -EIO;
09936         for (i = 0; i < NVRAM_SELFBOOT_DATA_SIZE; i++) {
09937             u8 hw8 = hweight8(data[i]);
09938 
09939             if ((hw8 & 0x1) && parity[i])
09940                 goto out;
09941             else if (!(hw8 & 0x1) && !parity[i])
09942                 goto out;
09943         }
09944         err = 0;
09945         goto out;
09946     }
09947 
09948     /* Bootstrap checksum at offset 0x10 */
09949     csum = calc_crc((unsigned char *) buf, 0x10);
09950     if (csum != be32_to_cpu(buf[0x10/4]))
09951         goto out;
09952 
09953     /* Manufacturing block starts at offset 0x74, checksum at 0xfc */
09954     csum = calc_crc((unsigned char *) &buf[0x74/4], 0x88);
09955     if (csum != be32_to_cpu(buf[0xfc/4]))
09956         goto out;
09957 
09958     err = 0;
09959 
09960 out:
09961     kfree(buf);
09962     return err;
09963 }
09964 
09965 #define TG3_SERDES_TIMEOUT_SEC  2
09966 #define TG3_COPPER_TIMEOUT_SEC  6
09967 
09968 static int tg3_test_link(struct tg3 *tp)
09969 {
09970     int i, max;
09971 
09972     if (!netif_running(tp->dev))
09973         return -ENODEV;
09974 
09975     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES)
09976         max = TG3_SERDES_TIMEOUT_SEC;
09977     else
09978         max = TG3_COPPER_TIMEOUT_SEC;
09979 
09980     for (i = 0; i < max; i++) {
09981         if (netif_carrier_ok(tp->dev))
09982             return 0;
09983 
09984         if (msleep_interruptible(1000))
09985             break;
09986     }
09987 
09988     return -EIO;
09989 }
09990 
09991 /* Only test the commonly used registers */
09992 static int tg3_test_registers(struct tg3 *tp)
09993 {
09994     int i, is_5705, is_5750;
09995     u32 offset, read_mask, write_mask, val, save_val, read_val;
09996     static struct {
09997         u16 offset;
09998         u16 flags;
09999 #define TG3_FL_5705 0x1
10000 #define TG3_FL_NOT_5705 0x2
10001 #define TG3_FL_NOT_5788 0x4
10002 #define TG3_FL_NOT_5750 0x8
10003         u32 read_mask;
10004         u32 write_mask;
10005     } reg_tbl[] = {
10006         /* MAC Control Registers */
10007         { MAC_MODE, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10008             0x00000000, 0x00ef6f8c },
10009         { MAC_MODE, TG3_FL_5705,
10010             0x00000000, 0x01ef6b8c },
10011         { MAC_STATUS, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10012             0x03800107, 0x00000000 },
10013         { MAC_STATUS, TG3_FL_5705,
10014             0x03800100, 0x00000000 },
10015         { MAC_ADDR_0_HIGH, 0x0000,
10016             0x00000000, 0x0000ffff },
10017         { MAC_ADDR_0_LOW, 0x0000,
10018                 0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10019         { MAC_RX_MTU_SIZE, 0x0000,
10020             0x00000000, 0x0000ffff },
10021         { MAC_TX_MODE, 0x0000,
10022             0x00000000, 0x00000070 },
10023         { MAC_TX_LENGTHS, 0x0000,
10024             0x00000000, 0x00003fff },
10025         { MAC_RX_MODE, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10026             0x00000000, 0x000007fc },
10027         { MAC_RX_MODE, TG3_FL_5705,
10028             0x00000000, 0x000007dc },
10029         { MAC_HASH_REG_0, 0x0000,
10030             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10031         { MAC_HASH_REG_1, 0x0000,
10032             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10033         { MAC_HASH_REG_2, 0x0000,
10034             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10035         { MAC_HASH_REG_3, 0x0000,
10036             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10037 
10038         /* Receive Data and Receive BD Initiator Control Registers. */
10039         { RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD+0, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10040             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10041         { RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD+4, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10042             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10043         { RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD+8, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10044             0x00000000, 0x00000003 },
10045         { RCVDBDI_JUMBO_BD+0xc, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10046             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10047         { RCVDBDI_STD_BD+0, 0x0000,
10048             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10049         { RCVDBDI_STD_BD+4, 0x0000,
10050             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10051         { RCVDBDI_STD_BD+8, 0x0000,
10052             0x00000000, 0xffff0002 },
10053         { RCVDBDI_STD_BD+0xc, 0x0000,
10054             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10055 
10056         /* Receive BD Initiator Control Registers. */
10057         { RCVBDI_STD_THRESH, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10058             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10059         { RCVBDI_STD_THRESH, TG3_FL_5705,
10060             0x00000000, 0x000003ff },
10061         { RCVBDI_JUMBO_THRESH, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10062             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10063 
10064         /* Host Coalescing Control Registers. */
10065         { HOSTCC_MODE, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10066             0x00000000, 0x00000004 },
10067         { HOSTCC_MODE, TG3_FL_5705,
10068             0x00000000, 0x000000f6 },
10069         { HOSTCC_RXCOL_TICKS, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10070             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10071         { HOSTCC_RXCOL_TICKS, TG3_FL_5705,
10072             0x00000000, 0x000003ff },
10073         { HOSTCC_TXCOL_TICKS, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10074             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10075         { HOSTCC_TXCOL_TICKS, TG3_FL_5705,
10076             0x00000000, 0x000003ff },
10077         { HOSTCC_RXMAX_FRAMES, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10078             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10079         { HOSTCC_RXMAX_FRAMES, TG3_FL_5705 | TG3_FL_NOT_5788,
10080             0x00000000, 0x000000ff },
10081         { HOSTCC_TXMAX_FRAMES, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10082             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10083         { HOSTCC_TXMAX_FRAMES, TG3_FL_5705 | TG3_FL_NOT_5788,
10084             0x00000000, 0x000000ff },
10085         { HOSTCC_RXCOAL_TICK_INT, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10086             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10087         { HOSTCC_TXCOAL_TICK_INT, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10088             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10089         { HOSTCC_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10090             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10091         { HOSTCC_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT, TG3_FL_5705 | TG3_FL_NOT_5788,
10092             0x00000000, 0x000000ff },
10093         { HOSTCC_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10094             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10095         { HOSTCC_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT, TG3_FL_5705 | TG3_FL_NOT_5788,
10096             0x00000000, 0x000000ff },
10097         { HOSTCC_STAT_COAL_TICKS, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10098             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10099         { HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10100             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10101         { HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_HOST_ADDR+4, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10102             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10103         { HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR, 0x0000,
10104             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10105         { HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_HOST_ADDR+4, 0x0000,
10106             0x00000000, 0xffffffff },
10107         { HOSTCC_STATS_BLK_NIC_ADDR, 0x0000,
10108             0xffffffff, 0x00000000 },
10109         { HOSTCC_STATUS_BLK_NIC_ADDR, 0x0000,
10110             0xffffffff, 0x00000000 },
10111 
10112         /* Buffer Manager Control Registers. */
10113         { BUFMGR_MB_POOL_ADDR, TG3_FL_NOT_5750,
10114             0x00000000, 0x007fff80 },
10115         { BUFMGR_MB_POOL_SIZE, TG3_FL_NOT_5750,
10116             0x00000000, 0x007fffff },
10117         { BUFMGR_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER, 0x0000,
10118             0x00000000, 0x0000003f },
10119         { BUFMGR_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER, 0x0000,
10120             0x00000000, 0x000001ff },
10121         { BUFMGR_MB_HIGH_WATER, 0x0000,
10122             0x00000000, 0x000001ff },
10123         { BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_ADDR, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10124             0xffffffff, 0x00000000 },
10125         { BUFMGR_DMA_DESC_POOL_SIZE, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10126             0xffffffff, 0x00000000 },
10127 
10128         /* Mailbox Registers */
10129         { GRCMBOX_RCVSTD_PROD_IDX+4, 0x0000,
10130             0x00000000, 0x000001ff },
10131         { GRCMBOX_RCVJUMBO_PROD_IDX+4, TG3_FL_NOT_5705,
10132             0x00000000, 0x000001ff },
10133         { GRCMBOX_RCVRET_CON_IDX_0+4, 0x0000,
10134             0x00000000, 0x000007ff },
10135         { GRCMBOX_SNDHOST_PROD_IDX_0+4, 0x0000,
10136             0x00000000, 0x000001ff },
10137 
10138         { 0xffff, 0x0000, 0x00000000, 0x00000000 },
10139     };
10140 
10141     is_5705 = is_5750 = 0;
10142     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) {
10143         is_5705 = 1;
10144         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS)
10145             is_5750 = 1;
10146     }
10147 
10148     for (i = 0; reg_tbl[i].offset != 0xffff; i++) {
10149         if (is_5705 && (reg_tbl[i].flags & TG3_FL_NOT_5705))
10150             continue;
10151 
10152         if (!is_5705 && (reg_tbl[i].flags & TG3_FL_5705))
10153             continue;
10154 
10155         if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_5788) &&
10156             (reg_tbl[i].flags & TG3_FL_NOT_5788))
10157             continue;
10158 
10159         if (is_5750 && (reg_tbl[i].flags & TG3_FL_NOT_5750))
10160             continue;
10161 
10162         offset = (u32) reg_tbl[i].offset;
10163         read_mask = reg_tbl[i].read_mask;
10164         write_mask = reg_tbl[i].write_mask;
10165 
10166         /* Save the original register content */
10167         save_val = tr32(offset);
10168 
10169         /* Determine the read-only value. */
10170         read_val = save_val & read_mask;
10171 
10172         /* Write zero to the register, then make sure the read-only bits
10173          * are not changed and the read/write bits are all zeros.
10174          */
10175         tw32(offset, 0);
10176 
10177         val = tr32(offset);
10178 
10179         /* Test the read-only and read/write bits. */
10180         if (((val & read_mask) != read_val) || (val & write_mask))
10181             goto out;
10182 
10183         /* Write ones to all the bits defined by RdMask and WrMask, then
10184          * make sure the read-only bits are not changed and the
10185          * read/write bits are all ones.
10186          */
10187         tw32(offset, read_mask | write_mask);
10188 
10189         val = tr32(offset);
10190 
10191         /* Test the read-only bits. */
10192         if ((val & read_mask) != read_val)
10193             goto out;
10194 
10195         /* Test the read/write bits. */
10196         if ((val & write_mask) != write_mask)
10197             goto out;
10198 
10199         tw32(offset, save_val);
10200     }
10201 
10202     return 0;
10203 
10204 out:
10205     if (netif_msg_hw(tp))
10206         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Register test failed at offset %x\n",
10207                offset);
10208     tw32(offset, save_val);
10209     return -EIO;
10210 }
10211 
10212 static int tg3_do_mem_test(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, u32 len)
10213 {
10214     static const u32 test_pattern[] = { 0x00000000, 0xffffffff, 0xaa55a55a };
10215     int i;
10216     u32 j;
10217 
10218     for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(test_pattern); i++) {
10219         for (j = 0; j < len; j += 4) {
10220             u32 val;
10221 
10222             tg3_write_mem(tp, offset + j, test_pattern[i]);
10223             tg3_read_mem(tp, offset + j, &val);
10224             if (val != test_pattern[i])
10225                 return -EIO;
10226         }
10227     }
10228     return 0;
10229 }
10230 
10231 static int tg3_test_memory(struct tg3 *tp)
10232 {
10233     static struct mem_entry {
10234         u32 offset;
10235         u32 len;
10236     } mem_tbl_570x[] = {
10237         { 0x00000000, 0x00b50},
10238         { 0x00002000, 0x1c000},
10239         { 0xffffffff, 0x00000}
10240     }, mem_tbl_5705[] = {
10241         { 0x00000100, 0x0000c},
10242         { 0x00000200, 0x00008},
10243         { 0x00004000, 0x00800},
10244         { 0x00006000, 0x01000},
10245         { 0x00008000, 0x02000},
10246         { 0x00010000, 0x0e000},
10247         { 0xffffffff, 0x00000}
10248     }, mem_tbl_5755[] = {
10249         { 0x00000200, 0x00008},
10250         { 0x00004000, 0x00800},
10251         { 0x00006000, 0x00800},
10252         { 0x00008000, 0x02000},
10253         { 0x00010000, 0x0c000},
10254         { 0xffffffff, 0x00000}
10255     }, mem_tbl_5906[] = {
10256         { 0x00000200, 0x00008},
10257         { 0x00004000, 0x00400},
10258         { 0x00006000, 0x00400},
10259         { 0x00008000, 0x01000},
10260         { 0x00010000, 0x01000},
10261         { 0xffffffff, 0x00000}
10262     };
10263     struct mem_entry *mem_tbl;
10264     int err = 0;
10265     int i;
10266 
10267     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS)
10268         mem_tbl = mem_tbl_5755;
10269     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
10270         mem_tbl = mem_tbl_5906;
10271     else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)
10272         mem_tbl = mem_tbl_5705;
10273     else
10274         mem_tbl = mem_tbl_570x;
10275 
10276     for (i = 0; mem_tbl[i].offset != 0xffffffff; i++) {
10277         if ((err = tg3_do_mem_test(tp, mem_tbl[i].offset,
10278             mem_tbl[i].len)) != 0)
10279             break;
10280     }
10281 
10282     return err;
10283 }
10284 
10285 #define TG3_MAC_LOOPBACK    0
10286 #define TG3_PHY_LOOPBACK    1
10287 
10288 static int tg3_run_loopback(struct tg3 *tp, int loopback_mode)
10289 {
10290     u32 mac_mode, rx_start_idx, rx_idx, tx_idx, opaque_key;
10291     u32 desc_idx, coal_now;
10292     struct sk_buff *skb, *rx_skb;
10293     u8 *tx_data;
10294     dma_addr_t map;
10295     int num_pkts, tx_len, rx_len, i, err;
10296     struct tg3_rx_buffer_desc *desc;
10297     struct tg3_napi *tnapi, *rnapi;
10298     struct tg3_rx_prodring_set *tpr = &tp->prodring[0];
10299 
10300     if (tp->irq_cnt > 1) {
10301         tnapi = &tp->napi[1];
10302         rnapi = &tp->napi[1];
10303     } else {
10304         tnapi = &tp->napi[0];
10305         rnapi = &tp->napi[0];
10306     }
10307     coal_now = tnapi->coal_now | rnapi->coal_now;
10308 
10309     if (loopback_mode == TG3_MAC_LOOPBACK) {
10310         /* HW errata - mac loopback fails in some cases on 5780.
10311          * Normal traffic and PHY loopback are not affected by
10312          * errata.
10313          */
10314         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5780)
10315             return 0;
10316 
10317         mac_mode = (tp->mac_mode & ~MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MASK) |
10318                MAC_MODE_PORT_INT_LPBACK;
10319         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
10320             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_LINK_POLARITY;
10321         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY)
10322             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MII;
10323         else
10324             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_GMII;
10325         tw32(MAC_MODE, mac_mode);
10326     } else if (loopback_mode == TG3_PHY_LOOPBACK) {
10327         u32 val;
10328 
10329         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) {
10330             tg3_phy_fet_toggle_apd(tp, false);
10331             val = BMCR_LOOPBACK | BMCR_FULLDPLX | BMCR_SPEED100;
10332         } else
10333             val = BMCR_LOOPBACK | BMCR_FULLDPLX | BMCR_SPEED1000;
10334 
10335         tg3_phy_toggle_automdix(tp, 0);
10336 
10337         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_BMCR, val);
10338         udelay(40);
10339 
10340         mac_mode = tp->mac_mode & ~MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MASK;
10341         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) {
10342             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
10343                 tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_FET_PTEST, 0x1800);
10344             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_MII;
10345         } else
10346             mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_PORT_MODE_GMII;
10347 
10348         /* reset to prevent losing 1st rx packet intermittently */
10349         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES) {
10350             tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, RX_MODE_RESET);
10351             udelay(10);
10352             tw32_f(MAC_RX_MODE, tp->rx_mode);
10353         }
10354         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700) {
10355             if ((tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) == PHY_ID_BCM5401)
10356                 mac_mode &= ~MAC_MODE_LINK_POLARITY;
10357             else if ((tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) == PHY_ID_BCM5411)
10358                 mac_mode |= MAC_MODE_LINK_POLARITY;
10359             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL,
10360                      MII_TG3_EXT_CTRL_LNK3_LED_MODE);
10361         }
10362         tw32(MAC_MODE, mac_mode);
10363     }
10364     else
10365         return -EINVAL;
10366 
10367     err = -EIO;
10368 
10369     tx_len = 1514;
10370     skb = netdev_alloc_skb(tp->dev, tx_len);
10371     if (!skb)
10372         return -ENOMEM;
10373 
10374     tx_data = skb_put(skb, tx_len);
10375     memcpy(tx_data, tp->dev->dev_addr, 6);
10376     memset(tx_data + 6, 0x0, 8);
10377 
10378     tw32(MAC_RX_MTU_SIZE, tx_len + 4);
10379 
10380     for (i = 14; i < tx_len; i++)
10381         tx_data[i] = (u8) (i & 0xff);
10382 
10383     map = pci_map_single(tp->pdev, skb->data, tx_len, PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
10384 
10385     tw32_f(HOSTCC_MODE, tp->coalesce_mode | HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE |
10386            rnapi->coal_now);
10387 
10388     udelay(10);
10389 
10390     rx_start_idx = rnapi->hw_status->idx[0].rx_producer;
10391 
10392     num_pkts = 0;
10393 
10394     tg3_set_txd(tnapi, tnapi->tx_prod, map, tx_len, 0, 1);
10395 
10396     tnapi->tx_prod++;
10397     num_pkts++;
10398 
10399     tw32_tx_mbox(tnapi->prodmbox, tnapi->tx_prod);
10400     tr32_mailbox(tnapi->prodmbox);
10401 
10402     udelay(10);
10403 
10404     /* 250 usec to allow enough time on some 10/100 Mbps devices.  */
10405     for (i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
10406         tw32_f(HOSTCC_MODE, tp->coalesce_mode | HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE |
10407                coal_now);
10408 
10409         udelay(10);
10410 
10411         tx_idx = tnapi->hw_status->idx[0].tx_consumer;
10412         rx_idx = rnapi->hw_status->idx[0].rx_producer;
10413         if ((tx_idx == tnapi->tx_prod) &&
10414             (rx_idx == (rx_start_idx + num_pkts)))
10415             break;
10416     }
10417 
10418     pci_unmap_single(tp->pdev, map, tx_len, PCI_DMA_TODEVICE);
10419     dev_kfree_skb(skb);
10420 
10421     if (tx_idx != tnapi->tx_prod)
10422         goto out;
10423 
10424     if (rx_idx != rx_start_idx + num_pkts)
10425         goto out;
10426 
10427     desc = &rnapi->rx_rcb[rx_start_idx];
10428     desc_idx = desc->opaque & RXD_OPAQUE_INDEX_MASK;
10429     opaque_key = desc->opaque & RXD_OPAQUE_RING_MASK;
10430     if (opaque_key != RXD_OPAQUE_RING_STD)
10431         goto out;
10432 
10433     if ((desc->err_vlan & RXD_ERR_MASK) != 0 &&
10434         (desc->err_vlan != RXD_ERR_ODD_NIBBLE_RCVD_MII))
10435         goto out;
10436 
10437     rx_len = ((desc->idx_len & RXD_LEN_MASK) >> RXD_LEN_SHIFT) - 4;
10438     if (rx_len != tx_len)
10439         goto out;
10440 
10441     rx_skb = tpr->rx_std_buffers[desc_idx].skb;
10442 
10443     map = pci_unmap_addr(&tpr->rx_std_buffers[desc_idx], mapping);
10444     pci_dma_sync_single_for_cpu(tp->pdev, map, rx_len, PCI_DMA_FROMDEVICE);
10445 
10446     for (i = 14; i < tx_len; i++) {
10447         if (*(rx_skb->data + i) != (u8) (i & 0xff))
10448             goto out;
10449     }
10450     err = 0;
10451 
10452     /* tg3_free_rings will unmap and free the rx_skb */
10453 out:
10454     return err;
10455 }
10456 
10457 #define TG3_MAC_LOOPBACK_FAILED     1
10458 #define TG3_PHY_LOOPBACK_FAILED     2
10459 #define TG3_LOOPBACK_FAILED     (TG3_MAC_LOOPBACK_FAILED |  \
10460                      TG3_PHY_LOOPBACK_FAILED)
10461 
10462 static int tg3_test_loopback(struct tg3 *tp)
10463 {
10464     int err = 0;
10465     u32 cpmuctrl = 0;
10466 
10467     if (!netif_running(tp->dev))
10468         return TG3_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
10469 
10470     err = tg3_reset_hw(tp, 1);
10471     if (err)
10472         return TG3_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
10473 
10474     /* Turn off gphy autopowerdown. */
10475     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_ENABLE_APD)
10476         tg3_phy_toggle_apd(tp, false);
10477 
10478     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT) {
10479         int i;
10480         u32 status;
10481 
10482         tw32(TG3_CPMU_MUTEX_REQ, CPMU_MUTEX_REQ_DRIVER);
10483 
10484         /* Wait for up to 40 microseconds to acquire lock. */
10485         for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
10486             status = tr32(TG3_CPMU_MUTEX_GNT);
10487             if (status == CPMU_MUTEX_GNT_DRIVER)
10488                 break;
10489             udelay(10);
10490         }
10491 
10492         if (status != CPMU_MUTEX_GNT_DRIVER)
10493             return TG3_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
10494 
10495         /* Turn off link-based power management. */
10496         cpmuctrl = tr32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL);
10497         tw32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL,
10498              cpmuctrl & ~(CPMU_CTRL_LINK_SPEED_MODE |
10499                   CPMU_CTRL_LINK_AWARE_MODE));
10500     }
10501 
10502     if (tg3_run_loopback(tp, TG3_MAC_LOOPBACK))
10503         err |= TG3_MAC_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
10504 
10505     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT) {
10506         tw32(TG3_CPMU_CTRL, cpmuctrl);
10507 
10508         /* Release the mutex */
10509         tw32(TG3_CPMU_MUTEX_GNT, CPMU_MUTEX_GNT_DRIVER);
10510     }
10511 
10512     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) &&
10513         !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB)) {
10514         if (tg3_run_loopback(tp, TG3_PHY_LOOPBACK))
10515             err |= TG3_PHY_LOOPBACK_FAILED;
10516     }
10517 
10518     /* Re-enable gphy autopowerdown. */
10519     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_ENABLE_APD)
10520         tg3_phy_toggle_apd(tp, true);
10521 
10522     return err;
10523 }
10524 
10525 static void tg3_self_test(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_test *etest,
10526               u64 *data)
10527 {
10528     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
10529 
10530     if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
10531         tg3_set_power_state(tp, PCI_D0);
10532 
10533     memset(data, 0, sizeof(u64) * TG3_NUM_TEST);
10534 
10535     if (tg3_test_nvram(tp) != 0) {
10536         etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
10537         data[0] = 1;
10538     }
10539     if (tg3_test_link(tp) != 0) {
10540         etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
10541         data[1] = 1;
10542     }
10543     if (etest->flags & ETH_TEST_FL_OFFLINE) {
10544         int err, err2 = 0, irq_sync = 0;
10545 
10546         if (netif_running(dev)) {
10547             tg3_phy_stop(tp);
10548             tg3_netif_stop(tp);
10549             irq_sync = 1;
10550         }
10551 
10552         tg3_full_lock(tp, irq_sync);
10553 
10554         tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SUSPEND, 1);
10555         err = tg3_nvram_lock(tp);
10556         tg3_halt_cpu(tp, RX_CPU_BASE);
10557         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
10558             tg3_halt_cpu(tp, TX_CPU_BASE);
10559         if (!err)
10560             tg3_nvram_unlock(tp);
10561 
10562         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES)
10563             tg3_phy_reset(tp);
10564 
10565         if (tg3_test_registers(tp) != 0) {
10566             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
10567             data[2] = 1;
10568         }
10569         if (tg3_test_memory(tp) != 0) {
10570             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
10571             data[3] = 1;
10572         }
10573         if ((data[4] = tg3_test_loopback(tp)) != 0)
10574             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
10575 
10576         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
10577 
10578         if (tg3_test_interrupt(tp) != 0) {
10579             etest->flags |= ETH_TEST_FL_FAILED;
10580             data[5] = 1;
10581         }
10582 
10583         tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
10584 
10585         tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
10586         if (netif_running(dev)) {
10587             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
10588             err2 = tg3_restart_hw(tp, 1);
10589             if (!err2)
10590                 tg3_netif_start(tp);
10591         }
10592 
10593         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
10594 
10595         if (irq_sync && !err2)
10596             tg3_phy_start(tp);
10597     }
10598     if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
10599         tg3_set_power_state(tp, PCI_D3hot);
10600 
10601 }
10602 
10603 static int tg3_ioctl(struct net_device *dev, struct ifreq *ifr, int cmd)
10604 {
10605     struct mii_ioctl_data *data = if_mii(ifr);
10606     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
10607     int err;
10608 
10609     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
10610         if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED))
10611             return -EAGAIN;
10612         return phy_mii_ioctl(tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR], data, cmd);
10613     }
10614 
10615     switch(cmd) {
10616     case SIOCGMIIPHY:
10617         data->phy_id = tp->phy_addr;
10618 
10619         /* fallthru */
10620     case SIOCGMIIREG: {
10621         u32 mii_regval;
10622 
10623         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES)
10624             break;          /* We have no PHY */
10625 
10626         if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
10627             return -EAGAIN;
10628 
10629         spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
10630         err = tg3_readphy(tp, data->reg_num & 0x1f, &mii_regval);
10631         spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
10632 
10633         data->val_out = mii_regval;
10634 
10635         return err;
10636     }
10637 
10638     case SIOCSMIIREG:
10639         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES)
10640             break;          /* We have no PHY */
10641 
10642         if (tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power)
10643             return -EAGAIN;
10644 
10645         spin_lock_bh(&tp->lock);
10646         err = tg3_writephy(tp, data->reg_num & 0x1f, data->val_in);
10647         spin_unlock_bh(&tp->lock);
10648 
10649         return err;
10650 
10651     default:
10652         /* do nothing */
10653         break;
10654     }
10655     return -EOPNOTSUPP;
10656 }
10657 
10658 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
10659 static void tg3_vlan_rx_register(struct net_device *dev, struct vlan_group *grp)
10660 {
10661     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
10662 
10663     if (!netif_running(dev)) {
10664         tp->vlgrp = grp;
10665         return;
10666     }
10667 
10668     tg3_netif_stop(tp);
10669 
10670     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
10671 
10672     tp->vlgrp = grp;
10673 
10674     /* Update RX_MODE_KEEP_VLAN_TAG bit in RX_MODE register. */
10675     __tg3_set_rx_mode(dev);
10676 
10677     tg3_netif_start(tp);
10678 
10679     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
10680 }
10681 #endif
10682 
10683 static int tg3_get_coalesce(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_coalesce *ec)
10684 {
10685     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
10686 
10687     memcpy(ec, &tp->coal, sizeof(*ec));
10688     return 0;
10689 }
10690 
10691 static int tg3_set_coalesce(struct net_device *dev, struct ethtool_coalesce *ec)
10692 {
10693     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
10694     u32 max_rxcoal_tick_int = 0, max_txcoal_tick_int = 0;
10695     u32 max_stat_coal_ticks = 0, min_stat_coal_ticks = 0;
10696 
10697     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS)) {
10698         max_rxcoal_tick_int = MAX_RXCOAL_TICK_INT;
10699         max_txcoal_tick_int = MAX_TXCOAL_TICK_INT;
10700         max_stat_coal_ticks = MAX_STAT_COAL_TICKS;
10701         min_stat_coal_ticks = MIN_STAT_COAL_TICKS;
10702     }
10703 
10704     if ((ec->rx_coalesce_usecs > MAX_RXCOL_TICKS) ||
10705         (ec->tx_coalesce_usecs > MAX_TXCOL_TICKS) ||
10706         (ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames > MAX_RXMAX_FRAMES) ||
10707         (ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames > MAX_TXMAX_FRAMES) ||
10708         (ec->rx_coalesce_usecs_irq > max_rxcoal_tick_int) ||
10709         (ec->tx_coalesce_usecs_irq > max_txcoal_tick_int) ||
10710         (ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames_irq > MAX_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT) ||
10711         (ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames_irq > MAX_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT) ||
10712         (ec->stats_block_coalesce_usecs > max_stat_coal_ticks) ||
10713         (ec->stats_block_coalesce_usecs < min_stat_coal_ticks))
10714         return -EINVAL;
10715 
10716     /* No rx interrupts will be generated if both are zero */
10717     if ((ec->rx_coalesce_usecs == 0) &&
10718         (ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames == 0))
10719         return -EINVAL;
10720 
10721     /* No tx interrupts will be generated if both are zero */
10722     if ((ec->tx_coalesce_usecs == 0) &&
10723         (ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames == 0))
10724         return -EINVAL;
10725 
10726     /* Only copy relevant parameters, ignore all others. */
10727     tp->coal.rx_coalesce_usecs = ec->rx_coalesce_usecs;
10728     tp->coal.tx_coalesce_usecs = ec->tx_coalesce_usecs;
10729     tp->coal.rx_max_coalesced_frames = ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames;
10730     tp->coal.tx_max_coalesced_frames = ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames;
10731     tp->coal.rx_coalesce_usecs_irq = ec->rx_coalesce_usecs_irq;
10732     tp->coal.tx_coalesce_usecs_irq = ec->tx_coalesce_usecs_irq;
10733     tp->coal.rx_max_coalesced_frames_irq = ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames_irq;
10734     tp->coal.tx_max_coalesced_frames_irq = ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames_irq;
10735     tp->coal.stats_block_coalesce_usecs = ec->stats_block_coalesce_usecs;
10736 
10737     if (netif_running(dev)) {
10738         tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
10739         __tg3_set_coalesce(tp, &tp->coal);
10740         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
10741     }
10742     return 0;
10743 }
10744 
10745 static const struct ethtool_ops tg3_ethtool_ops = {
10746     .get_settings       = tg3_get_settings,
10747     .set_settings       = tg3_set_settings,
10748     .get_drvinfo        = tg3_get_drvinfo,
10749     .get_regs_len       = tg3_get_regs_len,
10750     .get_regs       = tg3_get_regs,
10751     .get_wol        = tg3_get_wol,
10752     .set_wol        = tg3_set_wol,
10753     .get_msglevel       = tg3_get_msglevel,
10754     .set_msglevel       = tg3_set_msglevel,
10755     .nway_reset     = tg3_nway_reset,
10756     .get_link       = ethtool_op_get_link,
10757     .get_eeprom_len     = tg3_get_eeprom_len,
10758     .get_eeprom     = tg3_get_eeprom,
10759     .set_eeprom     = tg3_set_eeprom,
10760     .get_ringparam      = tg3_get_ringparam,
10761     .set_ringparam      = tg3_set_ringparam,
10762     .get_pauseparam     = tg3_get_pauseparam,
10763     .set_pauseparam     = tg3_set_pauseparam,
10764     .get_rx_csum        = tg3_get_rx_csum,
10765     .set_rx_csum        = tg3_set_rx_csum,
10766     .set_tx_csum        = tg3_set_tx_csum,
10767     .set_sg         = ethtool_op_set_sg,
10768     .set_tso        = tg3_set_tso,
10769     .self_test      = tg3_self_test,
10770     .get_strings        = tg3_get_strings,
10771     .phys_id        = tg3_phys_id,
10772     .get_ethtool_stats  = tg3_get_ethtool_stats,
10773     .get_coalesce       = tg3_get_coalesce,
10774     .set_coalesce       = tg3_set_coalesce,
10775     .get_sset_count     = tg3_get_sset_count,
10776 };
10777 
10778 static void __devinit tg3_get_eeprom_size(struct tg3 *tp)
10779 {
10780     u32 cursize, val, magic;
10781 
10782     tp->nvram_size = EEPROM_CHIP_SIZE;
10783 
10784     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0, &magic) != 0)
10785         return;
10786 
10787     if ((magic != TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC) &&
10788         ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW_MSK) != TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW) &&
10789         ((magic & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW_MSK) != TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW))
10790         return;
10791 
10792     /*
10793      * Size the chip by reading offsets at increasing powers of two.
10794      * When we encounter our validation signature, we know the addressing
10795      * has wrapped around, and thus have our chip size.
10796      */
10797     cursize = 0x10;
10798 
10799     while (cursize < tp->nvram_size) {
10800         if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, cursize, &val) != 0)
10801             return;
10802 
10803         if (val == magic)
10804             break;
10805 
10806         cursize <<= 1;
10807     }
10808 
10809     tp->nvram_size = cursize;
10810 }
10811 
10812 static void __devinit tg3_get_nvram_size(struct tg3 *tp)
10813 {
10814     u32 val;
10815 
10816     if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM) ||
10817         tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0, &val) != 0)
10818         return;
10819 
10820     /* Selfboot format */
10821     if (val != TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC) {
10822         tg3_get_eeprom_size(tp);
10823         return;
10824     }
10825 
10826     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0xf0, &val) == 0) {
10827         if (val != 0) {
10828             /* This is confusing.  We want to operate on the
10829              * 16-bit value at offset 0xf2.  The tg3_nvram_read()
10830              * call will read from NVRAM and byteswap the data
10831              * according to the byteswapping settings for all
10832              * other register accesses.  This ensures the data we
10833              * want will always reside in the lower 16-bits.
10834              * However, the data in NVRAM is in LE format, which
10835              * means the data from the NVRAM read will always be
10836              * opposite the endianness of the CPU.  The 16-bit
10837              * byteswap then brings the data to CPU endianness.
10838              */
10839             tp->nvram_size = swab16((u16)(val & 0x0000ffff)) * 1024;
10840             return;
10841         }
10842     }
10843     tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_512KB;
10844 }
10845 
10846 static void __devinit tg3_get_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
10847 {
10848     u32 nvcfg1;
10849 
10850     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
10851     if (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_FLASHIF_ENAB) {
10852         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
10853     } else {
10854         nvcfg1 &= ~NVRAM_CFG1_COMPAT_BYPASS;
10855         tw32(NVRAM_CFG1, nvcfg1);
10856     }
10857 
10858     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5750) ||
10859         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)) {
10860         switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_VENDOR_MASK) {
10861         case FLASH_VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_BUFFERED:
10862             tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10863             tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT45DB0X1B_PAGE_SIZE;
10864             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10865             break;
10866         case FLASH_VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_UNBUFFERED:
10867             tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10868             tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT25F512_PAGE_SIZE;
10869             break;
10870         case FLASH_VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM:
10871             tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10872             tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT24C512_CHIP_SIZE;
10873             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10874             break;
10875         case FLASH_VENDOR_ST:
10876             tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
10877             tp->nvram_pagesize = ST_M45PEX0_PAGE_SIZE;
10878             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10879             break;
10880         case FLASH_VENDOR_SAIFUN:
10881             tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_SAIFUN;
10882             tp->nvram_pagesize = SAIFUN_SA25F0XX_PAGE_SIZE;
10883             break;
10884         case FLASH_VENDOR_SST_SMALL:
10885         case FLASH_VENDOR_SST_LARGE:
10886             tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_SST;
10887             tp->nvram_pagesize = SST_25VF0X0_PAGE_SIZE;
10888             break;
10889         }
10890     } else {
10891         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10892         tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT45DB0X1B_PAGE_SIZE;
10893         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10894     }
10895 }
10896 
10897 static void __devinit tg3_nvram_get_pagesize(struct tg3 *tp, u32 nvmcfg1)
10898 {
10899     switch (nvmcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752PAGE_SIZE_MASK) {
10900     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_256:
10901         tp->nvram_pagesize = 256;
10902         break;
10903     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_512:
10904         tp->nvram_pagesize = 512;
10905         break;
10906     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_1K:
10907         tp->nvram_pagesize = 1024;
10908         break;
10909     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_2K:
10910         tp->nvram_pagesize = 2048;
10911         break;
10912     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_4K:
10913         tp->nvram_pagesize = 4096;
10914         break;
10915     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_264:
10916         tp->nvram_pagesize = 264;
10917         break;
10918     case FLASH_5752PAGE_SIZE_528:
10919         tp->nvram_pagesize = 528;
10920         break;
10921     }
10922 }
10923 
10924 static void __devinit tg3_get_5752_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
10925 {
10926     u32 nvcfg1;
10927 
10928     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
10929 
10930     /* NVRAM protection for TPM */
10931     if (nvcfg1 & (1 << 27))
10932         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PROTECTED_NVRAM;
10933 
10934     switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
10935     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM_64KHZ:
10936     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM_376KHZ:
10937         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10938         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10939         break;
10940     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_BUFFERED:
10941         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10942         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10943         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
10944         break;
10945     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE10:
10946     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE20:
10947     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE40:
10948         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
10949         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10950         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
10951         break;
10952     }
10953 
10954     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_FLASH) {
10955         tg3_nvram_get_pagesize(tp, nvcfg1);
10956     } else {
10957         /* For eeprom, set pagesize to maximum eeprom size */
10958         tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT24C512_CHIP_SIZE;
10959 
10960         nvcfg1 &= ~NVRAM_CFG1_COMPAT_BYPASS;
10961         tw32(NVRAM_CFG1, nvcfg1);
10962     }
10963 }
10964 
10965 static void __devinit tg3_get_5755_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
10966 {
10967     u32 nvcfg1, protect = 0;
10968 
10969     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
10970 
10971     /* NVRAM protection for TPM */
10972     if (nvcfg1 & (1 << 27)) {
10973         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PROTECTED_NVRAM;
10974         protect = 1;
10975     }
10976 
10977     nvcfg1 &= NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK;
10978     switch (nvcfg1) {
10979     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_1:
10980     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_2:
10981     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_3:
10982     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_5:
10983         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
10984         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
10985         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
10986         tp->nvram_pagesize = 264;
10987         if (nvcfg1 == FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_1 ||
10988             nvcfg1 == FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_5)
10989             tp->nvram_size = (protect ? 0x3e200 :
10990                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_512KB);
10991         else if (nvcfg1 == FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_2)
10992             tp->nvram_size = (protect ? 0x1f200 :
10993                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB);
10994         else
10995             tp->nvram_size = (protect ? 0x1f200 :
10996                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB);
10997         break;
10998     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE10:
10999     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE20:
11000     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE40:
11001         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
11002         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11003         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11004         tp->nvram_pagesize = 256;
11005         if (nvcfg1 == FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE10)
11006             tp->nvram_size = (protect ?
11007                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_64KB :
11008                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB);
11009         else if (nvcfg1 == FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE20)
11010             tp->nvram_size = (protect ?
11011                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_64KB :
11012                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB);
11013         else
11014             tp->nvram_size = (protect ?
11015                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB :
11016                       TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_512KB);
11017         break;
11018     }
11019 }
11020 
11021 static void __devinit tg3_get_5787_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
11022 {
11023     u32 nvcfg1;
11024 
11025     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
11026 
11027     switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11028     case FLASH_5787VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM_64KHZ:
11029     case FLASH_5787VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM_376KHZ:
11030     case FLASH_5787VENDOR_MICRO_EEPROM_64KHZ:
11031     case FLASH_5787VENDOR_MICRO_EEPROM_376KHZ:
11032         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11033         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11034         tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT24C512_CHIP_SIZE;
11035 
11036         nvcfg1 &= ~NVRAM_CFG1_COMPAT_BYPASS;
11037         tw32(NVRAM_CFG1, nvcfg1);
11038         break;
11039     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_BUFFERED:
11040     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_1:
11041     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_2:
11042     case FLASH_5755VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_3:
11043         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11044         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11045         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11046         tp->nvram_pagesize = 264;
11047         break;
11048     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE10:
11049     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE20:
11050     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE40:
11051         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
11052         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11053         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11054         tp->nvram_pagesize = 256;
11055         break;
11056     }
11057 }
11058 
11059 static void __devinit tg3_get_5761_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
11060 {
11061     u32 nvcfg1, protect = 0;
11062 
11063     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
11064 
11065     /* NVRAM protection for TPM */
11066     if (nvcfg1 & (1 << 27)) {
11067         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PROTECTED_NVRAM;
11068         protect = 1;
11069     }
11070 
11071     nvcfg1 &= NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK;
11072     switch (nvcfg1) {
11073     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB021D:
11074     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB041D:
11075     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB081D:
11076     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB161D:
11077     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB021D:
11078     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB041D:
11079     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB081D:
11080     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB161D:
11081         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11082         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11083         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11084         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM_ADDR_TRANS;
11085         tp->nvram_pagesize = 256;
11086         break;
11087     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE20:
11088     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE40:
11089     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE80:
11090     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE16:
11091     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE20:
11092     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE40:
11093     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE80:
11094     case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE16:
11095         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
11096         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11097         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11098         tp->nvram_pagesize = 256;
11099         break;
11100     }
11101 
11102     if (protect) {
11103         tp->nvram_size = tr32(NVRAM_ADDR_LOCKOUT);
11104     } else {
11105         switch (nvcfg1) {
11106         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB161D:
11107         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB161D:
11108         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE16:
11109         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE16:
11110             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_2MB;
11111             break;
11112         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB081D:
11113         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB081D:
11114         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE80:
11115         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE80:
11116             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_1MB;
11117             break;
11118         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB041D:
11119         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB041D:
11120         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE40:
11121         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE40:
11122             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_512KB;
11123             break;
