11124         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB021D:
11125         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB021D:
11126         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE20:
11127         case FLASH_5761VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE20:
11128             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB;
11129             break;
11130         }
11131     }
11132 }
11133 
11134 static void __devinit tg3_get_5906_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
11135 {
11136     tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11137     tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11138     tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT24C512_CHIP_SIZE;
11139 }
11140 
11141 static void __devinit tg3_get_57780_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
11142 {
11143     u32 nvcfg1;
11144 
11145     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
11146 
11147     switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11148     case FLASH_5787VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM_376KHZ:
11149     case FLASH_5787VENDOR_MICRO_EEPROM_376KHZ:
11150         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11151         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11152         tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT24C512_CHIP_SIZE;
11153 
11154         nvcfg1 &= ~NVRAM_CFG1_COMPAT_BYPASS;
11155         tw32(NVRAM_CFG1, nvcfg1);
11156         return;
11157     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_BUFFERED:
11158     case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB011D:
11159     case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB011B:
11160     case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB021D:
11161     case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB021B:
11162     case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB041D:
11163     case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB041B:
11164         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11165         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11166         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11167 
11168         switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11169         case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ATMEL_FLASH_BUFFERED:
11170         case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB011D:
11171         case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB011B:
11172             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB;
11173             break;
11174         case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB021D:
11175         case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB021B:
11176             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB;
11177             break;
11178         case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB041D:
11179         case FLASH_57780VENDOR_ATMEL_AT45DB041B:
11180             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_512KB;
11181             break;
11182         }
11183         break;
11184     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE10:
11185     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE20:
11186     case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE40:
11187         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
11188         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11189         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11190 
11191         switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11192         case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE10:
11193             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB;
11194             break;
11195         case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE20:
11196             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB;
11197             break;
11198         case FLASH_5752VENDOR_ST_M45PE40:
11199             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_512KB;
11200             break;
11201         }
11202         break;
11203     default:
11204         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM;
11205         return;
11206     }
11207 
11208     tg3_nvram_get_pagesize(tp, nvcfg1);
11209     if (tp->nvram_pagesize != 264 && tp->nvram_pagesize != 528)
11210         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM_ADDR_TRANS;
11211 }
11212 
11213 
11214 static void __devinit tg3_get_5717_nvram_info(struct tg3 *tp)
11215 {
11216     u32 nvcfg1;
11217 
11218     nvcfg1 = tr32(NVRAM_CFG1);
11219 
11220     switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11221     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_EEPROM:
11222     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_MICRO_EEPROM:
11223         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11224         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11225         tp->nvram_pagesize = ATMEL_AT24C512_CHIP_SIZE;
11226 
11227         nvcfg1 &= ~NVRAM_CFG1_COMPAT_BYPASS;
11228         tw32(NVRAM_CFG1, nvcfg1);
11229         return;
11230     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB011D:
11231     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB011B:
11232     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB011D:
11233     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB021D:
11234     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB021B:
11235     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB021D:
11236     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_45USPT:
11237         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ATMEL;
11238         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11239         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11240 
11241         switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11242         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_MDB021D:
11243         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB021B:
11244         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ATMEL_ADB021D:
11245             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB;
11246             break;
11247         default:
11248             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB;
11249             break;
11250         }
11251         break;
11252     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_M_M25PE10:
11253     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_A_M25PE10:
11254     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE10:
11255     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE10:
11256     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_M_M25PE20:
11257     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_A_M25PE20:
11258     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE20:
11259     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE20:
11260     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_25USPT:
11261     case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_45USPT:
11262         tp->nvram_jedecnum = JEDEC_ST;
11263         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED;
11264         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_FLASH;
11265 
11266         switch (nvcfg1 & NVRAM_CFG1_5752VENDOR_MASK) {
11267         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_M_M25PE20:
11268         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_A_M25PE20:
11269         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_M_M45PE20:
11270         case FLASH_5717VENDOR_ST_A_M45PE20:
11271             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_256KB;
11272             break;
11273         default:
11274             tp->nvram_size = TG3_NVRAM_SIZE_128KB;
11275             break;
11276         }
11277         break;
11278     default:
11279         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM;
11280         return;
11281     }
11282 
11283     tg3_nvram_get_pagesize(tp, nvcfg1);
11284     if (tp->nvram_pagesize != 264 && tp->nvram_pagesize != 528)
11285         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM_ADDR_TRANS;
11286 }
11287 
11288 /* Chips other than 5700/5701 use the NVRAM for fetching info. */
11289 static void __devinit tg3_nvram_init(struct tg3 *tp)
11290 {
11291     tw32_f(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR,
11292          (EEPROM_ADDR_FSM_RESET |
11293           (EEPROM_DEFAULT_CLOCK_PERIOD <<
11294            EEPROM_ADDR_CLKPERD_SHIFT)));
11295 
11296     msleep(1);
11297 
11298     /* Enable seeprom accesses. */
11299     tw32_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL,
11300          tr32(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL) | GRC_LCLCTRL_AUTO_SEEPROM);
11301     udelay(100);
11302 
11303     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700 &&
11304         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5701) {
11305         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_NVRAM;
11306 
11307         if (tg3_nvram_lock(tp)) {
11308             printk(KERN_WARNING PFX "%s: Cannot get nvarm lock, "
11309                    "tg3_nvram_init failed.\n", tp->dev->name);
11310             return;
11311         }
11312         tg3_enable_nvram_access(tp);
11313 
11314         tp->nvram_size = 0;
11315 
11316         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5752)
11317             tg3_get_5752_nvram_info(tp);
11318         else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755)
11319             tg3_get_5755_nvram_info(tp);
11320         else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5787 ||
11321              GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 ||
11322              GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785)
11323             tg3_get_5787_nvram_info(tp);
11324         else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761)
11325             tg3_get_5761_nvram_info(tp);
11326         else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
11327             tg3_get_5906_nvram_info(tp);
11328         else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780)
11329             tg3_get_57780_nvram_info(tp);
11330         else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
11331             tg3_get_5717_nvram_info(tp);
11332         else
11333             tg3_get_nvram_info(tp);
11334 
11335         if (tp->nvram_size == 0)
11336             tg3_get_nvram_size(tp);
11337 
11338         tg3_disable_nvram_access(tp);
11339         tg3_nvram_unlock(tp);
11340 
11341     } else {
11342         tp->tg3_flags &= ~(TG3_FLAG_NVRAM | TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED);
11343 
11344         tg3_get_eeprom_size(tp);
11345     }
11346 }
11347 
11348 static int tg3_nvram_write_block_using_eeprom(struct tg3 *tp,
11349                     u32 offset, u32 len, u8 *buf)
11350 {
11351     int i, j, rc = 0;
11352     u32 val;
11353 
11354     for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4) {
11355         u32 addr;
11356         __be32 data;
11357 
11358         addr = offset + i;
11359 
11360         memcpy(&data, buf + i, 4);
11361 
11362         /*
11363          * The SEEPROM interface expects the data to always be opposite
11364          * the native endian format.  We accomplish this by reversing
11365          * all the operations that would have been performed on the
11366          * data from a call to tg3_nvram_read_be32().
11367          */
11368         tw32(GRC_EEPROM_DATA, swab32(be32_to_cpu(data)));
11369 
11370         val = tr32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR);
11371         tw32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR, val | EEPROM_ADDR_COMPLETE);
11372 
11373         val &= ~(EEPROM_ADDR_ADDR_MASK | EEPROM_ADDR_DEVID_MASK |
11374             EEPROM_ADDR_READ);
11375         tw32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR, val |
11376             (0 << EEPROM_ADDR_DEVID_SHIFT) |
11377             (addr & EEPROM_ADDR_ADDR_MASK) |
11378             EEPROM_ADDR_START |
11379             EEPROM_ADDR_WRITE);
11380 
11381         for (j = 0; j < 1000; j++) {
11382             val = tr32(GRC_EEPROM_ADDR);
11383 
11384             if (val & EEPROM_ADDR_COMPLETE)
11385                 break;
11386             msleep(1);
11387         }
11388         if (!(val & EEPROM_ADDR_COMPLETE)) {
11389             rc = -EBUSY;
11390             break;
11391         }
11392     }
11393 
11394     return rc;
11395 }
11396 
11397 /* offset and length are dword aligned */
11398 static int tg3_nvram_write_block_unbuffered(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, u32 len,
11399         u8 *buf)
11400 {
11401     int ret = 0;
11402     u32 pagesize = tp->nvram_pagesize;
11403     u32 pagemask = pagesize - 1;
11404     u32 nvram_cmd;
11405     u8 *tmp;
11406 
11407     tmp = kmalloc(pagesize, GFP_KERNEL);
11408     if (tmp == NULL)
11409         return -ENOMEM;
11410 
11411     while (len) {
11412         int j;
11413         u32 phy_addr, page_off, size;
11414 
11415         phy_addr = offset & ~pagemask;
11416 
11417         for (j = 0; j < pagesize; j += 4) {
11418             ret = tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, phy_addr + j,
11419                           (__be32 *) (tmp + j));
11420             if (ret)
11421                 break;
11422         }
11423         if (ret)
11424             break;
11425 
11426             page_off = offset & pagemask;
11427         size = pagesize;
11428         if (len < size)
11429             size = len;
11430 
11431         len -= size;
11432 
11433         memcpy(tmp + page_off, buf, size);
11434 
11435         offset = offset + (pagesize - page_off);
11436 
11437         tg3_enable_nvram_access(tp);
11438 
11439         /*
11440          * Before we can erase the flash page, we need
11441          * to issue a special "write enable" command.
11442          */
11443         nvram_cmd = NVRAM_CMD_WREN | NVRAM_CMD_GO | NVRAM_CMD_DONE;
11444 
11445         if (tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, nvram_cmd))
11446             break;
11447 
11448         /* Erase the target page */
11449         tw32(NVRAM_ADDR, phy_addr);
11450 
11451         nvram_cmd = NVRAM_CMD_GO | NVRAM_CMD_DONE | NVRAM_CMD_WR |
11452             NVRAM_CMD_FIRST | NVRAM_CMD_LAST | NVRAM_CMD_ERASE;
11453 
11454             if (tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, nvram_cmd))
11455             break;
11456 
11457         /* Issue another write enable to start the write. */
11458         nvram_cmd = NVRAM_CMD_WREN | NVRAM_CMD_GO | NVRAM_CMD_DONE;
11459 
11460         if (tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, nvram_cmd))
11461             break;
11462 
11463         for (j = 0; j < pagesize; j += 4) {
11464             __be32 data;
11465 
11466             data = *((__be32 *) (tmp + j));
11467 
11468             tw32(NVRAM_WRDATA, be32_to_cpu(data));
11469 
11470             tw32(NVRAM_ADDR, phy_addr + j);
11471 
11472             nvram_cmd = NVRAM_CMD_GO | NVRAM_CMD_DONE |
11473                 NVRAM_CMD_WR;
11474 
11475             if (j == 0)
11476                 nvram_cmd |= NVRAM_CMD_FIRST;
11477             else if (j == (pagesize - 4))
11478                 nvram_cmd |= NVRAM_CMD_LAST;
11479 
11480             if ((ret = tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, nvram_cmd)))
11481                 break;
11482         }
11483         if (ret)
11484             break;
11485     }
11486 
11487     nvram_cmd = NVRAM_CMD_WRDI | NVRAM_CMD_GO | NVRAM_CMD_DONE;
11488     tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, nvram_cmd);
11489 
11490     kfree(tmp);
11491 
11492     return ret;
11493 }
11494 
11495 /* offset and length are dword aligned */
11496 static int tg3_nvram_write_block_buffered(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, u32 len,
11497         u8 *buf)
11498 {
11499     int i, ret = 0;
11500 
11501     for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4, offset += 4) {
11502         u32 page_off, phy_addr, nvram_cmd;
11503         __be32 data;
11504 
11505         memcpy(&data, buf + i, 4);
11506         tw32(NVRAM_WRDATA, be32_to_cpu(data));
11507 
11508             page_off = offset % tp->nvram_pagesize;
11509 
11510         phy_addr = tg3_nvram_phys_addr(tp, offset);
11511 
11512         tw32(NVRAM_ADDR, phy_addr);
11513 
11514         nvram_cmd = NVRAM_CMD_GO | NVRAM_CMD_DONE | NVRAM_CMD_WR;
11515 
11516             if ((page_off == 0) || (i == 0))
11517             nvram_cmd |= NVRAM_CMD_FIRST;
11518         if (page_off == (tp->nvram_pagesize - 4))
11519             nvram_cmd |= NVRAM_CMD_LAST;
11520 
11521         if (i == (len - 4))
11522             nvram_cmd |= NVRAM_CMD_LAST;
11523 
11524         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5752 &&
11525             !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS) &&
11526             (tp->nvram_jedecnum == JEDEC_ST) &&
11527             (nvram_cmd & NVRAM_CMD_FIRST)) {
11528 
11529             if ((ret = tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp,
11530                 NVRAM_CMD_WREN | NVRAM_CMD_GO |
11531                 NVRAM_CMD_DONE)))
11532 
11533                 break;
11534         }
11535         if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_FLASH)) {
11536             /* We always do complete word writes to eeprom. */
11537             nvram_cmd |= (NVRAM_CMD_FIRST | NVRAM_CMD_LAST);
11538         }
11539 
11540         if ((ret = tg3_nvram_exec_cmd(tp, nvram_cmd)))
11541             break;
11542     }
11543     return ret;
11544 }
11545 
11546 /* offset and length are dword aligned */
11547 static int tg3_nvram_write_block(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset, u32 len, u8 *buf)
11548 {
11549     int ret;
11550 
11551     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT) {
11552         tw32_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl &
11553                ~GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1);
11554         udelay(40);
11555     }
11556 
11557     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM)) {
11558         ret = tg3_nvram_write_block_using_eeprom(tp, offset, len, buf);
11559     }
11560     else {
11561         u32 grc_mode;
11562 
11563         ret = tg3_nvram_lock(tp);
11564         if (ret)
11565             return ret;
11566 
11567         tg3_enable_nvram_access(tp);
11568         if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS) &&
11569             !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PROTECTED_NVRAM))
11570             tw32(NVRAM_WRITE1, 0x406);
11571 
11572         grc_mode = tr32(GRC_MODE);
11573         tw32(GRC_MODE, grc_mode | GRC_MODE_NVRAM_WR_ENABLE);
11574 
11575         if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_NVRAM_BUFFERED) ||
11576             !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_FLASH)) {
11577 
11578             ret = tg3_nvram_write_block_buffered(tp, offset, len,
11579                 buf);
11580         }
11581         else {
11582             ret = tg3_nvram_write_block_unbuffered(tp, offset, len,
11583                 buf);
11584         }
11585 
11586         grc_mode = tr32(GRC_MODE);
11587         tw32(GRC_MODE, grc_mode & ~GRC_MODE_NVRAM_WR_ENABLE);
11588 
11589         tg3_disable_nvram_access(tp);
11590         tg3_nvram_unlock(tp);
11591     }
11592 
11593     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT) {
11594         tw32_f(GRC_LOCAL_CTRL, tp->grc_local_ctrl);
11595         udelay(40);
11596     }
11597 
11598     return ret;
11599 }
11600 
11601 struct subsys_tbl_ent {
11602     u16 subsys_vendor, subsys_devid;
11603     u32 phy_id;
11604 };
11605 
11606 static struct subsys_tbl_ent subsys_id_to_phy_id[] = {
11607     /* Broadcom boards. */
11608     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x1644, PHY_ID_BCM5401 }, /* BCM95700A6 */
11609     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0001, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BCM95701A5 */
11610     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0002, PHY_ID_BCM8002 }, /* BCM95700T6 */
11611     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0003, 0 },          /* BCM95700A9 */
11612     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0005, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BCM95701T1 */
11613     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0006, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BCM95701T8 */
11614     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0007, 0 },          /* BCM95701A7 */
11615     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0008, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BCM95701A10 */
11616     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x8008, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BCM95701A12 */
11617     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x0009, PHY_ID_BCM5703 }, /* BCM95703Ax1 */
11618     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM, 0x8009, PHY_ID_BCM5703 }, /* BCM95703Ax2 */
11619 
11620     /* 3com boards. */
11621     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_3COM, 0x1000, PHY_ID_BCM5401 }, /* 3C996T */
11622     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_3COM, 0x1006, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* 3C996BT */
11623     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_3COM, 0x1004, 0 },      /* 3C996SX */
11624     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_3COM, 0x1007, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* 3C1000T */
11625     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_3COM, 0x1008, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* 3C940BR01 */
11626 
11627     /* DELL boards. */
11628     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL, 0x00d1, PHY_ID_BCM5401 }, /* VIPER */
11629     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL, 0x0106, PHY_ID_BCM5401 }, /* JAGUAR */
11630     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL, 0x0109, PHY_ID_BCM5411 }, /* MERLOT */
11631     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL, 0x010a, PHY_ID_BCM5411 }, /* SLIM_MERLOT */
11632 
11633     /* Compaq boards. */
11634     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_COMPAQ, 0x007c, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BANSHEE */
11635     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_COMPAQ, 0x009a, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* BANSHEE_2 */
11636     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_COMPAQ, 0x007d, 0 },          /* CHANGELING */
11637     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_COMPAQ, 0x0085, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* NC7780 */
11638     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_COMPAQ, 0x0099, PHY_ID_BCM5701 }, /* NC7780_2 */
11639 
11640     /* IBM boards. */
11641     { PCI_VENDOR_ID_IBM, 0x0281, 0 } /* IBM??? */
11642 };
11643 
11644 static inline struct subsys_tbl_ent *lookup_by_subsys(struct tg3 *tp)
11645 {
11646     int i;
11647 
11648     for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(subsys_id_to_phy_id); i++) {
11649         if ((subsys_id_to_phy_id[i].subsys_vendor ==
11650              tp->pdev->subsystem_vendor) &&
11651             (subsys_id_to_phy_id[i].subsys_devid ==
11652              tp->pdev->subsystem_device))
11653             return &subsys_id_to_phy_id[i];
11654     }
11655     return NULL;
11656 }
11657 
11658 static void __devinit tg3_get_eeprom_hw_cfg(struct tg3 *tp)
11659 {
11660     u32 val;
11661     u16 pmcsr;
11662 
11663     /* On some early chips the SRAM cannot be accessed in D3hot state,
11664      * so need make sure we're in D0.
11665      */
11666     pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, tp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL, &pmcsr);
11667     pmcsr &= ~PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK;
11668     pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, tp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL, pmcsr);
11669     msleep(1);
11670 
11671     /* Make sure register accesses (indirect or otherwise)
11672      * will function correctly.
11673      */
11674     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
11675                    tp->misc_host_ctrl);
11676 
11677     /* The memory arbiter has to be enabled in order for SRAM accesses
11678      * to succeed.  Normally on powerup the tg3 chip firmware will make
11679      * sure it is enabled, but other entities such as system netboot
11680      * code might disable it.
11681      */
11682     val = tr32(MEMARB_MODE);
11683     tw32(MEMARB_MODE, val | MEMARB_MODE_ENABLE);
11684 
11685     tp->phy_id = PHY_ID_INVALID;
11686     tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_1;
11687 
11688     /* Assume an onboard device and WOL capable by default.  */
11689     tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT | TG3_FLAG_WOL_CAP;
11690 
11691     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
11692         if (!(tr32(PCIE_TRANSACTION_CFG) & PCIE_TRANS_CFG_LOM)) {
11693             tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT;
11694             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC;
11695         }
11696         val = tr32(VCPU_CFGSHDW);
11697         if (val & VCPU_CFGSHDW_ASPM_DBNC)
11698             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_ASPM_WORKAROUND;
11699         if ((val & VCPU_CFGSHDW_WOL_ENABLE) &&
11700             (val & VCPU_CFGSHDW_WOL_MAGPKT))
11701             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE;
11702         goto done;
11703     }
11704 
11705     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_SIG, &val);
11706     if (val == NIC_SRAM_DATA_SIG_MAGIC) {
11707         u32 nic_cfg, led_cfg;
11708         u32 nic_phy_id, ver, cfg2 = 0, cfg4 = 0, eeprom_phy_id;
11709         int eeprom_phy_serdes = 0;
11710 
11711         tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG, &nic_cfg);
11712         tp->nic_sram_data_cfg = nic_cfg;
11713 
11714         tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_VER, &ver);
11715         ver >>= NIC_SRAM_DATA_VER_SHIFT;
11716         if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700) &&
11717             (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5701) &&
11718             (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5703) &&
11719             (ver > 0) && (ver < 0x100))
11720             tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_2, &cfg2);
11721 
11722         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785)
11723             tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_4, &cfg4);
11724 
11725         if ((nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_PHY_TYPE_MASK) ==
11726             NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_PHY_TYPE_FIBER)
11727             eeprom_phy_serdes = 1;
11728 
11729         tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_PHY_ID, &nic_phy_id);
11730         if (nic_phy_id != 0) {
11731             u32 id1 = nic_phy_id & NIC_SRAM_DATA_PHY_ID1_MASK;
11732             u32 id2 = nic_phy_id & NIC_SRAM_DATA_PHY_ID2_MASK;
11733 
11734             eeprom_phy_id  = (id1 >> 16) << 10;
11735             eeprom_phy_id |= (id2 & 0xfc00) << 16;
11736             eeprom_phy_id |= (id2 & 0x03ff) <<  0;
11737         } else
11738             eeprom_phy_id = 0;
11739 
11740         tp->phy_id = eeprom_phy_id;
11741         if (eeprom_phy_serdes) {
11742             if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)
11743                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_MII_SERDES;
11744             else
11745                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES;
11746         }
11747 
11748         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS)
11749             led_cfg = cfg2 & (NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_LED_MODE_MASK |
11750                     SHASTA_EXT_LED_MODE_MASK);
11751         else
11752             led_cfg = nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_LED_MODE_MASK;
11753 
11754         switch (led_cfg) {
11755         default:
11756         case NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_LED_MODE_PHY_1:
11757             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_1;
11758             break;
11759 
11760         case NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_LED_MODE_PHY_2:
11761             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_2;
11762             break;
11763 
11764         case NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_LED_MODE_MAC:
11765             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_MAC;
11766 
11767             /* Default to PHY_1_MODE if 0 (MAC_MODE) is
11768              * read on some older 5700/5701 bootcode.
11769              */
11770             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) ==
11771                 ASIC_REV_5700 ||
11772                 GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) ==
11773                 ASIC_REV_5701)
11774                 tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_1;
11775 
11776             break;
11777 
11778         case SHASTA_EXT_LED_SHARED:
11779             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_SHARED;
11780             if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5750_A0 &&
11781                 tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5750_A1)
11782                 tp->led_ctrl |= (LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_1 |
11783                          LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_2);
11784             break;
11785 
11786         case SHASTA_EXT_LED_MAC:
11787             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_SHASTA_MAC;
11788             break;
11789 
11790         case SHASTA_EXT_LED_COMBO:
11791             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_COMBO;
11792             if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5750_A0)
11793                 tp->led_ctrl |= (LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_1 |
11794                          LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_2);
11795             break;
11796 
11797         }
11798 
11799         if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
11800              GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701) &&
11801             tp->pdev->subsystem_vendor == PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL)
11802             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_2;
11803 
11804         if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5784_AX)
11805             tp->led_ctrl = LED_CTRL_MODE_PHY_1;
11806 
11807         if (nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_EEPROM_WP) {
11808             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT;
11809             if ((tp->pdev->subsystem_vendor ==
11810                  PCI_VENDOR_ID_ARIMA) &&
11811                 (tp->pdev->subsystem_device == 0x205a ||
11812                  tp->pdev->subsystem_device == 0x2063))
11813                 tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT;
11814         } else {
11815             tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT;
11816             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC;
11817         }
11818 
11819         if (nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_ASF_ENABLE) {
11820             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF;
11821             if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS)
11822                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_ASF_NEW_HANDSHAKE;
11823         }
11824 
11825         if ((nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_APE_ENABLE) &&
11826             (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS))
11827             tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE;
11828 
11829         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES &&
11830             !(nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_FIBER_WOL))
11831             tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_WOL_CAP;
11832 
11833         if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_CAP) &&
11834             (nic_cfg & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_WOL_ENABLE))
11835             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE;
11836 
11837         if (cfg2 & (1 << 17))
11838             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_CAPACITIVE_COUPLING;
11839 
11840         /* serdes signal pre-emphasis in register 0x590 set by */
11841         /* bootcode if bit 18 is set */
11842         if (cfg2 & (1 << 18))
11843             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_SERDES_PREEMPHASIS;
11844 
11845         if (((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 &&
11846               GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5784_AX)) &&
11847             (cfg2 & NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_2_APD_EN))
11848             tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_PHY_ENABLE_APD;
11849 
11850         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) {
11851             u32 cfg3;
11852 
11853             tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_DATA_CFG_3, &cfg3);
11854             if (cfg3 & NIC_SRAM_ASPM_DEBOUNCE)
11855                 tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_ASPM_WORKAROUND;
11856         }
11857 
11858         if (cfg4 & NIC_SRAM_RGMII_STD_IBND_DISABLE)
11859             tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_RGMII_STD_IBND_DISABLE;
11860         if (cfg4 & NIC_SRAM_RGMII_EXT_IBND_RX_EN)
11861             tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_RX_EN;
11862         if (cfg4 & NIC_SRAM_RGMII_EXT_IBND_TX_EN)
11863             tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_RGMII_EXT_IBND_TX_EN;
11864     }
11865 done:
11866     device_init_wakeup(&tp->pdev->dev, tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_CAP);
11867     device_set_wakeup_enable(&tp->pdev->dev,
11868                  tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_WOL_ENABLE);
11869 }
11870 
11871 static int __devinit tg3_issue_otp_command(struct tg3 *tp, u32 cmd)
11872 {
11873     int i;
11874     u32 val;
11875 
11876     tw32(OTP_CTRL, cmd | OTP_CTRL_OTP_CMD_START);
11877     tw32(OTP_CTRL, cmd);
11878 
11879     /* Wait for up to 1 ms for command to execute. */
11880     for (i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
11881         val = tr32(OTP_STATUS);
11882         if (val & OTP_STATUS_CMD_DONE)
11883             break;
11884         udelay(10);
11885     }
11886 
11887     return (val & OTP_STATUS_CMD_DONE) ? 0 : -EBUSY;
11888 }
11889 
11890 /* Read the gphy configuration from the OTP region of the chip.  The gphy
11891  * configuration is a 32-bit value that straddles the alignment boundary.
11892  * We do two 32-bit reads and then shift and merge the results.
11893  */
11894 static u32 __devinit tg3_read_otp_phycfg(struct tg3 *tp)
11895 {
11896     u32 bhalf_otp, thalf_otp;
11897 
11898     tw32(OTP_MODE, OTP_MODE_OTP_THRU_GRC);
11899 
11900     if (tg3_issue_otp_command(tp, OTP_CTRL_OTP_CMD_INIT))
11901         return 0;
11902 
11903     tw32(OTP_ADDRESS, OTP_ADDRESS_MAGIC1);
11904 
11905     if (tg3_issue_otp_command(tp, OTP_CTRL_OTP_CMD_READ))
11906         return 0;
11907 
11908     thalf_otp = tr32(OTP_READ_DATA);
11909 
11910     tw32(OTP_ADDRESS, OTP_ADDRESS_MAGIC2);
11911 
11912     if (tg3_issue_otp_command(tp, OTP_CTRL_OTP_CMD_READ))
11913         return 0;
11914 
11915     bhalf_otp = tr32(OTP_READ_DATA);
11916 
11917     return ((thalf_otp & 0x0000ffff) << 16) | (bhalf_otp >> 16);
11918 }
11919 
11920 static int __devinit tg3_phy_probe(struct tg3 *tp)
11921 {
11922     u32 hw_phy_id_1, hw_phy_id_2;
11923     u32 hw_phy_id, hw_phy_id_masked;
11924     int err;
11925 
11926     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB)
11927         return tg3_phy_init(tp);
11928 
11929     /* Reading the PHY ID register can conflict with ASF
11930      * firmware access to the PHY hardware.
11931      */
11932     err = 0;
11933     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) ||
11934         (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)) {
11935         hw_phy_id = hw_phy_id_masked = PHY_ID_INVALID;
11936     } else {
11937         /* Now read the physical PHY_ID from the chip and verify
11938          * that it is sane.  If it doesn't look good, we fall back
11939          * to either the hard-coded table based PHY_ID and failing
11940          * that the value found in the eeprom area.
11941          */
11942         err |= tg3_readphy(tp, MII_PHYSID1, &hw_phy_id_1);
11943         err |= tg3_readphy(tp, MII_PHYSID2, &hw_phy_id_2);
11944 
11945         hw_phy_id  = (hw_phy_id_1 & 0xffff) << 10;
11946         hw_phy_id |= (hw_phy_id_2 & 0xfc00) << 16;
11947         hw_phy_id |= (hw_phy_id_2 & 0x03ff) <<  0;
11948 
11949         hw_phy_id_masked = hw_phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK;
11950     }
11951 
11952     if (!err && KNOWN_PHY_ID(hw_phy_id_masked)) {
11953         tp->phy_id = hw_phy_id;
11954         if (hw_phy_id_masked == PHY_ID_BCM8002)
11955             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES;
11956         else
11957             tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES;
11958     } else {
11959         if (tp->phy_id != PHY_ID_INVALID) {
11960             /* Do nothing, phy ID already set up in
11961              * tg3_get_eeprom_hw_cfg().
11962              */
11963         } else {
11964             struct subsys_tbl_ent *p;
11965 
11966             /* No eeprom signature?  Try the hardcoded
11967              * subsys device table.
11968              */
11969             p = lookup_by_subsys(tp);
11970             if (!p)
11971                 return -ENODEV;
11972 
11973             tp->phy_id = p->phy_id;
11974             if (!tp->phy_id ||
11975                 tp->phy_id == PHY_ID_BCM8002)
11976                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES;
11977         }
11978     }
11979 
11980     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES) &&
11981         !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE) &&
11982         !(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF)) {
11983         u32 bmsr, adv_reg, tg3_ctrl, mask;
11984 
11985         tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMSR, &bmsr);
11986         if (!tg3_readphy(tp, MII_BMSR, &bmsr) &&
11987             (bmsr & BMSR_LSTATUS))
11988             goto skip_phy_reset;
11989 
11990         err = tg3_phy_reset(tp);
11991         if (err)
11992             return err;
11993 
11994         adv_reg = (ADVERTISE_10HALF | ADVERTISE_10FULL |
11995                ADVERTISE_100HALF | ADVERTISE_100FULL |
11996                ADVERTISE_CSMA | ADVERTISE_PAUSE_CAP);
11997         tg3_ctrl = 0;
11998         if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY)) {
11999             tg3_ctrl = (MII_TG3_CTRL_ADV_1000_HALF |
12000                     MII_TG3_CTRL_ADV_1000_FULL);
12001             if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_A0 ||
12002                 tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_B0)
12003                 tg3_ctrl |= (MII_TG3_CTRL_AS_MASTER |
12004                          MII_TG3_CTRL_ENABLE_AS_MASTER);
12005         }
12006 
12007         mask = (ADVERTISED_10baseT_Half | ADVERTISED_10baseT_Full |
12008             ADVERTISED_100baseT_Half | ADVERTISED_100baseT_Full |
12009             ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Half | ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full);
12010         if (!tg3_copper_is_advertising_all(tp, mask)) {
12011             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_ADVERTISE, adv_reg);
12012 
12013             if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY))
12014                 tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_CTRL, tg3_ctrl);
12015 
12016             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_BMCR,
12017                      BMCR_ANENABLE | BMCR_ANRESTART);
12018         }
12019         tg3_phy_set_wirespeed(tp);
12020 
12021         tg3_writephy(tp, MII_ADVERTISE, adv_reg);
12022         if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY))
12023             tg3_writephy(tp, MII_TG3_CTRL, tg3_ctrl);
12024     }
12025 
12026 skip_phy_reset:
12027     if ((tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) == PHY_ID_BCM5401) {
12028         err = tg3_init_5401phy_dsp(tp);
12029         if (err)
12030             return err;
12031     }
12032 
12033     if (!err && ((tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) == PHY_ID_BCM5401)) {
12034         err = tg3_init_5401phy_dsp(tp);
12035     }
12036 
12037     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES)
12038         tp->link_config.advertising =
12039             (ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Half |
12040              ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full |
12041              ADVERTISED_Autoneg |
12042              ADVERTISED_FIBRE);
12043     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY)
12044         tp->link_config.advertising &=
12045             ~(ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Half |
12046               ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full);
12047 
12048     return err;
12049 }
12050 
12051 static void __devinit tg3_read_partno(struct tg3 *tp)
12052 {
12053     unsigned char vpd_data[256];   /* in little-endian format */
12054     unsigned int i;
12055     u32 magic;
12056 
12057     if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM) ||
12058         tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0x0, &magic))
12059         goto out_not_found;
12060 
12061     if (magic == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC) {
12062         for (i = 0; i < 256; i += 4) {
12063             u32 tmp;
12064 
12065             /* The data is in little-endian format in NVRAM.
12066              * Use the big-endian read routines to preserve
12067              * the byte order as it exists in NVRAM.
12068              */
12069             if (tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, 0x100 + i, &tmp))
12070                 goto out_not_found;
12071 
12072             memcpy(&vpd_data[i], &tmp, sizeof(tmp));
12073         }
12074     } else {
12075         int vpd_cap;
12076 
12077         vpd_cap = pci_find_capability(tp->pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_VPD);
12078         for (i = 0; i < 256; i += 4) {
12079             u32 tmp, j = 0;
12080             __le32 v;
12081             u16 tmp16;
12082 
12083             pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, vpd_cap + PCI_VPD_ADDR,
12084                           i);
12085             while (j++ < 100) {
12086                 pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, vpd_cap +
12087                              PCI_VPD_ADDR, &tmp16);
12088                 if (tmp16 & 0x8000)
12089                     break;
12090                 msleep(1);
12091             }
12092             if (!(tmp16 & 0x8000))
12093                 goto out_not_found;
12094 
12095             pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, vpd_cap + PCI_VPD_DATA,
12096                           &tmp);
12097             v = cpu_to_le32(tmp);
12098             memcpy(&vpd_data[i], &v, sizeof(v));
12099         }
12100     }
12101 
12102     /* Now parse and find the part number. */
12103     for (i = 0; i < 254; ) {
12104         unsigned char val = vpd_data[i];
12105         unsigned int block_end;
12106 
12107         if (val == 0x82 || val == 0x91) {
12108             i = (i + 3 +
12109                  (vpd_data[i + 1] +
12110                   (vpd_data[i + 2] << 8)));
12111             continue;
12112         }
12113 
12114         if (val != 0x90)
12115             goto out_not_found;
12116 
12117         block_end = (i + 3 +
12118                  (vpd_data[i + 1] +
12119                   (vpd_data[i + 2] << 8)));
12120         i += 3;
12121 
12122         if (block_end > 256)
12123             goto out_not_found;
12124 
12125         while (i < (block_end - 2)) {
12126             if (vpd_data[i + 0] == 'P' &&
12127                 vpd_data[i + 1] == 'N') {
12128                 int partno_len = vpd_data[i + 2];
12129 
12130                 i += 3;
12131                 if (partno_len > 24 || (partno_len + i) > 256)
12132                     goto out_not_found;
12133 
12134                 memcpy(tp->board_part_number,
12135                        &vpd_data[i], partno_len);
12136 
12137                 /* Success. */
12138                 return;
12139             }
12140             i += 3 + vpd_data[i + 2];
12141         }
12142 
12143         /* Part number not found. */
12144         goto out_not_found;
12145     }
12146 
12147 out_not_found:
12148     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
12149         strcpy(tp->board_part_number, "BCM95906");
12150     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 &&
12151          tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_57780)
12152         strcpy(tp->board_part_number, "BCM57780");
12153     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 &&
12154          tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_57760)
12155         strcpy(tp->board_part_number, "BCM57760");
12156     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 &&
12157          tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_57790)
12158         strcpy(tp->board_part_number, "BCM57790");
12159     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 &&
12160          tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_57788)
12161         strcpy(tp->board_part_number, "BCM57788");
12162     else
12163         strcpy(tp->board_part_number, "none");
12164 }
12165 
12166 static int __devinit tg3_fw_img_is_valid(struct tg3 *tp, u32 offset)
12167 {
12168     u32 val;
12169 
12170     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset, &val) ||
12171         (val & 0xfc000000) != 0x0c000000 ||
12172         tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset + 4, &val) ||
12173         val != 0)
12174         return 0;
12175 
12176     return 1;
12177 }
12178 
12179 static void __devinit tg3_read_bc_ver(struct tg3 *tp)
12180 {
12181     u32 val, offset, start, ver_offset;
12182     int i;
12183     bool newver = false;
12184 
12185     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0xc, &offset) ||
12186         tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0x4, &start))
12187         return;
12188 
12189     offset = tg3_nvram_logical_addr(tp, offset);
12190 
12191     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset, &val))
12192         return;
12193 
12194     if ((val & 0xfc000000) == 0x0c000000) {
12195         if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset + 4, &val))
12196             return;
12197 
12198         if (val == 0)
12199             newver = true;
12200     }
12201 
12202     if (newver) {
12203         if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset + 8, &ver_offset))
12204             return;
12205 
12206         offset = offset + ver_offset - start;
12207         for (i = 0; i < 16; i += 4) {
12208             __be32 v;
12209             if (tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, offset + i, &v))
12210                 return;
12211 
12212             memcpy(tp->fw_ver + i, &v, sizeof(v));
12213         }
12214     } else {
12215         u32 major, minor;
12216 
12217         if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, TG3_NVM_PTREV_BCVER, &ver_offset))
12218             return;
12219 
12220         major = (ver_offset & TG3_NVM_BCVER_MAJMSK) >>
12221             TG3_NVM_BCVER_MAJSFT;
12222         minor = ver_offset & TG3_NVM_BCVER_MINMSK;
12223         snprintf(&tp->fw_ver[0], 32, "v%d.%02d", major, minor);
12224     }
12225 }
12226 
12227 static void __devinit tg3_read_hwsb_ver(struct tg3 *tp)
12228 {
12229     u32 val, major, minor;
12230 
12231     /* Use native endian representation */
12232     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, TG3_NVM_HWSB_CFG1, &val))
12233         return;
12234 
12235     major = (val & TG3_NVM_HWSB_CFG1_MAJMSK) >>
12236         TG3_NVM_HWSB_CFG1_MAJSFT;
12237     minor = (val & TG3_NVM_HWSB_CFG1_MINMSK) >>
12238         TG3_NVM_HWSB_CFG1_MINSFT;
12239 
12240     snprintf(&tp->fw_ver[0], 32, "sb v%d.%02d", major, minor);
12241 }
12242 
12243 static void __devinit tg3_read_sb_ver(struct tg3 *tp, u32 val)
12244 {
12245     u32 offset, major, minor, build;
12246 
12247     tp->fw_ver[0] = 's';
12248     tp->fw_ver[1] = 'b';
12249     tp->fw_ver[2] = '\0';
12250 
12251     if ((val & TG3_EEPROM_SB_FORMAT_MASK) != TG3_EEPROM_SB_FORMAT_1)
12252         return;
12253 
12254     switch (val & TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_MASK) {
12255     case TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_0:
12256         offset = TG3_EEPROM_SB_F1R0_EDH_OFF;
12257         break;
12258     case TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_2:
12259         offset = TG3_EEPROM_SB_F1R2_EDH_OFF;
12260         break;
12261     case TG3_EEPROM_SB_REVISION_3:
12262         offset = TG3_EEPROM_SB_F1R3_EDH_OFF;
12263         break;
12264     default:
12265         return;
12266     }
12267 
12268     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset, &val))
12269         return;
12270 
12271     build = (val & TG3_EEPROM_SB_EDH_BLD_MASK) >>
12272         TG3_EEPROM_SB_EDH_BLD_SHFT;
12273     major = (val & TG3_EEPROM_SB_EDH_MAJ_MASK) >>
12274         TG3_EEPROM_SB_EDH_MAJ_SHFT;
12275     minor =  val & TG3_EEPROM_SB_EDH_MIN_MASK;
12276 
12277     if (minor > 99 || build > 26)
12278         return;
12279 
12280     snprintf(&tp->fw_ver[2], 30, " v%d.%02d", major, minor);
12281 
12282     if (build > 0) {
12283         tp->fw_ver[8] = 'a' + build - 1;
12284         tp->fw_ver[9] = '\0';
12285     }
12286 }
12287 
12288 static void __devinit tg3_read_mgmtfw_ver(struct tg3 *tp)
12289 {
12290     u32 val, offset, start;
12291     int i, vlen;
12292 
12293     for (offset = TG3_NVM_DIR_START;
12294          offset < TG3_NVM_DIR_END;
12295          offset += TG3_NVM_DIRENT_SIZE) {
12296         if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset, &val))
12297             return;
12298 
12299         if ((val >> TG3_NVM_DIRTYPE_SHIFT) == TG3_NVM_DIRTYPE_ASFINI)
12300             break;
12301     }
12302 
12303     if (offset == TG3_NVM_DIR_END)
12304         return;
12305 
12306     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS))
12307         start = 0x08000000;
12308     else if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset - 4, &start))
12309         return;
12310 
12311     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset + 4, &offset) ||
12312         !tg3_fw_img_is_valid(tp, offset) ||
12313         tg3_nvram_read(tp, offset + 8, &val))
12314         return;
12315 
12316     offset += val - start;
12317 
12318     vlen = strlen(tp->fw_ver);
12319 
12320     tp->fw_ver[vlen++] = ',';
12321     tp->fw_ver[vlen++] = ' ';
12322 
12323     for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
12324         __be32 v;
12325         if (tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, offset, &v))
12326             return;
12327 
12328         offset += sizeof(v);
12329 
12330         if (vlen > TG3_VER_SIZE - sizeof(v)) {
12331             memcpy(&tp->fw_ver[vlen], &v, TG3_VER_SIZE - vlen);
12332             break;
12333         }
12334 
12335         memcpy(&tp->fw_ver[vlen], &v, sizeof(v));
12336         vlen += sizeof(v);
12337     }
12338 }
12339 
12340 static void __devinit tg3_read_dash_ver(struct tg3 *tp)
12341 {
12342     int vlen;
12343     u32 apedata;
12344 
12345     if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE) ||
12346         !(tp->tg3_flags  & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF))
12347         return;
12348 
12349     apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_SEG_SIG);
12350     if (apedata != APE_SEG_SIG_MAGIC)
12351         return;
12352 
12353     apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_FW_STATUS);
12354     if (!(apedata & APE_FW_STATUS_READY))
12355         return;
12356 
12357     apedata = tg3_ape_read32(tp, TG3_APE_FW_VERSION);
12358 
12359     vlen = strlen(tp->fw_ver);
12360 
12361     snprintf(&tp->fw_ver[vlen], TG3_VER_SIZE - vlen, " DASH v%d.%d.%d.%d",
12362          (apedata & APE_FW_VERSION_MAJMSK) >> APE_FW_VERSION_MAJSFT,
12363          (apedata & APE_FW_VERSION_MINMSK) >> APE_FW_VERSION_MINSFT,
12364          (apedata & APE_FW_VERSION_REVMSK) >> APE_FW_VERSION_REVSFT,
12365          (apedata & APE_FW_VERSION_BLDMSK));
12366 }
12367 
12368 static void __devinit tg3_read_fw_ver(struct tg3 *tp)
12369 {
12370     u32 val;
12371 
12372     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM) {
12373         tp->fw_ver[0] = 's';
12374         tp->fw_ver[1] = 'b';
12375         tp->fw_ver[2] = '\0';
12376 
12377         return;
12378     }
12379 
12380     if (tg3_nvram_read(tp, 0, &val))
12381         return;
12382 
12383     if (val == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC)
12384         tg3_read_bc_ver(tp);
12385     else if ((val & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW_MSK) == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_FW)
12386         tg3_read_sb_ver(tp, val);
12387     else if ((val & TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW_MSK) == TG3_EEPROM_MAGIC_HW)
12388         tg3_read_hwsb_ver(tp);
12389     else
12390         return;
12391 
12392     if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) ||
12393          (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE))
12394         return;
12395 
12396     tg3_read_mgmtfw_ver(tp);
12397 
12398     tp->fw_ver[TG3_VER_SIZE - 1] = 0;
12399 }
12400 
12401 static struct pci_dev * __devinit tg3_find_peer(struct tg3 *);
12402 
12403 static int __devinit tg3_get_invariants(struct tg3 *tp)
12404 {
12405     static struct pci_device_id write_reorder_chipsets[] = {
12406         { PCI_DEVICE(PCI_VENDOR_ID_AMD,
12407                      PCI_DEVICE_ID_AMD_FE_GATE_700C) },
12408         { PCI_DEVICE(PCI_VENDOR_ID_AMD,
12409                      PCI_DEVICE_ID_AMD_8131_BRIDGE) },
12410         { PCI_DEVICE(PCI_VENDOR_ID_VIA,
12411                  PCI_DEVICE_ID_VIA_8385_0) },
12412         { },
12413     };
12414     u32 misc_ctrl_reg;
12415     u32 pci_state_reg, grc_misc_cfg;
12416     u32 val;
12417     u16 pci_cmd;
12418     int err;
12419 
12420     /* Force memory write invalidate off.  If we leave it on,
12421      * then on 5700_BX chips we have to enable a workaround.
12422      * The workaround is to set the TG3PCI_DMA_RW_CTRL boundary
12423      * to match the cacheline size.  The Broadcom driver have this
12424      * workaround but turns MWI off all the times so never uses
12425      * it.  This seems to suggest that the workaround is insufficient.
12426      */
12427     pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &pci_cmd);
12428     pci_cmd &= ~PCI_COMMAND_INVALIDATE;
12429     pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, pci_cmd);
12430 
12431     /* It is absolutely critical that TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL
12432      * has the register indirect write enable bit set before
12433      * we try to access any of the MMIO registers.  It is also
12434      * critical that the PCI-X hw workaround situation is decided
12435      * before that as well.
12436      */
12437     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
12438                   &misc_ctrl_reg);
12439 
12440     tp->pci_chip_rev_id = (misc_ctrl_reg >>
12441                    MISC_HOST_CTRL_CHIPREV_SHIFT);
12442     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_USE_PROD_ID_REG) {
12443         u32 prod_id_asic_rev;
12444 
12445         if (tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_5717C ||
12446             tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_5717S ||
12447             tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_5718C ||
12448             tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_5718S)
12449             pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev,
12450                           TG3PCI_GEN2_PRODID_ASICREV,
12451                           &prod_id_asic_rev);
12452         else
12453             pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PRODID_ASICREV,
12454                           &prod_id_asic_rev);
12455 
12456         tp->pci_chip_rev_id = prod_id_asic_rev;
12457     }
12458 
12459     /* Wrong chip ID in 5752 A0. This code can be removed later
12460      * as A0 is not in production.
12461      */
12462     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5752_A0_HW)
12463         tp->pci_chip_rev_id = CHIPREV_ID_5752_A0;
12464 
12465     /* If we have 5702/03 A1 or A2 on certain ICH chipsets,
12466      * we need to disable memory and use config. cycles
12467      * only to access all registers. The 5702/03 chips
12468      * can mistakenly decode the special cycles from the
12469      * ICH chipsets as memory write cycles, causing corruption
12470      * of register and memory space. Only certain ICH bridges
12471      * will drive special cycles with non-zero data during the
12472      * address phase which can fall within the 5703's address
12473      * range. This is not an ICH bug as the PCI spec allows
12474      * non-zero address during special cycles. However, only
12475      * these ICH bridges are known to drive non-zero addresses
12476      * during special cycles.
12477      *
12478      * Since special cycles do not cross PCI bridges, we only
12479      * enable this workaround if the 5703 is on the secondary
12480      * bus of these ICH bridges.
12481      */
12482     if ((tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5703_A1) ||
12483         (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5703_A2)) {
12484         static struct tg3_dev_id {
12485             u32 vendor;
12486             u32 device;
12487             u32 rev;
12488         } ich_chipsets[] = {
12489             { PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, PCI_DEVICE_ID_INTEL_82801AA_8,
12490               PCI_ANY_ID },
12491             { PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, PCI_DEVICE_ID_INTEL_82801AB_8,
12492               PCI_ANY_ID },
12493             { PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, PCI_DEVICE_ID_INTEL_82801BA_11,
12494               0xa },
12495             { PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, PCI_DEVICE_ID_INTEL_82801BA_6,
12496               PCI_ANY_ID },
12497             { },
12498         };
12499         struct tg3_dev_id *pci_id = &ich_chipsets[0];
12500         struct pci_dev *bridge = NULL;
12501 
12502         while (pci_id->vendor != 0) {
12503             bridge = pci_get_device(pci_id->vendor, pci_id->device,
12504                         bridge);
12505             if (!bridge) {
12506                 pci_id++;
12507                 continue;
12508             }
12509             if (pci_id->rev != PCI_ANY_ID) {
12510                 if (bridge->revision > pci_id->rev)
12511                     continue;
12512             }
12513             if (bridge->subordinate &&
12514                 (bridge->subordinate->number ==
12515                  tp->pdev->bus->number)) {
12516 
12517                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_ICH_WORKAROUND;
12518                 pci_dev_put(bridge);
12519                 break;
12520             }
12521         }
12522     }
12523 
12524     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701)) {
12525         static struct tg3_dev_id {
12526             u32 vendor;
12527             u32 device;
12528         } bridge_chipsets[] = {
12529             { PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, PCI_DEVICE_ID_INTEL_PXH_0 },
12530             { PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL, PCI_DEVICE_ID_INTEL_PXH_1 },
12531             { },
12532         };
12533         struct tg3_dev_id *pci_id = &bridge_chipsets[0];
12534         struct pci_dev *bridge = NULL;
12535 
12536         while (pci_id->vendor != 0) {
12537             bridge = pci_get_device(pci_id->vendor,
12538                         pci_id->device,
12539                         bridge);
12540             if (!bridge) {
12541                 pci_id++;
12542                 continue;
12543             }
12544             if (bridge->subordinate &&
12545                 (bridge->subordinate->number <=
12546                  tp->pdev->bus->number) &&
12547                 (bridge->subordinate->subordinate >=
12548                  tp->pdev->bus->number)) {
12549                 tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_5701_DMA_BUG;
12550                 pci_dev_put(bridge);
12551                 break;
12552             }
12553         }
12554     }
12555 
12556     /* The EPB bridge inside 5714, 5715, and 5780 cannot support
12557      * DMA addresses > 40-bit. This bridge may have other additional
12558      * 57xx devices behind it in some 4-port NIC designs for example.
12559      * Any tg3 device found behind the bridge will also need the 40-bit
12560      * DMA workaround.
12561      */
12562     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5780 ||
12563         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5714) {
12564         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS;
12565         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_40BIT_DMA_BUG;
12566         tp->msi_cap = pci_find_capability(tp->pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_MSI);
12567     }
12568     else {
12569         struct pci_dev *bridge = NULL;
12570 
12571         do {
12572             bridge = pci_get_device(PCI_VENDOR_ID_SERVERWORKS,
12573                         PCI_DEVICE_ID_SERVERWORKS_EPB,
12574                         bridge);
12575             if (bridge && bridge->subordinate &&
12576                 (bridge->subordinate->number <=
12577                  tp->pdev->bus->number) &&
12578                 (bridge->subordinate->subordinate >=
12579                  tp->pdev->bus->number)) {
12580                 tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_40BIT_DMA_BUG;
12581                 pci_dev_put(bridge);
12582                 break;
12583             }
12584         } while (bridge);
12585     }
12586 
12587     /* Initialize misc host control in PCI block. */
12588     tp->misc_host_ctrl |= (misc_ctrl_reg &
12589                    MISC_HOST_CTRL_CHIPREV);
12590     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
12591                    tp->misc_host_ctrl);
12592 
12593     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704 ||
12594         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5714 ||
12595         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
12596         tp->pdev_peer = tg3_find_peer(tp);
12597 
12598     /* Intentionally exclude ASIC_REV_5906 */
12599     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755 ||
12600         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5787 ||
12601         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 ||
12602         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761 ||
12603         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
12604         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 ||
12605         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
12606         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS;
12607 
12608     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5750 ||
12609         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5752 ||
12610         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906 ||
12611         (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS) ||
12612         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS))
12613         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS;
12614 
12615     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705) ||
12616         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS))
12617         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS;
12618 
12619     /* 5700 B0 chips do not support checksumming correctly due
12620      * to hardware bugs.
12621      */
12622     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5700_B0)
12623         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_BROKEN_CHECKSUMS;
12624     else {
12625         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_RX_CHECKSUMS;
12626         tp->dev->features |= NETIF_F_IP_CSUM | NETIF_F_SG;
12627         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS)
12628             tp->dev->features |= NETIF_F_IPV6_CSUM;
12629     }
12630 
12631     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5750_PLUS) {
12632         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSI;
12633         if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5750_AX ||
12634             GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5750_BX ||
12635             (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5714 &&
12636              tp->pci_chip_rev_id <= CHIPREV_ID_5714_A2 &&
12637              tp->pdev_peer == tp->pdev))
12638             tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSI;
12639 
12640         if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS) ||
12641             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
12642             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_2;
12643             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_1SHOT_MSI;
12644         } else {
12645             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_1 | TG3_FLG2_TSO_BUG;
12646             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) ==
12647                 ASIC_REV_5750 &&
12648                     tp->pci_chip_rev_id >= CHIPREV_ID_5750_C2)
12649                 tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_TSO_BUG;
12650         }
12651     }
12652 
12653     tp->irq_max = 1;
12654 
12655 #ifdef TG3_NAPI
12656     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717) {
12657         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSIX;
12658         tp->irq_max = TG3_IRQ_MAX_VECS;
12659     }
12660 #endif
12661 
12662     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) ||
12663          (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS) ||
12664         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
12665         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_CAPABLE;
12666 
12667     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PCISTATE,
12668                   &pci_state_reg);
12669 
12670     tp->pcie_cap = pci_find_capability(tp->pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_EXP);
12671     if (tp->pcie_cap != 0) {
12672         u16 lnkctl;
12673 
12674         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS;
12675 
12676         pcie_set_readrq(tp->pdev, 4096);
12677 
12678         pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev,
12679                      tp->pcie_cap + PCI_EXP_LNKCTL,
12680                      &lnkctl);
12681         if (lnkctl & PCI_EXP_LNKCTL_CLKREQ_EN) {
12682             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
12683                 tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_2;
12684             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 ||
12685                 GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761 ||
12686                 tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_57780_A0 ||
12687                 tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_57780_A1)
12688                 tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_CLKREQ_BUG;
12689         }
12690     } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785) {
12691         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS;
12692     } else if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) ||
12693            (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)) {
12694         tp->pcix_cap = pci_find_capability(tp->pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_PCIX);
12695         if (!tp->pcix_cap) {
12696             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot find PCI-X "
12697                         "capability, aborting.\n");
12698             return -EIO;
12699         }
12700 
12701         if (!(pci_state_reg & PCISTATE_CONV_PCI_MODE))
12702             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE;
12703     }
12704 
12705     /* If we have an AMD 762 or VIA K8T800 chipset, write
12706      * reordering to the mailbox registers done by the host
12707      * controller can cause major troubles.  We read back from
12708      * every mailbox register write to force the writes to be
12709      * posted to the chip in order.
12710      */
12711     if (pci_dev_present(write_reorder_chipsets) &&
12712         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS))
12713         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_MBOX_WRITE_REORDER;
12714 
12715     pci_read_config_byte(tp->pdev, PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE,
12716                  &tp->pci_cacheline_sz);
12717     pci_read_config_byte(tp->pdev, PCI_LATENCY_TIMER,
12718                  &tp->pci_lat_timer);
12719     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 &&
12720         tp->pci_lat_timer < 64) {
12721         tp->pci_lat_timer = 64;
12722         pci_write_config_byte(tp->pdev, PCI_LATENCY_TIMER,
12723                       tp->pci_lat_timer);
12724     }
12725 
12726     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5700_BX) {
12727         /* 5700 BX chips need to have their TX producer index
12728          * mailboxes written twice to workaround a bug.
12729          */
12730         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_TXD_MBOX_HWBUG;
12731 
12732         /* If we are in PCI-X mode, enable register write workaround.
12733          *
12734          * The workaround is to use indirect register accesses
12735          * for all chip writes not to mailbox registers.
12736          */
12737         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) {
12738             u32 pm_reg;
12739 
12740             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PCIX_TARGET_HWBUG;
12741 
12742             /* The chip can have it's power management PCI config
12743              * space registers clobbered due to this bug.
12744              * So explicitly force the chip into D0 here.
12745              */
12746             pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev,
12747                           tp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL,
12748                           &pm_reg);
12749             pm_reg &= ~PCI_PM_CTRL_STATE_MASK;
12750             pm_reg |= PCI_PM_CTRL_PME_ENABLE | 0 /* D0 */;
12751             pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev,
12752                            tp->pm_cap + PCI_PM_CTRL,
12753                            pm_reg);
12754 
12755             /* Also, force SERR#/PERR# in PCI command. */
12756             pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &pci_cmd);
12757             pci_cmd |= PCI_COMMAND_PARITY | PCI_COMMAND_SERR;
12758             pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, pci_cmd);
12759         }
12760     }
12761 
12762     if ((pci_state_reg & PCISTATE_BUS_SPEED_HIGH) != 0)
12763         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PCI_HIGH_SPEED;
12764     if ((pci_state_reg & PCISTATE_BUS_32BIT) != 0)
12765         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PCI_32BIT;
12766 
12767     /* Chip-specific fixup from Broadcom driver */
12768     if ((tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5704_A0) &&
12769         (!(pci_state_reg & PCISTATE_RETRY_SAME_DMA))) {
12770         pci_state_reg |= PCISTATE_RETRY_SAME_DMA;
12771         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PCISTATE, pci_state_reg);
12772     }
12773 
12774     /* Default fast path register access methods */
12775     tp->read32 = tg3_read32;
12776     tp->write32 = tg3_write32;
12777     tp->read32_mbox = tg3_read32;
12778     tp->write32_mbox = tg3_write32;
12779     tp->write32_tx_mbox = tg3_write32;
12780     tp->write32_rx_mbox = tg3_write32;
12781 
12782     /* Various workaround register access methods */
12783     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_TARGET_HWBUG)
12784         tp->write32 = tg3_write_indirect_reg32;
12785     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701 ||
12786          ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) &&
12787           tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5750_A0)) {
12788         /*
12789          * Back to back register writes can cause problems on these
12790          * chips, the workaround is to read back all reg writes
12791          * except those to mailbox regs.
12792          *
12793          * See tg3_write_indirect_reg32().
12794          */
12795         tp->write32 = tg3_write_flush_reg32;
12796     }
12797 
12798     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TXD_MBOX_HWBUG) ||
12799         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_MBOX_WRITE_REORDER)) {
12800         tp->write32_tx_mbox = tg3_write32_tx_mbox;
12801         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_MBOX_WRITE_REORDER)
12802             tp->write32_rx_mbox = tg3_write_flush_reg32;
12803     }
12804 
12805     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ICH_WORKAROUND) {
12806         tp->read32 = tg3_read_indirect_reg32;
12807         tp->write32 = tg3_write_indirect_reg32;
12808         tp->read32_mbox = tg3_read_indirect_mbox;
12809         tp->write32_mbox = tg3_write_indirect_mbox;
12810         tp->write32_tx_mbox = tg3_write_indirect_mbox;
12811         tp->write32_rx_mbox = tg3_write_indirect_mbox;
12812 
12813         iounmap(tp->regs);
12814         tp->regs = NULL;
12815 
12816         pci_read_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, &pci_cmd);
12817         pci_cmd &= ~PCI_COMMAND_MEMORY;
12818         pci_write_config_word(tp->pdev, PCI_COMMAND, pci_cmd);
12819     }
12820     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
12821         tp->read32_mbox = tg3_read32_mbox_5906;
12822         tp->write32_mbox = tg3_write32_mbox_5906;
12823         tp->write32_tx_mbox = tg3_write32_mbox_5906;
12824         tp->write32_rx_mbox = tg3_write32_mbox_5906;
12825     }
12826 
12827     if (tp->write32 == tg3_write_indirect_reg32 ||
12828         ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) &&
12829          (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
12830           GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701)))
12831         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_SRAM_USE_CONFIG;
12832 
12833     /* Get eeprom hw config before calling tg3_set_power_state().
12834      * In particular, the TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC flag must be
12835      * determined before calling tg3_set_power_state() so that
12836      * we know whether or not to switch out of Vaux power.
12837      * When the flag is set, it means that GPIO1 is used for eeprom
12838      * write protect and also implies that it is a LOM where GPIOs
12839      * are not used to switch power.
12840      */
12841     tg3_get_eeprom_hw_cfg(tp);
12842 
12843     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE) {
12844         /* Allow reads and writes to the
12845          * APE register and memory space.
12846          */
12847         pci_state_reg |= PCISTATE_ALLOW_APE_CTLSPC_WR |
12848                  PCISTATE_ALLOW_APE_SHMEM_WR;
12849         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PCISTATE,
12850                        pci_state_reg);
12851     }
12852 
12853     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 ||
12854         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761 ||
12855         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
12856         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 ||
12857         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
12858         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT;
12859 
12860     /* Set up tp->grc_local_ctrl before calling tg3_set_power_state().
12861      * GPIO1 driven high will bring 5700's external PHY out of reset.
12862      * It is also used as eeprom write protect on LOMs.
12863      */
12864     tp->grc_local_ctrl = GRC_LCLCTRL_INT_ON_ATTN | GRC_LCLCTRL_AUTO_SEEPROM;
12865     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700) ||
12866         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_EEPROM_WRITE_PROT))
12867         tp->grc_local_ctrl |= (GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE1 |
12868                        GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT1);
12869     /* Unused GPIO3 must be driven as output on 5752 because there
12870      * are no pull-up resistors on unused GPIO pins.
12871      */
12872     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5752)
12873         tp->grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE3;
12874 
12875     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755 ||
12876         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780)
12877         tp->grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_UART_SEL;
12878 
12879     if (tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5761 ||
12880         tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_5761S) {
12881         /* Turn off the debug UART. */
12882         tp->grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_UART_SEL;
12883         if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_NIC)
12884             /* Keep VMain power. */
12885             tp->grc_local_ctrl |= GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OE0 |
12886                           GRC_LCLCTRL_GPIO_OUTPUT0;
12887     }
12888 
12889     /* Force the chip into D0. */
12890     err = tg3_set_power_state(tp, PCI_D0);
12891     if (err) {
12892         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "(%s) transition to D0 failed\n",
12893                pci_name(tp->pdev));
12894         return err;
12895     }
12896 
12897     /* Derive initial jumbo mode from MTU assigned in
12898      * ether_setup() via the alloc_etherdev() call
12899      */
12900     if (tp->dev->mtu > ETH_DATA_LEN &&
12901         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS))
12902         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_JUMBO_RING_ENABLE;
12903 
12904     /* Determine WakeOnLan speed to use. */
12905     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
12906         tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_A0 ||
12907         tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_B0 ||
12908         tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_B2) {
12909         tp->tg3_flags &= ~(TG3_FLAG_WOL_SPEED_100MB);
12910     } else {
12911         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_WOL_SPEED_100MB;
12912     }
12913 
12914     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
12915         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET;
12916 
12917     /* A few boards don't want Ethernet@WireSpeed phy feature */
12918     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700) ||
12919         ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705) &&
12920          (tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5705_A0) &&
12921          (tp->pci_chip_rev_id != CHIPREV_ID_5705_A1)) ||
12922         (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) ||
12923         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES))
12924         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_NO_ETH_WIRE_SPEED;
12925 
12926     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5703_AX ||
12927         GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == CHIPREV_5704_AX)
12928         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_ADC_BUG;
12929     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5704_A0)
12930         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_5704_A0_BUG;
12931 
12932     if ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) &&
12933         !(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET) &&
12934         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5785 &&
12935         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_57780 &&
12936         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5717) {
12937         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755 ||
12938             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5787 ||
12939             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 ||
12940             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761) {
12941             if (tp->pdev->device != PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5756 &&
12942                 tp->pdev->device != PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5722)
12943                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_JITTER_BUG;
12944             if (tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5755M)
12945                 tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_ADJUST_TRIM;
12946         } else
12947             tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_PHY_BER_BUG;
12948     }
12949 
12950     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 &&
12951         GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5784_AX) {
12952         tp->phy_otp = tg3_read_otp_phycfg(tp);
12953         if (tp->phy_otp == 0)
12954             tp->phy_otp = TG3_OTP_DEFAULT;
12955     }
12956 
12957     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_CPMU_PRESENT)
12958         tp->mi_mode = MAC_MI_MODE_500KHZ_CONST;
12959     else
12960         tp->mi_mode = MAC_MI_MODE_BASE;
12961 
12962     tp->coalesce_mode = 0;
12963     if (GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5700_AX &&
12964         GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5700_BX)
12965         tp->coalesce_mode |= HOSTCC_MODE_32BYTE;
12966 
12967     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
12968         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780)
12969         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB;
12970 
12971     if ((tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_57780_A1 &&
12972          tr32(RCVLPC_STATS_ENABLE) & RCVLPC_STATSENAB_ASF_FIX) ||
12973         tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_57780_A0)
12974         tp->tg3_flags3 |= TG3_FLG3_TOGGLE_10_100_L1PLLPD;
12975 
12976     err = tg3_mdio_init(tp);
12977     if (err)
12978         return err;
12979 
12980     /* Initialize data/descriptor byte/word swapping. */
12981     val = tr32(GRC_MODE);
12982     val &= GRC_MODE_HOST_STACKUP;
12983     tw32(GRC_MODE, val | tp->grc_mode);
12984 
12985     tg3_switch_clocks(tp);
12986 
12987     /* Clear this out for sanity. */
12988     tw32(TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
12989 
12990     pci_read_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_PCISTATE,
12991                   &pci_state_reg);
12992     if ((pci_state_reg & PCISTATE_CONV_PCI_MODE) == 0 &&
12993         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_TARGET_HWBUG) == 0) {
12994         u32 chiprevid = GET_CHIP_REV_ID(tp->misc_host_ctrl);
12995 
12996         if (chiprevid == CHIPREV_ID_5701_A0 ||
12997             chiprevid == CHIPREV_ID_5701_B0 ||
12998             chiprevid == CHIPREV_ID_5701_B2 ||
12999             chiprevid == CHIPREV_ID_5701_B5) {
13000             void __iomem *sram_base;
13001 
13002             /* Write some dummy words into the SRAM status block
13003              * area, see if it reads back correctly.  If the return
13004              * value is bad, force enable the PCIX workaround.
13005              */
13006             sram_base = tp->regs + NIC_SRAM_WIN_BASE + NIC_SRAM_STATS_BLK;
13007 
13008             writel(0x00000000, sram_base);
13009             writel(0x00000000, sram_base + 4);
13010             writel(0xffffffff, sram_base + 4);
13011             if (readl(sram_base) != 0x00000000)
13012                 tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PCIX_TARGET_HWBUG;
13013         }
13014     }
13015 
13016     udelay(50);
13017     tg3_nvram_init(tp);
13018 
13019     grc_misc_cfg = tr32(GRC_MISC_CFG);
13020     grc_misc_cfg &= GRC_MISC_CFG_BOARD_ID_MASK;
13021 
13022     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705 &&
13023         (grc_misc_cfg == GRC_MISC_CFG_BOARD_ID_5788 ||
13024          grc_misc_cfg == GRC_MISC_CFG_BOARD_ID_5788M))
13025         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_IS_5788;
13026 
13027     if (!(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_5788) &&
13028         (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700))
13029         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS;
13030     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_TAGGED_STATUS) {
13031         tp->coalesce_mode |= (HOSTCC_MODE_CLRTICK_RXBD |
13032                       HOSTCC_MODE_CLRTICK_TXBD);
13033 
13034         tp->misc_host_ctrl |= MISC_HOST_CTRL_TAGGED_STATUS;
13035         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MISC_HOST_CTRL,
13036                        tp->misc_host_ctrl);
13037     }
13038 
13039     /* Preserve the APE MAC_MODE bits */
13040     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE)
13041         tp->mac_mode = tr32(MAC_MODE) |
13042                    MAC_MODE_APE_TX_EN | MAC_MODE_APE_RX_EN;
13043     else
13044         tp->mac_mode = TG3_DEF_MAC_MODE;
13045 
13046     /* these are limited to 10/100 only */
13047     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 &&
13048          (grc_misc_cfg == 0x8000 || grc_misc_cfg == 0x4000)) ||
13049         (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705 &&
13050          tp->pdev->vendor == PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM &&
13051          (tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5901 ||
13052           tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5901_2 ||
13053           tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5705F)) ||
13054         (tp->pdev->vendor == PCI_VENDOR_ID_BROADCOM &&
13055          (tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5751F ||
13056           tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5753F ||
13057           tp->pdev->device == PCI_DEVICE_ID_TIGON3_5787F)) ||
13058         tp->pdev->device == TG3PCI_DEVICE_TIGON3_57790 ||
13059         (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_IS_FET))
13060         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY;
13061 
13062     err = tg3_phy_probe(tp);
13063     if (err) {
13064         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "(%s) phy probe failed, err %d\n",
13065                pci_name(tp->pdev), err);
13066         /* ... but do not return immediately ... */
13067         tg3_mdio_fini(tp);
13068     }
13069 
13070     tg3_read_partno(tp);
13071     tg3_read_fw_ver(tp);
13072 
13073     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES) {
13074         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_USE_MI_INTERRUPT;
13075     } else {
13076         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700)
13077             tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_USE_MI_INTERRUPT;
13078         else
13079             tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_USE_MI_INTERRUPT;
13080     }
13081 
13082     /* 5700 {AX,BX} chips have a broken status block link
13083      * change bit implementation, so we must use the
13084      * status register in those cases.
13085      */
13086     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700)
13087         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG;
13088     else
13089         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG;
13090 
13091     /* The led_ctrl is set during tg3_phy_probe, here we might
13092      * have to force the link status polling mechanism based
13093      * upon subsystem IDs.
13094      */
13095     if (tp->pdev->subsystem_vendor == PCI_VENDOR_ID_DELL &&
13096         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701 &&
13097         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES)) {
13098         tp->tg3_flags |= (TG3_FLAG_USE_MI_INTERRUPT |
13099                   TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG);
13100     }
13101 
13102     /* For all SERDES we poll the MAC status register. */
13103     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PHY_SERDES)
13104         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_POLL_SERDES;
13105     else
13106         tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_POLL_SERDES;
13107 
13108     tp->rx_offset = NET_IP_ALIGN;
13109     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701 &&
13110         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) != 0)
13111         tp->rx_offset = 0;
13112 
13113     tp->rx_std_max_post = TG3_RX_RING_SIZE;
13114 
13115     /* Increment the rx prod index on the rx std ring by at most
13116      * 8 for these chips to workaround hw errata.
13117      */
13118     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5750 ||
