13119         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5752 ||
13120         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5755)
13121         tp->rx_std_max_post = 8;
13122 
13123     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ASPM_WORKAROUND)
13124         tp->pwrmgmt_thresh = tr32(PCIE_PWR_MGMT_THRESH) &
13125                      PCIE_PWR_MGMT_L1_THRESH_MSK;
13126 
13127     return err;
13128 }
13129 
13130 #ifdef CONFIG_SPARC
13131 static int __devinit tg3_get_macaddr_sparc(struct tg3 *tp)
13132 {
13133     struct net_device *dev = tp->dev;
13134     struct pci_dev *pdev = tp->pdev;
13135     struct device_node *dp = pci_device_to_OF_node(pdev);
13136     const unsigned char *addr;
13137     int len;
13138 
13139     addr = of_get_property(dp, "local-mac-address", &len);
13140     if (addr && len == 6) {
13141         memcpy(dev->dev_addr, addr, 6);
13142         memcpy(dev->perm_addr, dev->dev_addr, 6);
13143         return 0;
13144     }
13145     return -ENODEV;
13146 }
13147 
13148 static int __devinit tg3_get_default_macaddr_sparc(struct tg3 *tp)
13149 {
13150     struct net_device *dev = tp->dev;
13151 
13152     memcpy(dev->dev_addr, idprom->id_ethaddr, 6);
13153     memcpy(dev->perm_addr, idprom->id_ethaddr, 6);
13154     return 0;
13155 }
13156 #endif
13157 
13158 static int __devinit tg3_get_device_address(struct tg3 *tp)
13159 {
13160     struct net_device *dev = tp->dev;
13161     u32 hi, lo, mac_offset;
13162     int addr_ok = 0;
13163 
13164 #ifdef CONFIG_SPARC
13165     if (!tg3_get_macaddr_sparc(tp))
13166         return 0;
13167 #endif
13168 
13169     mac_offset = 0x7c;
13170     if ((GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) ||
13171         (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5780_CLASS)) {
13172         if (tr32(TG3PCI_DUAL_MAC_CTRL) & DUAL_MAC_CTRL_ID)
13173             mac_offset = 0xcc;
13174         if (tg3_nvram_lock(tp))
13175             tw32_f(NVRAM_CMD, NVRAM_CMD_RESET);
13176         else
13177             tg3_nvram_unlock(tp);
13178     } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717) {
13179         if (tr32(TG3_CPMU_STATUS) & TG3_CPMU_STATUS_PCIE_FUNC)
13180             mac_offset = 0xcc;
13181     } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
13182         mac_offset = 0x10;
13183 
13184     /* First try to get it from MAC address mailbox. */
13185     tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_MAC_ADDR_HIGH_MBOX, &hi);
13186     if ((hi >> 16) == 0x484b) {
13187         dev->dev_addr[0] = (hi >>  8) & 0xff;
13188         dev->dev_addr[1] = (hi >>  0) & 0xff;
13189 
13190         tg3_read_mem(tp, NIC_SRAM_MAC_ADDR_LOW_MBOX, &lo);
13191         dev->dev_addr[2] = (lo >> 24) & 0xff;
13192         dev->dev_addr[3] = (lo >> 16) & 0xff;
13193         dev->dev_addr[4] = (lo >>  8) & 0xff;
13194         dev->dev_addr[5] = (lo >>  0) & 0xff;
13195 
13196         /* Some old bootcode may report a 0 MAC address in SRAM */
13197         addr_ok = is_valid_ether_addr(&dev->dev_addr[0]);
13198     }
13199     if (!addr_ok) {
13200         /* Next, try NVRAM. */
13201         if (!(tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_NO_NVRAM) &&
13202             !tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, mac_offset + 0, &hi) &&
13203             !tg3_nvram_read_be32(tp, mac_offset + 4, &lo)) {
13204             memcpy(&dev->dev_addr[0], ((char *)&hi) + 2, 2);
13205             memcpy(&dev->dev_addr[2], (char *)&lo, sizeof(lo));
13206         }
13207         /* Finally just fetch it out of the MAC control regs. */
13208         else {
13209             hi = tr32(MAC_ADDR_0_HIGH);
13210             lo = tr32(MAC_ADDR_0_LOW);
13211 
13212             dev->dev_addr[5] = lo & 0xff;
13213             dev->dev_addr[4] = (lo >> 8) & 0xff;
13214             dev->dev_addr[3] = (lo >> 16) & 0xff;
13215             dev->dev_addr[2] = (lo >> 24) & 0xff;
13216             dev->dev_addr[1] = hi & 0xff;
13217             dev->dev_addr[0] = (hi >> 8) & 0xff;
13218         }
13219     }
13220 
13221     if (!is_valid_ether_addr(&dev->dev_addr[0])) {
13222 #ifdef CONFIG_SPARC
13223         if (!tg3_get_default_macaddr_sparc(tp))
13224             return 0;
13225 #endif
13226         return -EINVAL;
13227     }
13228     memcpy(dev->perm_addr, dev->dev_addr, dev->addr_len);
13229     return 0;
13230 }
13231 
13232 #define BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE   1
13233 #define BOUNDARY_MULTI_CACHELINE    2
13234 
13235 static u32 __devinit tg3_calc_dma_bndry(struct tg3 *tp, u32 val)
13236 {
13237     int cacheline_size;
13238     u8 byte;
13239     int goal;
13240 
13241     pci_read_config_byte(tp->pdev, PCI_CACHE_LINE_SIZE, &byte);
13242     if (byte == 0)
13243         cacheline_size = 1024;
13244     else
13245         cacheline_size = (int) byte * 4;
13246 
13247     /* On 5703 and later chips, the boundary bits have no
13248      * effect.
13249      */
13250     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700 &&
13251         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5701 &&
13252         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS))
13253         goto out;
13254 
13255 #if defined(CONFIG_PPC64) || defined(CONFIG_IA64) || defined(CONFIG_PARISC)
13256     goal = BOUNDARY_MULTI_CACHELINE;
13257 #else
13258 #if defined(CONFIG_SPARC64) || defined(CONFIG_ALPHA)
13259     goal = BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE;
13260 #else
13261     goal = 0;
13262 #endif
13263 #endif
13264 
13265     if (!goal)
13266         goto out;
13267 
13268     /* PCI controllers on most RISC systems tend to disconnect
13269      * when a device tries to burst across a cache-line boundary.
13270      * Therefore, letting tg3 do so just wastes PCI bandwidth.
13271      *
13272      * Unfortunately, for PCI-E there are only limited
13273      * write-side controls for this, and thus for reads
13274      * we will still get the disconnects.  We'll also waste
13275      * these PCI cycles for both read and write for chips
13276      * other than 5700 and 5701 which do not implement the
13277      * boundary bits.
13278      */
13279     if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) &&
13280         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS)) {
13281         switch (cacheline_size) {
13282         case 16:
13283         case 32:
13284         case 64:
13285         case 128:
13286             if (goal == BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE) {
13287                 val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_128_PCIX |
13288                     DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_128_PCIX);
13289             } else {
13290                 val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_384_PCIX |
13291                     DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_384_PCIX);
13292             }
13293             break;
13294 
13295         case 256:
13296             val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_256_PCIX |
13297                 DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_256_PCIX);
13298             break;
13299 
13300         default:
13301             val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_384_PCIX |
13302                 DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_384_PCIX);
13303             break;
13304         }
13305     } else if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) {
13306         switch (cacheline_size) {
13307         case 16:
13308         case 32:
13309         case 64:
13310             if (goal == BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE) {
13311                 val &= ~DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_DISAB_PCIE;
13312                 val |= DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_64_PCIE;
13313                 break;
13314             }
13315             /* fallthrough */
13316         case 128:
13317         default:
13318             val &= ~DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_DISAB_PCIE;
13319             val |= DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_128_PCIE;
13320             break;
13321         }
13322     } else {
13323         switch (cacheline_size) {
13324         case 16:
13325             if (goal == BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE) {
13326                 val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_16 |
13327                     DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_16);
13328                 break;
13329             }
13330             /* fallthrough */
13331         case 32:
13332             if (goal == BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE) {
13333                 val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_32 |
13334                     DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_32);
13335                 break;
13336             }
13337             /* fallthrough */
13338         case 64:
13339             if (goal == BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE) {
13340                 val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_64 |
13341                     DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_64);
13342                 break;
13343             }
13344             /* fallthrough */
13345         case 128:
13346             if (goal == BOUNDARY_SINGLE_CACHELINE) {
13347                 val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_128 |
13348                     DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_128);
13349                 break;
13350             }
13351             /* fallthrough */
13352         case 256:
13353             val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_256 |
13354                 DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_256);
13355             break;
13356         case 512:
13357             val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_512 |
13358                 DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_512);
13359             break;
13360         case 1024:
13361         default:
13362             val |= (DMA_RWCTRL_READ_BNDRY_1024 |
13363                 DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_1024);
13364             break;
13365         }
13366     }
13367 
13368 out:
13369     return val;
13370 }
13371 
13372 static int __devinit tg3_do_test_dma(struct tg3 *tp, u32 *buf, dma_addr_t buf_dma, int size, int to_device)
13373 {
13374     struct tg3_internal_buffer_desc test_desc;
13375     u32 sram_dma_descs;
13376     int i, ret;
13377 
13378     sram_dma_descs = NIC_SRAM_DMA_DESC_POOL_BASE;
13379 
13380     tw32(FTQ_RCVBD_COMP_FIFO_ENQDEQ, 0);
13381     tw32(FTQ_RCVDATA_COMP_FIFO_ENQDEQ, 0);
13382     tw32(RDMAC_STATUS, 0);
13383     tw32(WDMAC_STATUS, 0);
13384 
13385     tw32(BUFMGR_MODE, 0);
13386     tw32(FTQ_RESET, 0);
13387 
13388     test_desc.addr_hi = ((u64) buf_dma) >> 32;
13389     test_desc.addr_lo = buf_dma & 0xffffffff;
13390     test_desc.nic_mbuf = 0x00002100;
13391     test_desc.len = size;
13392 
13393     /*
13394      * HP ZX1 was seeing test failures for 5701 cards running at 33Mhz
13395      * the *second* time the tg3 driver was getting loaded after an
13396      * initial scan.
13397      *
13398      * Broadcom tells me:
13399      *   ...the DMA engine is connected to the GRC block and a DMA
13400      *   reset may affect the GRC block in some unpredictable way...
13401      *   The behavior of resets to individual blocks has not been tested.
13402      *
13403      * Broadcom noted the GRC reset will also reset all sub-components.
13404      */
13405     if (to_device) {
13406         test_desc.cqid_sqid = (13 << 8) | 2;
13407 
13408         tw32_f(RDMAC_MODE, RDMAC_MODE_ENABLE);
13409         udelay(40);
13410     } else {
13411         test_desc.cqid_sqid = (16 << 8) | 7;
13412 
13413         tw32_f(WDMAC_MODE, WDMAC_MODE_ENABLE);
13414         udelay(40);
13415     }
13416     test_desc.flags = 0x00000005;
13417 
13418     for (i = 0; i < (sizeof(test_desc) / sizeof(u32)); i++) {
13419         u32 val;
13420 
13421         val = *(((u32 *)&test_desc) + i);
13422         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR,
13423                        sram_dma_descs + (i * sizeof(u32)));
13424         pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_DATA, val);
13425     }
13426     pci_write_config_dword(tp->pdev, TG3PCI_MEM_WIN_BASE_ADDR, 0);
13427 
13428     if (to_device) {
13429         tw32(FTQ_DMA_HIGH_READ_FIFO_ENQDEQ, sram_dma_descs);
13430     } else {
13431         tw32(FTQ_DMA_HIGH_WRITE_FIFO_ENQDEQ, sram_dma_descs);
13432     }
13433 
13434     ret = -ENODEV;
13435     for (i = 0; i < 40; i++) {
13436         u32 val;
13437 
13438         if (to_device)
13439             val = tr32(FTQ_RCVBD_COMP_FIFO_ENQDEQ);
13440         else
13441             val = tr32(FTQ_RCVDATA_COMP_FIFO_ENQDEQ);
13442         if ((val & 0xffff) == sram_dma_descs) {
13443             ret = 0;
13444             break;
13445         }
13446 
13447         udelay(100);
13448     }
13449 
13450     return ret;
13451 }
13452 
13453 #define TEST_BUFFER_SIZE    0x2000
13454 
13455 static int __devinit tg3_test_dma(struct tg3 *tp)
13456 {
13457     dma_addr_t buf_dma;
13458     u32 *buf, saved_dma_rwctrl;
13459     int ret;
13460 
13461     buf = pci_alloc_consistent(tp->pdev, TEST_BUFFER_SIZE, &buf_dma);
13462     if (!buf) {
13463         ret = -ENOMEM;
13464         goto out_nofree;
13465     }
13466 
13467     tp->dma_rwctrl = ((0x7 << DMA_RWCTRL_PCI_WRITE_CMD_SHIFT) |
13468               (0x6 << DMA_RWCTRL_PCI_READ_CMD_SHIFT));
13469 
13470     tp->dma_rwctrl = tg3_calc_dma_bndry(tp, tp->dma_rwctrl);
13471 
13472     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) {
13473         /* DMA read watermark not used on PCIE */
13474         tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x00180000;
13475     } else if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE)) {
13476         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705 ||
13477             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5750)
13478             tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x003f0000;
13479         else
13480             tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x003f000f;
13481     } else {
13482         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 ||
13483             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704) {
13484             u32 ccval = (tr32(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL) & 0x1f);
13485             u32 read_water = 0x7;
13486 
13487             /* If the 5704 is behind the EPB bridge, we can
13488              * do the less restrictive ONE_DMA workaround for
13489              * better performance.
13490              */
13491             if ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_40BIT_DMA_BUG) &&
13492                 GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704)
13493                 tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x8000;
13494             else if (ccval == 0x6 || ccval == 0x7)
13495                 tp->dma_rwctrl |= DMA_RWCTRL_ONE_DMA;
13496 
13497             if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703)
13498                 read_water = 4;
13499             /* Set bit 23 to enable PCIX hw bug fix */
13500             tp->dma_rwctrl |=
13501                 (read_water << DMA_RWCTRL_READ_WATER_SHIFT) |
13502                 (0x3 << DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_WATER_SHIFT) |
13503                 (1 << 23);
13504         } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5780) {
13505             /* 5780 always in PCIX mode */
13506             tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x00144000;
13507         } else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5714) {
13508             /* 5714 always in PCIX mode */
13509             tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x00148000;
13510         } else {
13511             tp->dma_rwctrl |= 0x001b000f;
13512         }
13513     }
13514 
13515     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5703 ||
13516         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5704)
13517         tp->dma_rwctrl &= 0xfffffff0;
13518 
13519     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
13520         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701) {
13521         /* Remove this if it causes problems for some boards. */
13522         tp->dma_rwctrl |= DMA_RWCTRL_USE_MEM_READ_MULT;
13523 
13524         /* On 5700/5701 chips, we need to set this bit.
13525          * Otherwise the chip will issue cacheline transactions
13526          * to streamable DMA memory with not all the byte
13527          * enables turned on.  This is an error on several
13528          * RISC PCI controllers, in particular sparc64.
13529          *
13530          * On 5703/5704 chips, this bit has been reassigned
13531          * a different meaning.  In particular, it is used
13532          * on those chips to enable a PCI-X workaround.
13533          */
13534         tp->dma_rwctrl |= DMA_RWCTRL_ASSERT_ALL_BE;
13535     }
13536 
13537     tw32(TG3PCI_DMA_RW_CTRL, tp->dma_rwctrl);
13538 
13539 #if 0
13540     /* Unneeded, already done by tg3_get_invariants.  */
13541     tg3_switch_clocks(tp);
13542 #endif
13543 
13544     ret = 0;
13545     if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5700 &&
13546         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5701)
13547         goto out;
13548 
13549     /* It is best to perform DMA test with maximum write burst size
13550      * to expose the 5700/5701 write DMA bug.
13551      */
13552     saved_dma_rwctrl = tp->dma_rwctrl;
13553     tp->dma_rwctrl &= ~DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_MASK;
13554     tw32(TG3PCI_DMA_RW_CTRL, tp->dma_rwctrl);
13555 
13556     while (1) {
13557         u32 *p = buf, i;
13558 
13559         for (i = 0; i < TEST_BUFFER_SIZE / sizeof(u32); i++)
13560             p[i] = i;
13561 
13562         /* Send the buffer to the chip. */
13563         ret = tg3_do_test_dma(tp, buf, buf_dma, TEST_BUFFER_SIZE, 1);
13564         if (ret) {
13565             printk(KERN_ERR "tg3_test_dma() Write the buffer failed %d\n", ret);
13566             break;
13567         }
13568 
13569 #if 0
13570         /* validate data reached card RAM correctly. */
13571         for (i = 0; i < TEST_BUFFER_SIZE / sizeof(u32); i++) {
13572             u32 val;
13573             tg3_read_mem(tp, 0x2100 + (i*4), &val);
13574             if (le32_to_cpu(val) != p[i]) {
13575                 printk(KERN_ERR "  tg3_test_dma()  Card buffer corrupted on write! (%d != %d)\n", val, i);
13576                 /* ret = -ENODEV here? */
13577             }
13578             p[i] = 0;
13579         }
13580 #endif
13581         /* Now read it back. */
13582         ret = tg3_do_test_dma(tp, buf, buf_dma, TEST_BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
13583         if (ret) {
13584             printk(KERN_ERR "tg3_test_dma() Read the buffer failed %d\n", ret);
13585 
13586             break;
13587         }
13588 
13589         /* Verify it. */
13590         for (i = 0; i < TEST_BUFFER_SIZE / sizeof(u32); i++) {
13591             if (p[i] == i)
13592                 continue;
13593 
13594             if ((tp->dma_rwctrl & DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_MASK) !=
13595                 DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_16) {
13596                 tp->dma_rwctrl &= ~DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_MASK;
13597                 tp->dma_rwctrl |= DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_16;
13598                 tw32(TG3PCI_DMA_RW_CTRL, tp->dma_rwctrl);
13599                 break;
13600             } else {
13601                 printk(KERN_ERR "tg3_test_dma() buffer corrupted on read back! (%d != %d)\n", p[i], i);
13602                 ret = -ENODEV;
13603                 goto out;
13604             }
13605         }
13606 
13607         if (i == (TEST_BUFFER_SIZE / sizeof(u32))) {
13608             /* Success. */
13609             ret = 0;
13610             break;
13611         }
13612     }
13613     if ((tp->dma_rwctrl & DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_MASK) !=
13614         DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_16) {
13615         static struct pci_device_id dma_wait_state_chipsets[] = {
13616             { PCI_DEVICE(PCI_VENDOR_ID_APPLE,
13617                      PCI_DEVICE_ID_APPLE_UNI_N_PCI15) },
13618             { },
13619         };
13620 
13621         /* DMA test passed without adjusting DMA boundary,
13622          * now look for chipsets that are known to expose the
13623          * DMA bug without failing the test.
13624          */
13625         if (pci_dev_present(dma_wait_state_chipsets)) {
13626             tp->dma_rwctrl &= ~DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_MASK;
13627             tp->dma_rwctrl |= DMA_RWCTRL_WRITE_BNDRY_16;
13628         }
13629         else
13630             /* Safe to use the calculated DMA boundary. */
13631             tp->dma_rwctrl = saved_dma_rwctrl;
13632 
13633         tw32(TG3PCI_DMA_RW_CTRL, tp->dma_rwctrl);
13634     }
13635 
13636 out:
13637     pci_free_consistent(tp->pdev, TEST_BUFFER_SIZE, buf, buf_dma);
13638 out_nofree:
13639     return ret;
13640 }
13641 
13642 static void __devinit tg3_init_link_config(struct tg3 *tp)
13643 {
13644     tp->link_config.advertising =
13645         (ADVERTISED_10baseT_Half | ADVERTISED_10baseT_Full |
13646          ADVERTISED_100baseT_Half | ADVERTISED_100baseT_Full |
13647          ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Half | ADVERTISED_1000baseT_Full |
13648          ADVERTISED_Autoneg | ADVERTISED_MII);
13649     tp->link_config.speed = SPEED_INVALID;
13650     tp->link_config.duplex = DUPLEX_INVALID;
13651     tp->link_config.autoneg = AUTONEG_ENABLE;
13652     tp->link_config.active_speed = SPEED_INVALID;
13653     tp->link_config.active_duplex = DUPLEX_INVALID;
13654     tp->link_config.phy_is_low_power = 0;
13655     tp->link_config.orig_speed = SPEED_INVALID;
13656     tp->link_config.orig_duplex = DUPLEX_INVALID;
13657     tp->link_config.orig_autoneg = AUTONEG_INVALID;
13658 }
13659 
13660 static void __devinit tg3_init_bufmgr_config(struct tg3 *tp)
13661 {
13662     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS &&
13663         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != ASIC_REV_5717) {
13664         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_read_dma_low_water =
13665             DEFAULT_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER_5705;
13666         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water =
13667             DEFAULT_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER_5705;
13668         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water =
13669             DEFAULT_MB_HIGH_WATER_5705;
13670         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906) {
13671             tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water =
13672                 DEFAULT_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER_5906;
13673             tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water =
13674                 DEFAULT_MB_HIGH_WATER_5906;
13675         }
13676 
13677         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_read_dma_low_water_jumbo =
13678             DEFAULT_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER_JUMBO_5780;
13679         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water_jumbo =
13680             DEFAULT_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER_JUMBO_5780;
13681         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water_jumbo =
13682             DEFAULT_MB_HIGH_WATER_JUMBO_5780;
13683     } else {
13684         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_read_dma_low_water =
13685             DEFAULT_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER;
13686         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water =
13687             DEFAULT_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER;
13688         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water =
13689             DEFAULT_MB_HIGH_WATER;
13690 
13691         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_read_dma_low_water_jumbo =
13692             DEFAULT_MB_RDMA_LOW_WATER_JUMBO;
13693         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_mac_rx_low_water_jumbo =
13694             DEFAULT_MB_MACRX_LOW_WATER_JUMBO;
13695         tp->bufmgr_config.mbuf_high_water_jumbo =
13696             DEFAULT_MB_HIGH_WATER_JUMBO;
13697     }
13698 
13699     tp->bufmgr_config.dma_low_water = DEFAULT_DMA_LOW_WATER;
13700     tp->bufmgr_config.dma_high_water = DEFAULT_DMA_HIGH_WATER;
13701 }
13702 
13703 static char * __devinit tg3_phy_string(struct tg3 *tp)
13704 {
13705     switch (tp->phy_id & PHY_ID_MASK) {
13706     case PHY_ID_BCM5400:    return "5400";
13707     case PHY_ID_BCM5401:    return "5401";
13708     case PHY_ID_BCM5411:    return "5411";
13709     case PHY_ID_BCM5701:    return "5701";
13710     case PHY_ID_BCM5703:    return "5703";
13711     case PHY_ID_BCM5704:    return "5704";
13712     case PHY_ID_BCM5705:    return "5705";
13713     case PHY_ID_BCM5750:    return "5750";
13714     case PHY_ID_BCM5752:    return "5752";
13715     case PHY_ID_BCM5714:    return "5714";
13716     case PHY_ID_BCM5780:    return "5780";
13717     case PHY_ID_BCM5755:    return "5755";
13718     case PHY_ID_BCM5787:    return "5787";
13719     case PHY_ID_BCM5784:    return "5784";
13720     case PHY_ID_BCM5756:    return "5722/5756";
13721     case PHY_ID_BCM5906:    return "5906";
13722     case PHY_ID_BCM5761:    return "5761";
13723     case PHY_ID_BCM8002:    return "8002/serdes";
13724     case 0:         return "serdes";
13725     default:        return "unknown";
13726     }
13727 }
13728 
13729 static char * __devinit tg3_bus_string(struct tg3 *tp, char *str)
13730 {
13731     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_PCI_EXPRESS) {
13732         strcpy(str, "PCI Express");
13733         return str;
13734     } else if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCIX_MODE) {
13735         u32 clock_ctrl = tr32(TG3PCI_CLOCK_CTRL) & 0x1f;
13736 
13737         strcpy(str, "PCIX:");
13738 
13739         if ((clock_ctrl == 7) ||
13740             ((tr32(GRC_MISC_CFG) & GRC_MISC_CFG_BOARD_ID_MASK) ==
13741              GRC_MISC_CFG_BOARD_ID_5704CIOBE))
13742             strcat(str, "133MHz");
13743         else if (clock_ctrl == 0)
13744             strcat(str, "33MHz");
13745         else if (clock_ctrl == 2)
13746             strcat(str, "50MHz");
13747         else if (clock_ctrl == 4)
13748             strcat(str, "66MHz");
13749         else if (clock_ctrl == 6)
13750             strcat(str, "100MHz");
13751     } else {
13752         strcpy(str, "PCI:");
13753         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCI_HIGH_SPEED)
13754             strcat(str, "66MHz");
13755         else
13756             strcat(str, "33MHz");
13757     }
13758     if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_PCI_32BIT)
13759         strcat(str, ":32-bit");
13760     else
13761         strcat(str, ":64-bit");
13762     return str;
13763 }
13764 
13765 static struct pci_dev * __devinit tg3_find_peer(struct tg3 *tp)
13766 {
13767     struct pci_dev *peer;
13768     unsigned int func, devnr = tp->pdev->devfn & ~7;
13769 
13770     for (func = 0; func < 8; func++) {
13771         peer = pci_get_slot(tp->pdev->bus, devnr | func);
13772         if (peer && peer != tp->pdev)
13773             break;
13774         pci_dev_put(peer);
13775     }
13776     /* 5704 can be configured in single-port mode, set peer to
13777      * tp->pdev in that case.
13778      */
13779     if (!peer) {
13780         peer = tp->pdev;
13781         return peer;
13782     }
13783 
13784     /*
13785      * We don't need to keep the refcount elevated; there's no way
13786      * to remove one half of this device without removing the other
13787      */
13788     pci_dev_put(peer);
13789 
13790     return peer;
13791 }
13792 
13793 static void __devinit tg3_init_coal(struct tg3 *tp)
13794 {
13795     struct ethtool_coalesce *ec = &tp->coal;
13796 
13797     memset(ec, 0, sizeof(*ec));
13798     ec->cmd = ETHTOOL_GCOALESCE;
13799     ec->rx_coalesce_usecs = LOW_RXCOL_TICKS;
13800     ec->tx_coalesce_usecs = LOW_TXCOL_TICKS;
13801     ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames = LOW_RXMAX_FRAMES;
13802     ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames = LOW_TXMAX_FRAMES;
13803     ec->rx_coalesce_usecs_irq = DEFAULT_RXCOAL_TICK_INT;
13804     ec->tx_coalesce_usecs_irq = DEFAULT_TXCOAL_TICK_INT;
13805     ec->rx_max_coalesced_frames_irq = DEFAULT_RXCOAL_MAXF_INT;
13806     ec->tx_max_coalesced_frames_irq = DEFAULT_TXCOAL_MAXF_INT;
13807     ec->stats_block_coalesce_usecs = DEFAULT_STAT_COAL_TICKS;
13808 
13809     if (tp->coalesce_mode & (HOSTCC_MODE_CLRTICK_RXBD |
13810                  HOSTCC_MODE_CLRTICK_TXBD)) {
13811         ec->rx_coalesce_usecs = LOW_RXCOL_TICKS_CLRTCKS;
13812         ec->rx_coalesce_usecs_irq = DEFAULT_RXCOAL_TICK_INT_CLRTCKS;
13813         ec->tx_coalesce_usecs = LOW_TXCOL_TICKS_CLRTCKS;
13814         ec->tx_coalesce_usecs_irq = DEFAULT_TXCOAL_TICK_INT_CLRTCKS;
13815     }
13816 
13817     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_5705_PLUS) {
13818         ec->rx_coalesce_usecs_irq = 0;
13819         ec->tx_coalesce_usecs_irq = 0;
13820         ec->stats_block_coalesce_usecs = 0;
13821     }
13822 }
13823 
13824 static const struct net_device_ops tg3_netdev_ops = {
13825     .ndo_open       = tg3_open,
13826     .ndo_stop       = tg3_close,
13827     .ndo_start_xmit     = tg3_start_xmit,
13828     .ndo_get_stats      = tg3_get_stats,
13829     .ndo_validate_addr  = eth_validate_addr,
13830     .ndo_set_multicast_list = tg3_set_rx_mode,
13831     .ndo_set_mac_address    = tg3_set_mac_addr,
13832     .ndo_do_ioctl       = tg3_ioctl,
13833     .ndo_tx_timeout     = tg3_tx_timeout,
13834     .ndo_change_mtu     = tg3_change_mtu,
13835 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
13836     .ndo_vlan_rx_register   = tg3_vlan_rx_register,
13837 #endif
13838 #ifdef CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER
13839     .ndo_poll_controller    = tg3_poll_controller,
13840 #endif
13841 };
13842 
13843 static const struct net_device_ops tg3_netdev_ops_dma_bug = {
13844     .ndo_open       = tg3_open,
13845     .ndo_stop       = tg3_close,
13846     .ndo_start_xmit     = tg3_start_xmit_dma_bug,
13847     .ndo_get_stats      = tg3_get_stats,
13848     .ndo_validate_addr  = eth_validate_addr,
13849     .ndo_set_multicast_list = tg3_set_rx_mode,
13850     .ndo_set_mac_address    = tg3_set_mac_addr,
13851     .ndo_do_ioctl       = tg3_ioctl,
13852     .ndo_tx_timeout     = tg3_tx_timeout,
13853     .ndo_change_mtu     = tg3_change_mtu,
13854 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
13855     .ndo_vlan_rx_register   = tg3_vlan_rx_register,
13856 #endif
13857 #ifdef CONFIG_NET_POLL_CONTROLLER
13858     .ndo_poll_controller    = tg3_poll_controller,
13859 #endif
13860 };
13861 
13862 static int __devinit tg3_init_one(struct pci_dev *pdev,
13863                   const struct pci_device_id *ent)
13864 {
13865     static int tg3_version_printed = 0;
13866     struct net_device *dev;
13867     struct tg3 *tp;
13868     int i, err, pm_cap;
13869     u32 sndmbx, rcvmbx, intmbx;
13870     char str[40];
13871     u64 dma_mask, persist_dma_mask;
13872 
13873     if (tg3_version_printed++ == 0)
13874         printk(KERN_INFO "%s", version);
13875 
13876     err = pci_enable_device(pdev);
13877     if (err) {
13878         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot enable PCI device, "
13879                "aborting.\n");
13880         return err;
13881     }
13882 
13883     err = pci_request_regions(pdev, DRV_MODULE_NAME);
13884     if (err) {
13885         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot obtain PCI resources, "
13886                "aborting.\n");
13887         goto err_out_disable_pdev;
13888     }
13889 
13890     pci_set_master(pdev);
13891 
13892     /* Find power-management capability. */
13893     pm_cap = pci_find_capability(pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_PM);
13894     if (pm_cap == 0) {
13895         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot find PowerManagement capability, "
13896                "aborting.\n");
13897         err = -EIO;
13898         goto err_out_free_res;
13899     }
13900 
13901     dev = alloc_etherdev_mq(sizeof(*tp), TG3_IRQ_MAX_VECS);
13902     if (!dev) {
13903         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Etherdev alloc failed, aborting.\n");
13904         err = -ENOMEM;
13905         goto err_out_free_res;
13906     }
13907 
13908     SET_NETDEV_DEV(dev, &pdev->dev);
13909 
13910 #if TG3_VLAN_TAG_USED
13911     dev->features |= NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_TX | NETIF_F_HW_VLAN_RX;
13912 #endif
13913 
13914     tp = netdev_priv(dev);
13915     tp->pdev = pdev;
13916     tp->dev = dev;
13917     tp->pm_cap = pm_cap;
13918     tp->rx_mode = TG3_DEF_RX_MODE;
13919     tp->tx_mode = TG3_DEF_TX_MODE;
13920 
13921     if (tg3_debug > 0)
13922         tp->msg_enable = tg3_debug;
13923     else
13924         tp->msg_enable = TG3_DEF_MSG_ENABLE;
13925 
13926     /* The word/byte swap controls here control register access byte
13927      * swapping.  DMA data byte swapping is controlled in the GRC_MODE
13928      * setting below.
13929      */
13930     tp->misc_host_ctrl =
13931         MISC_HOST_CTRL_MASK_PCI_INT |
13932         MISC_HOST_CTRL_WORD_SWAP |
13933         MISC_HOST_CTRL_INDIR_ACCESS |
13934         MISC_HOST_CTRL_PCISTATE_RW;
13935 
13936     /* The NONFRM (non-frame) byte/word swap controls take effect
13937      * on descriptor entries, anything which isn't packet data.
13938      *
13939      * The StrongARM chips on the board (one for tx, one for rx)
13940      * are running in big-endian mode.
13941      */
13942     tp->grc_mode = (GRC_MODE_WSWAP_DATA | GRC_MODE_BSWAP_DATA |
13943             GRC_MODE_WSWAP_NONFRM_DATA);
13944 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
13945     tp->grc_mode |= GRC_MODE_BSWAP_NONFRM_DATA;
13946 #endif
13947     spin_lock_init(&tp->lock);
13948     spin_lock_init(&tp->indirect_lock);
13949     INIT_WORK(&tp->reset_task, tg3_reset_task);
13950 
13951     tp->regs = pci_ioremap_bar(pdev, BAR_0);
13952     if (!tp->regs) {
13953         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot map device registers, "
13954                "aborting.\n");
13955         err = -ENOMEM;
13956         goto err_out_free_dev;
13957     }
13958 
13959     tg3_init_link_config(tp);
13960 
13961     tp->rx_pending = TG3_DEF_RX_RING_PENDING;
13962     tp->rx_jumbo_pending = TG3_DEF_RX_JUMBO_RING_PENDING;
13963 
13964     intmbx = MAILBOX_INTERRUPT_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW;
13965     rcvmbx = MAILBOX_RCVRET_CON_IDX_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW;
13966     sndmbx = MAILBOX_SNDHOST_PROD_IDX_0 + TG3_64BIT_REG_LOW;
13967     for (i = 0; i < TG3_IRQ_MAX_VECS; i++) {
13968         struct tg3_napi *tnapi = &tp->napi[i];
13969 
13970         tnapi->tp = tp;
13971         tnapi->tx_pending = TG3_DEF_TX_RING_PENDING;
13972 
13973         tnapi->int_mbox = intmbx;
13974         if (i < 4)
13975             intmbx += 0x8;
13976         else
13977             intmbx += 0x4;
13978 
13979         tnapi->consmbox = rcvmbx;
13980         tnapi->prodmbox = sndmbx;
13981 
13982         if (i)
13983             tnapi->coal_now = HOSTCC_MODE_COAL_VEC1_NOW << (i - 1);
13984         else
13985             tnapi->coal_now = HOSTCC_MODE_NOW;
13986 
13987         if (!(tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_SUPPORT_MSIX))
13988             break;
13989 
13990         /*
13991          * If we support MSIX, we'll be using RSS.  If we're using
13992          * RSS, the first vector only handles link interrupts and the
13993          * remaining vectors handle rx and tx interrupts.  Reuse the
13994          * mailbox values for the next iteration.  The values we setup
13995          * above are still useful for the single vectored mode.
13996          */
13997         if (!i)
13998             continue;
13999 
14000         rcvmbx += 0x8;
14001 
14002         if (sndmbx & 0x4)
14003             sndmbx -= 0x4;
14004         else
14005             sndmbx += 0xc;
14006     }
14007 
14008     netif_napi_add(dev, &tp->napi[0].napi, tg3_poll, 64);
14009     dev->ethtool_ops = &tg3_ethtool_ops;
14010     dev->watchdog_timeo = TG3_TX_TIMEOUT;
14011     dev->irq = pdev->irq;
14012 
14013     err = tg3_get_invariants(tp);
14014     if (err) {
14015         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Problem fetching invariants of chip, "
14016                "aborting.\n");
14017         goto err_out_iounmap;
14018     }
14019 
14020     if ((tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_5755_PLUS) ||
14021         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906)
14022         dev->netdev_ops = &tg3_netdev_ops;
14023     else
14024         dev->netdev_ops = &tg3_netdev_ops_dma_bug;
14025 
14026 
14027     /* The EPB bridge inside 5714, 5715, and 5780 and any
14028      * device behind the EPB cannot support DMA addresses > 40-bit.
14029      * On 64-bit systems with IOMMU, use 40-bit dma_mask.
14030      * On 64-bit systems without IOMMU, use 64-bit dma_mask and
14031      * do DMA address check in tg3_start_xmit().
14032      */
14033     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_IS_5788)
14034         persist_dma_mask = dma_mask = DMA_BIT_MASK(32);
14035     else if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_40BIT_DMA_BUG) {
14036         persist_dma_mask = dma_mask = DMA_BIT_MASK(40);
14037 #ifdef CONFIG_HIGHMEM
14038         dma_mask = DMA_BIT_MASK(64);
14039 #endif
14040     } else
14041         persist_dma_mask = dma_mask = DMA_BIT_MASK(64);
14042 
14043     /* Configure DMA attributes. */
14044     if (dma_mask > DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) {
14045         err = pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, dma_mask);
14046         if (!err) {
14047             dev->features |= NETIF_F_HIGHDMA;
14048             err = pci_set_consistent_dma_mask(pdev,
14049                               persist_dma_mask);
14050             if (err < 0) {
14051                 printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Unable to obtain 64 bit "
14052                        "DMA for consistent allocations\n");
14053                 goto err_out_iounmap;
14054             }
14055         }
14056     }
14057     if (err || dma_mask == DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) {
14058         err = pci_set_dma_mask(pdev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32));
14059         if (err) {
14060             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "No usable DMA configuration, "
14061                    "aborting.\n");
14062             goto err_out_iounmap;
14063         }
14064     }
14065 
14066     tg3_init_bufmgr_config(tp);
14067 
14068     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5701_A0)
14069         tp->fw_needed = FIRMWARE_TG3;
14070 
14071     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO) {
14072         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE;
14073     }
14074     else if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5700 ||
14075         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5701 ||
14076         tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5705_A0 ||
14077         GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5906 ||
14078         (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) != 0) {
14079         tp->tg3_flags2 &= ~TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE;
14080     } else {
14081         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE | TG3_FLG2_TSO_BUG;
14082         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5705)
14083             tp->fw_needed = FIRMWARE_TG3TSO5;
14084         else
14085             tp->fw_needed = FIRMWARE_TG3TSO;
14086     }
14087 
14088     /* TSO is on by default on chips that support hardware TSO.
14089      * Firmware TSO on older chips gives lower performance, so it
14090      * is off by default, but can be enabled using ethtool.
14091      */
14092     if (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO) {
14093         if (dev->features & NETIF_F_IP_CSUM)
14094             dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO;
14095         if ((dev->features & NETIF_F_IPV6_CSUM) &&
14096             (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_HW_TSO_2))
14097             dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO6;
14098         if (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5761 ||
14099             (GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5784 &&
14100              GET_CHIP_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) != CHIPREV_5784_AX) ||
14101             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5785 ||
14102             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_57780 ||
14103             GET_ASIC_REV(tp->pci_chip_rev_id) == ASIC_REV_5717)
14104             dev->features |= NETIF_F_TSO_ECN;
14105     }
14106 
14107 
14108     if (tp->pci_chip_rev_id == CHIPREV_ID_5705_A1 &&
14109         !(tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE) &&
14110         !(tr32(TG3PCI_PCISTATE) & PCISTATE_BUS_SPEED_HIGH)) {
14111         tp->tg3_flags2 |= TG3_FLG2_MAX_RXPEND_64;
14112         tp->rx_pending = 63;
14113     }
14114 
14115     err = tg3_get_device_address(tp);
14116     if (err) {
14117         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Could not obtain valid ethernet address, "
14118                "aborting.\n");
14119         goto err_out_fw;
14120     }
14121 
14122     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_ENABLE_APE) {
14123         tp->aperegs = pci_ioremap_bar(pdev, BAR_2);
14124         if (!tp->aperegs) {
14125             printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot map APE registers, "
14126                    "aborting.\n");
14127             err = -ENOMEM;
14128             goto err_out_fw;
14129         }
14130 
14131         tg3_ape_lock_init(tp);
14132 
14133         if (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF)
14134             tg3_read_dash_ver(tp);
14135     }
14136 
14137     /*
14138      * Reset chip in case UNDI or EFI driver did not shutdown
14139      * DMA self test will enable WDMAC and we'll see (spurious)
14140      * pending DMA on the PCI bus at that point.
14141      */
14142     if ((tr32(HOSTCC_MODE) & HOSTCC_MODE_ENABLE) ||
14143         (tr32(WDMAC_MODE) & WDMAC_MODE_ENABLE)) {
14144         tw32(MEMARB_MODE, MEMARB_MODE_ENABLE);
14145         tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
14146     }
14147 
14148     err = tg3_test_dma(tp);
14149     if (err) {
14150         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "DMA engine test failed, aborting.\n");
14151         goto err_out_apeunmap;
14152     }
14153 
14154     /* flow control autonegotiation is default behavior */
14155     tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_PAUSE_AUTONEG;
14156     tp->link_config.flowctrl = FLOW_CTRL_TX | FLOW_CTRL_RX;
14157 
14158     tg3_init_coal(tp);
14159 
14160     pci_set_drvdata(pdev, dev);
14161 
14162     err = register_netdev(dev);
14163     if (err) {
14164         printk(KERN_ERR PFX "Cannot register net device, "
14165                "aborting.\n");
14166         goto err_out_apeunmap;
14167     }
14168 
14169     printk(KERN_INFO "%s: Tigon3 [partno(%s) rev %04x] (%s) MAC address %pM\n",
14170            dev->name,
14171            tp->board_part_number,
14172            tp->pci_chip_rev_id,
14173            tg3_bus_string(tp, str),
14174            dev->dev_addr);
14175 
14176     if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_PHY_CONNECTED)
14177         printk(KERN_INFO
14178                "%s: attached PHY driver [%s] (mii_bus:phy_addr=%s)\n",
14179                tp->dev->name,
14180                tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]->drv->name,
14181                dev_name(&tp->mdio_bus->phy_map[PHY_ADDR]->dev));
14182     else
14183         printk(KERN_INFO
14184                "%s: attached PHY is %s (%s Ethernet) (WireSpeed[%d])\n",
14185                tp->dev->name, tg3_phy_string(tp),
14186                ((tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_10_100_ONLY) ? "10/100Base-TX" :
14187             ((tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_ANY_SERDES) ? "1000Base-SX" :
14188              "10/100/1000Base-T")),
14189                (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_NO_ETH_WIRE_SPEED) == 0);
14190 
14191     printk(KERN_INFO "%s: RXcsums[%d] LinkChgREG[%d] MIirq[%d] ASF[%d] TSOcap[%d]\n",
14192            dev->name,
14193            (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_RX_CHECKSUMS) != 0,
14194            (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_USE_LINKCHG_REG) != 0,
14195            (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_USE_MI_INTERRUPT) != 0,
14196            (tp->tg3_flags & TG3_FLAG_ENABLE_ASF) != 0,
14197            (tp->tg3_flags2 & TG3_FLG2_TSO_CAPABLE) != 0);
14198     printk(KERN_INFO "%s: dma_rwctrl[%08x] dma_mask[%d-bit]\n",
14199            dev->name, tp->dma_rwctrl,
14200            (pdev->dma_mask == DMA_BIT_MASK(32)) ? 32 :
14201             (((u64) pdev->dma_mask == DMA_BIT_MASK(40)) ? 40 : 64));
14202 
14203     return 0;
14204 
14205 err_out_apeunmap:
14206     if (tp->aperegs) {
14207         iounmap(tp->aperegs);
14208         tp->aperegs = NULL;
14209     }
14210 
14211 err_out_fw:
14212     if (tp->fw)
14213         release_firmware(tp->fw);
14214 
14215 err_out_iounmap:
14216     if (tp->regs) {
14217         iounmap(tp->regs);
14218         tp->regs = NULL;
14219     }
14220 
14221 err_out_free_dev:
14222     free_netdev(dev);
14223 
14224 err_out_free_res:
14225     pci_release_regions(pdev);
14226 
14227 err_out_disable_pdev:
14228     pci_disable_device(pdev);
14229     pci_set_drvdata(pdev, NULL);
14230     return err;
14231 }
14232 
14233 static void __devexit tg3_remove_one(struct pci_dev *pdev)
14234 {
14235     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
14236 
14237     if (dev) {
14238         struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
14239 
14240         if (tp->fw)
14241             release_firmware(tp->fw);
14242 
14243         flush_scheduled_work();
14244 
14245         if (tp->tg3_flags3 & TG3_FLG3_USE_PHYLIB) {
14246             tg3_phy_fini(tp);
14247             tg3_mdio_fini(tp);
14248         }
14249 
14250         unregister_netdev(dev);
14251         if (tp->aperegs) {
14252             iounmap(tp->aperegs);
14253             tp->aperegs = NULL;
14254         }
14255         if (tp->regs) {
14256             iounmap(tp->regs);
14257             tp->regs = NULL;
14258         }
14259         free_netdev(dev);
14260         pci_release_regions(pdev);
14261         pci_disable_device(pdev);
14262         pci_set_drvdata(pdev, NULL);
14263     }
14264 }
14265 
14266 static int tg3_suspend(struct pci_dev *pdev, pm_message_t state)
14267 {
14268     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
14269     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
14270     pci_power_t target_state;
14271     int err;
14272 
14273     /* PCI register 4 needs to be saved whether netif_running() or not.
14274      * MSI address and data need to be saved if using MSI and
14275      * netif_running().
14276      */
14277     pci_save_state(pdev);
14278 
14279     if (!netif_running(dev))
14280         return 0;
14281 
14282     flush_scheduled_work();
14283     tg3_phy_stop(tp);
14284     tg3_netif_stop(tp);
14285 
14286     del_timer_sync(&tp->timer);
14287 
14288     tg3_full_lock(tp, 1);
14289     tg3_disable_ints(tp);
14290     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
14291 
14292     netif_device_detach(dev);
14293 
14294     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
14295     tg3_halt(tp, RESET_KIND_SHUTDOWN, 1);
14296     tp->tg3_flags &= ~TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
14297     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
14298 
14299     target_state = pdev->pm_cap ? pci_target_state(pdev) : PCI_D3hot;
14300 
14301     err = tg3_set_power_state(tp, target_state);
14302     if (err) {
14303         int err2;
14304 
14305         tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
14306 
14307         tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
14308         err2 = tg3_restart_hw(tp, 1);
14309         if (err2)
14310             goto out;
14311 
14312         tp->timer.expires = jiffies + tp->timer_offset;
14313         add_timer(&tp->timer);
14314 
14315         netif_device_attach(dev);
14316         tg3_netif_start(tp);
14317 
14318 out:
14319         tg3_full_unlock(tp);
14320 
14321         if (!err2)
14322             tg3_phy_start(tp);
14323     }
14324 
14325     return err;
14326 }
14327 
14328 static int tg3_resume(struct pci_dev *pdev)
14329 {
14330     struct net_device *dev = pci_get_drvdata(pdev);
14331     struct tg3 *tp = netdev_priv(dev);
14332     int err;
14333 
14334     pci_restore_state(tp->pdev);
14335 
14336     if (!netif_running(dev))
14337         return 0;
14338 
14339     err = tg3_set_power_state(tp, PCI_D0);
14340     if (err)
14341         return err;
14342 
14343     netif_device_attach(dev);
14344 
14345     tg3_full_lock(tp, 0);
14346 
14347     tp->tg3_flags |= TG3_FLAG_INIT_COMPLETE;
14348     err = tg3_restart_hw(tp, 1);
14349     if (err)
14350         goto out;
14351 
14352     tp->timer.expires = jiffies + tp->timer_offset;
14353     add_timer(&tp->timer);
14354 
14355     tg3_netif_start(tp);
14356 
14357 out:
14358     tg3_full_unlock(tp);
14359 
14360     if (!err)
14361         tg3_phy_start(tp);
14362 
14363     return err;
14364 }
14365 
14366 static struct pci_driver tg3_driver = {
14367     .name       = DRV_MODULE_NAME,
14368     .id_table   = tg3_pci_tbl,
14369     .probe      = tg3_init_one,
14370     .remove     = __devexit_p(tg3_remove_one),
14371     .suspend    = tg3_suspend,
14372     .resume     = tg3_resume
14373 };
14374 
14375 static int __init tg3_init(void)
14376 {
14377     return pci_register_driver(&tg3_driver);
14378 }
14379 
14380 static void __exit tg3_cleanup(void)
14381 {
14382     pci_unregister_driver(&tg3_driver);
14383 }
14384 
14385 module_init(tg3_init);
14386 module_exit(tg3_cleanup);
 All Classes Files Functions Variables
Generated on Wed Sep 28 2011 14:20:23 for Mark6 by  1.7.4
